3. Walk your fingers back down to the start position.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Enhances upper body stability and muscle activation
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing a wall with feet hip-width apart and palms on the wall at chest level.
2. Press your palms into the wall without letting your body move or the elbows bend.
3. Maintain the press for the desired time, then relax the pressure.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Increases wrist flexibility and forearm muscle length
Steps to perform:
1. Extend one arm in front with the palm facing down.
2. Use the other hand to gently pull the fingers back toward your body.
3. Keep the elbow straight and feel the stretch along the top of the forearm.
Safety cue: Keep the elbow extended and gently pull the fingers back while keeping the shoulder relaxed

Health benefit: Improves lateral core stability and shoulder girdle endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your side with knees bent and forearm on the floor under your shoulder.
2. Stack your hips and lift them off the ground into a side plank position.
3. Keep your top hand on your hip or reach toward the ceiling.
4. Hold the position with a straight line from shoulders to knees, then lower.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Opens chest and promotes improved posture alignment
Steps to perform:
1. Stand in a doorway and place your forearms on each side of the frame at shoulder height.
2. Step one foot forward and lean your chest through the doorway.
3. Keep your back straight and feel the stretch across your chest and shoulders.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Enhances scapular control and upper back muscular endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Lie face down on a bench or the floor with arms overhead in a Y position and thumbs pointing up.
2. Lift your arms slightly off the surface by squeezing your shoulder blades together.
3. Lower the arms back down with control and repeat.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Increases light cardiovascular activity and lateral coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet together and knees slightly bent.
2. Step to the side with one foot and bring the other foot to meet it with a soft touch.
3. Repeat the step-touch to the other side in a steady rhythmic pattern.
Safety cue: Maintain an upright posture, lead the movement from the hips, and control each lateral step

Health benefit: Strengthens quadriceps to support knee function and mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Sit tall in a chair with feet flat and knees bent.
2. Straighten one knee until the leg is fully extended.
3. Lower the foot back to the floor with control.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Increases hip flexor flexibility and promotes upright posture
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and step one foot back into a lunge or half-kneel position.
2. Tuck the pelvis and shift hips forward until you feel a stretch in the front of the back hip.
3. Keep your torso upright and hold the stretch.
4. Return to standing and switch sides.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Improves balance and ankle mobility for safer walking
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width apart and knees slightly soft.
2. Rock forward onto the balls of your feet and lift your heels.
3. Rock back onto your heels and lift your toes, repeating the motion.
Safety cue: Shift weight slowly from heel to toe while maintaining a tall posture and steady breath

Health benefit: Builds shoulder stabilization and improves upper body coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Start on hands and knees with a neutral spine.
2. Reach one arm straight forward until it is in line with your shoulder.
3. Lower the arm back to the floor and repeat with the other arm.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Improves neck flexibility and lateral range of motion
Steps to perform:
1. Sit or stand tall with shoulders relaxed and chin level.
2. Tilt your head toward one shoulder until you feel a stretch on the opposite side.
3. Place the same-side hand on the head and gently guide the bend.
Safety cue: Keep shoulders down and spine long while gently guiding the head with the opposite hand

Health benefit: Enhances thoracic rotation and shoulder mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Start on hands and knees with a neutral spine.
2. Reach one arm under the opposite arm and thread it across the mat.
3. Lower your shoulder and head toward the floor while keeping hips elevated.
4. Return to all fours and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Keep hips level and core engaged as you rotate, moving slowly and controlling the descent

Health benefit: Increases posterior shoulder flexibility and horizontal adduction range
Steps to perform:
1. Stand or sit tall with shoulders relaxed.
2. Bring one arm across your chest at shoulder height.
3. Use the opposite hand to pull the arm closer to your chest while keeping the shoulder down.
Safety cue: Align shoulders square and pull the arm across the chest without rotating the torso

Health benefit: Promotes scapular control and shoulder upward rotation
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and upper arms vertical at your sides.
2. Keep elbows bent at 90 degrees and maintain contact with the floor.
3. Slide your hands overhead while keeping the elbows lifted and the back neutral.
4. Reverse the motion to return to the starting position.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Strengthens rotator cuff external rotators and shoulder stability
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your side with your elbow bent to 90 degrees and the upper arm against your torso.
2. Hold a light weight or keep the hand free and rotate your forearm upward away from your body.
3. Keep the elbow fixed to your side and squeeze the shoulder blade.
4. Lower the forearm back to the starting position with control.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Builds biceps endurance and joint stabilization
Steps to perform:
1. Sit or stand with your elbow bent at 90 degrees by your side.
2. Press your palm upward into a fixed surface or against your opposite hand to create tension.
3. Squeeze the biceps and hold the contraction.
4. Release the pressure slowly and relax the arm.
Safety cue: Stand tall with shoulders back and press into the resistance without shrugging or swinging

Health benefit: Improves upper body coordination and light cardiovascular activity
Steps to perform:
1. Stand in a light staggered stance with hands up by your face.
2. Rotate your torso and snap your lead arm forward into a quick jab.
3. Retract the hand back to guard and keep light foot movement throughout.
Safety cue: Exhale on each jab and keep hands up with a stable core and relaxed shoulders

Health benefit: Enhances posterior shoulder endurance and scapular retraction control
Steps to perform:
1. Sit or stand with elbows bent at 90 degrees and hands in front of your chest.
2. Press your elbows outward against an immovable object or press palms together to create resistance.
3. Squeeze your shoulder blades and hold the tension.
4. Relax the shoulders and release the pressure slowly.
Safety cue: Hinge slightly, keep a neutral spine, and squeeze shoulder blades together without shrugging

Health benefit: Elevates heart rate and improves lower body coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet together and hands at your sides.
2. Jump your feet out wider than hip-width while keeping your arms down.
3. Jump your feet back together and continue the movement rhythmically.
Safety cue: Land softly with knees slightly bent, chest up, and core engaged to control movement

Health benefit: Increases glute and hip flexibility
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back and cross one ankle over the opposite knee.
2. Reach both hands behind the uncrossed thigh and pull the knee toward your chest.
3. Hold the position and breathe deeply.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Promotes hip mobility and dynamic joint range
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width and place hands on your hips.
2. Lift one knee to hip height and begin a slow circular motion with the hip.
3. Continue the circle for several repetitions in one direction.
4. Reverse the circle direction and then switch legs.
Safety cue: Move slowly with control and keep the pelvis stable while engaging the core

Health benefit: Strengthens shin muscles and supports ankle dorsiflexion
Steps to perform:
1. Sit or stand with feet flat and heels on the floor.
2. Pull your toes and forefoot upward toward your shins.
3. Lower the toes back down with control and repeat.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Engages core and hip flexors for trunk stability
Steps to perform:
1. Sit on the edge of a chair and grip the sides for support.
2. Lean back slightly and lift both knees toward your chest while engaging your core.
3. Lower your legs slowly back to the starting position.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Enhances foot placement precision and lateral balance
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and imagine a straight line on the floor in front of you.
2. Step forward placing the heel directly in front of the toes of the back foot each time.
3. Maintain balance and a steady gaze while walking the line.
Safety cue: Take heel-to-toe steps with hips level and gaze forward to maintain balance

Health benefit: Improves posterior chain activation and unilateral hip control
Steps to perform:
1. Start on hands and knees with hips over knees and shoulders over hands.
2. Extend one leg straight back until it aligns with your torso.
3. Hold briefly, return the knee under your hips, and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Enhances lateral stability and hip mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width apart and knees slightly bent.
2. Step your right foot behind and across your left with a light tap.
3. Push off your left foot and step your left foot behind and across with a light tap.
4. Continue alternating taps with controlled side-to-side movement.
Safety cue: Land softly with knees slightly bent and chest upright

Health benefit: Improves single leg balance and ankle stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand near a wall or chair and place one hand lightly on it for support.
2. Shift weight onto one leg and bend the opposite knee, bringing the foot toward your calf or ankle.
3. Balance on the standing leg for the desired time then switch sides.
Safety cue: Keep standing knee slightly soft and hip level while using support for balance

Health benefit: Develops core endurance and trunk stabilization
Steps to perform:
1. Place forearms on the floor shoulder-width apart and extend legs behind you.
2. Align your body from head to heels in a straight line.
3. Engage your core and glutes to prevent your hips from sagging.
4. Hold the position for the desired time.
Safety cue: Maintain a straight line from head to heels and draw your navel toward your spine

Health benefit: Strengthens upper back and improves scapular retraction
Steps to perform:
1. Lie face down with forehead on the mat and arms by your sides bent to form a W.
2. Squeeze your shoulder blades together and lift your hands and forearms off the floor.
3. Hold briefly at the top then lower with control.
Safety cue: Lift elbows off the ground keeping neck long and squeeze shoulder blades together

Health benefit: Promotes hamstring flexibility and gentle spinal lengthening
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing a chair or table and place your hands on the support at hip height.
2. Hinge at the hips and fold forward while keeping a soft bend in your knees.
3. Let your head and neck relax and maintain the support with your hands.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Strengthens hip abductors and enhances lateral pelvic stability
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your side with your bottom arm under your head and knees slightly bent.
2. Stack your hips and keep your top leg straight.
3. Lift the top leg upward toward the ceiling without rotating your hips.
4. Lower the leg slowly with control.
Safety cue: Stack hips and lift the top leg with glute control and no hip rotation

Health benefit: Improves balance and proprioception for safer everyday movement
Steps to perform:
1. Stand beside a chair and place one hand lightly on the back for support.
2. Shift your weight onto the standing leg and lift the other foot a few inches off the floor.
3. Hold your balance while keeping your torso upright.
4. Lower the lifted foot gently and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Keep the standing knee soft and hips level while breathing steadily

Health benefit: Increases groin and inner thigh flexibility and hip range of motion
Steps to perform:
1. Sit tall on the edge of a chair with the soles of your feet together.
2. Hold your feet with your hands and sit up straight.
3. Gently press your knees toward the floor using your elbows.
Safety cue: Sit tall hinge from the hips with a long spine and steady breathing

Health benefit: Improves lateral trunk flexibility and helps maintain spinal mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width apart and arms relaxed at your sides.
2. Raise one arm overhead and reach toward the opposite side.
3. Bend sideways from the waist while keeping your hips facing forward.
Safety cue: Pull ribs down and bend from the waist with slow even breathing

Health benefit: Engages core muscles and promotes awareness of pelvic alignment
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and hands on your hips.
2. Tilt your pelvis under to flatten the lower back briefly.
3. Return your pelvis to a neutral position with controlled movement.
Safety cue: Tuck and release the pelvis using the core and avoid overarching the lower back

Health benefit: Challenges balance and coordination while enhancing lower limb control
Steps to perform:
1. Find a clear space and stand with one foot directly in front of the other.
2. Take a slow step backward placing the heel of the back foot near the toe of the front foot.
3. Continue stepping backward in a straight line, keeping your gaze forward.
4. Use your arms for balance as needed.
Safety cue: Maintain a tall posture and place each foot in a straight line with controlled steps

Health benefit: Builds neck endurance and posterior neck muscle control
Steps to perform:
1. Sit or stand tall with a straight spine.
2. Place both hands behind your head and keep your chin level.
3. Push your head back into your hands without moving the head.
4. Hold the contraction for the desired time while breathing normally.
Safety cue: Keep chin tucked and spine neutral while holding the contraction

Health benefit: Improves aerobic fitness and lateral coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet together and arms at your sides.
2. Step your right foot out to the side while raising both arms overhead.
3. Step back to center and repeat to the left, alternating sides.
4. Maintain a steady, controlled rhythm.
Safety cue: Land softly with knees slightly bent and chest upright

Health benefit: Strengthens low chest and anterior shoulder stability through sustained muscle activation
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing a wall with feet hip-width apart.
2. Place your palms on the wall at a low height near your abdomen.
3. Press your hands into the wall without shifting your body.
4. Maintain the push for the desired time while keeping a neutral spine.
Safety cue: Press into the wall with straight wrists and a braced core

Health benefit: Increases wrist range of motion and joint mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Sit or stand with elbows slightly bent and hands in front.
2. Make small circles with both wrists in a clockwise direction.
3. Reverse the direction and make circles counterclockwise.
4. Keep motions smooth and relaxed.
Safety cue: Make slow controlled wrist circles with forearm relaxed and supported

Health benefit: Promotes hip flexor activation and light cardiovascular engagement
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart.
2. Lift one knee up toward your chest while swinging the opposite arm.
3. Step down and immediately lift the other knee, marching forward.
4. Keep a brisk but controlled walking pace.
Safety cue: Stay upright, drive knees forward with a tall posture and steady breath

Health benefit: Increases anterior chest and shoulder flexibility for improved posture
Steps to perform:
1. Stand in a doorway and place one forearm on the lower frame.
2. Step forward with the opposite foot to rotate your torso away.
3. Keep the shoulder down and chest open as you feel the stretch.
4. Hold while keeping steady breathing.
Safety cue: Keep pelvis neutral and avoid overarching the lower back as you lean forward

Health benefit: Enhances shoulder mobility and prepares upper body for dynamic activity
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart.
2. Extend both arms out to the sides at shoulder height.
3. Make large continuous circles forward with both arms.
4. Reverse the direction and continue making large circles.
Safety cue: Control the motion with scapular stability and maintain a soft bend in the elbows

Health benefit: Enhances quadriceps flexibility and hip mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and shift weight onto one leg.
2. Bend the other knee and grab the ankle behind you.
3. Pull the heel toward your glute while keeping knees close.
4. Keep hips neutral and hold the stretch.
Safety cue: Keep hips square

Health benefit: Activates glute muscles and supports pelvic stability
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and feet hip-width.
2. Press through your heels and lift your hips until your body forms a straight line.
3. Squeeze your glutes and hold, then lower with control.
Safety cue: Keep ribs lowered to prevent lower back arch

Health benefit: Enhances lateral agility and hip abductor strength
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with knees slightly bent and feet hip-width apart.
2. Step laterally with one foot and quickly bring the trailing foot to meet it.
3. Keep your chest up and hips level as you push off each step.
4. Continue shuffling laterally and switch direction as needed.
Safety cue: Maintain a slight knee bend

Health benefit: Challenges balance and proprioception under reduced visual input
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and place one foot directly in front of the other so the heel touches the toe.
2. Cross your arms over your chest and close your eyes.
3. Keep your hips level and hold the position while breathing steadily.
Safety cue: Distribute weight evenly between both feet

Health benefit: Improves calf flexibility and ankle dorsiflexion range
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing a wall and place your hands on it at shoulder height.
2. Step one foot back with the heel down and keep that back leg straight.
3. Lean forward into the wall until you feel a stretch in the upper calf and hold.
Safety cue: Keep the back heel flat on the floor

Health benefit: Strengthens intrinsic foot muscles and improves toe dexterity
Steps to perform:
1. Sit tall with a small towel under your toes.
2. Grip the towel with your toes and curl the toes toward your sole.
3. Release the towel and repeat while keeping your heel on the floor.
Safety cue: Sit tall with feet flat

Health benefit: Combines cardiovascular activity with coordination and upper body mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and engage your core.
2. Lift one knee to hip height while reaching the opposite arm overhead.
3. Lower the arm and foot and repeat on the other side.
4. Maintain a steady rhythm and controlled breathing.
Safety cue: Keep torso upright as you reach overhead

Health benefit: Improves core engagement and spinal stability during seated tasks
Steps to perform:
1. Sit tall with feet flat and hands resting on your thighs.
2. Brace your core and maintain a neutral spine.
3. Lift one arm or leg slightly without leaning or rotating.
4. Hold briefly, then switch sides and repeat.
Safety cue: Maintain a neutral spine

Health benefit: Improves neck mobility and flexibility
Steps to perform:
1. Sit tall with shoulders relaxed and chin level.
2. Tilt your right ear toward your right shoulder until a gentle stretch appears.
3. Hold the stretch for the chosen time and then return to center.
4. Repeat the same sequence on the left side.
Safety cue: Keep chin neutral and move slowly from the neck

Health benefit: Enhances thoracic rotation and spinal mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat on the floor.
2. Extend both arms out to the sides at shoulder height with palms up.
3. Rotate your right arm across your body toward the left, keeping your shoulder on the floor.
4. Return to center and repeat on the opposite side.
Safety cue: Keep hips grounded and rotate through the thoracic spine with control

Health benefit: Promotes improved shoulder posture and scapular control
Steps to perform:
1. Stand or sit tall with arms at your sides.
2. Squeeze your shoulder blades together without shrugging the shoulders.
3. Hold the squeeze for a few seconds, then relax.
Safety cue: Squeeze shoulder blades down and together without shrugging

Health benefit: Improves shoulder flexion and scapular mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Kneel on hands and knees with a neutral spine in tabletop.
2. Walk your hands forward along the floor while keeping the back flat.
3. Slide until you feel a gentle stretch through the shoulders and upper back.
4. Hold briefly and then walk your hands back to the starting position.
Safety cue: Maintain a neutral spine and slide hips back while keeping shoulders stable

Health benefit: Enhances shoulder stability through sustained muscle activation
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with one elbow bent against your side at 90 degrees.
2. Press the forearm inward against a doorframe or partner without moving the torso.
3. Hold the inward press for the chosen time while breathing steadily.
4. Relax and repeat on the other arm.
Safety cue: Brace the core and press the arm inward without rotating the torso

Health benefit: Increases triceps flexibility and elbow extension range
Steps to perform:
1. Stand or sit tall and raise one arm overhead.
2. Bend the elbow and reach the hand down your back.
3. Use the opposite hand to gently pull the elbow toward your head and hold.
Safety cue: Keep ribs down and draw the elbow toward the head while maintaining a long spine

Health benefit: Strengthens core endurance with reduced wrist stress compared to palms
Steps to perform:
1. Kneel and place your foreknuckles on the floor under your shoulders.
2. Step your hips back slightly and engage your core to form a straight line from head to knees.
3. Hold the plank position while breathing steadily and keeping the neck neutral.
4. Lower to resting position when finished.
Safety cue: Hold a straight line from head to knees and breathe evenly throughout the plank

Health benefit: Improves upper back strength and scapular stability
Steps to perform:
1. Lie face down with arms extended overhead and thumbs pointing up.
2. Squeeze your shoulder blades and lift your arms a few inches off the ground.
3. Hold the raised position briefly while keeping the neck neutral.
Safety cue: Keep neck neutral and lift the arms using scapular motion without arching the low back

Health benefit: Promotes shoulder mobility and dynamic blood flow to the upper limbs
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and knees soft.
2. Swing both arms across your body and then open them wide in a controlled motion.
3. Continue alternating crosses at a steady rhythm while keeping the torso stable.
Safety cue: Control arm speed and keep shoulders relaxed while allowing thoracic rotation

Health benefit: Enhances hip and thigh strength while improving balance
Steps to perform:
1. Stand upright with feet hip-width apart and take a short step back with one foot.
2. Bend both knees slightly and lower into a shallow lunge while keeping the torso upright.
3. Pause briefly, then press through the front heel to return to standing.
4. Repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Keep torso upright and front knee tracking over the toes

Health benefit: Targets hip abductor strength and lateral hip stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and shift weight onto one leg.
2. Keep the lifted leg straight and raise it out to the side to about hip height.
3. Lower the leg slowly under control and repeat.
Safety cue: Keep hips level and lift from the outer hip with controlled motion

Health benefit: Increases external hip rotation flexibility and gluteal mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Sit tall near the front edge of a chair and cross one ankle over the opposite thigh.
2. Keep the spine long and hinge forward at the hips until you feel a stretch in the crossed hip.
3. Hold the position with steady breathing.
4. Return to upright and switch sides.
Safety cue: Sit tall and maintain a long spine while leaning forward into the stretch

Health benefit: Builds calf muscle endurance and ankle plantarflexion strength
Steps to perform:
1. Sit with feet flat and place one hand on the forefoot to apply gentle resistance.
2. Press the ball of the foot down while attempting to lift the heel against the resisting hand.
3. Hold the contraction briefly.
4. Release slowly and repeat.
Safety cue: Keep knee stable and press through the ball of the foot with controlled heel raises

Health benefit: Strengthens intrinsic foot muscles and promotes arch support
Steps to perform:
1. Sit or stand with the foot flat on the floor and toes relaxed.
2. Draw the ball of the foot toward the heel without curling the toes to raise the medial arch.
3. Hold the domed arch briefly, then relax the foot.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Develops lower body strength and hip mobility in a wide stance
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet wider than hip-width and toes slightly turned out.
2. Hinge at the hips and bend the knees to lower into a squat with the chest upright.
3. Keep weight through the heels and knees tracking over toes.
4. Press through the heels to stand back up.
Safety cue: Keep chest up and knees tracking over toes while sitting back between the legs

Health benefit: Improves neck posture and reduces forward head position
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and gaze forward.
2. Draw your chin straight back toward your neck without tilting.
3. Hold for three seconds, then relax to the starting position.
Safety cue: Keep chin tucked and neck long while retracting the head

Health benefit: Enhances thoracic mobility and rotation
Steps to perform:
1. Begin on hands and knees with one hand behind your head.
2. Rotate your torso and lift the elbow of the top arm toward the ceiling.
3. Open the chest and follow the movement with your eyes.
4. Return the elbow toward the supporting hand and repeat.
Safety cue: Anchor hips over knees and rotate through the thoracic spine with a stable core

Health benefit: Strengthens upper trapezius and supports shoulder elevation
Steps to perform:
1. Stand or sit upright with arms at your sides.
2. Lift both shoulders straight up toward your ears.
3. Lower the shoulders fully and repeat.
Safety cue: Lift and lower the shoulders with control while keeping the neck relaxed

Health benefit: Improves shoulder and finger range of motion
Steps to perform:
1. Stand side-on to a wall with fingertips touching at waist height.
2. Slowly "crawl" your fingers sideways up the wall without moving your torso.
3. Stop at a comfortable height with the arm straight.
4. Reverse the motion to walk your fingers back down.
Safety cue: Stand tall and crawl your fingers along the wall using scapular movement, keeping ribs down

Health benefit: Builds rotator cuff endurance and stabilizes the shoulder joint
Steps to perform:
1. Stand in a doorway with elbow bent 90° and forearm across your abdomen.
2. Place the back of your hand against the doorframe.
3. Push outward against the frame without letting the elbow move.
4. Hold the press for a few seconds, then relax.
Safety cue: Keep the elbow pinned to your side and press outward without letting the shoulder hike

Health benefit: Improves forearm rotational mobility and functional wrist control
Steps to perform:
1. Sit with elbow bent and forearm supported on a table, thumb pointing up.
2. Rotate the forearm to turn the palm up (supination).
3. Rotate the forearm to turn the palm down (pronation) and repeat.
Safety cue: Support the forearm and rotate only at the wrist with slow controlled motion

Health benefit: Increases wrist and forearm flexibility for improved reaching tasks
Steps to perform:
1. Place palms together at chest level in a prayer position.
2. Keep palms pressed and slowly lower your hands toward your waist.
3. Maintain the pressure as the wrists bend backward.
4. Hold briefly, then release the hands.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Strengthens posterior shoulder muscles and promotes scapular retraction
Steps to perform:
1. Lie face down with arms extended out to the sides in a T position, palms down.
2. Keep the neck neutral and squeeze the shoulder blades together.
3. Lift the arms a few inches off the ground while keeping elbows straight.
4. Lower the arms back down with control and repeat.
Safety cue: Raise arms into a T while squeezing the shoulder blades and maintaining a neutral neck

Health benefit: Builds lower body endurance and supports knee joint stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with your back against a wall and feet hip-width about 6–12 inches from the wall.
2. Slide down just enough to create a shallow bend in the knees while keeping your back against the wall.
3. Hold the position with core engaged and weight in your heels.
4. Push through your heels to slide back up to standing.
Safety cue: Keep weight in your heels and maintain a neutral spine

Health benefit: Enhances glute activation and hip stability for improved pelvic control
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent, feet flat hip-width, and arms at your sides.
2. Press through your heels to lift hips until your body forms a straight line from shoulders to knees.
3. Keep hips steady and lift one knee toward your chest while maintaining hip height.
4. Lower that foot and repeat on the other side in a controlled march.
Safety cue: Drive hips up and keep the pelvis stable as you alternate legs

Health benefit: Strengthens hip extensors and improves posterior chain activation
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with hands on a chair or wall for support and feet hip-width apart.
2. Keep your torso upright and squeeze the glute to lift one leg straight back without rotating the hips.
3. Lower the leg slowly with control and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Stand tall and hinge from the hip without arching the lower back

Health benefit: Improves hip mobility and rotational control in sitting positions
Steps to perform:
1. Sit on the floor with both knees bent at 90 degrees so one thigh faces forward and the other faces to the side.
2. Sit tall and hinge slightly forward from the hips to create space for rotation.
3. Shift your hips to rotate both legs into the opposite 90/90 position while keeping your spine tall.
4. Pause briefly, then return to the starting position or switch again.
Safety cue: Sit tall and rotate through the hips without rounding the lower back

Health benefit: Enhances balance and ankle strength to support confident walking mechanics
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and focus on a straight line ahead.
2. Take a step and place your heel down first, rolling forward onto the toes.
3. Continue forward with small controlled steps while keeping upright posture.
Safety cue: Walk heel to toe deliberately with core engaged

Health benefit: Strengthens intrinsic foot muscles and supports improved toe alignment
Steps to perform:
1. Sit or stand with feet flat and toes relaxed.
2. Actively spread all toes apart as wide as possible without curling.
3. Hold briefly, then relax and repeat.
Safety cue: Actively spread toes while keeping the forefoot grounded

Health benefit: Promotes spinal extension and relaxation of the back and hip muscles
Steps to perform:
1. Kneel on the floor with big toes touching and knees wide or together as comfortable.
2. Sit back toward your heels and lower your torso forward until your forehead rests on the mat.
3. Extend your arms forward or alongside your body and relax into the position.
Safety cue: Sink hips back, lengthen the spine, and breathe steadily

Health benefit: Improves neck mobility and increases shoulder range of motion
Steps to perform:
1. Sit tall or stand with feet hip-width apart.
2. Rotate your head about 45 degrees toward the opposite shoulder.
3. Tilt your chin down toward the chest and the armpit.
4. Place the same-side hand on the back of the head and gently guide deeper.
Safety cue: Keep neck long and chin tucked while gently guiding your head toward the shoulder

Health benefit: Improves shoulder joint mobility and warms up surrounding muscles
Steps to perform:
1. Stand or sit tall with arms relaxed at your sides.
2. Lift the shoulders slightly and make small controlled circles forward.
3. Reverse direction and make small controlled circles backward.
Safety cue: Keep ribs down and move slowly from the shoulder joint with controlled small circles

Health benefit: Enhances scapular stability and promotes better shoulder alignment during movement
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing a wall and place forearms on the wall at shoulder height.
2. Step feet back until your body forms a straight line from head to heels.
3. Pull shoulder blades down and together to retract the scapulae.
4. Maintain the retracted position while breathing steadily.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Strengthens core and shoulder stabilizers with lower impact on wrists
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing a wall and place forearms on the wall shoulder-width apart.
2. Step feet back until your body forms a straight line from head to heels.
3. Engage your core and glutes and hold the plank position on the forearms.
Safety cue: Keep a straight line from head to heels, engage the core, and avoid sagging hips

Health benefit: Opens the chest and counters forward shoulder posture
Steps to perform:
1. Stand in a doorway and place your forearm and palm on the door frame at shoulder height.
2. Step one foot forward to create a gentle stretch across the chest.
3. Keep the torso upright and rotate slightly away from the arm to increase the stretch.
4. Hold the position while breathing steadily.
Safety cue: Keep spine neutral, retract your shoulder blades slightly, and gently lean forward from the hips

Health benefit: Improves triceps endurance and functional pushing capacity
Steps to perform:
1. Sit on the edge of a chair with hands gripping the edge beside your hips.
2. Slide your hips forward slightly and bend the elbows a small amount to lower a few inches.
3. Press through the palms to straighten the arms and return to the starting position.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Enhances coordination and hip flexor activation while providing light cardiovascular stimulus
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and lift the right knee while driving the left arm forward.
2. Land softly on the ball of the foot and lower the foot back to the ground.
3. Repeat on the opposite side by lifting the left knee and driving the right arm.
4. Continue alternating with quick, exaggerated marching steps and rhythmic arm swings.
Safety cue: Maintain an upright posture, drive knees with control, and keep a rhythmic arm swing

Health benefit: Strengthens quadriceps and improves knee stability
Steps to perform:
1. Sit with your leg extended and a rolled towel placed under the knee.
2. Press the back of your knee down into the towel and tighten your thigh muscle.
3. Hold the contraction while keeping the knee pressed down.
4. Relax the muscle and repeat.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Strengthens hip abductors and improves lateral hip stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand sideways next to a wall and place your nearest hand on it for balance.
2. Keep the standing leg straight and lift the other leg straight out to the side.
3. Hold the lifted position while keeping your hips level and torso upright.
4. Lower the leg slowly back to the starting position.
Safety cue: Stand tall with hips level and lift the leg slowly without leaning the torso

Health benefit: Increases hip flexor flexibility and enhances anterior hip mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Kneel with one knee on the floor and the other foot planted in front at a 90-degree angle.
2. Tuck your pelvis slightly and shift your weight forward until you feel a stretch in the front of the hip.
3. Keep your torso upright and breathe steadily while holding the stretch.
4. Return to the starting position and switch sides.
Safety cue: Maintain a neutral spine, gently tuck the pelvis and breathe into the stretch

Health benefit: Improves ankle mobility and promotes lower leg circulation
Steps to perform:
1. Sit tall with both feet flat on the floor and knees bent.
2. Point your toes away from you and then pull them back toward you.
3. Continue rhythmic ankle flexion and extension while keeping your heels on the floor.
Safety cue: Keep the knee relaxed and pump the ankle slowly through full range while breathing evenly

Health benefit: Enhances single leg balance and neuromuscular coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Stand on one leg with a slight bend in the knee and hands on hips or a support.
2. Tap the toe of the other foot lightly to the floor in front, to the side, or to the back.
3. Return the tapped foot to the starting position and keep the standing knee soft.
4. Repeat taps while maintaining balance and a steady core.
Safety cue: Keep hips level, soften the standing knee and tap the toe lightly with control

Health benefit: Supports arch strength and improves foot stability
Steps to perform:
1. Sit with both feet flat on the floor and knees at hip width.
2. Press your heel and toes down while lifting the midfoot arch upward.
3. Hold the lifted arch briefly and then relax back to the flat foot.
Safety cue: Root the toes and lift the arch using intrinsic foot muscles without curling

Health benefit: Improves spinal mobility and encourages posture awareness
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing a support and place your hands shoulder-width on the surface.
2. Drop your belly and lift your chest to arch the back while inhaling.
3. Round your back and tuck your chin toward your chest while exhaling.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Improves neck mobility and range of motion
Steps to perform:
1. Sit or stand tall with shoulders relaxed.
2. Drop your chin slightly toward your chest.
3. Slowly rotate your head to the right until you feel a gentle stretch.
4. Rotate slowly through center to the left and return to center.
Safety cue: Rotate slowly with controlled motion and keep your chin slightly tucked

Health benefit: Enhances thoracic rotation and shoulder mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width and knees soft.
2. Reach both arms forward at chest height and clasp your hands.
3. Rotate your upper torso to the right, sweeping your arms open and looking over your right shoulder.
4. Return to center and repeat to the left.
Safety cue: Keep hips facing forward and rotate through the upper back with controlled movement

Health benefit: Strengthens scapular stabilizers and improves posture
Steps to perform:
1. Sit tall with feet flat and hands resting on your thighs.
2. Pull your shoulder blades down and back as if pinching a small object between them.
3. Hold the squeeze for a few seconds.
4. Release slowly and repeat.
Safety cue: Sit tall and squeeze shoulder blades together without shrugging

Health benefit: Promotes shoulder mobility and upward rotation of the scapula
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing the wall with forearms against it and elbows at shoulder height.
2. Press forearms and palms into the wall to maintain contact.
3. Slowly slide your forearms upward as far as comfortable while keeping contact.
4. Lower forearms back to start and repeat.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Improves wrist and forearm flexibility for functional hand use
Steps to perform:
1. Extend one arm in front with the palm facing up and the elbow straight.
2. Use the opposite hand to gently pull the fingers and palm down toward the floor.
3. Keep the elbow straight and feel the stretch along the inner forearm.
4. Hold briefly, release, and switch sides.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Engages core and shoulder muscles to enhance posture control
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing a wall and place forearms against it at shoulder width.
2. Step your feet back until your body forms a straight line from head to heels.
3. Engage your core and glutes and hold a steady position without sagging.
4. Breathe steadily and step forward to finish.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Activates posterior chain and promotes thoracic extension awareness
Steps to perform:
1. Lie face down with arms bent into a W beside your torso and palms down.
2. Gently lift your chest while pulling your shoulder blades down and together.
3. Keep your neck neutral and maintain the W arm position.
4. Hold briefly, lower with control, and repeat.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Opens the chest and improves respiratory movement and posture
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and clasp your hands behind your back or hold a strap with both hands.
2. Draw your shoulders back and down while gently lifting your chest.
3. Straighten your arms to open the chest and squeeze the shoulder blades.
4. Hold the stretch briefly and release.
Safety cue: Draw shoulders back and down while expanding the chest and avoiding arching the lower back

Health benefit: Strengthens quadriceps and improves lower body endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with your back against a wall and feet hip-width apart.
2. Slide down a few inches until your knees bend about 15–30 degrees.
3. Hold your core and press your lower back into the wall.
4. Push through your feet to return to standing when finished.
Safety cue: Keep weight in your heels and maintain a neutral spine
is_not_suitable_for: Hypertension, Coronary Artery Disease, Obesity/Overweight, Osteoarthritis

Health benefit: Improves ankle dorsiflexion and tibialis anterior activation
Steps to perform:
1. Sit on a chair with feet flat and toes lifted off the floor.
2. Press your heels down into the floor while keeping toes up.
3. Release the toes back up and repeat.
Safety cue: Keep your core engaged and lift the heel with slow controlled motion

Health benefit: Strengthens hip abductors and enhances lateral hip stability
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and feet together.
2. Keep your feet touching and lift one knee outward while keeping hips square.
3. Lower the knee back down with control.
4. Repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Stabilize the pelvis and open the knee without rotating your torso

Health benefit: Increases hip adductor flexibility and range of motion
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back and bring the soles of your feet together near your groin.
2. Let your knees fall open toward the floor and relax your hips.
3. Hold the position and breathe deeply.
Safety cue: Keep the lower back on the mat and gently lower the knees using hip control

Health benefit: Improves calf muscle flexibility and ankle mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Sit upright with one leg extended and a towel looped around the ball of the foot.
2. Pull the towel toward you to flex the ankle and feel the stretch in the calf.
3. Hold, then switch legs.
Safety cue: Keep the knee straight, dorsiflex the ankle, and sit tall through the spine

Health benefit: Strengthens intrinsic foot muscles and improves toe dexterity
Steps to perform:
1. Sit with a small pile of marbles or small objects on the floor near your toes.
2. Use your toes to pick up one marble and place it into a nearby container.
3. Repeat picking up marbles with the same foot.
4. Switch to the other foot and continue.
Safety cue: Keep the arch lifted and use controlled toe movement to pick up the marbles

Health benefit: Improves gait stability and single leg balance control
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and place one foot directly in front of the other so the heel touches the toe.
2. Take a slow step forward keeping your balance and your gaze forward.
3. Continue walking heel-to-toe in a straight line for several steps, then switch leading foot.
Safety cue: Keep your gaze forward, engage your core, and place heel to toe with control

Health benefit: Promotes core engagement and pelvic mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat on the floor.
2. Tighten your abdominal muscles and press your lower back into the floor to tilt your pelvis.
3. Hold briefly, then relax and repeat.
Safety cue: Flatten your lower back to the mat by gently engaging the lower abdominals

Health benefit: Encourages gentle spinal extension and improves postural awareness
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your stomach with forearms on the floor and elbows under shoulders.
2. Press into your forearms and lift your chest gently while keeping hips on the floor.
3. Lengthen through your spine and relax your shoulders away from your ears.
4. Hold the position while breathing steadily.
Safety cue: Keep shoulders down and lift through the chest without overarching the low back

Health benefit: Improves upper neck and shoulder flexibility
Steps to perform:
1. Sit tall with feet flat and shoulders relaxed.
2. Place your right hand on the left side of your head and gently pull your ear toward your shoulder.
3. Hold for 20–30 seconds, then repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Sit tall, brace your core, and tilt your head slowly toward the opposite shoulder

Health benefit: Increases thoracic rotation and spinal mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Sit upright with feet flat and hands resting on your thighs.
2. Reach your right arm across your body and slide it under the left arm with your palm facing up.
3. Lower your right shoulder and head toward your lap while keeping the left hand steady.
4. Hold briefly, return to start, and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Rotate from your mid‑back with controlled motion and keep hips squared forward

Health benefit: Promotes gentle shoulder mobility and movement control
Steps to perform:
1. Lean forward and support yourself with one hand on a stable surface.
2. Let the opposite arm hang relaxed and swing it in small controlled circles from the shoulder.
3. Reverse the circle direction after several reps and then rest.
Safety cue: Let the arm hang and make small controlled shoulder circles without shrugging

Health benefit: Enhances external rotator strength and shoulder stability
Steps to perform:
1. Sit or stand with your elbow bent to 90 degrees and press a rolled towel between your elbow and your torso.
2. Grasp the towel with your outside hand to create gentle resistance.
3. Rotate your forearm outward away from your body while keeping your elbow close to your side.
4. Return slowly to the start position and repeat, then switch sides.
Safety cue: Keep elbows tucked to your sides and rotate forearms outward with steady control

Health benefit: Improves wrist and forearm flexibility for better hand positioning
Steps to perform:
1. Extend one arm in front of you with the palm facing down.
2. Use the opposite hand to gently pull the fingers and hand downward toward your body.
3. Hold the stretch, then switch to the other wrist.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Strengthens core muscles and enhances postural stability
Steps to perform:
1. Kneel and place your forearms on the floor with elbows under your shoulders.
2. Step your knees back so your body forms a straight line from head to knees.
3. Engage your core and keep your neck neutral by looking down.
4. Hold the position for the desired time, then lower your knees to rest.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Increases chest flexibility and promotes open shoulder posture
Steps to perform:
1. Stand in a doorway and place your forearms on the doorframe at shoulder height with elbows bent.
2. Step one foot forward and lean your chest through the doorway until you feel a stretch across your chest.
3. Hold briefly, then step back and relax.
Safety cue: Keep a neutral spine and gently retract the shoulder blade before leaning into the stretch

Health benefit: Improves latissimus mobility and upper back reach
Steps to perform:
1. Kneel on the floor and sit back toward your heels.
2. Reach both arms back along your sides toward your feet with palms facing upward.
3. Lower your chest toward your thighs and lengthen through the sides of your torso.
4. Hold the stretch, then return to the starting position.
Safety cue: Press hips back toward heels and reach arms back while maintaining a long neutral spine

Health benefit: Strengthens glutes and enhances hip extension control
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat hip-width apart.
2. Drive through your heels and lift your hips until your body forms a straight line.
3. Squeeze your glutes at the top.
4. Lower your hips back to the mat with control.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Improves hip abductor strength and lateral pelvic stability
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your side with legs straight and stacked.
2. Support your head with your hand and align your hips.
3. Lift the top leg upward keeping it straight and foot flexed.
4. Lower the leg slowly to the starting position.
Safety cue: Keep hips stacked and lift with control from the outer hip to avoid rolling backward

Health benefit: Strengthens ankle evertors and supports lateral ankle stability
Steps to perform:
1. Sit with your leg extended and loop a resistance band around the forefoot.
2. Anchor the band to the inside and keep your heel on the floor.
3. Push the forefoot outward against the band to evert the ankle.
4. Return the foot slowly to the neutral position.
Safety cue: Stabilize the lower leg and move the foot slowly against resistance with toes pointing forward

Health benefit: Improves single leg balance and proprioceptive control
Steps to perform:
1. Stand beside a wall and place one hand lightly on it for support.
2. Shift your weight onto the supporting leg and lift the other foot off the ground.
3. Hold balance with a slight bend in the supporting knee and steady posture.
4. Lower the lifted foot back down with control.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Activates foot intrinsic muscles to support arch integrity
Steps to perform:
1. Sit with feet flat on the floor and knees at 90 degrees.
2. Keep your toes and heel planted and lift the arch of your foot upward.
3. Hold the lifted arch while keeping the toes relaxed.
4. Lower the arch back to the floor slowly.
Safety cue: Lift the arch while keeping toes relaxed and weight evenly distributed between heel and toe

Health benefit: Enhances ankle mobility and dynamic balance during weight shifts
Steps to perform:
1. Stand upright with feet hip-width apart and hands near support if needed.
2. Rise slowly onto your toes and hold briefly.
3. Rock back onto your heels and lift the toes off the ground.
4. Repeat the heel-to-toe shifts with controlled movement.
Safety cue: Roll slowly from heel to toe with an upright spine and soft knees

Health benefit: Develops core stability and coordinated spinal movement
Steps to perform:
1. Start on hands and knees with a neutral spine.
2. Extend one arm forward and the opposite leg back while keeping hips level.
3. Hold the position while engaging your core.
4. Return the arm and leg to the starting position and switch sides.
Safety cue: Brace your core and extend limbs slowly while keeping hips steady to avoid pelvic rotation

Health benefit: Improves hip mobility and gently lengthens lower back muscles
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with both legs extended.
2. Bend one knee and grab it with both hands.
3. Pull the knee gently toward your chest while keeping the other leg straight.
4. Release the knee back to the starting position.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Strengthens neck extensor muscles and supports head control
Steps to perform:
1. Sit or stand tall with feet hip-width apart.
2. Interlace fingers and place palms against the back of your head.
3. Press your head back into your hands without moving the neck and hold.
Safety cue: Keep chin tucked and maintain a neutral spine

Health benefit: Enhances lateral trunk flexibility and mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Sit tall on a chair with feet flat on the floor.
2. Reach one arm overhead and place the opposite hand on the chair seat.
3. Bend your torso toward the hand on the chair, sliding the overhead arm to deepen the side bend, then return upright.
Safety cue: Anchor hips and hinge from the waist with a long spine

Health benefit: Promotes shoulder mobility and dynamic coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and arms relaxed.
2. Swing one arm across your chest while the other arm swings back, keeping shoulders down.
3. Alternate arms in a smooth, controlled rhythm and keep your torso stable.
Safety cue: Control arm speed and maintain tall posture with a braced core

Health benefit: Builds shoulder and core strength while challenging balance
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing a wall at arm’s length with feet hip-width apart.
2. Place both palms on the wall at chest level and walk your hands upward toward the ceiling.
3. Step your feet closer as your hands ascend to increase the incline.
4. Walk your hands back down and step your feet back to the start.
Safety cue: Keep shoulders packed and move slowly with a neutral spine

Health benefit: Improves forearm rotational control and wrist functional mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Sit or stand with elbow bent to 90 degrees and forearm across your lap.
2. Hold a light object or keep empty hand and rotate the palm upward into supination.
3. Rotate the palm downward into pronation with controlled motion.
Safety cue: Keep wrist neutral and rotate from the forearm with controlled tempo

Health benefit: Promotes upper body strength while modifying wrist loading
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing a wall with feet hip-width apart.
2. Make fists and place your knuckles flat against the wall at chest height.
3. Bend your elbows to bring your chest toward the wall, then press back to extend the arms.
Safety cue: Press through the knuckles while keeping a neutral spine and stable scapulae

Health benefit: Activates posterior shoulder muscles to support scapular control
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width apart and hinge slightly at the hips.
2. Raise both arms out to the sides with elbows slightly bent and palms facing down.
3. Squeeze the shoulder blades together and hold the contraction without moving the arms.
Safety cue: Maintain a soft bend in the elbows and squeeze the shoulder blades together

Health benefit: Enhances spine mobility and full body coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back and hug your knees to your chest.
2. Tuck your chin and brace your core while keeping a rounded spine.
3. Use your core to roll onto your upper back and shoulders in a controlled motion.
4. Reverse the movement to return to supine and repeat.
Safety cue: Engage the core and articulate the spine slowly while breathing evenly

Health benefit: Strengthens hamstrings and improves knee flexion control
Steps to perform:
1. Lie face down on a mat with legs straight and toes pointing away.
2. Bend one knee and pull the heel toward your glutes by contracting the back of the thigh.
3. Hold briefly at the top, then lower the foot slowly to the starting position.
Safety cue: Press your hips into the bench and curl the heel with controlled motion

Health benefit: Strengthens gluteal muscles and supports functional hip extension
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall beside a sturdy support and place one hand lightly on it.
2. Keep the torso upright and extend one leg straight back without bending the knee.
3. Squeeze the glute at the top, then lower the leg slowly to the starting position.
4. Repeat with the other leg while maintaining a steady upright posture.
Safety cue: Hinge from the hip and keep the torso tall while using the support

Health benefit: Improves hip mobility and rotational range of motion
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat on the floor.
2. Keep your shoulders down and slowly let both knees drop to one side as far as comfortable.
3. Return the knees to center, then lower them slowly to the opposite side.
Safety cue: Anchor your pelvis and rotate the knees slowly with steady breathing

Health benefit: Strengthens calf muscles and enhances ankle plantarflexion control
Steps to perform:
1. Sit tall near the front edge of a chair with feet flat and knees bent.
2. Lift both heels off the floor so only the balls of your feet and toes touch.
3. Hold briefly at the top, then lower the heels back to the floor with control.
Safety cue: Press through the balls of the feet and lift the heels with control

Health benefit: Improves foot intrinsic strength and supports arch stability
Steps to perform:
1. Sit in a chair and place a small towel flat under one foot.
2. Spread your toes, then curl them to scrunch the towel toward you.
3. Continue scrunching the towel with repeated toe curls while keeping your heel on the chair.
4. Smooth the towel back out with your foot between sets.
Safety cue: Anchor the heel and curl the toes deliberately to pull the towel

Health benefit: Improves dynamic balance and gait coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and place one foot directly in front of the other so the heel touches the opposite toe.
2. Take a slow, controlled step forward, placing the heel of the moving foot directly in front of the toes of the other.
3. Continue walking heel-to-toe for the desired distance while maintaining steady balance.
Safety cue: Take slow heel-to-toe steps and maintain an upright posture

Health benefit: Enhances deep core activation and trunk stability
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat, arms extended up toward the ceiling.
2. Slowly lower one arm back overhead toward the floor while keeping the other arm pointed up.
3. Return the lowered arm to the ceiling and repeat with the opposite arm while keeping your core stable.
4. Maintain a neutral spine and breathe steadily throughout the movement.
Safety cue: Press the low back into the floor and move the arms slowly with control

Health benefit: Promotes spinal mobility and gentle trunk flexibility
Steps to perform:
1. Begin on hands and knees with wrists under shoulders and knees under hips.
2. Inhale and drop the belly while lifting the head and tailbone to arch the back (cow).
3. Exhale and round the back, tucking the chin and tailbone to lift the mid-back (cat).
Safety cue: Move through full spinal flexion and extension with deep, steady breaths

Health benefit: Improves neck posture and strengthens neck stabilizing muscles
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat on the floor.
2. Tuck your chin gently toward your chest to create a small double chin.
3. Lift your head an inch off the floor while keeping the chin tucked.
4. Hold briefly and lower your head slowly to the floor.
Safety cue: Tuck your chin and lift the head while maintaining a neutral spine

Health benefit: Enhances thoracic rotation and shoulder mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Start on hands and knees with hands under shoulders and knees under hips.
2. Reach one arm under the opposite arm and rotate your torso to thread the arm through.
3. Rest your shoulder and ear toward the floor and breathe.
4. Return to all fours and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Rotate through the thoracic spine slowly while keeping the low back stable

Health benefit: Improves shoulder internal rotation and flexibility
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your side with the affected arm bent at 90 degrees at the shoulder and elbow.
2. Use your top hand to gently press the forearm down toward the bed or floor.
3. Hold the stretch where you feel mild tension and relax.
Safety cue: Anchor the shoulder blade and rotate the arm with controlled motion

Health benefit: Promotes lateral shoulder mobility and controlled scapular movement
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing a table and place your forearm on the tabletop.
2. Glide your hand laterally across the surface while keeping your elbow on the table.
3. Slide until you feel a gentle stretch at the side of your shoulder, then return.
Safety cue: Slide the arm laterally with the elbow close and avoid shrugging the shoulder

Health benefit: Enhances scapular control and supports upright posture
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with your back and heels against a wall.
2. Pull your shoulder blades down and together without shrugging.
3. Hold the set briefly and then relax.
Safety cue: Press your shoulder blades gently into the wall while keeping your ribs down

Health benefit: Improves wrist mobility and range of motion
Steps to perform:
1. Sit with your forearm supported on a table and the palm facing down.
2. Move your wrist toward the thumb side to perform radial deviation.
3. Move your wrist toward the little-finger side to perform ulnar deviation.
Safety cue: Move the wrist slowly through a comfortable range while keeping the forearm supported

Health benefit: Strengthens upper back and shoulder stabilizers
Steps to perform:
1. Lie face down or prop your chest on a low bench with arms overhead in a Y.
2. Lift your arms a few inches off the surface by squeezing your shoulder blades downward and together.
3. Hold briefly at the top while keeping the neck neutral.
4. Lower your arms slowly back down.
Safety cue: Hinge at the hips, keep the neck neutral, and lift using your shoulder blades

Health benefit: Promotes cardiovascular activity and improves balance and coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart.
2. Lift one knee to hip level and lower it while alternating legs.
3. Swing your opposite arm with each step and maintain an upright posture.
Safety cue: Stand tall, engage your core, and march with controlled breaths

Health benefit: Strengthens hip external rotators and glute muscles for improved lateral stability
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your side with knees bent and feet stacked together.
2. Keep feet touching and lift the top knee upward while keeping hips stacked.
3. Lower the knee slowly back to the start position.
Safety cue: Keep hips stacked and core braced as you open the knee

Health benefit: Challenges static balance and enhances postural control in narrow stance
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with one foot directly in front of the other so the heel touches the opposite toe.
2. Keep your weight centered, hips level, and gaze forward.
3. Hold the position for the desired time then switch the leading foot.
Safety cue: Keep hips level, soften the knees, and focus your gaze forward

Health benefit: Promotes calf flexibility and ankle dorsiflexion for improved walking mechanics
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing a wall and place both hands on it at shoulder height.
2. Step one foot back with the heel on the floor and keep the back leg straight.
3. Lean toward the wall until you feel a stretch in the back calf, then switch sides.
Safety cue: Press the back heel down and keep the back leg straight for a steady stretch

Health benefit: Activates deep abdominal muscles to enhance pelvic alignment and core stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width apart and knees slightly bent.
2. Tighten your abdominal muscles and tilt your pelvis to flatten your lower back.
3. Hold the tucked position briefly, then relax to neutral.
Safety cue: Tuck the pelvis by engaging the core and avoid overarching the lower back

Health benefit: Encourages gentle spinal elongation and relaxation while stretching the hips and back
Steps to perform:
1. Kneel on the floor with big toes touching and knees apart.
2. Sit back toward your heels and extend your arms forward on the floor.
3. Lower your forehead toward the mat and relax into the position.
Safety cue: Reach the hips back toward the heels and breathe while maintaining a long spine

Health benefit: Enhances thoracic mobility and rotational range of motion
Steps to perform:
1. Sit upright on a chair with feet flat and hands behind your head.
2. Rotate your chest and upper back to one side while keeping hips facing forward.
3. Look over the rotating shoulder to increase the turn.
4. Return to center and repeat to the other side.
Safety cue: Sit tall and rotate from the mid back with control

Health benefit: Improves shoulder elevation strength and upper trapezius engagement
Steps to perform:
1. Stand or sit tall with arms at your sides.
2. Lift both shoulders straight up toward your ears.
3. Lower your shoulders slowly back down.
Safety cue: Lift straight up and lower slowly without shrugging the neck

Health benefit: Builds internal shoulder stability and rotator cuff endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with your elbow bent 90° and the elbow anchored at your side.
2. Place your forearm against a stable object or your other hand.
3. Press your forearm inward into the object without letting the arm move.
4. Hold the press, then relax.
Safety cue: Keep elbow pinned to your side and press inward without shrugging

Health benefit: Builds core strength and promotes shoulder and spinal stability
Steps to perform:
1. Kneel and make fists so your knuckles rest on the floor under your shoulders.
2. Align your elbows under your shoulders and engage your core.
3. Keep a straight line from head to knees and hold the position.
4. Lower your knees to rest when finished.
Safety cue: Maintain a straight line from head to knees and brace the core

Health benefit: Improves scapular control and functional shoulder elevation
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing a wall with feet a few inches away and forearms resting on the wall.
2. Slide your arms upward in the scapular plane with thumbs pointing up.
3. Maintain contact with the wall and controlled movement.
4. Slide your arms back down to the starting position.
Safety cue: Keep forearms against the wall and slide in the scapular plane without shrugging

Health benefit: Increases low-intensity cardiovascular activity and lateral movement coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet together and arms relaxed at your sides.
2. Step one foot laterally and bring the other foot to meet it in a tapping motion.
3. Continue stepping side to side in a rhythmic pattern.
Safety cue: Step with control, keep chest up and avoid letting the knees collapse inward

Health benefit: Strengthens quadriceps and improves knee joint control
Steps to perform:
1. Sit upright on a chair with feet flat and a small rolled towel behind the knee.
2. Press the back of the knee gently into the towel and straighten the leg by tightening the front thigh.
3. Hold the contraction and then relax the leg and repeat.
Safety cue: Keep the thigh stable and extend the knee with slow controlled motion

Health benefit: Enhances lateral hip strength and pelvic stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall next to a chair for light support and shift weight onto the standing leg.
2. Lift the other leg slightly out to the side without rotating the hips and hold the raised position.
3. Squeeze the outer hip muscles and maintain the isometric hold, then lower the leg.
Safety cue: Keep hips level and abduct the leg without leaning your torso

Health benefit: Promotes ankle mobility and lower limb coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Sit tall at the edge of a chair with knees bent and feet flat.
2. Lift one foot an inch off the floor and tap the heel back down repeatedly.
3. Alternate feet in a steady rhythm while keeping the core engaged.
Safety cue: Brace your core and tap the foot deliberately without bouncing

Health benefit: Develops single leg balance and proprioceptive awareness
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing a wall with one hand lightly touching the wall for balance.
2. Shift weight onto one leg and lift the opposite foot slightly off the floor.
3. Hold balance and reach forward to touch the wall gently with the free hand.
4. Return the lifted foot to the floor and switch legs.
Safety cue: Keep the standing knee slightly bent and control each touch to the wall

Health benefit: Strengthens intrinsic foot muscles and improves toe dexterity
Steps to perform:
1. Sit tall with feet flat and heels on the floor.
2. Spread all five toes apart as wide as possible and hold the spread.
3. Relax the toes and repeat for the set.
Safety cue: Keep the heel grounded and actively spread the toes while maintaining a neutral ankle

Health benefit: Improves cervical posture and head alignment
Steps to perform:
1. Sit upright with feet flat and shoulders relaxed.
2. Gently draw your chin straight back to create a small double chin without tilting the head.
3. Hold briefly, then relax and repeat.
Safety cue: Retract chin and glide the head straight back while keeping shoulders relaxed

Health benefit: Enhances thoracic spine mobility and rotational range
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width and arms extended at shoulder height.
2. Rotate your torso and reach one arm back while keeping hips facing forward.
3. Return to center and repeat to the other side.
Safety cue: Hinge at the hips and rotate your chest while keeping the pelvis square

Health benefit: Strengthens core stability and improves trunk endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Kneel and place forearms on the floor shoulder-width apart.
2. Lift your hips so your body forms a straight line from head to knees.
3. Hold with steady breathing, then lower down.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Increases chest flexibility and promotes improved shoulder range of motion
Steps to perform:
1. Stand in a doorway and place one forearm on the frame at shoulder height.
2. Step forward on the same side and gently lean your torso through the doorway until you feel a chest stretch.
3. Hold briefly, then switch sides.
Safety cue: Keep a neutral pelvis and gently retract the shoulder blades without arching the low back

Health benefit: Improves lateral mobility and supports balance with low joint stress
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with knees soft and feet hip-width apart.
2. Step sideways with one foot and bring the other foot to meet it in a slight squat.
3. Continue stepping smoothly in one direction then reverse.
Safety cue: Take controlled side steps with knees slightly bent and weight centered over your feet

Health benefit: Enhances circulation and maintains gentle cardiovascular activity and coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width and engage your core.
2. Lift one knee to a comfortable height, lower it, then lift the other knee in a marching rhythm.
3. Swing your arms naturally and maintain a gentle pace.
Safety cue: March with a tall spine, engage the core, and breathe steadily

Health benefit: Strengthens gluteal muscles and promotes hip extension control
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and feet hip-width on the floor.
2. Press through your heels and squeeze your glutes to lift your hips until your body forms a straight line.
3. Hold the top position, then lower your hips slowly to the floor.
4. Repeat the lift with controlled motion.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Builds hip abductor strength and improves pelvic stability
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your side with legs stacked and head supported by your arm.
2. Keep the top leg straight and lift it upward to about hip height.
3. Lower the leg slowly with control back to the starting position.
Safety cue: Keep hips stacked and avoid rotating the torso as you lift the top leg

Health benefit: Promotes ankle mobility and enhances proprioceptive awareness
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back and lift one leg slightly off the ground.
2. Point your toes and draw large circles with the ankle.
3. Reverse the direction and repeat the same number of circles.
Safety cue: Move only the foot from the ankle joint and control the motion throughout

Health benefit: Improves single leg stability and neuromuscular balance control
Steps to perform:
1. Stand near a wall or chair for optional support.
2. Shift your weight onto one leg and lift the other foot off the ground to knee height.
3. Keep your hips level and gaze steady ahead.
4. Maintain balance for the desired time, then switch legs.
Safety cue: Keep a soft bend in the standing knee and maintain an upright posture

Health benefit: Improves plantar fascia flexibility and supports foot mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Sit upright and cross one ankle over the opposite knee.
2. Grasp the toes of the crossed foot and gently pull them back toward the shin.
3. Hold the stretch in the arch, then switch to the other foot.
Safety cue: Pull the toes toward the shin and keep the foot aligned with a relaxed ankle

Health benefit: Enhances gait coordination and challenges dynamic balance while walking
Steps to perform:
1. Stand on a straight line or imagine one on the floor.
2. Step forward placing the heel on the line and roll forward onto the toes.
3. Continue walking along the line with heel-to-toe placement and controlled steps.
Safety cue: Take small controlled steps and place each foot heel to toe while staying upright

Health benefit: Improves upper trapezius flexibility and neck range of motion
Steps to perform:
1. Sit or stand tall with shoulders relaxed.
2. Tilt your head toward one shoulder and reach up with the same-side hand.
3. Gently pull your head closer to the shoulder until you feel a stretch and hold.
Safety cue: Keep shoulder down and spine long while tilting the head toward the opposite shoulder

Health benefit: Enhances thoracic mobility and spinal rotation control
Steps to perform:
1. Start on hands and knees with a neutral spine.
2. Place one hand behind your head and keep the other hand planted.
3. Rotate your chest and lifted elbow up toward the ceiling, opening your chest.
4. Return the elbow toward the supporting hand and repeat, then switch sides.
Safety cue: Keep hips stable and rotate through the thoracic spine with control

Health benefit: Strengthens scapular stabilizers and improves posterior shoulder alignment
Steps to perform:
1. Lie face down on a bench or the floor with arms at your sides.
2. Squeeze your shoulder blades together and lift them slightly off the surface.
3. Hold briefly, then relax and repeat.
Safety cue: Squeeze the shoulder blades together without shrugging the shoulders

Health benefit: Builds shoulder mobility and active upper extremity coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Stand side-on to a wall with the inside hand placed at shoulder height.
2. Slide your hand laterally along the wall, reaching upward as far as comfortable.
3. Reverse the motion to return to the start.
4. Repeat for desired reps then switch sides.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Improves hand grip strength and forearm muscular endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Sit or stand and roll a small towel into a tight cylinder.
2. Hold the towel in one hand and squeeze as hard as possible for a set time.
3. Release slowly and repeat, then switch hands.
Safety cue: Grip the towel firmly using fingers and thumb without tensing the forearm excessively

Health benefit: Develops chest and triceps activation with reduced load on joints
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing a wall and make fists, placing your knuckles on the wall at chest height.
2. Step your feet back slightly so your body forms a straight line and bend your elbows to approach the wall.
3. Push back to the starting position and repeat.
Safety cue: Maintain a neutral spine and lower with controlled elbows close to the body

Health benefit: Improves lateral agility and lower body coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with knees slightly bent and feet together.
2. Step to the side with one foot and touch the trailing foot next to it, keeping a light bounce.
3. Alternate sides continuously at a controlled pace.
Safety cue: Step laterally with controlled weight transfer and keep the chest lifted

Health benefit: Strengthens hamstrings and supports knee joint function
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall facing a chair and hold the back for support.
2. Shift weight onto one leg and bend the other knee to lift your heel toward your butt.
3. Pause briefly at the top while squeezing the back of the thigh.
4. Lower the foot slowly to the start position and repeat.
Safety cue: Keep hips level and curl the heel toward the glutes with a slow controlled motion

Health benefit: Activates quadriceps to improve knee extension control
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back and place a rolled towel under one knee.
2. Keep the other leg relaxed on the floor.
3. Straighten the knee of the rolled leg by lifting the foot until the knee is nearly straight.
4. Hold briefly then lower the foot back down with control.
Safety cue: Support the thigh and contract the quad to extend the knee with controlled movement

Health benefit: Enhances hip flexor endurance and promotes circulation in lower limbs
Steps to perform:
1. Sit upright in a chair with feet flat and hands on the sides of the chair.
2. Lift one knee up toward the chest to a comfortable height.
3. Lower that foot back to the floor with control.
4. Alternate lifting the other knee and continue marching rhythmically.
Safety cue: Sit tall with a neutral spine and lift each knee slowly without leaning back

Health benefit: Builds calf muscle strength and supports ankle stability
Steps to perform:
1. Sit tall in a chair with feet flat hip-width apart.
2. Press through the balls of your feet to lift your heels off the floor.
3. Pause briefly at the top while keeping toes on the floor.
4. Lower the heels slowly back to the floor and repeat.
Safety cue: Press through the balls of the feet and lift the heels with controlled ankle alignment

Health benefit: Develops lower body strength and functional sit to stand ability
Steps to perform:
