1. Stand in front of a chair with feet hip-width apart and arms extended if needed.
2. Sit back toward the chair by bending at the hips and knees until your hips touch the chair lightly.
3. Press through your heels to stand back up to full extension.
4. Repeat the sit-to-stand movement with controlled motion.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Strengthens lateral core muscles and improves side stability
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your side with knees bent and prop your upper body on your forearm.
2. Stack your hips and knees and press into the forearm to lift your hips off the floor.
3. Hold a straight line from shoulders to knees while keeping the core engaged.
4. Lower your hips with control and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Stack shoulders over elbow and lift hips into a straight line while breathing steadily

Health benefit: Improves thoracic mobility and upright posture
Steps to perform:
1. Sit on a chair with feet flat and hands behind your head.
2. Arch your upper back over the chair back and lift your chest.
3. Hold briefly, then return to an upright position.
Safety cue: Sit tall and extend through the thoracic spine while keeping the core braced

Health benefit: Promotes scapular control and shoulder girdle stability
Steps to perform:
1. Sit upright with arms relaxed at your sides.
2. Pull your shoulder blades downward and slightly together.
3. Hold briefly, then release to a neutral shoulder position.
Safety cue: Keep shoulders down and back and avoid shrugging toward the ears

Health benefit: Enhances scapular mobility and shoulder range of motion
Steps to perform:
1. Start on hands and knees with shoulders over wrists and hips over knees.
2. Slide your hands forward along the floor while keeping a neutral spine.
3. Lower your chest toward the floor as far as is comfortable without collapsing the midline.
4. Pause, then slide your hands back to the starting position.
Safety cue: Maintain a neutral pelvis and slide the shoulders forward with slow controlled motion

Health benefit: Strengthens shoulder external rotators and improves rotational control
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your side with the top elbow bent to 90° and a towel roll under the elbow.
2. Keep the elbow tucked to your side and hold a light weight or your hand in neutral.
3. Rotate the forearm upward away from your abdomen while keeping the elbow against the towel.
4. Lower slowly to the start position and repeat.
Safety cue: Keep the elbow tucked to the side and rotate slowly while stabilizing the shoulder blade

Health benefit: Builds core endurance and enhances trunk stability
Steps to perform:
1. Start on hands and knees and lower your forearms to the floor.
2. Align shoulders over elbows and position knees under hips.
3. Engage your core and lift hips until a straight line forms from shoulders to knees.
4. Hold briefly, then lower hips back to the floor.
Safety cue: Keep a straight line from head to hips and brace the core

Health benefit: Promotes cervical alignment and deep neck muscle activation
Steps to perform:
1. Sit upright with shoulders relaxed and eyes forward.
2. Draw your chin straight back to create a double-chin without tilting the head.
3. Hold briefly, then relax to a neutral position.
Safety cue: Gently retract the chin keeping eyes level and lengthen the back of the neck

Health benefit: Improves shoulder mobility and thoracic extension awareness
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent, feet flat, and elbows bent at your sides.
2. Press elbows and hands lightly into the floor while keeping a neutral lower back.
3. Slide your arms slowly overhead as far as is comfortable while maintaining contact.
4. Return your arms to your sides with control.
Safety cue: Keep the low back gently on the floor and move the shoulders slowly without arching

Health benefit: Enhances hip flexor activation and circulation through rhythmic seated movement
Steps to perform:
1. Sit tall with feet flat and hands on your hips or at your sides.
2. Lift one knee toward your chest in a controlled motion.
3. Lower that foot and alternate legs in a steady marching rhythm.
Safety cue: Sit tall with hips back and lift knees alternately with controlled breath

Health benefit: Improves quadriceps activation and knee joint mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Sit tall on a firm chair with feet flat and hands resting at sides.
2. Extend the right leg forward until the knee is almost straight.
3. Hold the extended position briefly and squeeze the thigh.
4. Lower the right foot and repeat with the left leg, alternating smoothly.
Safety cue: Keep core braced and back against the chair while extending the knee slowly

Health benefit: Enhances quadriceps engagement and improves knee stability
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with legs extended and a small towel under one knee if needed.
2. Tighten the front thigh muscle and press the back of the knee gently into the surface.
3. Hold the contraction briefly and then relax.
Safety cue: Squeeze the thigh and press the knee into the mat while keeping the pelvis level

Health benefit: Strengthens hip abductor muscles and enhances lateral pelvic control
Steps to perform:
1. Stand next to a chair and lightly hold the back for support.
2. Keep your toes pointing forward and your torso upright.
3. Lift one leg sideways a few inches without rotating the hips.
4. Lower the leg with control and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Stand tall with hips square and lift the leg without tilting the pelvis

Health benefit: Improves inner thigh flexibility and hip range of motion
Steps to perform:
1. Sit upright on a chair and bring the soles of your feet together.
2. Let your knees fall outward and hold your feet with your hands.
3. Gently press your knees toward the floor and breathe calmly.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Engages lower abdominal muscles and promotes ankle mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Sit tall with heels on the floor and toes lifted.
2. Tap your toes down to the floor one foot at a time in a steady rhythm.
3. Maintain an upright posture and continue alternating taps.
Safety cue: Keep the low back neutral and lower each toe with control while breathing evenly

Health benefit: Challenges balance and improves single leg stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand behind a chair and place both hands lightly on the back for balance.
2. Shift your weight onto one leg and bend the standing knee slightly.
3. Lift the other foot off the floor and hold the knee at hip height.
4. Lower the lifted foot and switch legs, keeping slow controlled movements.
Safety cue: Keep hips level and a soft support knee while lightly touching the chair for balance

Health benefit: Increases calf flexibility and ankle dorsiflexion range
Steps to perform:
1. Sit with one leg extended and loop a strap or towel around the ball of the foot.
2. Keep the knee straight and pull the strap toward you until you feel a stretch in the calf.
3. Hold the stretch with steady breathing and avoid bouncing.
4. Release the strap and switch to the other leg.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Enhances postural control and proprioceptive awareness
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with one foot slightly in front of the other and feet about shoulder-width apart.
2. Find a steady position and soften your knees while keeping the hips level.
3. Hold the stance for a set time, then switch the front foot.
Safety cue: Maintain hips and shoulders aligned and engage the core to control balance between the feet

Health benefit: Activates deep core muscles and promotes coordinated lower limb movement
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat on the floor.
2. Engage your core and lift one knee toward your chest to a comfortable height.
3. Lower that foot and lift the other knee in a marching rhythm.
4. Keep the pelvis stable and continue alternating slowly.
Safety cue: Maintain a neutral spine and brace the core as you lift each knee slowly

Health benefit: Encourages gentle spinal extension and supports upright posture
Steps to perform:
1. Lie face down and place your forearms on the floor with elbows under the shoulders.
2. Press through your forearms to lift your chest slightly while keeping the pelvis on the floor.
3. Hold the gentle backbend for a few breaths and then lower down.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Enhances shoulder mobility and thoracic rotation
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your side with knees bent and the top arm extended straight out from the shoulder.
2. Rotate the top arm in a smooth arc overhead and across your body like a windmill.
3. Keep hips stacked and move only the arm through the range.
4. Reverse the arc back to the starting position.
Safety cue: Keep the top hip stacked and rotate the shoulder with slow control

Health benefit: Promotes gentle shoulder joint mobility and fluid movement
Steps to perform:
1. Lean forward and support your non‑working hand on a stable surface.
2. Let the working arm hang down relaxed from the shoulder.
3. Move the hanging arm in small controlled circles.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Improves scapular control and shoulder range of motion
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a tabletop position with hands under shoulders and knees under hips.
2. Place a towel under one hand and reach that hand diagonally forward and outward while keeping the trunk stable.
3. Slide the hand back to the starting point with control.
4. Repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Brace the core and slide the hand diagonally without arching the lower back

Health benefit: Builds shoulder stability and muscular endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Stand side to a wall with your elbow bent at 90 degrees and the outer arm against the wall.
2. Press the arm outward into the wall without allowing shoulder movement.
3. Maintain the press with steady effort, then relax.
Safety cue: Press evenly into the wall keeping the shoulder blades down and avoid shrugging

Health benefit: Strengthens core and lateral trunk stability
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your side with knees bent and prop your forearm under your shoulder.
2. Stack your hips and knees and lift your hips off the ground into a straight line from shoulders to knees.
3. Keep the top hand on your hip and hold the position.
4. Lower the hips with control.
Safety cue: Lift the hips and maintain a straight line from knees to shoulders

Health benefit: Opens chest and improves anterior shoulder flexibility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing into a corner and place your forearms on each wall at shoulder height.
2. Step one foot forward and lean your chest toward the corner.
3. Keep your spine neutral and hold the stretch.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Enhances upper back strength and scapular stability
Steps to perform:
1. Lie face down with arms overhead in a Y and thumbs pointing up.
2. Squeeze your shoulder blades and lift your arms off the floor a few inches.
3. Keep your neck neutral and lower the arms back down.
4. Repeat with controlled motion.
Safety cue: Keep your gaze down and lift from the shoulder blades without overextending the neck

Health benefit: Promotes knee and hip mobility through controlled flexion and extension
Steps to perform:
1. Sit tall on a chair with both feet flat on the floor.
2. Keep one heel in contact with the floor and slide it backward to bend the knee.
3. Slide the heel forward to return to the start and repeat.
Safety cue: Slide the heel with control and keep the pelvis stable

Health benefit: Strengthens hip abductors and enhances lateral pelvic stability
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your side with hips and knees bent and feet together.
2. Lift the top knee while keeping the feet touching and hips stacked.
3. Lower the knee slowly back to the start and repeat.
Safety cue: Keep hips stacked and avoid rolling the pelvis backward

Health benefit: Improves hip joint mobility and rotational range of motion
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat on the floor.
2. Drop both knees to one side while keeping both shoulders on the floor.
3. Return the knees to center.
4. Drop the knees to the opposite side and repeat.
Safety cue: Move slowly and keep the lower back gently pressed to the floor

Health benefit: Targets ankle muscles to improve inversion control and proprioception
Steps to perform:
1. Sit with your feet flat and the ankle relaxed.
2. Turn the sole of the foot inward by lifting the medial edge.
3. Return the foot to neutral and repeat.
Safety cue: Stabilize the shin and invert the foot with controlled movement

Health benefit: Enhances ankle flexibility and balance during weight transfers
Steps to perform:
1. Stand holding a stable surface with feet hip-width apart.
2. Rock backward onto your heels lifting the toes, then rock forward onto your toes lifting the heels.
3. Continue rocking in a controlled manner.
Safety cue: Shift weight slowly with soft knees and an upright torso

Health benefit: Activates foot intrinsic muscles to support arch stability and toe control
Steps to perform:
1. Sit or stand with the foot flat on the floor and toes relaxed.
2. Shorten the foot by drawing the ball of the foot toward the heel to lift the arch without curling the toes.
3. Hold briefly, relax, and repeat.
Safety cue: Keep toes relaxed and curl from the ball of the foot with control

Health benefit: Challenges dynamic balance and improves lateral foot placement accuracy
Steps to perform:
1. Find a straight line on the floor or imagine one and stand at one end.
2. Step forward placing the heel of each foot directly in front of the toes of the other foot.
3. Walk slowly along the line with controlled steps.
Safety cue: Take small controlled steps while keeping an upright posture

Health benefit: Encourages spinal mobility and gentle movement coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Stand hip-width apart and place hands on your thighs.
2. Round your spine and tuck your chin toward your chest.
3. Arch your spine, lift your chest, and look forward, then repeat.
Safety cue: Move the spine smoothly with steady breaths and soft knees

Health benefit: Improves neck lateral mobility and muscle flexibility
Steps to perform:
1. Sit tall on a chair with feet flat on the floor.
2. Tuck your chin and rotate your head toward the same-side armpit.
3. Place the same-side hand on the back of your head and gently guide the stretch.
Safety cue: Keep spine tall and shoulder blade down

Health benefit: Enhances thoracic spine rotation and core coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Start on hands and knees with a neutral spine.
2. Place one hand on the floor and rotate your torso while reaching the other hand up toward the ceiling.
3. Keep hips stable and follow your reaching hand with your eyes.
4. Return the reaching hand to the floor with control.
Safety cue: Keep hips level and rotate through the upper back slowly

Health benefit: Builds shoulder stability and upward rotation control
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing a wall with feet hip-width apart.
2. Place your hands on the wall at waist height and walk them upward until your arms are overhead.
3. Keep your core engaged and ribs down as you walk back down.
4. Repeat the upward and downward hand-walk with controlled movement.
Safety cue: Keep core braced and walk the hands up the wall with controlled motion

Health benefit: Enhances wrist extension flexibility and forearm muscle length
Steps to perform:
1. Extend one arm straight in front of you with the palm facing down.
2. Use the opposite hand to gently pull the fingers and hand downward toward the floor.
3. Keep the elbow straight and feel the stretch on the top of the forearm.
Safety cue: Keep the elbow extended and gently pull the wrist back until you feel a stretch

Health benefit: Develops core endurance while maintaining wrist alignment
Steps to perform:
1. Make fists and place your knuckles on the floor under your shoulders.
2. Step your feet back until your body forms a straight line from head to heels.
3. Engage your core and glutes to maintain a neutral spine.
4. Breathe steadily while holding the position.
Safety cue: Keep a straight line from head to heels and brace the core to prevent sagging

Health benefit: Strengthens posterior shoulder muscles and improves scapular retraction
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width and hinge forward at the hips with a flat back.
2. Hold light weights or no weights with a slight bend in the elbows.
3. Lift your arms out to the sides to shoulder height while squeezing your shoulder blades.
4. Lower with control and maintain the hinge.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Enhances mid back strength and scapular stabilization
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing an open door and grasp the handle with both hands.
2. Step back to create tension and pull your elbows straight back as if rowing.
3. Squeeze your shoulder blades and hold the contracted position.
4. Release slowly while maintaining steady posture.
Safety cue: Stand tall, keep elbows close, and press back against the door with steady tension

Health benefit: Strengthens quadriceps and improves knee extension control
Steps to perform:
1. Sit tall with feet flat and back supported.
2. Extend one leg until the knee is straight.
3. Hold the straight position, then lower with control.
Safety cue: Sit tall and control the knee extension with a braced core

Health benefit: Activates hamstrings to enhance posterior thigh stability
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat.
2. Dig one heel into the surface while contracting the back of the thigh.
3. Hold the contraction, then relax slowly.
Safety cue: Press the heel into the surface and keep the pelvis and low back stable

Health benefit: Improves hip abductor strength and lateral balance
Steps to perform:
1. Stand beside a chair and hold the back for support.
2. Lift the outside leg straight out to the side without tilting the torso.
3. Lower the leg with control back to the start.
Safety cue: Stand tall and lift the leg to the side without leaning the torso

Health benefit: Increases hip external rotation mobility and glute flexibility
Steps to perform:
1. Sit tall and cross one ankle over the opposite knee.
2. Press the crossed knee gently down to open the hip.
3. Hinge forward from the hips until you feel a gentle stretch.
Safety cue: Sit upright and hinge from the hips to keep the spine long during the stretch

Health benefit: Strengthens ankle evertors to support foot alignment
Steps to perform:
1. Sit with your foot against an immovable surface or an anchored band.
2. Push the outer edge of the foot outward without allowing visible movement.
3. Hold the push, then relax with control.
Safety cue: Keep the ankle neutral and press outward with steady controlled tension

Health benefit: Enhances shoulder mobility and controlled reaching patterns
Steps to perform:
1. Sit with your heel planted and toes free to move.
2. Move the toes and forefoot slightly toward one small clock position.
3. Return the foot to center, then repeat toward the other positions.
Safety cue: Move the leg with small controlled reaches while keeping the hips level and core engaged

Health benefit: Improves intrinsic foot strength and fine motor control
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with a small towel under the front of one foot.
2. Curl your toes to pull the towel toward you using your foot.
3. Smooth the towel back and repeat the scrunching action.
Safety cue: Stand with weight evenly distributed and use controlled toe flexion to scrunch the towel

Health benefit: Builds lateral hip strength and improves pelvic stability
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your side with a pillow supporting your head.
2. Keep the top leg straight and lift it upward without rotating the hips.
3. Lower the leg slowly back to the starting position.
Safety cue: Keep hips stacked and avoid rotating the torso as you lift the leg

Health benefit: Enhances core stability and coordinated trunk control
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and feet hovering above the floor.
2. Brace your core and slowly extend one leg until the heel taps the surface.
3. Return that leg to start and repeat the movement with the other leg.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Promotes lumbar mobility and gentle posterior chain stretching
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat.
2. Hug both knees into your chest using your hands.
3. Hold briefly, then lower your feet back to the floor with control.
Safety cue: Exhale as you draw both knees in and maintain a long neutral lumbar spine

Health benefit: Improves cervical range of motion and neck mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Sit or stand tall with shoulders relaxed.
2. Slowly turn your head to look over one shoulder until you feel a gentle stretch.
3. Return to center and repeat to the other side.
Safety cue: Keep chin level and rotate slowly within a comfortable range

Health benefit: Enhances thoracic rotation and shoulder mobility while promoting spinal flexibility
Steps to perform:
1. Sit sideways on a chair with feet flat and hips level.
2. Reach one arm up then thread the opposite arm under and across toward the back of the chair.
3. Rotate your torso and look toward the raised arm while keeping your chest lifted.
4. Return to center and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Keep hips square and thread through with slow controlled motion

Health benefit: Improves shoulder mobility and encourages scapular movement
Steps to perform:
1. Sit or stand tall with arms relaxed at your sides.
2. Lift both shoulders toward your ears and roll them forward in a smooth circular motion.
3. Continue for the desired number of repetitions.
Safety cue: Keep shoulders relaxed and roll slowly maintaining scapular control

Health benefit: Improves finger dexterity and hand coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Place your hand flat on a table with fingers together.
2. Lift and move each fingertip sideways one at a time to "walk" across the surface.
3. Reverse direction to return to the start position.
Safety cue: Keep wrist neutral and move fingers deliberately without collapsing the palm

Health benefit: Strengthens posterior shoulder and back extensors improving upright posture
Steps to perform:
1. Lie face down with forehead on the mat and arms alongside your torso.
2. Squeeze your shoulder blades and lift your chest a few inches while keeping your neck neutral.
3. Lower slowly back down and repeat.
Safety cue: Squeeze shoulder blades and lift using thoracic extension while keeping neck long

Health benefit: Builds biceps endurance and elbow stabilizer strength
Steps to perform:
1. Sit or stand with your elbow bent at about 90 degrees and upper arm fixed at your side.
2. Contract your biceps and press your hand against an immovable surface without moving the elbow.
3. Hold the contraction for the desired time, then relax.
Safety cue: Keep elbow tucked by your side and maintain steady tension without swinging

Health benefit: Enhances core stability and coordinated contralateral limb control
Steps to perform:
1. Start on all fours with fists on the ground under your shoulders and knees under your hips.
2. Extend one fist forward and the opposite leg back until both are parallel to the floor.
3. Hold briefly while keeping your core stable and hips level.
4. Return to the start and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Keep hips and shoulders square to the floor and extend slowly while bracing the core

Health benefit: Improves scapular retraction and shoulder external rotation mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Lie face down with arms extended to the sides in a T and thumbs pointing up.
2. Squeeze your shoulder blades and lift your arms a few inches off the ground while keeping your neck neutral.
3. Lower controlled back down and repeat.
Safety cue: Keep neck neutral and retract the shoulder blades as you lift arms into a T

Health benefit: Increases shoulder flexion range and thoracic extension
Steps to perform:
1. Sit tall with feet flat and hands resting at your sides.
2. Reach both arms overhead and extend through the fingertips while keeping the chest open.
3. Lower your arms back down with control and repeat.
Safety cue: Sit tall with ribs stacked over hips and reach overhead without arching the lower back

Health benefit: Improves lower body strength and functional transfer ability
Steps to perform:
1. Sit near the front of the chair with feet hip-width apart and flat on the floor.
2. Lean slightly forward and press down through your heels to lift your hips.
3. Stand up fully by straightening your hips and knees.
4. Reverse the movement slowly and sit back down with control.
Safety cue: Push through your heels and keep your spine neutral

Health benefit: Enhances quadriceps control and knee extension strength
Steps to perform:
1. Sit with a rolled towel under the back of the knee and the leg relaxed.
2. Tighten the front thigh to straighten the knee slightly and lift the heel a little.
3. Hold the contraction briefly, then slowly relax the muscle.
Safety cue: Extend the knee slowly while keeping the thigh aligned over the knee

Health benefit: Promotes glute activation and hip extension strength for improved posture
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing away from a wall with your hands lightly touching it for balance.
2. Brace your core and keep the standing leg slightly bent.
3. Extend one leg straight back by squeezing the glute without arching the lower back.
4. Lower the leg with control and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Keep your torso upright and hinge from the hip without arching your lower back

Health benefit: Improves hip flexor coordination and promotes gait patterning
Steps to perform:
1. Sit tall with feet flat on the floor and hands resting at your sides.
2. Lift one knee toward your chest while keeping your spine upright.
3. Lower that foot back to the floor and repeat with the other leg in a marching rhythm.
Safety cue: Maintain an upright pelvis and lift the knee with controlled motion

Health benefit: Increases ankle dorsiflexion range and foot clearance during walking
Steps to perform:
1. Sit or lie with the leg supported and the foot free to move.
2. Pull the toes and foot upward toward the shin using the front lower leg muscles.
3. Hold briefly at the top, then slowly lower the foot back to a neutral position.
Safety cue: Keep the heel down and pull the toes toward the shin with control

Health benefit: Strengthens intrinsic foot muscles and supports arch stability
Steps to perform:
1. Sit or stand with feet flat and weight evenly distributed.
2. Draw the ball of the foot toward the heel without curling the toes to shorten the arch.
3. Hold the shortened foot position briefly, then relax.
Safety cue: Shorten the foot by drawing the ball toward the heel without curling the toes

Health benefit: Enhances ankle stability and weight transfer control during standing and walking
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width apart and arms at your sides.
2. Rise slowly onto your toes and hold while keeping knees soft.
3. Shift your weight back onto your heels and hold, then return to neutral.
Safety cue: Keep a tall spine and press evenly through heel and toe

Health benefit: Promotes lumbopelvic control and lower back mobility awareness
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with your back against a wall and feet about one foot away from it.
2. Tilt your pelvis to press the small of your back toward the wall.
3. Hold the tucked position briefly, then release back to neutral.
Safety cue: Tilt the pelvis to press your lower back into the wall while keeping ribs relaxed

Health benefit: Improves spinal mobility and relaxation of trunk muscles
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat on the floor.
2. Drop both knees slowly to one side while keeping your shoulders on the floor.
3. Turn your head gently to the opposite side if comfortable.
4. Return the knees to center and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Move your knees slowly and keep both shoulders grounded on the floor

Health benefit: Reduces neck muscle tightness and improves neck range of motion
Steps to perform:
1. Sit tall with shoulders relaxed.
2. Place one hand behind your back and use the other hand to tilt your head away from that side.
3. Keep the opposite shoulder down and maintain a gentle pull.
Safety cue: Keep neck long and tilt from the top of the neck without shrugging the shoulder

Health benefit: Enhances thoracic mobility and improves posture alignment
Steps to perform:
1. Sit near the edge of a chair with feet flat and hands behind your head.
2. Lean back over the top of the chair back while lifting your chest and keeping elbows wide.
3. Return to upright with control and repeat.
Safety cue: Keep pelvis neutral and hinge from the thoracic spine rather than arching the lower back

Health benefit: Promotes scapular control and supports shoulder stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing a wall and place your hands on the wall at shoulder height with arms straight.
2. Keep your arms straight and pull your shoulder blades down away from your ears.
3. Hold the depressed position and then relax to neutral.
Safety cue: Draw shoulders down away from the ears and focus on scapular depression with control

Health benefit: Improves scapular upward rotation and shoulder mechanics
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with your back and hips against a wall and press the backs of your hands and forearms to the wall.
2. Keep contact with the wall and slide your arms upward by extending at the shoulders.
3. Reverse the motion by sliding your arms back down while maintaining contact.
4. Repeat with slow controlled movements.
Safety cue: Keep forearms and wrists in contact with the wall and slide using scapular motion only

Health benefit: Strengthens shoulder external rotators and improves joint stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with one elbow bent at 90 degrees and the elbow tucked to your side near a wall.
2. Press the back of your hand into the wall as if trying to rotate your forearm outward and resist the motion.
3. Maintain the isometric contraction and then relax.
Safety cue: Tuck elbow to 90 degrees and rotate externally without elevating the shoulder

Health benefit: Enhances forearm rotational mobility and functional wrist control
Steps to perform:
1. Sit or stand with elbow bent at 90 degrees and the forearm supported at your side.
2. Rotate your forearm to turn your palm up toward the ceiling in a controlled motion.
3. Reverse the motion to turn the palm down and repeat.
Safety cue: Keep elbow at your side and rotate the forearm slowly with control

Health benefit: Builds core endurance and trains shoulder and wrist stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing a wall and place your knuckles on the wall at shoulder height, shoulder-width apart.
2. Step your feet back until your body forms a straight line from head to heels and brace your core.
3. Hold the plank position while keeping the knuckles pressed into the wall and the spine neutral.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Opens anterior chest and supports improved breathing mechanics
Steps to perform:
1. Stand or sit tall and interlace your fingers behind your back with palms together.
2. Straighten your arms and squeeze your shoulder blades together while lifting your chest.
3. Keep the neck long and hold the expanded position.
Safety cue: Squeeze shoulder blades together to open the chest while keeping the neck neutral

Health benefit: Increases latissimus flexibility and enhances overhead reach
Steps to perform:
1. Kneel facing a bench or stable surface and place one forearm on the bench with the hand flat.
2. Keep the supporting knee under your hip and reach your hips back toward your heels.
3. Allow your torso to lower and lengthen over the bench arm to stretch the side of the ribcage.
4. Breathe steadily and switch sides after completing the set.
Safety cue: Keep hips square and reach through the arm while maintaining a long, aligned spine

Health benefit: Promotes whole body mobility and facilitates muscular tension release
Steps to perform:
1. Lie flat on your back with legs extended and arms reaching overhead toward the wall behind you.
2. Actively lengthen through your fingertips and toes by reaching in opposite directions.
3. Hold the extended position while keeping your spine neutral.
4. Relax your arms and legs and return to a resting position.
Safety cue: Lengthen from fingertips to toes and breathe steadily while keeping the core engaged

Health benefit: Increases quadriceps and gluteal muscle activation for lower limb strength
Steps to perform:
1. Sit upright with knees bent and feet flat on the footplate or wall.
2. Press your feet into the plate or wall without moving your legs.
3. Hold the press and keep the muscles engaged for the set time.
4. Relax slowly and breathe normally between repetitions.
Safety cue: Keep spine neutral and press evenly through both heels

Health benefit: Strengthens hip abductor muscles to improve lateral hip stability and control
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your side with the bottom leg bent and the top leg straight.
2. Lift the top straight leg upward away from the bottom leg in a controlled motion.
3. Lower the leg slowly back to the starting position.
Safety cue: Anchor your lower back to the mat and lift through the hip without rotating

Health benefit: Enhances hip flexor strength and thigh muscle coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your side with both legs straight and the top leg slightly forward.
2. Bend the top knee and lift the top thigh forward toward your torso.
3. Lower the leg back slowly to the starting position.
Safety cue: Keep hips stacked and core engaged to prevent rolling

Health benefit: Improves hip flexor length and hip extension mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Kneel with one knee on the ground and the other foot flat in front at 90 degrees.
2. Tuck your pelvis slightly and shift your weight forward until you feel a stretch in the front hip.
3. Hold the position and keep your torso upright.
4. Return to start and switch legs.
Safety cue: Maintain an upright torso and gently tuck the pelvis during the stretch

Health benefit: Builds calf muscle strength and ankle plantarflexion power
Steps to perform:
1. Sit tall with knees bent and loop a resistance band around the ball of one foot.
2. Press your toes and forefoot away from you against the band until your ankle points.
3. Return to neutral slowly and repeat.
Safety cue: Control the ankle motion and avoid bouncing through the range

Health benefit: Enhances balance and ankle proprioception on unstable surfaces
Steps to perform:
1. Stand barefoot on a soft surface like a foam pad and lift one foot off the ground.
2. Keep your hips level and focus on a fixed point ahead.
3. Hold the position for the desired time, then switch legs.
Safety cue: Keep a slight bend in the standing knee and maintain a level pelvis

Health benefit: Increases toe and forefoot mobility and intrinsic muscle activation
Steps to perform:
1. Sit with your foot supported and the ankle relaxed.
2. Use your hand to gently lift and extend the toes upward toward the shin.
3. Hold the stretch briefly and release slowly.
Safety cue: Stabilize the ankle and lift the toes deliberately without compensating elsewhere

Health benefit: Promotes gait precision and improves foot placement coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Place a straight piece of tape on the floor and stand at one end.
2. Walk forward placing the heel of one foot directly in front of the toes of the other foot on the line.
3. Continue walking the length of the tape with slow, controlled steps.
Safety cue: Walk slowly heel-to-toe with eyes forward and controlled posture

Health benefit: Encourages thoracic extension and improves upper back mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Lie face down with hands under your shoulders and elbows close to your sides.
2. Press through your hands to lift your chest a small distance while keeping your hips on the floor.
3. Lower your chest back down slowly and relax.
Safety cue: Keep the hips grounded and extend the thoracic spine with slow controlled movement

Rest intervals: Builds biceps strength and improves arm muscle endurance
Health benefit:
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width on the band and hold handles with palms facing up.
2. Keep elbows fixed at your sides and curl hands toward your shoulders.
3. Lower the handles with control back to the starting position.
Steps to perform: Keep elbows close to ribs and curl with controlled tempo

Rest intervals: Enhances lower body strength and functional leg power
Health benefit:
1. Stand on the band with feet shoulder-width and hold the handles at shoulder height.
2. Brace your core, push your hips back, and bend your knees to lower into a squat.
3. Keep your chest up and knees tracking over your toes.
4. Drive through your heels to stand and squeeze your glutes at the top.
Steps to perform: Sit back into hips chest up knees tracking over toes

Rest intervals: Combines lower and upper body strength with explosive full body coordination
Health benefit:
1. Stand on the band with feet shoulder-width and hold handles at shoulder level palms facing in.
2. Sit back into a squat by driving your hips back and bending your knees until thighs are near parallel.
3. Explosively stand and press the handles overhead until your arms are straight.
4. Lower the handles back to shoulder level with control and repeat.
Steps to perform: Drive through heels to stand and press overhead while bracing your core

Rest intervals: Strengthens core stability and resists rotational movement
Health benefit:
1. Anchor the band at chest height and stand perpendicular to the anchor, holding the handle with both hands at your chest.
2. Step away to create tension, brace your core, and position your feet hip-width apart.
3. Extend your arms straight out in front of you, resist rotation, then pull the handle back to your chest.
Steps to perform: Brace core and press straight out keeping shoulders level and hips square

Rest intervals: Targets triceps for improved arm extension strength
Health benefit:
1. Stand on or anchor the band behind you and hold the handle with both hands overhead, elbows close to your ears.
2. Keep your upper arms stationary and extend your forearms to straighten your arms.
3. Lower the handle slowly behind your head with control and repeat.
Steps to perform: Keep elbows close to ears and lower band slowly using triceps

Rest intervals: Activates glutes and posterior chain for hip strength and stability
Health benefit:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat hip-width apart.
2. Place a resistance band just above your knees.
3. Press your feet into the floor and lift your hips until your body forms a straight line from shoulders to knees.
4. Lower your hips with control until they hover above the floor.
Steps to perform: Drive hips up through heels, keep ribs down and core braced

Rest intervals: Builds leg and back strength while promoting postural control
Health benefit:
1. Stand on the band with feet shoulder-width apart and hold the handles at your sides.
2. Sit back into a squat, keeping your chest up and knees tracking over toes.
3. Drive through your heels to stand and pull the handles toward your ribcage, squeezing shoulder blades.
4. Extend your arms forward and return into the squat to repeat.
Steps to perform: Maintain chest up and neutral spine, row by pulling elbows back

Rest intervals: Enhances rotational core strength and dynamic trunk control
Health benefit:
1. Anchor the band above shoulder height and grasp the handle with both hands.
2. Stand with feet hip-width and take a short staggered stance away from the anchor.
3. Rotate your torso and pull the band down and across your body toward the opposite hip with arms extended.
4. Control the band back to the start position and repeat.
Steps to perform: Rotate from hips and core, control the band on the descent

Rest intervals: Develops chest and shoulder strength with standing stability challenge
Health benefit:
1. Anchor the band behind you at chest height and hold the handles at chest level.
2. Step forward into a split stance with one foot in front for stability.
3. Press the handles straight forward until your arms are extended and shoulders stay down.
4. Slowly return your hands to chest level and repeat.
Steps to perform: Keep shoulders down and back, press with stable core and neutral spine

Rest intervals: Improves hip abductor strength and lateral hip stability
Health benefit:
1. Lie on your side with knees bent and stacked, and place a band above your knees.
2. Keep your heels together and lift the top knee away from the bottom knee, opening the hips.
3. Pause at the top while maintaining a stable pelvis.
4. Slowly lower the top knee back to the start position.
Steps to perform: Keep hips stacked and still, open knee using glute control

Rest intervals: Builds lower body strength while improving balance and integrated arm strength
Health benefit:
1. Stand with one foot forward on the center of the band and hold the handles with palms facing up.
2. Step into a lunge by bending both knees until the front thigh is parallel to the floor.
3. Press through the front heel to rise and curl the band toward your shoulders.
4. Lower the arms with control and reset your stance before repeating or switching legs.
Steps to perform: Keep front knee aligned over ankle and torso upright

Rest intervals: Enhances rotational core strength and functional trunk stability
Health benefit:
1. Anchor the band low and stand sideways to the anchor with feet shoulder-width apart.
2. Hold the handle with both hands near the hip farthest from the anchor and hinge slightly at the hips.
3. Pull the band diagonally upward across your body, finishing above the opposite shoulder.
4. Return the handle to the low start position with control and repeat, then switch sides.
Steps to perform: Rotate through hips and core while maintaining a neutral spine

Rest intervals: Strengthens upper back and improves scapular stability and pulling mechanics
Health benefit:
1. Secure the band at chest height and stand facing the anchor with feet shoulder-width apart.
2. Hold the handles with arms extended and hinge slightly at the hips while keeping a straight back.
3. Pull the handles toward your ribcage by driving elbows back and squeezing your shoulder blades.
4. Extend the arms slowly to the start position with control and repeat.
Steps to perform: Pull with shoulder blades together keeping chest up and spine neutral

Rest intervals: Improves hip abductor strength and lateral stability during movement
Health benefit:
1. Place a loop band around both legs just above the knees and stand with feet hip-width apart.
2. Sink into a quarter squat by bending the knees and pushing the hips back.
3. Step laterally with one foot against the band's resistance, then follow with the other foot to restore hip-width.
4. Continue stepping side to side while maintaining band tension and a stable torso.
Steps to perform: Maintain a low half squat and step controlled without letting knees collapse

Rest intervals: Develops posterior chain strength while enhancing upper back and shoulder pulling power
Health benefit:
1. Stand on the band with feet hip-width and hold the handles in front of your thighs with palms facing you.
2. Hinge at the hips with a slight knee bend and lower the handles toward mid-shin while keeping a flat back.
3. Drive the hips forward to stand tall and pull the handles upward toward your chin with elbows leading.
4. Lower the handles back to the starting position with control and repeat.
Steps to perform: Hinge at hips with a neutral spine then lead pull with elbows high

Rest intervals: Strengthens obliques and improves trunk rotation control
Health benefit:
1. Sit on the floor with knees bent and feet flat, loop the band around your feet, and hold the ends with both hands.
2. Lean back slightly and lift your feet a few inches off the floor to engage the core.
3. Rotate your torso and hands to one side, moving the band across your body.
4. Return to center and rotate to the opposite side in a controlled motion.
Steps to perform: Keep spine tall and rotate from the ribs with controlled movement

Rest intervals: Improves shoulder girdle stability and scapular retraction strength
Health benefit:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and hold the band at chest height with hands shoulder-width apart.
2. Pull your hands outward, keeping arms straight and squeezing your shoulder blades together.
3. Slowly return your hands to the starting position with control.
Steps to perform: Retract shoulder blades and lead with elbows to avoid shrugging

Rest intervals: Activates and strengthens the glute muscles to enhance hip extension power
Health benefit:
1. Start on hands and knees and loop the band under your hands and around the sole of one foot.
2. Brace your core and drive that foot upward, keeping the knee bent at about 90 degrees.
3. Squeeze the glute at the top without arching the lower back.
4. Lower the foot back to the starting position with control.
Steps to perform: Keep hips square and kick with glute control without arching low back

Rest intervals: Combines unilateral lower body stabilization with chest pressing to improve functional pushing strength
Health benefit:
1. Anchor the band behind you at chest height and hold the handles at chest level with elbows bent.
2. Step one foot back into a split stance while keeping your torso upright.
3. Press the handles forward to extend your arms until they are straight.
4. Return to the starting position and repeat, then switch legs.
Steps to perform: Maintain upright torso and brace core as you step back and press

Rest intervals: Enhances deep core stability and coordination for improved spinal support
Health benefit:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent to 90 degrees and loop the band around both feet, holding the ends in your hands extended toward the ceiling.
2. Slowly lower one arm and the opposite leg toward the floor while maintaining tension on the band.
3. Return to the center and repeat the movement on the other side with controlled motion.
Steps to perform: Press low back into the floor and move limbs slowly with exhale

Rest intervals: Improves shoulder strength and overhead stability
Health benefit:
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width apart and the middle of the resistance band under both feet.
2. Hold the band handles at shoulder height with palms facing forward and elbows bent.
3. Press both hands upward until arms are nearly straight overhead.
4. Lower the handles back to shoulder height with control.
Steps to perform: Keep ribs down and shoulders away from ears while pressing with control

Rest intervals: Enhances glute activation and hip stability
Health benefit:
1. Place a loop band around your thighs just above the knees and come to hands and knees.
2. Keep your core tight and spine neutral.
3. Lift one knee out to the side to hip level while keeping the knee bent at 90 degrees.
4. Lower the knee back under control and repeat on the other side.
Steps to perform: Keep hips square and core braced as you lift the knee to the side

Exercise Name: Band Squat with Side Leg Lift
Rest intervals: Builds lower body strength and lateral hip control
Health benefit:
1. Place a loop band above your knees and stand with feet hip-width apart.
2. Sit back into a squat by pushing hips back and bending knees until thighs are parallel to the floor.
3. Stand up and shift weight onto one leg, lifting the other leg out to the side to hip height.
4. Return the lifted leg to neutral and repeat the squat on the next rep.
Steps to perform: Maintain chest up weight in heels and control the lateral lift

Rest intervals: Increases core endurance and shoulder stability
Health benefit:
1. Wrap a thin band around both wrists and come into a high plank position with hands under shoulders.
2. Brace your core and keep hips steady.
3. Lift one hand to tap the opposite shoulder while maintaining a stable plank.
4. Return the hand to the floor and alternate taps with the other hand.
Steps to perform: Keep hips level and core tight while tapping hands with controlled reach

Rest intervals: Strengthens shoulder abductors and improves shoulder mobility
Health benefit:
1. Stand on the center of the resistance band with feet shoulder-width apart and hold a handle in each hand at your sides.
2. Keep a slight bend in your elbows and palms facing down.
3. Raise both arms out to the sides to shoulder level with control.
4. Slowly lower the arms back to your sides.
Steps to perform: Hinge slightly from shoulders keep elbows soft and lift with scapular control

Rest intervals: Targets quadriceps strength and knee joint control
Health benefit:
1. Sit upright on a chair with feet flat and the band looped around one ankle and anchored under the chair leg.
2. Grip the sides of the chair and brace your core.
3. Extend the banded leg forward until the knee is straight.
4. Slowly return the leg to the starting position and repeat.
Steps to perform: Sit tall and brace core as you extend leg slowly

Exercise Name: Band Curtsy Lunge to Lateral Raise
Rest intervals: Combines lower body balance with shoulder and hip coordination
Health benefit:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width and a resistance band under both feet, holding the handles at your sides.
2. Step one leg diagonally behind into a curtsy and lower into a lunge.
3. As you push back to standing, lift both arms out to the sides to shoulder height.
4. Lower the arms and return feet to start, then repeat on the other side.
Steps to perform: Keep chest upright and step slowly to protect knee alignment

Rest intervals: Engages obliques and improves rotational core strength
Health benefit:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and the band looped around the soles of your feet, holding the ends in your hands.
2. Lift your head and shoulders and bring one elbow toward the opposite knee while extending the other leg.
3. Switch sides in a controlled pedaling motion while keeping tension in the band.
Steps to perform: Keep lower back grounded and rotate from ribs with control

Rest intervals: Develops anterior shoulder strength and improves scapular control
Health benefit:
1. Stand on the band with feet hip-width and hold the handles in front of your thighs with palms facing down.
2. Keeping a slight bend in your elbows, lift your hands forward to shoulder height.
3. Lower the handles slowly to the starting position and repeat.
Steps to perform: Lead with shoulders down and lift slowly without swinging

Rest intervals: Strengthens hamstrings and enhances posterior chain activation
Health benefit:
1. Lie face down on a mat with the band anchored at a low point and looped around your ankles.
2. Keep your hips pressed into the mat and bend your knees to curl your heels toward your glutes.
3. Squeeze your hamstrings at the top and hold briefly.
4. Slowly lower your legs to the starting position and repeat.
Steps to perform: Keep hips pressed down and curl heels toward glutes with control

Rest intervals: Improves rotational core strength and lower body power
Health benefit:
1. Anchor a resistance band at a high point and grasp the handles with both hands.
2. Step into a split stance with the front knee bent and the band held high to the outside of the front foot.
3. Drive through the front heel to rise and pull the band diagonally across your body toward the opposite hip.
4. Return to the lunge position while controlling the band back to the start.
Steps to perform: Keep chest tall and rotate from the torso not the knees

Rest intervals: Enhances core strength and abdominal control
Health benefit:
1. Anchor a band overhead and kneel facing away while holding the ends behind your head.
2. Brace your core and curl your torso forward, bringing your elbows toward your knees.
3. Slowly return to the upright kneeling position while maintaining band tension.
Steps to perform: Tuck ribcage and exhale to engage abs as you crunch

Rest intervals: Promotes scapular stability and upper back muscle balance
Health benefit:
1. Anchor the band at face height and grab the ends with an overhand or neutral grip.
2. Step back to create tension and pull your hands toward your face, leading with your elbows flared out.
3. Squeeze your shoulder blades together, then slowly extend your arms to return.
Steps to perform: Pull bands toward your face with elbows high and scapula retracted

Rest intervals: Improves hip abductor strength and lateral pelvic stability
Health benefit:
1. Loop a mini band around both ankles and stand tall with feet hip-width apart.
2. Shift weight onto the support leg and lift the other leg straight out to the side without leaning.
3. Control the band as you lower the leg back to the starting position.
Steps to perform: Keep hips level and move slowly controlling the band resistance

Rest intervals: Simultaneously strengthens glutes and chest while enhancing posterior chain engagement
Health benefit:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat, and loop the band under your feet while holding the ends at chest level.
2. Drive through your heels and lift your hips into a glute bridge while simultaneously pressing the band straight up from your chest.
3. Squeeze your glutes and keep your core engaged at the top.
4. Slowly lower your hips and bring your hands back to chest level with control.
Steps to perform: Squeeze glutes press through heels and maintain a neutral spine

Rest intervals: Increases lateral trunk strength and improves side bending control
Health benefit:
1. Stand with feet hip-width apart.
2. Secure one end of the band under the same-side foot and hold the other end overhead with that hand.
3. Keep hips square and bend at the waist toward the anchored foot.
4. Drive through your oblique to return upright and repeat.
Steps to perform: Keep ribs stacked over hips and hinge only at the waist

Rest intervals: Develops triceps strength and improves elbow extension control
Health benefit:
1. Stand with feet hip-width apart and place the band under one foot.
2. Hinge at the hips and bend the elbow so the upper arm is aligned with your torso.
3. Extend the elbow straight back until the arm is fully extended.
4. Bend the elbow to return to start and repeat.
Steps to perform: Keep elbow pinned to side and extend forearm with controlled motion

Rest intervals: Enhances hip extensor strength and supports posterior chain activation
Health benefit:
1. Anchor the band low behind you and loop the free end around your ankle.
2. Stand tall on the opposite leg with a slight forward lean.
3. Extend the banded leg straight back until the hip is fully extended, then return under control.
Steps to perform: Stand tall and squeeze glute to extend hip without arching lower back

Rest intervals: Builds core stability, shoulder endurance, and coordinated full body movement
Health benefit:
1. Loop a band around your waist and secure the other end to a low anchor behind you.
2. Start in a bear crawl position with hands under shoulders and knees hovering off the floor.
3. Move opposite hand and foot forward while resisting the band pull.
4. Maintain a flat back and controlled steps as you crawl.
Steps to perform: Brace your core and move slowly keeping spine long and hips level

Rest intervals: Strengthens anti rotation core stability and enhances bracing control
Health benefit:
1. Anchor the band at chest height and stand perpendicular to the anchor.
2. Hold the band with both hands at your chest and step away to create tension.
3. Press the band straight out and hold, resisting rotation.
Steps to perform: Brace core and press away from anchor to resist rotation while breathing

Rest intervals: Enhances shoulder external rotator strength and stability
Health benefit:
1. Attach the band to a stable anchor at elbow height or hold one end.
2. Stand side-on and bend your elbow to 90°, keeping the upper arm against your side.
3. Rotate your forearm away from your body until comfortable, keeping the elbow tucked.
4. Return slowly to the start position under control.
Steps to perform: Keep elbow tucked at side and rotate slowly with controlled scapular retraction

Rest intervals: Builds hip abductor strength and lateral stability
Health benefit:
1. Place the band around your ankles or just above your knees and stand with feet hip-width.
2. Sink into a shallow squat and brace your core.
3. Step diagonally forward with one foot, then follow with the other, keeping the band taut.
4. Continue stepping while maintaining the squat and steady band tension.
Steps to perform: Keep a slight squat, step sideways with constant tension and knees tracking toes

Rest intervals: Combines lower body strengthening with shoulder anterior control and coordination
Health benefit:
1. Stand on the band with feet shoulder-width and hold the ends at thigh level.
2. Sit back into a squat until your hips reach roughly knee level.
3. Stand up and lift the banded hands straight in front of you to shoulder height.
4. Lower the arms and return to the squat with control.
Steps to perform: Brace core, sit back into hips and raise arms maintaining a neutral spine

Rest intervals: Improves lower abdominal control and core stability
Health benefit:
1. Lie on your back and loop the band around your feet while holding the ends near your hips.
2. Raise both legs straight up toward the ceiling with knees extended.
3. Lower your legs slowly toward the floor until just above the ground.
4. Pull the legs back up to vertical using your core while keeping your lower back pressed to the floor.
Steps to perform: Press lower back into the mat and lower legs slowly with controlled core

Rest intervals: Enhances upper back and shoulder pulling strength
Health benefit:
1. Stand on the band with feet hip-width and hold the ends with palms facing your body.
2. Keep your chest up and pull the band upward along your midline toward your chin.
3. Lead the movement with your elbows and keep the band close to your body.
4. Lower the hands back down under control to the starting position.
Steps to perform: Lead with elbows, lift hands to chest height and avoid shrugging shoulders

Rest intervals: Develops single leg strength and balance control
Health benefit:
1. Place the resistance band under your front foot and hold the ends at shoulder height.
2. Step into a split stance with the back heel lifted and hips square.
3. Bend both knees and lower the back knee toward the floor while keeping your torso upright.
4. Press through the front heel to return to the start position and repeat.
Steps to perform: Keep front knee aligned over ankle and torso upright

Rest intervals: Increases low-impact cardiovascular fitness and lateral movement coordination
Health benefit:
1. Loop a mini band around both thighs just above the knees and stand with feet hip-width apart.
2. Step your right foot out to the side to create band tension and push your knees outward.
3. Step the right foot back to center, then step the left foot out and repeat the pattern.
Steps to perform: Land softly and maintain a neutral spine with controlled movements

Rest intervals: Improves core endurance and shoulder stability while elevating heart rate
Health benefit:
1. Secure a band around both feet and assume a high plank with hands under shoulders.
2. Brace your core and draw your right knee toward your chest against the band tension.
3. Return the right foot to plank and drive the left knee toward your chest.
4. Alternate legs in a controlled, steady rhythm while keeping hips level.
Steps to perform: Brace core and keep hips level with shoulders stacked over wrists

Rest intervals: Strengthens chest muscles and promotes scapular control
Health benefit:
1. Anchor the band behind you at chest height and hold the handles with a slight bend in the elbows.
2. Step forward to create tension and position your feet hip-width apart.
3. Squeeze your chest to bring your hands together in front of your chest, then return slowly.
Steps to perform: Keep a slight bend in elbows and retract shoulder blades

Rest intervals: Builds calf strength and improves ankle stability
Health benefit:
1. Stand on the band with feet hip-width and hold the ends or handles at shoulder level.
2. Shift your weight onto the balls of your feet and lift your heels as high as possible.
3. Lower your heels slowly back to the ground and repeat.
Steps to perform: Rise through midfoot with slow controlled motion and maintain upright posture

Rest intervals: Enhances core stability and lateral hip strength
Health benefit:
1. Loop a resistance band around your ankles and assume a forearm plank with elbows under shoulders.
2. Brace your core and keep your hips level.
3. Step one foot laterally against the band's tension while maintaining a stable plank.
4. Step the foot back and repeat the step-out with the other foot in a controlled rhythm.
Steps to perform: Maintain flat back and braced core as feet step wide and together

Rest intervals: Improves core coordination and glute activation
Health benefit:
1. Loop a band around one hand and the opposite foot and kneel on hands and knees.
2. Brace your core and keep a neutral spine.
3. Extend the banded arm forward while extending the opposite leg back until both are straight.
4. Return both limbs under control and repeat on the other side.
Steps to perform: Keep neutral spine and move limbs slowly avoiding rotation

Rest intervals: Strengthens upper back muscles and improves shoulder posture
Health benefit:
1. Stand on the center of a band with feet hip-width and hold the ends in each hand, hinge slightly forward.
2. Pull the band outward by squeezing your shoulder blades and keeping a slight bend in the elbows.
3. Slowly return to the start with control and repeat.
Steps to perform: Hinge from hips slightly and squeeze shoulder blades together

Rest intervals: Activates posterior chain and trains hip hinge mechanics
Health benefit:
1. Stand on a band with feet shoulder-width and place the other end across the back of your shoulders, holding it in place.
2. Hinge at the hips with a soft knee bend and a flat back, pushing your hips back until your torso is angled forward.
3. Drive your hips forward to return to standing while keeping tension on the band.
Steps to perform: Hinge at hips with neutral spine and soft knees

Rest intervals: Builds single leg stability while strengthening upper back pulling muscles
Health benefit:
1. Stand with one foot forward and one foot back, stepping on the band with the front foot and holding the ends in both hands.
2. Lower into a split squat by bending both knees until the back knee nears the ground and the front thigh is parallel.
3. Pull the band toward your ribcage by squeezing your shoulder blades to perform a row.
4. Extend your arms and press through the front heel to stand back up and repeat on the other side.
Steps to perform: Keep torso upright and weight centered while squeezing shoulder blades during each row

Rest intervals: Improves glute endurance and challenges core stability through dynamic marching
Health benefit:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent, feet flat, and the band looped just above your knees.
2. Press through your heels and lift your hips into a bridge, squeezing your glutes.
3. Lift one knee toward your chest while keeping your hips level and the band engaged.
4. Lower that foot back down and repeat by lifting the other knee in alternation.
Steps to perform: Maintain a neutral spine and squeeze glutes before each march

Rest intervals: Strengthens upper trapezius and supports shoulder elevation control
Health benefit:
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width apart and the band under both feet, holding the handles at your sides.
2. Keep your arms straight and torso tall, then lift your shoulders straight up toward your ears.
3. Pause and squeeze the upper traps at the top of the movement.
4. Lower your shoulders back down with control to the starting position.
Steps to perform: Draw shoulders down and back as you lift with controlled motion

Rest intervals: Develops hamstring strength and reinforces proper hip hinge mechanics
Health benefit:
1. Stand on the band with feet hip-width apart and hold the band ends with palms facing your thighs.
2. Slightly bend your knees and hinge at the hips, pushing them back while keeping your spine flat.
3. Lower your torso until you feel a stretch in your hamstrings while maintaining tension in the band.
4. Drive your hips forward to return to standing and squeeze your glutes at the top.
Steps to perform: Hinge from hips with a flat spine and soft knee to load hamstrings

Exercise Name: Band Sumo Squat to High Pull
Rest intervals: Combines lower body power with upper pulling for full body coordination
Health benefit:
1. Stand with feet wider than hip-width and toes slightly turned out, with the band under both feet and hands holding the ends between your legs.
2. Squat down by bending your knees and pushing your hips back, keeping your chest up and knees tracking your toes.
3. Explode up from the squat and pull the band up toward your chest with elbows flared high.
4. Lower your hands back between your legs and descend into the next squat.
Steps to perform: Push knees out keep chest up and explode through hips into the pull

Rest intervals: Improves rotational core strength and thoracic mobility
Health benefit:
1. Anchor the band at chest height or hold it with both hands extended in front of you while standing with feet shoulder-width apart.
2. Keep your hips stable and core engaged, then rotate your torso away from the anchor or band end.
3. Pause briefly at the end range while maintaining controlled tension on the band.
4. Rotate back to center and repeat the movement to the opposite side.
Steps to perform: Anchor hips rotate thoracic spine and control the movement with slow tempo

Rest intervals: Improves upper body power and neuromuscular coordination
Health benefit:
1. Anchor the band behind you at chest height and hold the handles with both hands.
2. Step forward into the band to create tension with a staggered stance.
3. Press both hands explosively forward until arms are almost straight.
4. Return the hands to chest level with control and repeat at a fast pace.
Steps to perform: Brace your core and maintain scapular stability during each press

Rest intervals: Improves lower limb muscular endurance and hip mobility
Health benefit:
1. Sit on the floor with legs extended and loop the band around the soles of your feet.
2. Lean back slightly to engage your core and hold the band ends in your hands.
3. Lower one heel to tap the floor, lift it back, and alternate legs in a steady rhythm.
Steps to perform: Sit tall with neutral spine and control each leg tap from the hip

Rest intervals: Enhances aerobic capacity and lateral coordination
Health benefit:
1. Place a loop band around your ankles and stand with feet together and knees soft.
2. Step your right foot out to the side while raising your arms to shoulder height.
3. Step your left foot back to the start and bring your arms down.
4. Continue alternating sides in a controlled, jack-like motion.
Steps to perform: Land softly keep knees aligned over toes and maintain upright posture

Rest intervals: Develops hip flexor power and improves balance
Health benefit:
1. Anchor the band low behind you and loop it around one ankle.
2. Stand tall facing away with the support foot planted and hips squared.
3. Drive the banded knee up toward your chest with a strong contraction.
4. Lower the knee with control and repeat, then switch sides.
Steps to perform: Drive knee with controlled hip flexion while keeping chest tall and core engaged

Rest intervals: Improves upper body endurance and hand eye coordination
Health benefit:
1. Sit on a chair and loop the band around your upper back, holding the handles at chest level.
2. Sit tall with your core engaged and elbows bent.
3. Extend one arm forward in a punch while rotating your torso slightly.
4. Return the hand to the start and punch with the opposite arm in a steady rhythm.
Steps to perform: Sit tall rotate through torso and exhale sharply with each punch

Rest intervals: Enhances lateral agility and lower body stability
Health benefit:
1. Loop a resistance band around your legs just above the knees.
2. Bend your knees and lower into an athletic stance.
3. Shuffle sideways with small, quick steps while keeping the band taut.
4. Maintain chest up and repeat the shuffle in the opposite direction.
Steps to perform: Keep chest up and hips level while stepping laterally with controlled cadence

Rest intervals: Improves rotational power and whole body coordination
Health benefit:
1. Stand on a loop band with feet shoulder-width and hold the ends in both hands.
2. Hinge slightly at the hips and bend your knees into a soft athletic stance.
3. Swing both arms and the band across your body from side to side in a controlled, explosive motion.
4. Keep your core braced and let your feet follow the upper-body rotation.
Steps to perform: Hinge slightly at hips maintain tall posture and absorb impact through knees

Rest intervals: Increases trunk rotational mobility and core engagement
Health benefit:
1. Sit with knees bent and feet flat, looping a resistance band around the soles of your feet.
2. Hold the band with both hands at chest height and brace your core.
3. Rotate your torso to one side, pulling the band across your body with control.
4. Return to center and repeat to the other side while keeping your hips stable.
Steps to perform: Sit tall brace core and rotate through thoracic spine not lower back

Rest intervals: Boosts shoulder endurance and overhead pressing speed
Health benefit:
1. Stand with feet hip-width and hold a resistance band overhead with hands slightly wider than shoulder width.
2. Press the band overhead until your arms are extended and your core is braced.
3. Perform quick, small pulses by slightly lowering and raising the band while keeping your arms extended.
4. Keep your shoulders down and move at a fast, controlled tempo.
Steps to perform: Keep ribs down and shoulders packed pulse with stable core

Rest intervals: Improves foot quickness and neuromuscular coordination for agility
Health benefit:
1. Place a loop band around your ankles and stand in an athletic stance.
2. Stay on the balls of your feet and slightly bend your knees.
3. Quickly march or run in place with short, rapid steps while keeping tension on the band.
4. Maintain an upright torso and quick, controlled foot contacts.
Steps to perform: Stay light on your toes maintain tall chest and quick controlled steps

Rest intervals: Builds lower body and shoulder endurance while improving coordination
Health benefit:
1. Stand on the band with feet shoulder-width and hold the handles at shoulder level.
2. Hinge hips back and lower into a shallow squat with chest up.
3. Drive through your heels to stand while pressing the handles overhead.
4. Lower the band back to shoulder level and repeat.
Steps to perform: Brace core and drive through heels as you press overhead

Rest intervals: Enhances core endurance and dynamic trunk stability
Health benefit:
1. Lie on your back with the band looped around your feet and hold the ends in your hands.
2. Lift your head and shoulders and bring one knee toward your chest while twisting the opposite elbow toward that knee.
3. Alternate legs rapidly in a bicycle motion while keeping tension on the band.
Steps to perform: Keep lower back pressed to the mat and control each rotation

Rest intervals: Strengthens upper back and improves posture
Health benefit:
1. Stand on the band and hinge slightly at the hips with a flat back.
2. Pull the handles quickly toward your ribs while squeezing your shoulder blades together.
3. Extend your arms back under control and repeat at a fast pace.
Steps to perform: Hinge from hips, retract shoulder blades and avoid shrugging

Rest intervals: Boosts cardiovascular fitness while engaging hip flexors and coordination
Health benefit:
1. Anchor the band behind you at waist height and loop it around your hips.
2. Stand tall and drive one knee up toward hip level while keeping a slight forward lean.
3. Alternate knees quickly while maintaining steady band tension and an upright torso.
Steps to perform: Land softly with tall chest and engage core on each knee drive

Rest intervals: Develops lower body power and muscular endurance
Health benefit:
1. Stand on the band with feet hip-width and hold the handles at shoulder level.
2. Sit back into a quick squat with hips moving down and back.
3. Drive up explosively through your heels while extending your hips.
4. Return to squat depth and repeat rapidly.
Steps to perform: Send hips back, chest upright and control the descent

Rest intervals: Challenges core stability while increasing heart rate and coordination
Health benefit:
1. Place a resistance band around your ankles and get into a high plank with hands under shoulders.
2. Jump both feet out wide against the band tension and land softly.
3. Jump both feet back together while keeping hips level and core engaged.
4. Repeat the jack rhythmically without letting your hips sag.
Steps to perform: Keep hips level and core braced as legs move

Rest intervals: Improves shoulder mobility and upper back strength
Health benefit:
1. Hold a resistance band with both hands shoulder-width apart and extend your arms diagonally across your body.
2. Pull your hands apart by retracting the shoulder blades and moving the arms outward along the diagonal.
3. Squeeze the upper back at end range while keeping the arms straight.
4. Control the band as you return to the starting diagonal position.
Steps to perform: Retract shoulder blades and keep chest lifted during the diagonal pull

Rest intervals: Enhances lateral hip strength and agility
Health benefit:
1. Place a resistance band around your ankles and stand tall with soft knees.
2. Step diagonally forward and outward with your right foot while keeping tension in the band.
3. Bring your left foot forward to meet or slightly behind the right while maintaining band tension.
4. Continue alternating diagonal steps to move forward in a zigzag pattern.
Steps to perform: Keep tall posture and take controlled diagonal steps with soft knees

Rest intervals: Improves single leg stability and glute activation
Health benefit:
1. Stand with feet hip-width and place the band under your front foot while holding the ends at your hips.
2. Step your other foot straight back into a controlled lunge until the front knee bends about 90 degrees.
3. Push through the front heel to return to standing while keeping the band under tension.
4. Repeat by stepping the opposite foot back on the next repetition.
Steps to perform: Step back with a tight core and ensure front knee tracks over toes

Rest intervals: Strengthens obliques and improves lateral trunk mobility
Health benefit:
1. Stand on the band with feet hip-width and hold an end of the band in each hand at shoulder height.
2. Brace your core and hinge at the waist to bend toward one side, sliding the top hand down your thigh.
3. Return to center by contracting the opposite oblique to lift back upright.
4. Alternate sides in a steady rhythm while keeping the band taut.
Steps to perform: Breathe steadily and hinge only at the waist without rounding the back

Rest intervals: Improves upper body power and rotational core strength
Health benefit:
1. Stand with feet hip-width on the band or anchor it low and hold handles at your sides with palms facing in.
2. Rotate your torso and drive one fist upward in an explosive uppercut toward your chin.
3. Return the hand to the starting position under control.
4. Alternate uppercuts quickly while keeping your core braced.
Steps to perform: Drive movement from hips and brace core to protect lower back

Rest intervals: Enhances hip stability and glute activation during dynamic movement
Health benefit:
1. Place a loop band around your ankles and stand with a slight knee bend.
2. Step one foot diagonally forward while keeping the other foot wide to maintain band tension.
3. Follow with the trailing foot and keep hips level.
4. Continue marching forward with controlled, quick steps.
Steps to perform: Keep chest up knees tracking over toes take slow controlled steps

Rest intervals: Builds lower body power and functional mobility for daily activities
Health benefit:
1. Sit on a chair with a loop band under both feet and the handles at shoulder height.
2. Lean slightly forward and explode up into a full standing position as quickly as possible.
3. Sit back down under control.
4. Repeat the stand-ups rapidly while keeping your chest lifted.
Steps to perform: Explode up but land softly with hips back and chest tall

Rest intervals: Develops explosive rotational power and coordination through fast core movement
Health benefit:
1. Anchor the band high and stand side-on with feet shoulder-width and both hands on the handle.
2. Pull the band down and across your body in a fast diagonal chopping motion toward the opposite hip.
3. Return to the start position under control.
4. Repeat the chops quickly while rotating your torso and bracing your core.
Steps to perform: Control the descent pivot feet and brace core throughout

Rest intervals: Boosts full body power and conditioning while challenging grip endurance
Health benefit:
1. Anchor the band overhead and grab one handle in each hand with feet hip-width.
2. Hinge slightly and raise your hands overhead if performing a double slam.
3. Explosively pull both handles down toward your hips to create a slam.
4. Reset quickly and repeat the slams at speed.
Steps to perform: Hinge at hips maintain neutral spine exhale on each slam

Rest intervals: Strengthens lateral hip muscles and improves lower body stability in low stance
Health benefit:
1. Place a loop band around your legs just above the knees and stand with feet hip-width apart in a low quarter-squat.
2. Sit back into your hips and keep your chest up to hold the low stance.
3. Step your right foot laterally against the band tension, then bring your left foot in to reset the stance.
4. Continue controlled side steps while maintaining the low squat and knee alignment.
Steps to perform: Keep hips back chest tall and step slowly to maintain band tension

Rest intervals: Combines strength and cardio to increase overall work capacity and coordination
Health benefit:
1. Place a loop band around both ankles and stand with feet hip-width and a slight squat.
2. Bend at the hips and knees and step your right foot back into a plank while keeping your core braced.
3. Step the right foot forward to meet the left, stand tall, and perform a small hop or reach overhead.
4. Alternate by stepping the left foot back on the next rep.
Steps to perform: Hinge from hips and control each step back maintaining a neutral spine

Rest intervals: Enhances core endurance and shoulder stability while elevating heart rate
Health benefit:
1. Place a loop band around both feet and assume a high plank with hands under shoulders.
2. Brace your core and pull your right knee toward your chest against the band resistance.
