3. Return the right foot and quickly drive the left knee toward your chest, alternating in a running motion.
Steps to perform: Brace core and move knees toward chest with slow controlled tempo

Rest intervals: Improves upper body power and shoulder endurance through repeated punching motion
Health benefit:
1. Anchor the band behind you at chest height and hold one handle in each hand with a staggered stance.
2. Keep hands near your chin and punch your right hand forward, fully extending the arm against the band.
3. Retract the right hand under control and repeat the same punch with the left hand.
Steps to perform: Stand tall exhale as you extend and keep shoulders down

Rest intervals: Develops single leg strength and balance during controlled forward stepping
Health benefit:
1. Place a loop band around both ankles and stand tall with a slight knee bend.
2. Step your right foot forward and slightly outward against the band tension.
3. Bring your left foot forward to restore spacing while keeping the band taut.
4. Continue stepping forward, alternating feet, and maintain an upright posture.
Steps to perform: Step forward keeping chest up and knee tracking over toes

Rest intervals: Enhances core stability and shoulder endurance
Health benefit:
1. Loop a mini band around your wrists and come into a bear plank with knees hovering.
2. Brace your core and keep your back flat.
3. Lift your right hand and tap your left shoulder, then return it to the ground.
4. Repeat alternating taps in a controlled, steady rhythm.
Steps to perform: Keep hips level and brace core to prevent rotation

Rest intervals: Strengthens abdominal muscles and improves hip flexor engagement
Health benefit:
1. Sit tall with a loop band around your feet and hold the band ends at your sides.
2. Lean back slightly and lift your feet a few inches off the floor.
3. Draw your knees toward your chest by contracting your abs against the band.
4. Extend your legs back out with control and repeat.
Steps to perform: Keep a neutral spine and exhale as you pull knees in

Rest intervals: Improves posterior shoulder strength and scapular control
Health benefit:
1. Anchor a band at eye level and grab the ends with thumbs up.
2. Step back to create tension and stand tall with knees soft.
3. Pull the band toward your face, flaring elbows and squeezing your shoulder blades.
4. Release to the start and perform the pulls at a brisk, controlled pace.
Steps to perform: Retract shoulder blades and lead with elbows control the return

Rest intervals: Enhances lateral power balance and dynamic coordination
Health benefit:
1. Place a loop band around your ankles and stand with feet hip-width apart.
2. Push off to the right with your left leg and land softly on your right foot.
3. Immediately bound to the left, driving through the supporting leg and swinging your arms.
4. Continue alternating quick, controlled lateral bounds.
Steps to perform: Land softly with knees bent and hips back to absorb impact

Rest intervals: Develops upper body pushing power and shoulder stability
Health benefit:
1. Anchor the band at chest height on a wall and hold the ends while facing the wall.
2. Place palms on the wall shoulder-width and step back to create tension.
3. Press firmly into the wall and push your body away against the band's resistance.
4. Control your return to the wall and repeat the push-offs rhythmically.
Steps to perform: Keep body aligned shoulders over wrists and exhale on push

Rest intervals: Boosts rotational core endurance and oblique activation
Health benefit:
1. Sit on the floor with knees bent and feet flat, loop the band around your feet and hold the ends.
2. Lean back slightly to engage your core and lift your feet a few inches off the floor.
3. Twist your torso quickly to one side while pulling the band across your body.
4. Rotate explosively to the other side and continue alternating at a fast pace.
Steps to perform: Keep spine tall and rotate from the ribs not the lower back

Rest intervals: Increases triceps endurance and muscular definition
Health benefit:
1. Stand with feet hip-width apart and step on the band, hold the ends with elbows bent by your head.
2. Keep your elbows stationary and extend your forearms down until arms are almost straight.
3. Return your hands slightly toward your head and perform quick small pulses.
4. Maintain an upright chest and tight core throughout the pumping motion.
Steps to perform: Anchor elbows by your sides and move only at the elbows

Rest intervals: Improves ankle control and lower leg muscle activation
Health benefit:
1. Sit on the floor with knees bent, loop the band around the soles of your feet and hold the ends.
2. Sit tall and brace your core.
3. Extend one heel forward against the band tension until the leg straightens slightly.
4. Return the heel, switch sides quickly, and continue alternating digs.
Steps to perform: Brace your core and keep hips level as you drive the heel

Rest intervals: Enhances full body coordination and rhythmic cardiovascular fitness
Health benefit:
1. Stand tall with the band looped around your wrists and feet together.
2. Jump your feet wide while pulling your hands together in front of your chest against the band.
3. Jump your feet back together while opening your arms back to the start position.
4. Repeat the seal jack motion at a steady, controlled tempo.
Steps to perform: Keep chest lifted, land softly with knees slightly bent to absorb impact

Rest intervals: Builds core strength while challenging shoulder stability and hip mobility
Health benefit:
1. Start in a high plank with hands under shoulders and loop the band around both feet.
2. Keep your hips level and brace your core.
3. Drive your right knee toward your right elbow against the band resistance.
4. Return to plank and repeat the movement with your left knee.
Steps to perform: Maintain a neutral spine and drive knee slowly toward same side elbow

Rest intervals: Improves shoulder and upper back strength and coordination
Health benefit:
1. Stand on the band with feet hip-width and hold the ends with elbows bent to form a W behind you.
2. Pull elbows back and squeeze shoulder blades while pressing hands slightly forward.
3. Return to the start with control and repeat the movement in a steady rhythmic tempo.
Steps to perform: Retract shoulder blades and press with slow controlled rhythm

Rest intervals: Activates hamstrings and glutes while increasing lower body mobility
Health benefit:
1. Loop the band around both ankles and stand tall with a slight forward lean.
2. Bend one knee and drive the heel up toward the glutes quickly while keeping hips square.
3. Alternate legs rapidly, maintaining short, quick movements and steady breathing.
Steps to perform: Keep hips level and core braced land softly with controlled knee drive

Rest intervals: Builds lower body power and upper back engagement for functional strength
Health benefit:
1. Stand on the band with feet shoulder-width and grasp the ends at shoulder height.
2. Push hips back and bend knees into a squat until thighs are parallel to the ground.
3. Drive through the heels to stand and pull the band up so elbows lead toward chest.
4. Lower the hands back to shoulder height and repeat the squat to high pull.
Steps to perform: Sit back through hips chest up drive through heels and control the pull

Rest intervals: Strengthens core muscles and supports improved posture
Health benefit:
1. Anchor the band overhead and hold the ends at forehead level while standing tall.
2. Tuck the chin and crunch the torso forward, pulling the band down with your hands.
3. Slowly return to upright and repeat the standing crunch with control.
Steps to perform: Exhale and curl from ribs keep neck long and core engaged

Rest intervals: Enhances lat and scapular strength while boosting upper body power
Health benefit:
1. Anchor the band overhead and kneel or stand under the anchor with arms extended upward.
2. Pull the band down quickly by driving elbows toward your sides and squeezing the lats.
3. Control the band as you return the hands overhead and repeat at a brisk tempo.
Steps to perform: Drive down with scapular pull control the return and avoid using momentum

Rest intervals: Builds lower body strength with lower joint impact than plyometrics
Health benefit:
1. Wrap a loop band just above your knees and stand with feet hip-width apart.
2. Push your hips back slightly and bend your knees to lower into a shallow squat.
3. Hold the squat briefly with weight in your heels and tension on the band.
4. Drive through your heels to stand while keeping knees aligned and the band taut.
Steps to perform: Sit back into hips keeping chest lifted and knees tracking over toes

Rest intervals: Improves lateral mobility and coordination while providing light cardiovascular activity
Health benefit:
1. Place the band around your lower thighs and stand with feet together.
2. Step your right foot to the side and lightly touch your left foot next to it while keeping the band taut.
3. Repeat by stepping left and touching, alternating sides at a controlled pace.
Steps to perform: Land softly through midfoot with a slightly bent knee and tall torso

Rest intervals: Enhances lower abdominal endurance and hip flexor strength
Health benefit:
1. Lie on your back and loop the band around both feet with hands resting under your hips.
2. Engage your core and lift both legs a few inches off the floor.
3. Alternate small, quick up-and-down flutter kicks while maintaining tension in the band.
Steps to perform: Keep lower back pressed into mat and breathe steadily

Rest intervals: Strengthens posterior shoulders and improves scapular stability during dynamic movement
Health benefit:
1. Hold the band with both hands and extend your arms in front of you at chest height.
2. Pull your hands outward and squeeze your shoulder blades together until your arms are out to the sides.
3. Return your hands to the starting position under control.
4. Repeat the movement at a brisk pace while keeping your core engaged and posture steady.
Steps to perform: Hinge slightly from hips and control shoulder blades avoiding shrugging

Rest intervals: Activates glutes and enhances hip stability for improved pelvic control
Health benefit:
1. Place a mini-band around your ankles and stand tall with a slight bend in your knees.
2. Lift one knee up toward hip height while keeping the band taut.
3. Lower that foot and immediately lift the opposite knee, marching in place with steady tension.
Steps to perform: Maintain a neutral spine and keep hips level while driving through heels

Rest intervals: Enhances thoracic rotation and shoulder mobility
Health benefit:
1. Anchor a band at chest height and stand perpendicular with feet hip-width apart.
2. Grasp the band with the hand farthest from the anchor and extend that arm across your body.
3. Pull the band across to the opposite hip while rotating your torso toward the pulling hand.
4. Control the return to the start position and repeat.
Steps to perform: Keep hips square and lead reach with thoracic rotation

Rest intervals: Builds core stability and dynamic coordination
Health benefit:
1. Lie on your back with a looped band anchored above your head and hold it with both hands overhead.
2. Bend hips and knees to 90 degrees and engage your core.
3. Rapidly extend one leg toward the floor while lowering the opposite arm toward the anchor, keeping band tension.
4. Quickly return to center and alternate sides in a steady fast rhythm.
Steps to perform: Maintain neutral spine and brace core with each quick alternating reach
MET value: Hypertension, Coronary Artery Disease, Metabolic Syndrome, Fatty Liver Disease (NAFLD), Hyperthyroidism

Rest intervals: Enhances shoulder endurance and range of motion
Health benefit:
1. Stand tall holding a short loop band between both hands with arms extended in front at shoulder height.
2. Keep arms straight and make small controlled circular motions with the band.
3. Reverse the direction after the set time or reps.
Steps to perform: Keep shoulders down and scapulae stable while controlling circle speed

Rest intervals: Improves unilateral leg strength and single leg stability
Health benefit:
1. Place one foot forward and one foot back in a split stance and loop a band under the front foot while holding the ends at shoulder height.
2. Bend the front knee slightly and keep the torso upright.
3. Pulse the front knee up and down a few inches while maintaining band tension.
4. Complete the reps then switch legs and repeat.
Steps to perform: Keep front knee aligned over toes and maintain an upright chest

Rest intervals: Promotes posterior chain mobility and shoulder stability during movement
Health benefit:
1. Stand with feet hip-width apart and place a band around both wrists with light tension.
2. Hinge at the hips and walk your hands forward into a high plank while keeping wrist tension and stable shoulders.
3. Pause briefly in the plank while maintaining a straight wrist line and engaged core.
4. Walk your hands back toward your feet by hinging at the hips and stand upright.
Steps to perform: Maintain neutral spine and control hip movement as you walk hands forward

Rest intervals: Improves pelvic control and lumbar mobility
Health benefit:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and loop the band around your hips, anchoring the ends low or holding them.
2. Tilt your pelvis posteriorly to flatten the lower back into the floor against band tension.
3. Release to a neutral spine while maintaining band tension.
4. Repeat the tilting motion rhythmically for repetitions.
Steps to perform: Keep neutral spine and rhythmically tilt from the hips using core control

Rest intervals: Improves shoulder girdle mobility and scapular stability
Health benefit:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and hold the band with both hands at chest level under light tension.
2. Move your hands in a controlled semicircle around your head and behind you with elbows slightly bent.
3. Reverse the direction and repeat for repetitions.
Steps to perform: Keep ribs down and shoulder blades pulled back while moving slowly around head

Rest intervals: Develops hip extension power and single leg control
Health benefit:
1. Stand with one foot slightly forward and loop the band under the front foot, holding the ends at shoulder height.
2. Step the rear foot back into a reverse lunge, lowering until both knees are about 90 degrees and keeping torso upright.
3. Drive through the front heel to stand and extend the rear leg forward into a controlled kick against band tension.
4. Return to start and repeat on the other leg.
Steps to perform: Step back with controlled descent and keep knee aligned over second toe

Rest intervals: Enhances coordination while building core stability and shoulder endurance
Health benefit:
1. Stand on the band with feet hip-width apart and hold the ends at shoulder level.
2. Lift one knee into a march while pressing the band overhead in a controlled motion.
3. Lower the arm and foot together to return to start.
4. Alternate legs and continue the march-and-press sequence.
Steps to perform: Brace core stand tall and press through midline with controlled scapular movement

Rest intervals: Builds rotational power and oblique strength
Health benefit:
1. Anchor the band at hip height and stand sideways with feet shoulder-width apart, holding the band with both hands.
2. Start with hands near the outside hip and pull the band diagonally across your body to the opposite shoulder in a chopping motion.
3. Slowly reverse the movement back to the starting hip position.
4. Repeat for repetitions and then switch sides.
Steps to perform: Hinge slightly rotate through torso and keep hips stable with soft knees

Rest intervals: Improves shoulder mobility and overhead range of motion
Health benefit:
1. Grab the band with a wide overhand grip and stand tall.
2. Raise the band overhead and move it slowly behind your head.
3. Continue until the band reaches your hips or your comfortable end range.
4. Reverse the motion slowly to return to the starting position.
Steps to perform: Keep arms straight with slow controlled motion and scapula engaged

Rest intervals: Enhances hamstring flexibility and hip hinge range
Health benefit:
1. Lie on your back and loop the band around the arch of one foot.
2. Bend the opposite knee and keep that foot flat on the floor.
3. Extend the banded leg toward the ceiling with a flexed foot.
4. Pull the band gently to increase the stretch and hold the position.
Steps to perform: Keep lower back pressed gently into floor and breathe into the stretch

Rest intervals: Reinforces squat mechanics and improves core and shoulder stability
Health benefit:
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width and loop the band under both feet.
2. Grasp the band with both hands and press it overhead with straight arms.
3. Sit back into a squat until your thighs are at or near parallel.
4. Hold the squat while keeping your arms locked overhead and chest lifted.
Steps to perform: Keep chest up and ribs down while driving knees out

Rest intervals: Improves core strength and trunk stability during rotational challenges
Health benefit:
1. Anchor the band at chest height and stand perpendicular to the anchor.
2. Hold the band at your chest with both hands and step away to create tension.
3. Extend your arms forward and resist the band trying to rotate your torso.
4. Brace your core and maintain the isometric hold without twisting.
Steps to perform: Brace your core and prevent torso rotation while maintaining neutral spine

Rest intervals: Strengthens scapular muscles and enhances shoulder posture
Health benefit:
1. Hold the band in front of you with arms extended and palms facing each other.
2. Pull the band apart by squeezing your shoulder blades together.
3. Return to the start under control and repeat the squeeze.
Steps to perform: Retract shoulder blades together and avoid shrugging the shoulders

Rest intervals: Activates hip abductors and improves lateral stability
Health benefit:
1. Place a loop band just above your knees and stand with feet hip-width apart.
2. Push your hips back and sink into a shallow squat to create band tension.
3. Take small lateral steps leading with your heel while maintaining band tension.
4. Keep a steady, controlled pace and maintain an upright chest.
Steps to perform: Keep hips level and knees tracking over feet while stepping slowly

Rest intervals: Trains unilateral leg strength while improving rotational mobility and balance
Health benefit:
1. Stand with a loop band secured under your front foot and hold the ends at chest level.
2. Step back into a lunge so the front knee aligns over the ankle and the back knee lowers.
3. Rotate your torso toward the front leg while keeping hips square.
4. Push through the front foot to return to standing with control.
Steps to perform: Sink through front hip maintain upright chest rotate from thoracic spine

Rest intervals: Enhances thoracic mobility and improves spinal rotation range
Health benefit:
1. Stand perpendicular to an anchor and hold a band with both hands at chest height, arms extended.
2. Rotate your upper torso away from the anchor while keeping hips facing forward.
3. Return slowly to the start position and repeat for the desired reps.
Steps to perform: Keep hips stable and square rotate through upper back with controlled motion

Rest intervals: Enhances anterior shoulder flexibility and promotes an upright chest posture
Health benefit:
1. Stand tall and hold a loop band behind your back with both hands, palms facing away.
2. Pull the band outward while squeezing your shoulder blades together and lifting your chest.
3. Maintain steady breathing while holding the stretch.
Steps to perform: Draw shoulder blades down and together open chest while breathing deeply

Rest intervals: Improves ankle dorsiflexion range and enhances gait mechanics
Health benefit:
1. Sit with legs extended and loop a resistance band around the top of one foot, securing the other end to a fixed point in front.
2. Pull your toes toward your shin against the band's resistance while keeping the ankle stable.
3. Slowly return to neutral and repeat for reps, then switch sides.
Steps to perform: Anchor heel move tibia over toes without collapsing arch or letting knee cave

Rest intervals: Enhances upper back strength and scapular stability
Health benefit:
1. Attach a resistance band to a sturdy anchor at chest height and hold one end in each hand, with one arm extended across the body (bow) and the other hand near your chest (arrow).
2. Step into a staggered stance and keep your torso steady.
3. Pull the arrow hand straight back toward your ribs while keeping the bow arm extended and the shoulder down.
4. Return the arrow hand slowly to the start and repeat.
Steps to perform: Keep shoulders down and scapula packed as you pull

Rest intervals: Improves pelvic control and deep core activation
Health benefit:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent, feet flat, and a loop band placed just above your knees.
2. Tuck your pelvis to flatten your lower back against the floor and squeeze your glutes.
3. Release the tilt slowly and repeat.
Steps to perform: Exhale to tuck pelvis and flatten lower back into the floor

Rest intervals: Promotes shoulder mobility and scapular upward rotation
Health benefit:
1. Stand with your back against a wall and loop a resistance band around your wrists at shoulder height.
2. Press your forearms into the wall and slide your arms upward while keeping contact with the wall.
3. Lower your arms under control back to the start and repeat.
Steps to perform: Keep low back and head against wall and slide shoulders smoothly

Rest intervals: Strengthens hip abductors and lateral pelvic stability
Health benefit:
1. Lie on your side with hips stacked, knees bent to about 90 degrees, and a loop band around your thighs above the knees.
2. Open the top knee by rotating the hip while keeping your feet together and lifting until you feel resistance.
3. Hold the lifted position isometrically for the prescribed time.
4. Lower the knee slowly and repeat.
Steps to perform: Keep hips stacked and pelvis stable and avoid rolling backward

Rest intervals: Improves lateral hip strength and gait stability
Health benefit:
1. Place a loop band around your ankles and stand with feet hip-width apart in a slight squat.
2. Step diagonally forward and across with the lead foot to create an "X" pattern with your legs.
3. Bring the trailing foot in to return to hip-width while maintaining tension in the band.
4. Continue the cross-stepping pattern for the desired reps, then switch lead sides.
Steps to perform: Step with controlled tension and keep knees tracking over toes

Rest intervals: Enhances anti-extension core stability and coordination
Health benefit:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat, loop a resistance band around the arches of both feet and hold the band ends in both hands.
2. Press your lower back into the floor and lift your knees to a 90-degree angle over your hips.
3. Extend one leg straight toward the floor while pulling the band gently to maintain tension and keep your core tight.
4. Hold the extended position, then return the leg to start and repeat on the other side.
Steps to perform: Keep low back pressed to the floor and move slowly

Rest intervals: Builds rotator cuff endurance and shoulder external rotation control
Health benefit:
1. Anchor the band at elbow height and hold the loose end with your hand, keeping your elbow bent at 90 degrees and tucked at your side.
2. Keep your upper arm against your torso and rotate your forearm outward away from your body against the band.
3. Control the band as you slowly rotate the forearm back toward your belly.
Steps to perform: Tuck elbow at side and rotate using shoulder not wrist

Rest intervals: Targets gluteal strength and lateral hip stability
Health benefit:
1. Sit upright on a chair or bench with a loop band placed just above both knees.
2. Press your knees outward against the band until you feel your hip abductors engage.
3. Hold briefly at the outer range, then return your knees together with control.
Steps to perform: Sit tall brace core and control the band outward movement

Rest intervals: Develops unilateral leg strength and functional balance
Health benefit:
1. Stand with one foot on the middle of a loop band and hold the other end with both hands at chest level.
2. Step your back foot straight behind you and lower into a reverse lunge until both knees are about 90 degrees.
3. Reach the band forward while keeping your torso upright to create tension.
4. Push through the front heel to return to standing and switch legs.
Steps to perform: Step back slowly keep chest upright and breathe evenly

Rest intervals: Enhances lateral core endurance and shoulder stability
Health benefit:
1. Loop a band around your thighs just above the knees and lie on your side with knees bent and stacked.
2. Prop yourself on your forearm and lift your hips so your body forms a straight line from shoulder to knees.
3. Hold the side plank while keeping your core engaged and hips lifted, then lower back down.
Steps to perform: Stack hips over knees and hold a straight spine

Rest intervals: Improves shoulder and latissimus mobility for reaching and overhead movements
Health benefit:
1. Anchor the band overhead and grab it with one hand, palm facing forward.
2. Step forward until the band has light tension and stand with feet hip-width.
3. Reach the arm overhead and lean your torso away from the anchor to feel the lateral stretch.
4. Hold the position, then switch sides.
Steps to perform: Keep chest open and shoulder down while reaching through the arm and breathing

Rest intervals: Enhances glute activation to support hip extension and stability
Health benefit:
1. Loop the band around the foot and kneel on all fours with hands under shoulders.
2. Brace your core and keep a neutral spine.
3. Drive the banded foot straight back and up by squeezing the glute.
4. Lower the leg slowly and repeat, then switch legs.
Steps to perform: Maintain neutral spine and hinge from hips control each kickback without momentum

Rest intervals: Improves full body mobility and thoracic spine rotation
Health benefit:
1. Anchor the band low and hold the handle with both hands while standing in a staggered stance.
2. Hinge at the hips and place the opposite hand on the ground inside the front foot.
3. Rotate your chest upward while pulling the band with the top arm into a thoracic rotation.
4. Return to the start and repeat on the other side.
Steps to perform: Square hips forward and rotate through thoracic spine using controlled breaths

Rest intervals: Builds anti rotation core stability and control
Health benefit:
1. Anchor the band at chest height and stand perpendicular to the anchor holding the band at your sternum.
2. Step away to create tension and set your feet hip-width apart.
3. Press the band straight out from your chest and resist any rotation, moving slowly back and forth.
Steps to perform: Brace core and press slowly keeping body tall and resisting band rotation

Rest intervals: Strengthens scapular stabilizers and shoulder endurance
Health benefit:
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width and hold the band with thumbs pointing up, anchored under your feet or low behind you.
2. Hinge slightly at the hips and depress your shoulders to set scapular position.
3. Raise your arms overhead in a Y shape in the scapular plane until fully extended.
4. Lower the arms with control and repeat.
Steps to perform: Lead with thumbs and lift in scapular plane without shrugging or arching back

Rest intervals: Increases hip flexor flexibility to improve pelvic mobility
Health benefit:
1. Secure a resistance band to a low anchor behind you and loop the free end around the ankle of the rear leg.
2. Kneel in a half-lunge with the banded knee on the ground and the front foot planted.
3. Drive your hips forward and press the banded ankle backward to lengthen the front of the hip.
4. Maintain an upright torso and hold the stretch for the desired time.
Steps to perform: Tuck pelvis and maintain ribcage down to protect low back

Rest intervals: Improves squat mechanics while enhancing upper back mobility
Health benefit:
1. Stand on the center of a resistance band with feet shoulder-width and hold the ends in each hand at hip level.
2. Squat down by pushing hips back and bending knees until thighs are at or above parallel.
3. Press through your heels to stand while simultaneously raising your arms diagonally overhead into a Y.
4. Lower arms and return to the squat position in a controlled motion and repeat.
Steps to perform: Drive chest up and keep knees tracking over toes

Rest intervals: Enhances core stability and coordinated contralateral limb control
Health benefit:
1. Anchor a band behind you at floor level and loop the other end around the foot of the leg you will extend.
2. Start on hands and knees with a neutral spine and a slight tension in the band.
3. Extend the banded leg straight back while reaching the opposite arm forward until body forms a straight line.
4. Hold briefly, then return to the starting position and repeat on the other side.
Steps to perform: Keep spine neutral and hips level as you extend limbs

Rest intervals: Improves internal shoulder rotation strength and joint control
Health benefit:
1. Attach the band to an anchor at elbow height and hold the free end with the hand of the arm to be worked.
2. Bend your elbow to 90° and keep your upper arm pinned to your side.
3. Rotate your forearm across your body against the band's resistance and return slowly.
Steps to perform: Keep elbow glued to side and scapula stable during rotation

Rest intervals: Increases hamstring isometric strength and posterior chain engagement
Health benefit:
1. Lie prone with the band looped around one ankle and anchored at a low point.
2. Bend your knee to curl the heel toward your glutes and squeeze the hamstring.
3. Hold the peak contraction isometrically for the target duration while keeping your hips stable.
Steps to perform: Brace core and press hips down to prevent low back arch

Rest intervals: Improves single-leg balance and strengthens posterior chain
Health benefit:
1. Stand tall with a loop band under the foot of the supporting leg and hold the band with the opposite hand for support.
2. Hinge at the hips and lower your torso while keeping the supporting leg slightly bent and the other leg extended behind you.
3. Keep your back flat and shoulders pulled back as you reach the band toward the floor.
4. Drive the hips forward and return to standing while keeping the extended leg lifted.
Steps to perform: Hinge at hips with neutral spine and slight knee bend

Rest intervals: Enhances core endurance and promotes spinal stability
Health benefit:
1. Lie on your back with a light band looped around your feet and hold the ends overhead.
2. Engage your core and lift your shoulders and knees off the ground into a hollow shape.
3. Maintain a braced core and controlled breathing while holding the position.
Steps to perform: Pull ribs toward hips press lower back into ground and breathe steadily

Rest intervals: Improves shoulder and triceps flexibility and range of motion
Health benefit:
1. Hold a band behind your back with one hand overhead and the other hand near your lower back.
2. Pull down gently with the lower hand to increase the stretch in the top triceps.
3. Keep your chest lifted and switch sides after holding.
Steps to perform: Draw shoulder blades down keep chest tall and avoid shrugging shoulders

Rest intervals: Enhances hip mobility and rotational control
Health benefit:
1. Sit in a 90/90 position with a band looped above both knees and sit tall.
2. Brace your core and lift the front hand slightly to create space for the switch.
3. Rotate your hips and legs to switch the front and back positions while keeping knees elevated.
4. Control the movement and repeat alternating sides.
Steps to perform: Keep pelvis level move slowly through hips without collapsing the torso

Rest intervals: Builds core engagement and shoulder stability
Health benefit:
1. Place a band around your thighs and come onto hands and toes with knees hovering an inch above the ground.
2. Press your palms into the floor, keep hips low, and brace your core.
3. Hold the static position while maintaining even breathing and tension in the band.
Steps to perform: Maintain neutral spine with protracted shoulders and avoid letting hips sag

Rest intervals: Improves lateral core flexibility and oblique activation
Health benefit:
1. Sit tall on the floor with knees bent and feet flat.
2. Loop the resistance band under the foot on the side you will bend toward and hold the other end overhead with the same hand.
3. Bend sideways at the waist toward the anchored foot while sliding the free hand down your thigh.
4. Return to upright with control and repeat for the desired reps.
Steps to perform: Stack ribs over hips and hinge from the waist

Rest intervals: Enhances thoracic mobility and supports better posture
Health benefit:
1. Anchor the band at chest height and grab it with both hands, stepping back to create tension.
2. Stand tall and hinge at the mid-back to lift your chest while keeping hips stable.
3. Rotate your thoracic spine and reach one arm overhead away from the anchor.
4. Return to center and repeat on the other side.
Steps to perform: Keep neck neutral and rotate from the thoracic spine only

Rest intervals: Strengthens hip abductors and enhances pelvic stability
Health benefit:
1. Loop a mini band around both ankles and stand tall with feet hip-width apart.
2. Shift weight onto the support leg and bend that knee slightly.
3. Lift the other leg straight out to the side to hip height and hold the position.
4. Maintain an upright torso and keep steady tension in the band.
Steps to perform: Keep hips level and lift from the glute not the lower back

Rest intervals: Improves hamstring mobility and promotes core activation
Health benefit:
1. Stand with feet hip-width and place a loop band under both feet while holding the ends in your hands.
2. Hinge at the hips and bend forward, walking your hands out into a forward-bend or tabletop position while keeping band tension.
3. Pause with a long spine to mobilize shoulders and hamstrings.
4. Walk your hands back toward your feet and slowly stand up.
Steps to perform: Maintain a neutral spine and move slowly with core engaged

Rest intervals: Builds anti rotation core strength and enhances shoulder stability
Health benefit:
1. Anchor the band low to one side and assume a high plank facing perpendicular to the anchor.
2. Reach the far hand under your body and grab the band end.
3. Pull the band across your body while keeping hips level and core engaged.
4. Return the hand to plank and repeat on the other side.
Steps to perform: Keep a straight plank line and pull smoothly without rotating hips

Rest intervals: Improves neck mobility and eases muscle tension
Health benefit:
1. Anchor a looped band at head height on a sturdy point.
2. Sit tall and place the band under your chin or around the back of your head.
3. Lean back slightly to create gentle upward traction and hold.
Steps to perform: Keep chin tucked and spine neutral while gently pulling with the band

Rest intervals: Improves lateral hip flexibility and thigh tissue mobility
Health benefit:
1. Anchor a looped band at waist height and thread the opposite ankle through the band.
2. Stand with the banded foot slightly across and behind the other foot.
3. Lean the hip of the banded leg toward the anchor until you feel a lateral thigh stretch.
Steps to perform: Keep hips square and hinge from the hips avoiding lower back twist

Rest intervals: Increases posterior chain flexibility and hip hinge range
Health benefit:
1. Stand on the band with feet hip-width apart and hold the band across your shoulders.
2. Hinge at the hips with a neutral spine and push your hips back while keeping a soft bend in the knees.
3. Lower your torso until you feel a hamstring stretch, then pause.
4. Drive your hips forward to return to standing.
Steps to perform: Hinge at the hips with a neutral spine and light band tension

Rest intervals: Promotes spinal mobility and coordinates breathing with movement
Health benefit:
1. Kneel on hands and knees with a light loop band draped across your upper back and ends under your palms.
2. Inhale and lift your chest and tailbone to arch your back into cow while maintaining band tension.
3. Exhale and round your spine toward the ceiling into cat while keeping steady tension on the band.
Steps to perform: Move slowly with breath coordinating spine flexion and extension

Rest intervals: Improves wrist extension range and forearm muscle flexibility
Health benefit:
1. Secure a light band at wrist height and hold one end with the palm facing down.
2. Extend the wrist upward against the band's resistance until you feel a stretch on the top of the forearm.
3. Release and repeat the same steps on the other wrist.
Steps to perform: Keep elbow extended and wrist aligned breathe deeply into the stretch

Rest intervals: Increases calf muscle flexibility and ankle dorsiflexion range
Health benefit:
1. Sit on the floor with one leg extended and loop the band around the ball of your foot.
2. Hold the band ends with both hands and sit tall with a straight back.
3. Pull the band toward you to dorsiflex the ankle until you feel the calf stretch.
4. Keep the knee straight and maintain gentle tension.
Steps to perform: Sit tall, keep foot dorsiflexed and control the stretch with the band

Rest intervals: Enhances thoracic rotation and promotes postural control
Health benefit:
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width apart and hold the band with both hands at chest height.
2. Step one foot slightly forward to create light tension on the band.
3. Rotate your torso slowly away from the forward foot while keeping your arms extended.
4. Reverse the rotation smoothly and repeat on the opposite side.
Steps to perform: Rotate from your waist, keep chest lifted and move slowly with control

Rest intervals: Strengthens hip flexors while challenging standing balance
Health benefit:
1. Anchor the band low and loop the free end around your ankle while standing facing away from the anchor.
2. Stand tall and engage your core.
3. Lift the banded knee forward to about hip height and hold the isometric position.
4. Keep your pelvis level and maintain steady tension.
Steps to perform: Keep hips level, engage core and hold the lifted knee steady

Rest intervals: Opens the chest and increases pectoral flexibility and shoulder mobility
Health benefit:
1. Anchor the band at chest height behind you and hold one handle in each hand.
2. Step forward to create gentle tension with arms extended to the sides and elbows slightly bent.
3. Bring your arms back in a wide arc until you feel a stretch across the chest.
4. Keep your shoulders down and chest open while holding the stretch.
Steps to perform: Keep shoulders down and back, retract scapula and open chest slowly

Rest intervals: Improves groin flexibility and hip abduction range
Health benefit:
1. Sit with the soles of your feet together and loop the band around both feet while holding the ends.
2. Sit tall and gently pull the band forward to draw your heels slightly toward you.
3. Press your knees toward the floor with the band or your elbows until you feel the groin stretch.
4. Keep your spine long and hold the position without forcing.
Steps to perform: Hinge at hips, keep spine long and gently sink into the groin stretch

Rest intervals: Enhances trunk rotational strength and core stability
Health benefit:
1. Anchor the band high to your right and stand with feet shoulder-width apart.
2. Hold the band with both hands above your left shoulder and brace your core.
3. Pull the band down across your body to your right hip in a slow chopping motion.
4. Control the return to the start position and repeat, then switch sides.
Steps to perform: Brace your core and lead movement from hips not arms

Rest intervals: Improves spinal mobility and thoracic rotation
Health benefit:
1. Sit tall on the floor with knees bent and feet flat.
2. Loop the band around a fixed anchor to your right and hold it with both hands at chest height.
3. Rotate your torso to the left, leading with your chest while keeping your hips square.
4. Slowly return to center and repeat, then switch anchor sides.
Steps to perform: Sit tall and lengthen your spine before rotating from the ribcage

Rest intervals: Increases wrist and forearm flexibility and chest opening
Health benefit:
1. Hold the band behind your back with one hand high and the other low.
2. Slide the lower hand up the band toward the top hand until the backs of your hands approach each other.
3. Pull the band upward with the top hand to bring your palms closer in a reverse prayer alignment.
4. Lower the hands slowly and repeat the motion.
Steps to perform: Lift your chest and depress your shoulders to avoid shrugging

Rest intervals: Enhances quadriceps flexibility and hip extension range
Health benefit:
1. Lie face down and loop the band around your right ankle.
2. Reach back and grasp the band with your right hand.
3. Bend your right knee and pull the band to draw your heel toward your glutes.
4. Keep your hips on the floor, hold briefly, then release and switch sides.
Steps to perform: Keep pelvis neutral and squeeze glutes to prevent lower back arch

Rest intervals: Improves hamstring and thoracic mobility while challenging core stability
Health benefit:
1. Stand with feet wider than hip-width and hold the band overhead with both hands.
2. Hinge at the hips and rotate your torso to lower one hand toward the opposite foot while keeping the band taut.
3. Keep the opposite arm reaching overhead and your gaze toward the top hand.
4. Reverse the motion to return to standing and repeat on the other side.
Steps to perform: Hinge at the hips with a long spine and move slowly

Rest intervals: Builds glute activation and pelvic stability during single leg progression
Health benefit:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent, feet flat, and a band looped just above your knees.
2. Press your hips up into a bridge until your body forms a straight line from shoulders to knees.
3. Keep hips raised and slowly lift one knee toward your chest, then lower it back.
4. Alternate legs slowly while maintaining hip height and band tension.
Steps to perform: Keep hips level and core braced as you alternate marching

Rest intervals: Enhances shoulder mobility and scapular control through dynamic movement
Health benefit:
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width apart and hold the band with both hands at chest height.
2. Extend your arms and rotate them in small controlled circles forward while keeping band tension.
3. Reverse the circle direction after several rotations and maintain a steady pace.
Steps to perform: Keep shoulders down and scapulae stable while moving arms with control

Rest intervals: Assists hip external rotation and glute flexibility for improved hip mobility
Health benefit:
1. Sit with one knee bent in front and the other leg extended back, and loop the band around the front foot.
2. Slide the front knee wider and lower your hips toward the floor while keeping your spine long.
3. Use the band to gently pull the front foot toward you to deepen the stretch.
4. Hold for several counts, release the band, and then switch sides.
Steps to perform: Square hips forward and keep spine long while breathing into the stretch

Rest intervals: Develops isometric quadriceps endurance and lower body muscular stamina
Health benefit:
1. Stand with your back against a wall, band looped around your thighs above the knees, and feet hip-width apart a step forward.
2. Slide down the wall until your knees are about 90 degrees and press your knees outward into the band.
3. Hold the seated position while maintaining band tension and steady breathing.
Steps to perform: Press low back into wall and keep knees tracking over toes while breathing
MET value: Hypertension, Coronary Artery Disease, Osteoarthritis, Obesity / Overweight

Rest intervals: Strengthens back extensors and enhances posterior chain engagement
Health benefit:
1. Lie face down with the band looped around your hands and feet and your arms extended overhead.
2. Lift your chest and legs a few inches off the floor while pulling your hands toward your hips against the band.
3. Squeeze your upper back and glutes at the top and hold briefly.
4. Lower with control and repeat.
Steps to perform: Maintain a neutral spine and lift with glutes without overextending

Rest intervals: Improves posterior shoulder flexibility and scapular mobility
Health benefit:
1. Anchor the band at chest height or hold it taut between both hands.
2. Grasp the band with the hand of the arm to be stretched and bring that arm across your chest.
3. Use the band with the opposite hand to gently pull the stretching arm closer to your body.
4. Keep your torso upright and breathe evenly while maintaining the pull.
Steps to perform: Keep shoulder down and chest open as you pull across

Rest intervals: Increases inner thigh and adductor flexibility for improved hip range of motion
Health benefit:
1. Lie on your back and loop the band around the sole of one foot.
2. Hold the band ends with both hands and bend the other knee with the foot on the floor.
3. Gently open the leg with the band out to the side to feel the inner thigh stretch.
4. Control the movement with the band and keep your hips flat on the floor.
Steps to perform: Keep hips level and breathe slowly as you control the band

Rest intervals: Promotes hamstring and lower back flexibility while encouraging gentle spine lengthening
Health benefit:
1. Stand on the middle of the band with feet hip-width apart.
2. Hold the band ends in each hand and hinge at the hips to begin a forward fold.
3. Use the band to support the upper body by pulling slightly as you fold deeper.
4. Keep a soft bend in the knees and lengthen the spine as you hold the position.
Steps to perform: Hinge from hips keeping a long spine and softened knees

Rest intervals: Enhances lateral trunk flexibility and increases oblique muscle length
Health benefit:
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width and step one foot onto the band.
2. Hold the other end of the band overhead with the same-side hand.
3. Lean the torso toward the opposite side while keeping the arm extended.
4. Maintain steady tension on the band and keep the position static.
Steps to perform: Reach through fingertips while keeping ribs stacked over hips

Rest intervals: Improves triceps and posterior shoulder flexibility and overhead reach
Health benefit:
1. Hold the band overhead with both hands and let one hand drop behind your head.
2. Loop the band behind your back with the lower hand and grip it firmly.
3. Pull down with the lower hand while pressing the upper hand upward to feel the tricep stretch.
4. Keep your chest lifted and switch sides after the desired time.
Steps to perform: Keep ribs tucked neck neutral and breathe deeply into the stretch

Rest intervals: Increases calf flexibility and ankle dorsiflexion range of motion
Health benefit:
1. Sit on the floor with one leg extended and the other bent or relaxed.
2. Loop the band around the ball of the extended foot and hold the ends in your hands.
3. Keep the knee straight and pull the band toward you until you feel a stretch in the calf.
4. Hold the stretch and breathe steadily.
Steps to perform: Keep knee straight and hinge at ankle to feel calf without bouncing

Rest intervals: Supports shoulder stability and hamstring stretching while promoting overall body lengthening
Health benefit:
1. Start on hands and knees and drape the looped band across your upper back, holding the ends with your hands on the mat.
2. Tuck your toes and lift your hips up and back into a downward dog position.
3. Press your hands into the mat and let the band gently pull your shoulders back to open the chest.
4. Maintain the position with even breaths.
Steps to perform: Lift hips press heels gently and pull shoulder blades down for a long spine

Rest intervals: Encourages thoracic mobility and gentle spinal flexion for improved posture awareness
Health benefit:
1. Sit on the floor with legs crossed and loop the band around your upper back, holding the ends in front of you.
2. Inhale and lengthen the spine, then exhale and round the upper back while pulling the band forward.
3. Hold the rounded position briefly.
4. Return to a neutral spine and repeat with controlled breaths.
Steps to perform: Exhale as you round the spine and tuck chin while engaging abdominals

Rest intervals: Opens chest and anterior shoulder muscles improving scapular retraction and posture alignment
Health benefit:
1. Anchor the band at chest height behind you and grasp the ends with both hands.
2. Step forward to create tension and stand tall with a slight bend in the knees.
3. Pull the band outward and back, opening the chest and squeezing the shoulder blades together.
4. Hold the opened position briefly and return slowly to the start.
Steps to perform: Keep chest lifted squeeze shoulder blades together and avoid shrugging

Rest intervals: Enhances quadriceps flexibility and hip extension range in a side lying position
Health benefit:
1. Lie on your side and loop the band around the ankle of the top leg, holding the band with your hand.
2. Bend the top knee and pull the band so the heel moves toward your glutes.
3. Keep your hips stacked and press the top hip slightly forward to increase the quad stretch.
4. Hold the position and breathe steadily.
Steps to perform: Keep hips stacked and pelvis neutral as you gently pull heel toward glute

Rest intervals: Promotes spinal decompression and hamstring flexibility
Health benefit:
1. Stand feet hip-width apart and drape a looped band over your shoulders, holding an end in each hand.
2. Hinge at the hips and fold your torso forward with a soft bend in the knees until you feel a release.
3. Relax your neck and let the band gently pull your shoulders and arms toward the floor.
4. Breathe evenly and maintain the hang for the desired duration.
Steps to perform: Hinge from hips and keep a neutral spine while softening your knees

Rest intervals: Enhances thoracic extension and anterior chain mobility
Health benefit:
1. Lie face down with the band looped across your upper back and hold an end in each hand near your shoulders.
2. Exhale and lift your chest by engaging your back while gently pulling the band to assist the lift.
3. Keep your hips grounded, open your chest, and hold the lifted position for several breaths.
Steps to perform: Keep pelvis grounded and lift through shoulder blades while breathing smoothly

Health benefit:
1. Sit or stand and anchor one end of the band under your foot while holding the other end with the palm facing up.
2. Extend the arm and use the band to gently pull the wrist and fingers into extension.
3. Keep the elbow straight and hold the stretch, then switch sides.
Steps to perform: Extend arm with neutral wrist and relax shoulder away from ear

Rest intervals: Improves hip external rotation and glute flexibility
Health benefit:
1. Lie on your back and loop the band around the foot of the leg to be stretched, holding the ends in your hands.
2. Cross that ankle over the opposite thigh to form a figure-4.
3. Pull the band toward your chest to deepen the glute stretch.
4. Keep the opposite leg relaxed on the floor and hold, then switch sides.
Steps to perform: Keep lower back long and draw belly button toward spine

Rest intervals: Promotes shoulder mobility and gentle spinal lengthening
Health benefit:
1. Kneel and sit back on your heels, loop the band under your hands, and hold the ends with palms down.
2. Walk your hands forward and press your hips back toward your heels while keeping your arms extended.
3. Relax your chest toward the floor and breathe while holding the extended child's pose.
Steps to perform: Sink hips toward heels and reach through arms while breathing into ribs

Rest intervals: Enhances lateral trunk mobility and rib cage expansion
Health benefit:
1. Anchor the band overhead and kneel so the band is on the same side as the working arm.
2. Grasp the band with the top hand and extend the arm overhead.
3. Keep hips square and bend your torso away from the anchor into a side bend.
4. Return slowly to upright and repeat for the desired reps.
Steps to perform: Square hips and hinge from the waist with slow controlled movement

Rest intervals: Alleviates upper trapezius tension and increases neck mobility
Health benefit:
1. Anchor a looped band at chest height and stand facing away from the anchor.
2. Hold the band with the hand on the side to work and place the band against the upper trapezius.
3. Lean into the band to apply steady pressure on the muscle.
4. Gently tilt and rotate your head to find and release tight spots.
Steps to perform: Lower the shoulder and lengthen the neck while breathing slowly

Rest intervals: Improves hip abduction range and adductor flexibility
Health benefit:
1. Sit on the floor with legs spread wide in a straddle and loop the band around the balls of both feet.
2. Sit tall and grasp the band ends with both hands to keep a long spine.
3. Hinge forward from the hips and use the band to pull your chest toward your legs.
4. Maintain the forward fold and relax deeper into the stretch.
Steps to perform: Sit tall and hinge from the hips with controlled breathing

Rest intervals: Opens the chest and promotes improved shoulder posture
Health benefit:
1. Anchor the band at shoulder height in a doorway and hold a handle in each hand.
2. Step forward until the band pulls your arms back and opens your chest.
3. Keep your shoulders down and squeeze your shoulder blades together gently.
4. Hold the open-chest position and breathe evenly.
Steps to perform: Keep ribs down and retract shoulders gently while breathing deeply

Rest intervals: Enhances spinal rotation mobility and promotes relaxation of the lower back
Health benefit:
1. Lie on your back and anchor the band to a low point beside you, then loop the free end around one foot.
2. Extend that leg and use the band to bring the leg across your body into a twist.
3. Keep both shoulders on the floor and the opposite arm extended for support.
4. Hold the static twist and breathe evenly while keeping your hips level.
Steps to perform: Keep both shoulders down on the floor and exhale to deepen

Rest intervals: Improves biceps flexibility and shoulder extension range of motion
Health benefit:
1. Secure the band to a stable anchor at shoulder height.
2. Grasp the band with palm up and extend your arm straight behind you.
3. Step forward to create tension and press your arm back while keeping the elbow straight.
4. Lean your torso forward slightly until you feel a stretch in the front of the upper arm.
Steps to perform: Keep shoulder blades down and back while gently pressing the bicep into the wall

Rest intervals: Enhances hamstring flexibility and posterior chain mobility
Health benefit:
1. Loop the band around one foot and hold the ends with both hands.
2. Stand tall with the opposite knee slightly bent.
3. Lift the banded leg straight in front of you and hinge at the hips until you feel a stretch.
Steps to perform: Maintain a neutral spine and hinge from the hips not rounding the lower back

Rest intervals: Improves hip and ankle mobility for more stable squatting
Health benefit:
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width apart and loop the band under both feet.
2. Hold the band ends at chest height and lower into a deep squat, keeping your chest up.
3. Maintain tension in the band and hold the deep squat position.
4. Pull gently on the band to sit taller if you need extra assistance.
Steps to perform: Sit back into your heels keep chest upright and knees tracking over toes
MET value: Osteoarthritis, Hypertension, Coronary Artery Disease, Obesity / Overweight

Rest intervals: Strengthens oblique endurance and lateral trunk stability
Health benefit:
1. Secure the band to a stable anchor at hip height.
2. Stand sideways to the anchor and hold the band with both hands at torso level.
3. Step away to create tension and brace your core while keeping your hips square.
4. Hold the position without rotating and squeeze the obliques.
Steps to perform: Keep hips stacked and ribs pulled down avoid collapsing through the midline

Rest intervals: Enhances scapular mobility and shoulder blade control
Health benefit:
1. Secure the band to a stable anchor at chest height.
2. Grasp the band with both hands and step forward to create tension.
3. Extend your arms in front of you and push them forward to round the upper back.
4. Hold the protracted position and keep the neck relaxed.
Steps to perform: Reach shoulders forward while keeping neck long and shoulder blades moving smoothly

Rest intervals: Increases hip flexor length and promotes pelvic mobility
Health benefit:
1. Anchor the band low behind you and loop the other end around the back thigh above the knee.
2. Kneel with the front foot planted and the back knee banded on a pad.
3. Tuck the pelvis and squeeze the back glute while shifting the hips forward until you feel the front-hip stretch.
4. Keep the torso upright and breathe steadily while maintaining band tension.
Steps to perform: Tuck pelvis and keep back neutral as you push hips forward

Rest intervals: Promotes thoracic rotation and full body mobility
Health benefit:
1. Anchor the band overhead and hold one end in each hand with arms extended wide like a star.
2. Step away from the anchor to create tension and lift your chest while keeping arms straight.
3. Rotate the torso and reach one arm diagonally upward while keeping the opposite foot planted.
Steps to perform: Keep ribs down and reach through limbs to feel even tension

Rest intervals: Targets lateral lower back flexibility and improves side bending mobility
Health benefit:
1. Anchor the band high to one side and hold the free end with the nearest hand.
2. Step away to create tension and set your feet in a staggered stance.
3. Lean away from the anchor, laterally flex the trunk, and press the hip toward the anchor to feel the side lower-back stretch.
Steps to perform: Square hips and bend only at the waist to target the side torso

Rest intervals: Improves wrist extensor flexibility and hand function
Health benefit:
1. Secure the band under your foot or to a low anchor and loop the other end over the back of your hand with the palm facing down.
2. Step back to create tension and straighten the elbow while keeping fingers relaxed.
3. Allow the band to pull the hand into wrist flexion and maintain the stretch.
Steps to perform: Keep elbow straight and gently pull fingers back until you feel a stretch

Rest intervals: Enhances quadriceps flexibility and knee extension range
Health benefit:
1. Anchor the band low and lie face down near the anchor with the band looped around the ankle.
2. Grasp the band and bend the knee to bring the heel toward the glute.
3. Pull the band gently to increase heel-to-glute approximation while keeping hips pressed into the floor.
4. Keep the torso flat and breathe steadily as you maintain the stretch.
Steps to perform: Tuck tailbone and squeeze glutes to protect low back as you lift

Rest intervals: Improves latissimus dorsi flexibility and overhead reach
Health benefit:
1. Stand with feet hip-width and hold the band overhead with both hands slightly wider than your shoulders.
2. Step back to create light tension in the band and pull your shoulders down.
3. Shift your hips opposite and lean your torso to one side until you feel a lateral stretch.
4. Return to center, switch sides, and repeat.
Steps to perform: Keep ribs down and reach band overhead with long spine

Rest intervals: Enhances hip extension mobility and glute activation
Health benefit:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent, feet flat, and a loop band placed above your knees.
2. Press your knees outward against the band and brace your core.
3. Drive through your heels and lift your hips until your body forms a straight line from shoulders to knees.
4. Hold the bridge position for the desired time, then lower slowly.
Steps to perform: Drive hips up while squeezing glutes and maintaining neutral spine

Rest intervals: Improves neck lateral flexion range of motion
Health benefit:
1. Stand tall and loop a light band under one foot, holding the other end in the hand on the same side.
2. Gently tilt your head away from the anchored hand until you feel a stretch along the side of your neck.
3. Hold briefly, then switch sides and repeat.
Steps to perform: Lengthen through crown and tilt from upper neck without shrugging shoulders

Rest intervals: Increases groin and inner thigh flexibility
Health benefit:
1. Lie on your back and bring the soles of your feet together with knees bent outward.
2. Loop a band around the arches of your feet and hold the ends in each hand.
3. Gently pull the band toward you while allowing your knees to fall outward.
4. Hold the stretch, then release the band and relax.
Steps to perform: Let knees fall open while keeping low back gently pressed to floor

Rest intervals: Promotes hip mobility while lengthening the hamstrings
Health benefit:
1. Place a loop band under your front foot and hold the ends at hip height.
2. Step into a forward lunge and lower your back knee toward the floor.
3. Shift weight forward and straighten your front leg while keeping hold of the band to deepen the hamstring stretch.
4. Flow back into the lunge, repeat for reps, then switch legs.
Steps to perform: Keep front knee aligned over ankle and hinge from hips with control

Rest intervals: Enhances anterior trunk flexibility and spinal extension capacity
Health benefit:
1. Anchor the band overhead and hold both ends with your hands.
2. Step forward a few feet to create tension and stand with feet hip-width apart.
3. Reach the band overhead and gently arch your upper back to open the front body.
4. Keep hips square and hold the stretch.
Steps to perform: Keep ribs down and pelvis neutral while you lengthen through the spine

Rest intervals: Improves shoulder mobility and upper back scapular control
Health benefit:
1. Hold the band ends and extend your arms forward at shoulder height.
2. Cross one arm over the other at the elbows and wrap your forearms together.
3. Pull the band outward to create tension and draw the elbows toward your face.
4. Keep shoulders down and hold the position.
Steps to perform: Lift elbows to shoulder height and draw shoulder blades together

Rest intervals: Enhances ankle eversion flexibility and lateral stability awareness
Health benefit:
1. Sit with legs extended and loop the band around the forefoot of the target ankle.
2. Anchor the band to the opposite side or hold it with your hands to create lateral tension.
3. Gently invert the foot inward against the band to feel a stretch along the outer ankle.
4. Maintain a soft dorsiflexion and hold the stretch.
Steps to perform: Keep foot aligned with shin and control movement into dorsiflexion

Rest intervals: Improves hip flexor flexibility and pelvic mobility
Health benefit:
1. Anchor the band behind you at hip height and hold the ends in both hands.
2. Step into a low lunge with the front knee over the ankle and the back knee on the ground.
3. Press the band overhead or slightly back to open the front hip and chest.
4. Square your hips and hold the lunge position.
Steps to perform: Square hips keep front knee over ankle and breathe slowly

Rest intervals: Enhances thoracic rotation and seated spinal mobility
Health benefit:
1. Sit tall with knees bent and anchor the band to one side at chest height.
2. Hold the band with both hands and extend your arms in front of your chest.
3. Rotate your torso away from the anchor while keeping your hips facing forward.
4. Pause and hold the rotated position with a long spine.
Steps to perform: Sit tall rotate from the thoracic spine and keep hips anchored

Rest intervals: Enhances shoulder external rotation and rotator cuff mobility
Health benefit:
1. Anchor the band at waist height and stand with your side to the anchor.
2. Grasp the band with the hand nearest the anchor and bend your elbow to 90 degrees at your side.
3. Step away to create light tension and rotate your forearm outward until you feel resistance.
4. Hold the position briefly and then control the forearm back to the start.
Steps to perform: Keep elbow close to ribs and move shoulder slowly with controlled breathing

Rest intervals: Increases inner thigh flexibility and hip range of motion
Health benefit:
1. Anchor the band low to a stable point and loop it around the inner thigh of the working leg.
2. Step the working leg outward to create tension and widen your stance.
3. Shift your weight away from the anchored side and keep the leg straight to stretch the inner thigh.
4. Maintain an upright torso and control the return to the starting position.
Steps to perform: Keep pelvis neutral and hinge from hips with chest lifted

Rest intervals: Promotes lateral torso mobility and side body extension
Health benefit:
1. Stand in a wide stance and hold the band anchored low behind you with your top hand.
2. Turn the front foot out and hinge at the hip toward the front leg.
3. Reach the bottom hand down toward your shin while the top hand pulls the band upward to open the chest.
4. Keep a long spine and hold the position while maintaining band tension.
Steps to perform: Keep hips square and lengthen spine while breathing into the side stretch

Rest intervals: Facilitates thoracic extension and anterior chest opening for improved posture
Health benefit:
1. Anchor the band overhead and kneel with knees hip-width apart.
2. Grasp the band behind your shoulders with both hands and draw the shoulder blades down.
3. Press your hips forward and lift your chest as you gently arch back using the band for support.
4. Keep your neck neutral and control the movement back to upright.
Steps to perform: Engage core lift chest upward and maintain neutral neck to protect low back

Rest intervals: Enhances finger extensor mobility and hand flexibility
Health benefit:
1. Loop a light band around the tips of all fingers on one hand.
2. Spread your fingers apart against the band to extend the finger joints.
3. Hold the extended position briefly and then slowly relax the fingers.
Steps to perform: Keep wrist neutral and gently control band tension without forcing fingers back

Rest intervals: Improves ankle dorsiflexion and anterior lower leg mobility
Health benefit:
1. Secure the band to a low anchor and loop it over the top of your foot near the ankle.
2. Sit with the knee bent and the shin resting on the floor while holding the band ends.
3. Point your toes away from your shin and lean slightly forward to increase tension.
4. Maintain steady tension through the band and keep the ankle relaxed.
Steps to perform: Dorsiflex your ankle

Rest intervals: Assists hip flexor lengthening and standing balance during lunge alignment
Health benefit:
1. Stand facing away from the anchor and step into a lunge with the front knee over the ankle.
2. Hold the band ends overhead with arms straight and create steady tension from the anchor behind you.
3. Sink your hips forward and press your chest up while keeping the back leg long.
4. Keep the front knee aligned over the ankle and maintain firm footing.
Steps to perform: Square your hips toward the front

Rest intervals: Develops core stability while promoting shoulder girdle mobility
Health benefit:
1. Loop the band around your upper back and hold the ends under each hand.
2. Assume a high plank position with hands under shoulders and feet hip-width apart.
3. Press your hands into the floor and gently pull the band to open the chest while keeping core engaged.
4. Keep a flat spine and breathe evenly while holding the position.
Steps to perform: Maintain a neutral spine

Rest intervals: Opens chest and stretches shoulders while encouraging shoulder internal rotation
Health benefit:
1. Hold the band behind your back with one hand over your shoulder and the other behind your lower back.
2. Pull the band so both hands move toward each other behind your back with elbows slightly bent.
3. Lift your chest and squeeze your shoulder blades together as the hands draw closer.
4. Keep your chin neutral and breathe steadily while maintaining band tension.
Steps to perform: Retract your shoulder blades

Rest intervals: Increases gluteal flexibility and hip external rotation range of motion
Health benefit:
1. Lie on your back and loop the band around the foot of the leg you will cross.
2. Cross that ankle over the opposite thigh in a figure-four position.
3. Pull the band toward your chest to draw the knee toward the opposite shoulder.
4. Keep the other foot on the floor and a neutral spine while holding steady tension.
Steps to perform: Keep spine long

Rest intervals: Promotes gentle full body mobility and dynamic flexibility
Health benefit:
1. Stand on the band with feet hip-width and hold the ends overhead with palms facing each other.
2. Inhale and lengthen the spine while pulling the band upward to lift the chest.
3. Exhale and hinge at the hips into a forward fold with a soft bend in the knees while maintaining band tension.
4. Step one foot back into a low lunge, then step back to plank while keeping the band engaged.
Steps to perform: Keep a long spine and lead with your chest

Rest intervals: Enhances core engagement and seated balance
Health benefit:
1. Sit with knees bent and loop the band around the soles of your feet, holding the ends with both hands.
2. Lean back slightly onto your sit bones and lift your feet to balance, straightening the legs into a V while pulling the band toward you.
3. Keep your chest tall and the band taut as you hold the pose, then release slowly.
Steps to perform: Engage your core and lift through the crown

Rest intervals: Improves upper neck mobility and eases shoulder girdle tension
Health benefit:
1. Anchor the band low behind you or step on it and hold the free end with the hand on the side to be stretched.
2. Sit or stand tall and hold the band behind your back to keep the shoulder down.
3. Tilt your ear diagonally toward the same-side armpit while maintaining band tension to deepen the stretch.
Steps to perform: Tuck your chin slightly and keep a neutral spine

Rest intervals: Supports foot mobility and toe range of motion
Health benefit:
1. Sit and loop the band around the toes of one foot, holding the band ends in both hands.
2. Keep the knee bent and pull the band to draw the toes toward the shin until you feel a stretch along the sole.
3. Hold the stretch with a relaxed ankle, then release and switch sides.
Steps to perform: Support the ankle and dorsiflex gently without forcing

Rest intervals: Enhances hip adductor flexibility and lateral movement capacity
Health benefit:
1. Stand with feet wider than hip-width and loop the band under the front foot, holding the ends with both hands.
2. Shift weight to one leg and bend that knee into a side lunge while keeping the opposite leg straight and foot flexed.
3. Pull the band gently toward your chest to intensify the inner-thigh stretch.
4. Keep the chest upright and switch sides after holding.
Steps to perform: Push hips back and keep knee tracking over toes

Rest intervals: Develops core stability and controlled limb coordination
Health benefit:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and loop the band around the soles of both feet while holding the band ends.
2. Engage your core and press your low back into the mat.
3. Extend one leg straight toward the ceiling and reach the opposite arm overhead while keeping the band taut.
4. Hold the position, then bend the knee and return to the start and repeat on the other side.
Steps to perform: Keep a neutral spine and draw your navel toward your spine during movement
MET value: Hypertension, Coronary Artery Disease, Sleep Apnea

Rest intervals: Increases thoracic mobility and chest opening
Health benefit:
1. Sit or stand tall and hold a looped band behind your back with both hands clasped around it.
2. Pull the band upward so your hands move away from your lower back and your chest opens.
3. Squeeze your shoulder blades together as you lift the hands slightly.
4. Lower your hands back down under control and reset your posture.
Steps to perform: Keep ribs down and shoulder blades stable while extending arms overhead

Rest intervals: Improves hamstring flexibility and seated forward range of motion
Health benefit:
1. Sit tall with legs extended and loop the band around the arches of both feet.
2. Hold the band ends and lengthen your spine by reaching your chest forward.
3. Hinge at the hips and pull the band to increase the forward fold toward your feet.
4. Hold the stretch with a long spine, then release the band and sit upright.
Steps to perform: Hinge from the hips and maintain a long neutral spine as you fold

Rest intervals: Facilitates hip external rotation and gentle lower back mobility
Health benefit:
1. Lie on your back and loop the band around the soles of your feet while holding the ends with both hands.
2. Draw your knees toward your armpits so the knees point beside your torso.
3. Use the band to pull your feet toward you while keeping your back on the mat.
4. Hold the position, then release one foot at a time and return to neutral.
Steps to perform: Keep low back gently pressed to mat and breathe into hips

Rest intervals: Promotes gentle lumbar extension and front body mobility
Health benefit:
1. Lie on your stomach and place your forearms on the mat with elbows under the shoulders and loop a band across your upper back, holding the ends.
2. Press your forearms into the floor and gently lift your chest forward while using the band to broaden the front of your shoulders.
3. Keep your hips grounded and draw your shoulder blades down your back as you lift.
4. Hold the lifted position, then lower your chest and remove the band.
Steps to perform: Support weight on forearms and lengthen through the lower back without overarching

Rest intervals: Builds unilateral biceps strength and elbow stability
Health benefit:
1. Stand on one leg with the band anchored under that foot and the other end in your hand.
2. Keep your elbow close to your side and palm facing up.
3. Curl your hand toward your shoulder against the band's resistance.
4. Lower the hand slowly and maintain balance.
Steps to perform: Keep elbow anchored at your side throughout each curl

Rest intervals: Enhances upper back strength and postural stability
Health benefit:
1. Stand in tandem stance with one foot directly in front of the other and hold the band ends with both hands.
2. Hinge slightly at the hips and pull your shoulder blades back.
3. Pull the band toward your torso with elbows close to your sides.
4. Extend the arms slowly and keep a stable posture.
Steps to perform: Squeeze shoulder blades together on each row

Rest intervals: Develops single leg balance and overhead pressing control
Health benefit:
1. Stand on one leg with the other knee lifted and hold the band ends at shoulder height.
2. Press the hands overhead until the arms are fully extended.
3. Lower the hands back to shoulder height with control.
4. Keep your core engaged and maintain balance.
Steps to perform: Maintain a tall spine and engaged core while pressing

Rest intervals: Improves single leg strength and knee control
Health benefit:
1. Stand on one leg and hold the band anchored under that foot with both hands at chest height.
2. Sit back into a single-leg squat while keeping your knee aligned over your toes.
3. Use the band to assist as you push up to standing.
4. Squeeze the glute and fully extend the hip at the top.
Steps to perform: Sit back into the hips and keep weight on the heel

Rest intervals: Enhances lateral stability and neuromuscular coordination
Health benefit:
1. Stand on an imaginary straight line with feet heel-to-toe and hold the band with both hands at chest level.
2. Keep the band taut and take a slow step forward placing the heel on the line.
3. Continue stepping heel-to-toe while maintaining band tension and upright posture.
4. Focus on a fixed point and move deliberately to preserve balance.
Steps to perform: Keep hips level and shoulders stacked over hips while stepping
MET value: Sarcopenia, Cognitive Decline / Dementia, Depression / Anxiety

Rest intervals: Improves dynamic hip mobility and single leg balance
Health benefit:
1. Stand on one leg and loop a resistance band around the ankle of the opposite leg, holding the band end in one hand.
2. Keep a soft bend in the standing knee and maintain an upright torso.
3. Swing the banded leg forward and backward in a controlled arc while focusing on balance.
4. Pause briefly at each end of the swing and reset before the next repetition.
Steps to perform: Keep spine tall and hinge only at the hip

Rest intervals: Strengthens posterior chain and improves single leg balance
Health benefit:
1. Stand on one foot with a resistance band looped under that foot and hold the other end in both hands.
2. Hinge at the hips with a slight bend in the standing knee and a neutral spine.
3. Lower your torso as the free leg extends back until you feel tension in the standing hamstring.
4. Drive through the planted heel and squeeze the glute to return to standing.
Steps to perform: Keep a neutral spine and hinge from the hips

Rest intervals: Builds unilateral leg power and functional balance
Health benefit:
1. Stand facing a step with a resistance band looped under the foot you will step onto and hold the band at chest height.
2. Step up onto the platform with the banded foot, driving through the heel and keeping hips level.
3. Bring the trailing foot up to balance on the step, hold briefly, then step down with control.
Steps to perform: Drive through the heel and keep knee tracking over the foot

Rest intervals: Promotes low impact cardiovascular activity and hip flexor activation
Health benefit:
1. Stand tall with a loop resistance band under both feet and the ends held at hip level.
2. Lift one knee to hip height while keeping an upright torso and light tension in the band.
3. Lower the foot and repeat on the other side, maintaining a steady marching rhythm.
Steps to perform: Stand tall brace your core lift each knee with control

Rest intervals: Enhances anti rotation core stability and single leg balance
Health benefit:
1. Anchor the band at chest height and stand perpendicular to the anchor on one leg, holding the band at your chest.
2. Brace the core and press the band straight out until the arms are extended.
3. Hold the press briefly while resisting rotation and maintaining single-leg balance.
4. Slowly return the band to your chest under control and repeat.
Steps to perform: Brace your core and resist rotation while exhaling steadily

Rest intervals: Enhances lateral core strength and trunk stability
Health benefit:
1. Anchor the band at shoulder height and stand sideways with feet hip-width apart.
2. Hold the band with the hand away from the anchor and place the other hand on your hip.
3. Contract your oblique and crunch your torso toward the anchor.
4. Slowly return to start with control and repeat.
Steps to perform: Brace your core and keep a neutral spine as you crunch slowly

Rest intervals: Improves core stabilization and contralateral limb coordination
Health benefit:
