1. Loop the band under your right foot and get into a tabletop position.
2. Hold the band with your left hand and brace your core.
3. Extend the right leg back and the left arm forward against the band’s resistance.
4. Retract the arm and leg slowly and repeat on the other side.
Steps to perform: Keep hips level and core tight to prevent rotation as you extend

Rest intervals: Develops single leg balance and overhead shoulder endurance
Health benefit:
1. Stand on the middle of the band with your left foot and lift your right foot off the ground.
2. Grasp the band with both hands and press it straight overhead until your arms are extended.
3. Keep your core tight and hips level while balancing on the standing leg.
4. Lower the band with control and switch legs.
Steps to perform: Keep shoulders stacked over hips and core braced to avoid arching the lower back

Rest intervals: Builds triceps strength and improves elbow extension control
Health benefit:
1. Anchor the band overhead and step into a staggered stance with one foot forward.
2. Grip the band behind your head with both hands and keep your elbows close to your ears.
3. Extend your forearms forward to straighten your arms and engage the triceps.
4. Bend the elbows to return to the start with control.
Steps to perform: Tuck elbows close to head and extend with controlled tempo

Rest intervals: Strengthens hip abductors and lateral balance
Health benefit:
1. Stand tall on your left foot and loop the band around your right ankle with the other end under the left foot.
2. Brace your core and lift the right leg straight out to the side against the band.
3. Lower the leg with control and hold your balance before repeating.
Steps to perform: Keep standing knee soft and maintain a tall spine while lifting slowly

Rest intervals: Enhances single leg power and dynamic hip extension
Health benefit:
1. Stand with the band anchored under your front foot and hold the ends at shoulder height.
2. Step backward with the other leg into a controlled reverse lunge.
3. Drive through the front heel to stand and pull the rear knee forward and up.
4. Lower the rear leg back into a reverse lunge and repeat.
Steps to perform: Keep chest tall and core braced as you drive the knee up

Rest intervals: Improves single leg proprioception and ankle stability
Health benefit:
1. Loop a light band under the standing foot and hold the ends near your chest.
2. Lift the free leg so the knee bends and the foot hovers off the ground.
3. Maintain an upright torso and hold the single-leg balance while keeping tension in the band.
Steps to perform: Stand tall, hips level, soft knee on standing leg and control sway

Rest intervals: Develops rotational core strength and single leg stability
Health benefit:
1. Anchor the band low to one side and grab the handle with both hands.
2. Stand on the opposite leg with a slight knee bend and hinge at the hips.
3. Pull the band from low to high across your body in a chopping arc while rotating your torso.
4. Control the return to the start position and keep balance on the single leg.
Steps to perform: Rotate from hips, brace core, keep lifted leg stable and spine long
MET value: Osteoporosis, Chronic Low Back Pain, Sarcopenia

Rest intervals: Enhances full body balance and shoulder girdle stability
Health benefit:
1. Stand on one leg and loop a band under the standing foot while holding the ends with both hands.
2. Extend the nonstanding leg and open your arms and leg out to form a star shape.
3. Hold the position with a tall spine and steady the balance.
Steps to perform: Maintain neutral spine, squeeze glutes, control limb positions

Rest intervals: Improves back muscle endurance and seated balance control
Health benefit:
1. Sit tall with legs slightly bent and loop the band around your feet while holding the handles.
2. Lean back to a balanced position and lift your feet if you can for added challenge.
3. Pull the handles toward your ribs by squeezing your shoulder blades together.
4. Extend your arms slowly to return to the start while keeping your core engaged.
Steps to perform: Sit tall, draw shoulders down and back, pull with shoulder blades

Rest intervals: Enhances unilateral chest and shoulder strength and stability
Health benefit:
1. Secure the band to a sturdy anchor at chest height and hold one handle in the working hand.
2. Step into a staggered stance with the working-side leg forward and create tension in the band.
3. Press the handle straight forward until your arm is fully extended and your shoulder feels stable.
4. Slowly return the handle to your chest under control.
Steps to perform: Maintain neutral spine and press slowly while bracing core

Rest intervals: Improves plantar flexor strength and single-leg balance
Health benefit:
1. Loop the band under the ball of your working foot and hold the ends in both hands.
2. Balance on the working foot and raise your heel until your calf is fully contracted.
3. Slowly lower your heel back to the starting position under control.
Steps to perform: Drive through forefoot and lower slowly with knee slightly bent

Rest intervals: Enhances single-leg balance and posterior chain engagement
Health benefit:
1. Anchor the band at a low point and hold the handle with both hands while standing on the supporting leg.
2. Hinge forward from the hips and lift the back leg until your torso and lifted leg form a straight line.
3. Extend your arms into the band to maintain balance and tension.
4. Return to standing with control.
Steps to perform: Hinge from hips keeping back flat and reach arms long

Rest intervals: Promotes coordinated core stabilization and contralateral limb control
Health benefit:
1. Lie on your back and loop the band around one foot while holding the opposite end in the opposite hand.
2. Lift both knees to tabletop and press your lower back into the floor.
3. Slowly extend the banded leg away while lowering the opposite arm overhead, keeping the core engaged.
4. Return both limbs to the starting tabletop position under control.
Steps to perform: Press lower back into floor and move opposite arm and leg slowly

Rest intervals: Strengthens rotator cuff activation while challenging single-leg stability
Health benefit:
1. Stand on one leg and secure the band to a low anchor beside you, holding the handle with the working hand.
2. Tuck your elbow to your side with a 90-degree bend and rotate your forearm away from your body.
3. Return your hand toward your body with control while maintaining single-leg balance.
Steps to perform: Keep hips level and core braced while rotating shoulder under control

Rest intervals: Improves dynamic balance and lower limb proprioception
Health benefit:
1. Stand on one foot with a loop band anchored under that foot and hold the band in the same-side hand.
2. Balance tall, brace the core, and reach the band upward and outward into a Y with a straight arm.
3. Control the band back to start and repeat, then switch legs.
Steps to perform: Stand on one leg with soft knee and tall chest as you reach overhead

Rest intervals: Targets glute strength and enhances unilateral hip stability
Health benefit:
1. Lie on your back with one knee bent, loop the band under the grounded foot and place the band across your hips, and extend the other leg straight.
2. Plant the grounded heel, squeeze the glute, and drive the hips upward until your hips align with your torso.
3. Pause at the top while maintaining band tension.
4. Lower the hips with control and repeat, then switch legs.
Steps to perform: Drive through heel and keep hips level avoid dropping the opposite hip

Rest intervals: Develops core anti-rotation strength and shoulder stability
Health benefit:
1. Assume a high plank with a loop band around both wrists and hands under shoulders.
2. Brace the core and lift one arm straight forward, stretching the band between the wrists.
3. Lower that arm with control and repeat, then switch arms.
Steps to perform: Brace core and keep hips square as you lift arm slowly without rotating torso

Rest intervals: Builds shoulder endurance while promoting balance through heel-to-toe progression
Health benefit:
1. Stand with one foot slightly in front of the other (heel-to-toe) on a resistance band and hold the band ends with palms facing down.
2. Keep a soft bend in the elbows and brace the core.
3. Lift both hands straight in front to shoulder height with controlled motion.
4. Lower slowly and repeat, then swap the front foot position.
Steps to perform: Maintain neutral spine and nod chin slightly as you raise band to shoulder level

Rest intervals: Increases unilateral hip extensor strength and improves single-leg power
Health benefit:
1. Sit with your upper back against a bench, loop a band across your hips and anchor it under your driving foot, and extend the other leg straight.
2. Plant the driving heel, brace the core, and drive the hips up until your torso and thigh form a straight line.
3. Squeeze the glutes at the top while keeping band tension.
4. Lower the hips with control and repeat, then switch legs.
Steps to perform: Press through heel drive hips up and keep ribcage down to avoid arching

Rest intervals: Enhances unilateral leg strength and balance
Health benefit:
1. Step into a split stance with your front knee over the ankle and back foot on the toes.
2. Loop a resistance band under the front foot and hold the ends at shoulder level.
3. Lower into a deep split squat and hold the bottom position with chest upright.
4. Squeeze the front glute and maintain weight through the front heel.
Steps to perform: Keep front knee stacked over ankle and maintain upright chest
MET value: Hypertension, Coronary Artery Disease, Osteoarthritis, Obesity / Overweight

Rest intervals: Increases core endurance and hip flexor engagement
Health benefit:
1. Sit with knees bent and loop a resistance band around the soles of your feet while holding the ends.
2. Lean back slightly and lift your feet off the floor to balance on your sit bones.
3. Extend your legs into a V and straighten your arms to create tension in the band.
4. Keep your spine long and hold the boat position.
Steps to perform: Lengthen spine brace core and breathe evenly through the nose
MET value: Hypertension, Coronary Artery Disease, Osteoporosis, Chronic Low Back Pain

Rest intervals: Improves scapular stability and single leg balance
Health benefit:
1. Stand on one leg with a loop band anchored under the standing foot and hold the band ends with both hands.
2. Hinge slightly at the hips with a straight back and extend your arms toward the band.
3. Pull your elbows back and squeeze your shoulder blades together to retract the scapulae.
4. Lower the band with control while maintaining single-leg balance.
Steps to perform: Retract shoulder blades smoothly avoid shrugging and keep hips level

Rest intervals: Strengthens glute medius and enhances lateral core stability
Health benefit:
1. Lie in a side plank on your forearm with a band looped around both knees just above the knees.
2. Stack your feet and lift your hips to form a straight line from head to heels.
3. Open the top knee against the band while keeping your feet together.
4. Close the knee with control and keep your core stable.
Steps to perform: Stack hips and shoulders and move top knee slowly without rolling torso

Rest intervals: Develops dynamic balance and unilateral lower body endurance
Health benefit:
1. Step into a forward lunge with a loop band anchored under the front foot and hold the ends at chest level.
2. Lower until both knees are about 90 degrees while keeping an upright torso.
3. Pulse up and down a few inches in the bottom of the lunge while maintaining band tension.
4. Hold your balance and keep weight through the front heel.
Steps to perform: Drive through front heel control pulses keep torso tall and core braced

Rest intervals: Builds lateral core strength and hip abductor endurance
Health benefit:
1. Lie on your side with a loop band around your thighs above the knees and prop up on your forearm.
2. Lift your hips into a side plank so your body forms a straight line from head to heels.
3. Lift the top leg against the band to hip height while keeping hips steady.
4. Lower the top leg with control and repeat.
Steps to perform: Keep hips stacked and core braced as you lift the top leg

Rest intervals: Enhances upper back strength and postural shoulder stability
Health benefit:
1. Stand in a tandem stance with one foot slightly in front of the other and place the band under the front foot.
2. Hinge slightly at the hips with a tall spine and hold the band ends with arms extended in front.
3. Pull the band apart, squeezing the shoulder blades and opening the chest until your arms reach shoulder level.
4. Slowly return the arms to the start position under control.
Steps to perform: Hinge from hips and squeeze shoulder blades together keeping elbows slightly bent

Rest intervals: Improves hip flexor activation and gait related coordination
Health benefit:
1. Place a loop band around both ankles and stand tall with feet hip-width apart.
2. Brace your core and lift one knee toward your chest against the band’s resistance.
3. Lower the foot back to the floor with control.
4. Alternate legs in a steady marching rhythm.
Steps to perform: Keep pelvis neutral and exhale as you lift avoid arching the lower back

Rest intervals: Combines posterior chain strengthening with single leg balance and pulling coordination
Health benefit:
1. Stand on one foot with the band secured under that foot and hold the other end in the opposite hand.
2. Hinge at the hips and lift the free leg back until your torso and lifted leg form a straight line.
3. Pull the band toward your hip, retracting the shoulder blade to perform a row.
4. Lower the band and return to standing with control.
Steps to perform: Hinge from the standing hip keeping spine neutral and row with control

Rest intervals: Enhances core stability and shoulder endurance under anti rotational load
Health benefit:
1. Place a loop band above your knees and come into a bear plank with knees hovering just off the floor and hands under shoulders.
2. Brace your core and keep a neutral spine while pressing your knees slightly outward against the band.
3. Hold the hover or perform small controlled knee taps toward the floor without resting.
Steps to perform: Brace the core keep hips level and breathe during controlled knee hovers

Rest intervals: Enhances shoulder stability and single-leg balance through integrated core engagement
Health benefit:
1. Stand on one leg with a slight knee bend and hold the band with both hands at chest level.
2. Move the band in a slow semicircle around your head to the opposite side while keeping elbows soft.
3. Reverse the halo back to the starting side with controlled motion and maintain balance.
4. Repeat for the set then switch legs and perform the same sequence.
Steps to perform: Keep hips level and core braced while controlling the band around your head

Rest intervals: Improves hip abductor strength and lateral stability with controlled glute activation
Health benefit:
1. Place the band around your ankles and lower into a shallow squat with feet hip-width.
2. Step one foot outward and slightly forward to create tension in the band.
3. Follow with the other foot while keeping a steady squat and constant band tension.
4. Continue slow, deliberate steps for the desired distance or reps.
Steps to perform: Step slowly with knees tracking toes and maintain constant band tension

Rest intervals: Develops rotational core strength and coordinated oblique activation
Health benefit:
1. Anchor the band low beside one foot and grasp the handle with both hands.
2. Rotate your torso and pull the band diagonally upward across your body toward the opposite shoulder.
3. Control the band back to the starting position with a reverse rotation.
4. Repeat for reps then switch sides and perform the same movement.
Steps to perform: Hinge from hips and rotate through the torso with a braced core

Rest intervals: Builds anti-rotation core stability and shoulder girdle control
Health benefit:
1. Anchor the band at chest height and stand perpendicular holding the handle close to your chest with both hands.
2. Step away from the anchor until the band is taut and your arms are extended at chest level.
3. Walk sideways or forward in small controlled steps while keeping your torso square to the anchor and resisting rotation.
4. Walk back to the start under control and repeat, then switch sides.
Steps to perform: Lock ribs to pelvis and resist rotation as you slowly walk hands forward

Rest intervals: Strengthens posterior shoulder and scapular retraction with increased upper back activation
Health benefit:
1. Stand tall on the balls of your feet with heels raised and hold the band in front at shoulder height.
2. Pull the band apart by squeezing your shoulder blades and moving your hands out to your sides with elbows soft.
3. Return the band to the center with control while maintaining the heel raise.
4. Repeat for the desired reps while keeping your posture tall and core engaged.
Steps to perform: Raise heels, keep chest tall and squeeze shoulder blades while maintaining a neutral neck

Rest intervals: Improves shoulder mobility and coordinated reach with single-leg balance challenge
Health benefit:
1. Secure one end of the band to a low anchor and hold the free handle with one hand.
2. Stand tall with feet hip-width and knees slightly bent.
3. Rotate your torso and reach the band across to tap the floor at each clock position one at a time.
4. Control the return to center between taps and keep tension on the band.
Steps to perform: Keep a tall chest and neutral spine as you reach and tap

Rest intervals: Enhances lateral hip stability and glute engagement through controlled single-leg loading
Health benefit:
1. Loop the band under the front foot and hold the ends at your hips.
2. Step the back leg diagonally behind and across into a curtsy position.
3. Lower into a shallow lunge so the back knee hovers just above the floor.
4. Press through the front heel to return to standing while maintaining band tension.
Steps to perform: Lower with control keeping front knee tracking over toes and chest upright
MET value: Osteoarthritis, Obesity / Overweight, Hypertension, Coronary Artery Disease

Rest intervals: Improves knee stabilization and hip muscle recruitment with resisted standing press
Health benefit:
1. Anchor the band behind you at knee height and loop the free end around the front of the working knee.
2. Stand tall on the supporting leg with the working knee slightly bent.
3. Drive the working knee forward against the band's resistance while keeping hips level.
4. Return the knee to the start position under control.
Steps to perform: Drive knee slowly into band while bracing core and keeping hips level

Rest intervals: Develops unilateral shoulder strength while challenging balance and scapular coordination
Health benefit:
1. Stand on one leg and place the band under the standing foot, holding the handle with the working hand.
2. Keep the standing knee soft and chest tall.
3. Pull the handle straight up toward your chin, leading with the elbow.
4. Lower the handle under control while maintaining balance on the supporting leg.
Steps to perform: Lead with elbow keeping shoulder down and spine long while balancing

Rest intervals: Strengthens ankle evertors and enhances lateral ankle control during seated resistance
Health benefit:
1. Sit with knees bent and loop the band around the forefoot, anchoring the other end to a stable object at the inside of the foot.
2. Keep the heel planted and toes pointing forward.
3. Rotate the forefoot outward against the band's resistance to evert the ankle.
4. Return the foot to neutral under control.
Steps to perform: Move ankle slowly controlling eversion and keep knee and hip stable

Rest intervals: Enhances lateral hip and glute activation and movement coordination
Health benefit:
1. Stand with feet hip-width apart and imagine a band lying on the floor between your feet.
2. Shift weight onto your left foot and lift your right foot to step over the imaginary band.
3. Place the right foot down beyond the band and control your balance.
4. Reverse the motion to step back to the starting position and repeat on the other side.
Steps to perform: Keep hips level and chest tall as you step over

Rest intervals: Develops anti rotation core stability and torso control
Health benefit:
1. Anchor the band at chest height and stand perpendicular with feet shoulder-width apart.
2. Hold the band with both hands at your chest and step away to create tension.
3. Press the band straight out and rotate your hands in a slow circular motion while bracing your core.
4. Reverse the circle and return the band to your chest with control.
Steps to perform: Brace core and exhale while moving slowly to resist rotation

Fitness Level: Limited single-leg balance | Rotator cuff weakness / instability
Rest intervals: Promotes shoulder posterior chain strength and single leg balance
Health benefit:
1. Anchor the band at upper-chest height and grab the band with both hands using an overhand grip.
2. Stand on one leg with a slight knee bend and step back to create tension.
3. Pull the band toward your face, leading with your elbows and squeezing your shoulder blades.
4. Lower the band with control and switch legs.
Steps to perform: Keep a soft knee on stance leg and squeeze shoulder blades together

Rest intervals: Improves hip extensor strength and multiplanar hip mobility
Health benefit:
1. Secure the band to a low anchor and wrap the other end around your ankle.
2. Stand tall with a slight forward lean and extend your leg straight back against the band's resistance.
3. From the same setup sweep your leg diagonally back and return with control.
4. Then move your leg out to the side against the band and repeat on the other ankle.
Steps to perform: Maintain neutral spine and drive from the glute with controlled tempo

Rest intervals: Reinforces hip hinge mechanics while improving posterior chain activation and balance
Health benefit:
1. Hold the band handle in one hand and step back to create tension while standing on the opposite leg.
2. Hinge at your hips by sending them back and lowering your torso while extending the free leg behind you.
3. Keep a neutral spine and hold the band close to your hip to maintain tension.
4. Drive through the standing heel to return to standing and switch sides.
Steps to perform: Hinge from the hips keeping spine long and shoulders stacked over hips

Rest intervals: Challenges core anti rotation control while enhancing shoulder stability and coordination
Health benefit:
1. Secure the band to a stable anchor at waist height and hold the band with both hands.
2. Stand with feet hip-width apart and hinge slightly at the hips to keep a tall spine.
3. Rotate your torso to move your hands in a circular "stir the pot" motion while keeping arms extended.
4. Reverse the circle direction after the set and maintain steady core tension.
Steps to perform: Brace your core and rotate slowly from the ribs keeping hips square

Rest intervals: Enhances thoracic rotation mobility and dynamic balance
Health benefit:
1. Anchor the band at chest height and grab it with both hands.
2. Stand on one leg with the knee bent to about 90 degrees and keep hips level.
3. Rotate your torso away from the anchor while moving your hands across your body.
4. Repeat the desired reps and switch legs.
Steps to perform: Keep chest lifted and rotate from thoracic spine while keeping knee stacked

Rest intervals: Builds anterior chain control and improves eccentric hip and trunk stability
Health benefit:
1. Place the band under both feet and hold the ends at chest height.
2. Hinge at the hips and lean forward until you feel steady band tension.
3. Drive your hips forward to return to an upright stance while keeping the core engaged.
Steps to perform: Hinge at the hips keeping a neutral spine and shoulders over hips

Rest intervals: Develops posterior oblique strength and single leg rotational stability
Health benefit:
1. Anchor the band low beside you and grab the handle with the opposite hand.
2. Stand on one leg with a slight bend in the knee and lift the other foot off the ground.
3. Pull the band from low to high in a sweeping "lawn mower" motion across your body.
4. Control the return and repeat before switching legs.
Steps to perform: Balance on the supporting leg with a tall spine and controlled horizontal pull

Rest intervals: Increases core anti extension strength while activating glutes and shoulder stability
Health benefit:
1. Loop the band around your ankles and get into a forearm plank with a straight body line.
2. Brace your core and lift one leg straight back against the band's resistance.
3. Lower the leg slowly and alternate sides while maintaining a stable plank.
Steps to perform: Keep hips level and core braced while breathing evenly during leg extension

Health benefit: Enhances hip mobility and lateral leg strength
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with a wide stance and toes slightly turned out.
2. Shift weight onto one leg and push hips back while keeping the other leg straight and toes up.
3. Drop hips toward the bent knee until you feel a stretch in the straight leg and keep chest upright.
4. Drive through the bent foot to return to center and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Keep chest tall and knees tracking over toes as you shift laterally

Health benefit: Strengthens shoulder stability and core control
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a forearm plank with hips lifted in a dolphin shape.
2. Bend through the shoulders and lower your head slightly toward the ground.
3. Press through your forearms to lift hips back up into the dolphin position.
4. Repeat the movement with control and steady breathing.
Safety cue: Maintain a neutral spine and core tight as you lower with control

Health benefit: Improves core endurance and dynamic shoulder stability
Steps to perform:
1. Begin in a forearm plank with shoulders stacked over elbows and body in a straight line.
2. Drive one knee toward your chest while keeping hips level and core engaged.
3. Return the foot to the start and immediately switch legs in a controlled, running rhythm.
4. Maintain a steady pace and avoid letting hips sag or rise.
Safety cue: Keep hips level and shoulders stacked while driving knees quickly with control

Health benefit: Builds single leg strength and balance control
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing away from a bench with one leg extended forward and toes pointed up.
2. Hinge hips back and lower down by bending the standing knee until your glutes lightly touch the bench.
3. Keep your chest upright and the extended leg straight throughout the descent.
4. Press through the heel to stand back up and repeat on the other leg.
Safety cue: Sit back to the bench with chest upright and supporting leg engaged

Health benefit: Enhances lateral core strength and trunk stabilization
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your side and prop your torso up on your forearm with elbow under the shoulder.
2. Stack your feet or place the top foot in front and lift hips until your body forms a straight line.
3. Hold the position while keeping hips elevated and core engaged.
Safety cue: Keep hips lifted in line with shoulders and breathe steadily

Health benefit: Develops posterior chain strength and single leg stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand on one leg with a soft bend in the knee and hands by your sides or holding weight.
2. Hinge at the hips and reach your torso forward while lifting the free leg straight behind you.
3. Keep your back flat and lower until your torso is parallel to the floor or you feel a stretch in the hamstring.
4. Drive the standing hip forward and return to standing with control.
Safety cue: Hinge from the hips with a neutral spine and a soft knee

Health benefit: Improves core anti rotation control and shoulder endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Assume a forearm plank with elbows under shoulders and body in a straight line.
2. Engage your core and push your hips back toward your heels, then thrust them forward in a controlled sawing motion.
3. Repeat the back-and-forth hip movement while keeping shoulders stable and breathing evenly.
Safety cue: Keep hips level, brace your core, and move shoulders without sagging

Health benefit: Increases single leg quadriceps endurance and isometric strength
Steps to perform:
1. Slide your back down a wall and lower into a seated position with one knee at roughly 90 degrees and the other leg extended forward.
2. Press your back flat to the wall and engage your core and the braced leg.
3. Hold the single-leg wall sit for the desired time while keeping steady breathing.
4. Push through the standing foot to rise and switch legs.
Safety cue: Press lower back into wall, drive through standing heel, breathe

Health benefit: Enhances lateral power, agility, and dynamic balance
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width and a slight knee bend while preparing to move laterally.
2. Leap explosively to one side, landing softly on the outside foot while swinging the opposite arm across your body.
3. Immediately push off and bound to the other side, keeping a low and quick rhythm.
Safety cue: Land softly, absorb force through hips, keep chest tall

Health benefit: Improves upper body coordination and rotational core endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Adopt a fighting stance with feet staggered and hands up near your face.
2. Rotate your hips and shoulder and drive your elbow horizontally toward the target in a short, sharp motion.
3. Retract the elbow back to guard and reset your stance.
4. Repeat the elbow strike on the opposite side while maintaining footwork and balance.
Safety cue: Exhale with each strike, keep shoulders relaxed and core engaged

Health benefit: Boosts cardiovascular fitness and lower body explosive power
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet together and arms at your sides.
2. Bend knees slightly and swing arms backward.
3. Explode into a jump, spread legs and raise arms overhead into a star.
4. Land softly on the balls of your feet and repeat without touching hands to feet.
Safety cue: Land softly with knees slightly bent and hips back

Health benefit: Enhances foot speed and agility for quick movement
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width and knees slightly bent.
2. Rapidly tap the balls of your feet alternately on the ground as quickly as possible.
3. Maintain an upright posture and keep arms moving for rhythm.
Safety cue: Stay light on your toes and maintain quick controlled steps

Health benefit: Improves core stability and dynamic lower body coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Position forearms on the floor under shoulders and extend legs back into a straight line.
2. Engage core and squeeze glutes to keep hips steady.
3. Jump both feet out wide and then back together quickly, like a jumping jack.
4. Continue alternating while keeping hips level and spine neutral.
Safety cue: Keep core braced and hips level as you move legs controlled

Health benefit: Elevates cardiovascular fitness while improving hip flexor activation
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and lift one knee toward your chest while driving the opposite arm forward.
2. Quickly switch legs in a running motion, keeping knees high and landing softly on the balls of your feet.
3. Maintain upright posture and pump your arms for speed.
Safety cue: Drive knees up with tall chest and steady rhythmic breathing
is_not_suitable_for: Hypothyroidism, Hyperthyroidism, COPD, Coronary Artery Disease

Health benefit: Promotes gentle spinal extension and upper back engagement
Steps to perform:
1. Lie face down and place forearms on the floor shoulder-width apart with elbows under shoulders.
2. Press forearms down and lift your chest while drawing shoulder blades down and together.
3. Engage core and legs to hold a gentle backbend, keeping the neck long and gaze forward.
Safety cue: Press forearms down draw shoulders back and lengthen through the spine

Health benefit: Enhances core and lower back stability with contralateral coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Set up on forearms and knees with elbows under shoulders and spine neutral.
2. Brace your core and extend your right arm forward and left leg back until body forms a straight line.
3. Hold briefly with hips level and shoulders square.
4. Return to the start and repeat on the opposite side.
Safety cue: Keep hips level and spine neutral as you extend arm and leg

Health benefit: Improves chest and anterior shoulder flexibility and posture alignment
Steps to perform:
1. Stand in a doorway and place your forearm on the frame at shoulder height with the elbow bent.
2. Step one foot forward and lean your chest through the doorway until you feel a stretch across the chest.
3. Hold briefly, then step back and switch sides.
Safety cue: Keep ribs down and shoulders relaxed while leaning into the chest stretch

Health benefit: Builds lower body strength and balance through unilateral hip and knee control
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and hands at your sides.
2. Step one foot back and lower into a lunge until both knees are about 90 degrees.
3. Keep your torso upright and front knee aligned over the ankle.
4. Push through the front heel to return to standing and repeat on the other leg.
Safety cue: Step back with control and keep front knee aligned over midfoot

Health benefit: Engages posterior chain and improves shoulder and core endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Sit with legs extended and forearms on the floor behind you under your shoulders.
2. Press into forearms and heels and lift your hips until your body forms a straight line from head to heels.
3. Squeeze your glutes and keep your neck neutral while holding the position.
4. Lower your hips back down with control to finish.
Safety cue: Press through forearms and heels to maintain a straight shoulder to heel line

Health benefit: Strengthens scapular stabilizers and enhances shoulder mobility and posture
Steps to perform:
1. Lie face down with arms extended out to the sides in a T and palms facing down.
2. Lift both arms off the ground, rotate your thumbs up, and squeeze your shoulder blades together.
3. Hold briefly, then lower the arms with control.
Safety cue: Lift with scapular retraction and keep neck long and eyes down

Health benefit: Improves wrist flexibility and forearm muscle length
Steps to perform:
1. Extend one arm straight in front at shoulder height with the palm facing down.
2. Use the other hand to gently bend the fingers and wrist downward so the fingers point toward the floor.
3. Keep the elbow straight and hold the stretch for 20 to 30 seconds.
4. Release and repeat on the opposite arm.
Safety cue: Keep elbow straight and drop shoulder while gently pulling wrist into a comfortable stretch

Health benefit: Enhances core stability and coordinated abdominal engagement
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with arms by your sides and knees bent at 90 degrees in a tabletop position.
2. Press your lower back into the floor and brace your core.
3. Slowly extend one leg straight until it is a few inches above the floor while keeping the other knee bent.
4. Return the extended leg to tabletop and repeat with the opposite leg.
Safety cue: Press lower back into the floor and move legs slowly with steady exhales

Health benefit: Improves oblique activation and dynamic rotational core strength
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width apart and place hands lightly behind your head.
2. Lift your right knee toward your chest while rotating your torso to bring your left elbow toward the knee.
3. Lower and switch sides in a controlled, alternating cycling motion.
Safety cue: Keep chest lifted rotate through the ribs and exhale as you twist

Health benefit: Builds lower body strength while enhancing hip mobility and overhead reach
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and arms at your sides.
2. Step forward with one foot and lower into a lunge until both knees are about 90 degrees.
3. Reach both arms overhead and keep your torso upright.
4. Push through the front heel to return to standing and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Step forward keeping knee over ankle and reach overhead without arching lower back

Health benefit: Improves scapular stability and upper back muscle endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Lie face down with your forehead on the mat and arms extended overhead in a Y position.
2. Squeeze your shoulder blades and lift your chest slightly while externally rotating the arms through Y, then lower and move to T and W positions in sequence.
3. Keep your neck neutral and perform the sequence in a slow, controlled manner for multiple repetitions.
Safety cue: Keep chin tucked and squeeze shoulder blades down and together while moving arms slowly

Health benefit: Increases shoulder stability and dynamic core strength
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a forearm plank with elbows under shoulders and body in a straight line.
2. Press into one hand and place the other hand on the floor to lift into a full high plank.
3. Lower the first forearm then the second to return to the forearm plank.
4. Alternate the leading hand each repetition.
Safety cue: Keep hips level and move slowly to avoid sagging or hip rotation

Health benefit: Enhances lower body muscular endurance and ankle mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width and arms relaxed by your sides.
2. Drop your hips back and down while swinging your arms back, keeping chest upright and knees tracking over toes.
3. Drive through the midfoot to stand while swinging your arms forward and fully extending the hips.
Safety cue: Drive chest upright, knees tracking toes, land softly through midfoot

Health benefit: Improves single leg balance and unilateral strength
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing a box on one leg with the other leg extended slightly forward for balance.
2. Hinge at the hips and bend the standing knee to lower your hips straight back toward the box.
3. Lightly touch the box with your glutes without fully sitting, keeping the chest lifted and core engaged.
4. Press through the heel of the standing leg to return to standing while keeping the non-working leg extended.
Safety cue: Lower with control, sit back onto box keeping knee aligned over toes

Health benefit: Develops static core strength and posterior pelvic control
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat, then lift your shoulders off the floor and reach your arms toward your knees.
2. Tilt your pelvis so your lower back presses gently into the floor and draw your belly button toward your spine.
3. Hold this position with steady breathing, maintaining a flattened lower back and elevated chest.
Safety cue: Exhale and brace core, keep lower back gently pressed to the floor

Health benefit: Boosts anaerobic power and short burst cardiovascular fitness
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall in an athletic stance with knees slightly bent and chest up.
2. Drive knees up and pump your arms rapidly while sprinting in place at maximal effort for the chosen interval.
3. Slow down to a light jog or march to recover before repeating.
Safety cue: Maintain upright posture and controlled breathing while accelerating into short powerful strides
is_not_suitable_for: Hypertension, Coronary Artery Disease, Heart Failure (Stable)

Health benefit: Develops lateral power and agility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width and knees slightly bent.
2. Push off one foot and jump laterally to the opposite side.
3. Land softly on the outside foot with knees bent and chest up.
4. Bound back the other way in a controlled, explosive motion.
Safety cue: Land softly with knees bent and hips back to absorb impact

Health benefit: Strengthens obliques and improves lateral trunk stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width and hands behind your head.
2. Lift one knee toward the elbow on the same side while bending your torso sideways.
3. Lower and repeat on the other side with a controlled motion.
Safety cue: Keep ribcage down and spine neutral as you crunch with slow control

Health benefit: Amplifies muscular endurance and metabolic demand in lower body
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width and sink into a shallow squat with hips back.
2. Pulse up and down quickly a few inches while keeping weight in the heels.
3. Maintain chest up and quick rhythm for the desired reps.
Safety cue: Maintain chest up and weight in heels move from hips not knees

Health benefit: Builds dynamic core stability and functional lower body strength
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a high plank with hands under shoulders and body in a straight line.
2. Jump or step both feet forward toward your hands into a low squat.
3. Pop up to a standing position with hips driving up.
4. Return hands to the floor and jump or step back to plank to repeat.
Safety cue: Keep core braced and move slowly to avoid collapsing in the low back

Health benefit: Raises upper body power and improves hand eye coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Stand in an athletic boxing stance with hands up near the chin.
2. Rotate your torso and drive one fist upward in a short, explosive uppercut.
3. Alternate quickly between sides while keeping your guard high.
4. Pivot your feet lightly to add power and maintain balance.
Safety cue: Drive power from hips retract hands quickly and keep shoulders relaxed

Health benefit: Promotes hamstring flexibility and improves dynamic hip mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and arms at your sides.
2. Lift your right leg slightly forward and hinge at the hips.
3. Reach your left hand across your body toward your right toes as far as comfortable.
4. Lower and repeat on the opposite side, alternating smoothly.
Safety cue: Keep chest lifted and hinge from hips as you reach across

Health benefit: Increases shoulder mobility and warms upper body muscles
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width and arms extended straight out to the sides at shoulder height.
2. Make large, fast forward circles with both arms while keeping your core steady.
3. Reverse the circle direction and continue at the same speed.
Safety cue: Drive circles from your shoulders keep scapula stable and core braced

Health benefit: Enhances hip flexor mobility and thoracic rotation
Steps to perform:
1. Begin in a high plank and step your right foot outside your right hand into a deep lunge.
2. Lower your left knee toward the floor while keeping your chest lifted.
3. Place your left hand on the ground and rotate your torso to lift your right arm toward the ceiling.
4. Return hands to the floor and step back to plank, then repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Keep front knee over ankle and rotate thorax without collapsing hips

Health benefit: Improves spinal rotational mobility and hip flexibility
Steps to perform:
1. Lie face down with arms extended out to the sides in a T position and legs straight.
2. Lift your chest slightly and bend your right knee, bringing your right foot toward your left hand while rotating your hips.
3. Hold briefly, return the leg to center, and repeat on the opposite side.
Safety cue: Keep hips pinned to the floor and move through thoracic rotation

Health benefit: Activates glutes and improves posterior chain stability
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent, feet flat hip-width apart, and arms extended toward the ceiling.
2. Press through your heels to lift your hips into a bridge until your body forms a straight line from shoulders to knees.
3. Reach one arm back over your head and toward the floor behind you while keeping hips lifted.
4. Return the arm, lower your hips with control, and repeat alternating arms.
Safety cue: Drive heels into the ground lift with glutes and maintain a neutral spine

Health benefit: Improves thoracic mobility and rotational control
Steps to perform:
1. Kneel on hands and knees with knees under hips and hands under shoulders.
2. Place one hand behind your head and keep the other hand on the floor for support.
3. Rotate your chest and lift the elbow of the hand behind your head toward the ceiling while looking up.
4. Return to start and repeat, then switch sides.
Safety cue: Keep hips square and rotate from thoracic spine not lower back

Health benefit: Improves single leg balance and dynamic neck control
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and shift weight onto one foot while lifting the other foot slightly off the ground.
2. Keep hips level and slowly turn your head to look over one shoulder, then to the other.
3. Maintain balance and control throughout, then switch legs.
Safety cue: Maintain a tall spine and control head turns avoid collapsing through standing hip

Health benefit: Increases inner thigh flexibility and hip range of motion
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet wider than hip-width and toes pointing forward.
2. Shift your weight to one side by bending that knee and keeping the other leg straight.
3. Press the straight leg's heel into the floor and hinge your hips back to deepen the stretch, then switch sides.
Safety cue: Keep knees soft and weight balanced evenly between feet

Health benefit: Develops multidirectional lunge strength and dynamic hip mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and visualize a clock around you.
2. Step into a lunge toward one clock direction with the front knee over the ankle.
3. Push through the front heel to return to standing.
4. Repeat lunges to different clock positions and then switch legs.
Safety cue: Step deliberately and maintain upright torso align front knee over ankle

Health benefit: Promotes shoulder and chest flexibility and improved postural alignment
Steps to perform:
1. Stand perpendicular to a wall and place your forearm and palm on the wall at shoulder height.
2. Step the foot farthest from the wall forward and rotate your torso away from the wall.
3. Move in and out of the rotation with controlled rhythm while keeping the arm anchored.
4. Repeat for desired reps and switch sides.
Safety cue: Press shoulder blades down and open chest while breathing steadily

Health benefit: Strengthens posterior chain and enhances shoulder and core stability
Steps to perform:
1. Sit with knees bent, feet flat, and hands placed behind hips with fingers pointing toward your feet.
2. Press through your palms and heels and lift your hips until your torso and thighs form a flat tabletop.
3. Keep your neck neutral and squeeze your glutes to maintain a straight line from shoulders to knees.
4. Lower your hips with control back to the starting position.
Safety cue: Lift hips until body forms a straight line and keep neck neutral

Health benefit: Challenges lateral core strength and rotational coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your side and prop your torso on your forearm with elbow under the shoulder and legs stacked.
2. Lift your hips so your body forms a straight line from head to feet.
3. Thread your top arm under your torso and reach through toward the floor with controlled rotation.
4. Reverse the motion to return the arm to the starting position and maintain the side plank.
Safety cue: Keep hips stacked and ribs down as you rotate through with control
is_not_suitable_for: Hypertension, Coronary Artery Disease, Chronic Low Back Pain

Health benefit: Builds unilateral leg strength and improves hip and knee stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand a couple of feet in front of a bench and place the top of one foot on the bench behind you.
2. Keep your torso upright and step the front foot forward to create a stable long stride.
3. Bend the front knee and lower your hips until the front thigh is near parallel to the floor.
4. Press through the front heel to return to standing and repeat, then switch legs.
Safety cue: Ensure front knee tracks over toes and maintain upright chest

Health benefit: Enhances scapular control and upper back endurance through static pulling tension
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing an open doorframe and grasp the frame with both hands at chest height.
2. Lean back with arms straight and your weight supported on your heels.
3. Pull your chest toward the frame without moving your feet and hold the contraction.
Safety cue: Pull shoulders down and back while bracing core and keeping spine neutral

Health benefit: Improves core motor control and coordinated limb stabilization
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent at 90 degrees and hands crossed over your chest.
2. Lower one heel slowly toward the floor while keeping your lower back pressed into the mat.
3. Return the lowered leg to the start and repeat with the opposite leg in a controlled manner.
Safety cue: Press lower back gently to floor and move limbs slowly with control

Health benefit: Strengthens upper back and improves shoulder stability
Steps to perform:
1. Lie face down with legs extended and toes on the floor.
2. Place your hands flat by your hips with fingers pointing forward.
3. Lift your chest and hands a few inches while squeezing shoulder blades and glutes.
4. Keep your neck neutral and hold the raised position.
Safety cue: Squeeze shoulder blades to lift chest and keep neck neutral

Health benefit: Improves lateral core stability and oblique strength
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your side with knees bent and stacked under your hips.
2. Prop up on your forearm with elbow under your shoulder.
3. Lift hips until a straight line forms from head to knees.
4. Hold the position and keep hips steady.
Safety cue: Keep shoulders stacked over elbow and hold hips lifted

Health benefit: Increases quadriceps endurance and lower body isometric strength
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with your back against a wall and feet shoulder-width apart.
2. Slide down until your thighs are parallel to the floor and knees over ankles.
3. Keep arms relaxed at your sides and hold the position.
Safety cue: Keep knees over ankles and press low back into wall

Health benefit: Improves shoulder stability and upper chest muscular engagement
Steps to perform:
1. Stand or sit tall and bring palms together at chest level.
2. Press palms firmly together and raise elbows to shoulder height.
3. Hold the squeeze while maintaining upright posture.
Safety cue: Keep elbows at chest height and squeeze palms evenly while breathing

Health benefit: Improves cardiovascular fitness and hip flexor activation
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and arms resting at your sides.
2. Quickly lift one knee toward hip level while keeping the opposite foot on the ground.
3. Alternate knees in a running motion, keeping arms down by your sides.
4. Land softly on each foot and maintain a brisk pace.
Safety cue: Drive knees up while maintaining an upright chest and steady breathing

Health benefit: Develops lateral power, balance, and explosive hip strength
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width and knees slightly bent, arms relaxed low at your sides.
2. Push off one foot and leap laterally while swinging your arms low across your body toward the landing leg.
3. Land on the opposite foot with a soft knee bend and absorb the impact.
4. Immediately push off and repeat to the other side in a controlled, rhythmic manner.
Safety cue: Land softly with knees bent and chest lifted

Health benefit: Strengthens single leg stability and functional lower body strength
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing a stable step or box and place one foot fully on the platform.
2. Drive through the heel of the planted foot and step up until you are standing tall on the platform.
3. Raise the trailing knee to hip height to balance, hold briefly, then step down with control.
Safety cue: Drive through the heel and control the balance at the top

Health benefit: Builds lower abdominal endurance and hip flexor control
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back and slide your hands under your glutes for support with legs extended.
2. Lift both legs a few inches off the floor while keeping your lower back pressed into the mat.
3. Alternate small, quick up-and-down kicks with straight legs while maintaining steady breathing.
Safety cue: Press lower back into the floor and breathe steadily through movement

Health benefit: Increases light cardiovascular endurance and shoulder mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet together and arms at shoulder height and slightly bent.
2. Jump or step your feet out to shoulder-width while moving your arms out to shoulder height.
3. Return your feet and arms to the starting position and repeat at a steady pace.
Safety cue: Keep chest up core braced and land softly on each rep

Health benefit: Enhances glute activation and improves posterior chain coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Start on hands and knees with a neutral spine and hands under your shoulders.
2. Extend one leg straight back until the leg aligns with your hip, keeping your hips level.
3. Hold briefly, lower the leg with control, and repeat on the opposite side.
Safety cue: Hinge from hips keep spine neutral and avoid twisting

Health benefit: Improves scapular mobility and shoulder movement patterns
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with your back against a wall, feet a few inches away, and elbows bent at 90 degrees with the backs of your hands touching the wall.
2. Press your lower back, upper back, and head into the wall.
3. Slide your arms upward into a "Y" while keeping contact with the wall.
4. Slowly lower your arms back to the starting "W" position.
Safety cue: Keep ribs down and shoulder blades gently retracted against the wall

Health benefit: Enhances single-leg balance and posterior chain strength
Steps to perform:
1. Stand on one leg with a slight bend in the knee and the other leg lifted behind you.
2. Hinge at the hips, sending your hips back and lowering your torso while keeping your back flat.
3. Reach your hands toward the floor until you feel tension in the standing leg's hamstring.
4. Drive your hips forward and return to standing.
Safety cue: Hinge at hips with a slight knee bend and maintain a neutral spine

Health benefit: Increases thoracic mobility and chest flexibility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and interlace your fingers behind your lower back.
2. Straighten your arms and lift them slightly while squeezing your shoulder blades together.
3. Lift your chest and breathe evenly while holding the open chest position.
Safety cue: Breathe deeply and expand through the chest while keeping shoulders down

Health benefit: Builds hip hinge strength for posterior chain engagement
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width and a barbell across your upper back or hands placed behind your head.
2. Bend your knees slightly and brace your core.
3. Hinge at the hips, push your butt back, and lower your torso while keeping your spine neutral.
4. Drive your hips forward to return to an upright position.
Safety cue: Push hips back keep a long neutral spine and brace the core

Health benefit: Improves functional lower body strength and daily transfer ability
Steps to perform:
1. Sit on the edge of a chair with feet hip-width apart and positioned slightly behind your knees.
2. Lean your chest forward and engage your core.
3. Push through your heels and stand up without using your hands, then sit back down slowly.
Safety cue: Drive through heels lean chest forward and stand using leg strength

Health benefit: Develops core stability and spinal control
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with legs extended and arms resting by your sides.
2. Engage your core and press your lower back gently into the floor.
3. Lift your head, shoulders, and legs a few inches off the ground.
4. Hold the hollow position while breathing steadily.
Safety cue: Tuck pelvis and draw ribs toward it while breathing steadily

Health benefit: Targets glute strength while enhancing unilateral hip stability
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent, one foot flat on the floor, and the other leg extended straight.
2. Drive through the heel of the grounded foot and lift your hips until your body forms a straight line from shoulders to knee.
3. Squeeze your glute at the top and keep the extended leg aligned with your torso.
4. Lower your hips back down with control and repeat, then switch legs.
Safety cue: Drive through heel and keep hips level squeeze glute at top

Health benefit: Strengthens calf muscles and improves ankle plantarflexion power
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and weight evenly distributed.
2. Rise onto the balls of your feet by pushing through your calves and lift your heels as high as possible.
3. Pause at the top, then lower your heels slowly back to the floor.
Safety cue: Rise and lower slowly controlling the ankle keep knees soft and spine neutral

Health benefit: Promotes trunk mobility and rotational range of motion
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat on the floor.
2. Extend your arms out to the sides at shoulder height.
3. Slowly lower both knees to one side while keeping your shoulders in contact with the floor.
4. Return to center and repeat to the other side in a controlled motion.
Safety cue: Anchor shoulders to floor and initiate rotation from the ribs not low back

Health benefit: Enhances shoulder endurance and static pressing strength
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing a wall with one fist at chest height and your elbow bent.
2. Press your fist firmly into the wall while keeping your shoulder and core engaged.
3. Hold the press for the desired time, then release and repeat with the other arm.
Safety cue: Keep shoulder blades long and avoid shrugging while pressing firmly into wall

Health benefit: Builds lower body strength and improves functional mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet about shoulder-width apart and bring your hands together at your chest.
2. Push your hips back and bend your knees to lower your hips as if sitting, keeping your chest upright.
3. Lower until your thighs are parallel to the floor or as far as comfortable.
4. Drive through your heels to stand, straighten your hips and knees, and return your hands to your chest.
Safety cue: Sit hips back, keep chest up, knees tracking over toes

Health benefit: Enhances core stability and control during lower abdominal engagement
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with hips and knees at 90 degrees and hands by your sides or under your hips.
2. Brace your core and press your lower back gently into the floor.
3. Slowly lower one foot to lightly tap the floor while keeping the opposite knee at tabletop.
4. Return the lowered foot to tabletop and repeat on the other side in a controlled rhythm.
Safety cue: Press lower back into floor and control each tap slowly

Health benefit: Improves shoulder mobility and posterior chain activation
Steps to perform:
1. Lie prone with legs extended and arms at your sides, palms down.
2. Lift your chest and arms a few inches off the floor while keeping your neck neutral.
3. Sweep your arms forward above your head and then back to your sides in a smooth, controlled motion.
Safety cue: Keep ribcage down and squeeze shoulder blades together as arms move

Health benefit: Activates glutes and strengthens hip extension for improved hip power
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and feet wider than hip-width, toes pointing slightly outward.
2. Press through your heels, squeeze your glutes, and lift your hips until your body forms a straight line from knees to shoulders.
3. Lower your hips back down with control and reset before the next repetition.
Safety cue: Drive through heels, lift hips with glutes, avoid overarching lower back

Health benefit: Enhances lateral core stability and hip support
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your side and prop yourself on your forearm with knees bent and stacked, elbow under your shoulder.
2. Lift your hips so your body forms a straight line from shoulder to knees, keeping the top hand on your hip or extended.
3. Hold the position, then lower your hips back down with control to finish the set.
Safety cue: Stack hips, lift through ribs, breathe steadily and avoid shoulder collapse

Health benefit: Improves scapular upward rotation and shoulder mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing a wall with feet hip-width and forearms on the wall at shoulder height, elbows bent about 90 degrees.
2. Protract your shoulder blades by reaching forward so the forearms press into the wall.
3. Slide your forearms upward along the wall while maintaining contact and scapular protraction.
4. Lower back down with control and repeat.
Safety cue: Press forearms into wall and lift through scapulae to prevent shrugging

Health benefit: Improves single leg balance and ankle proprioception
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with one foot directly in front of the other in a heel-to-toe line and shift weight onto the front foot.
2. Lift the back foot slightly off the ground and maintain a tall posture with hips level.
3. Hold your balance, focus on a fixed point, then switch sides.
Safety cue: Keep hips level and maintain slight knee bend on standing leg

Health benefit: Increases dynamic core coordination and elevates heart rate for conditioning
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a slight squat with feet shoulder-width and arms bent.
2. Drive one knee up while pulling the opposite elbow back in a running motion.
3. Jump lightly and switch legs, bringing the other knee up and the opposite elbow back.
4. Land softly on the balls of your feet and continue alternating.
Safety cue: Hinge from the hips and brace core before extending opposite leg

Health benefit: Enhances lateral agility and boosts aerobic activity
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet together and knees slightly bent.
2. Step quickly to the right and bring the left foot to touch next to the right while swinging your arms.
3. Immediately step quickly to the left and repeat the touch, staying light on your feet.
Safety cue: Land softly with knees aligned over toes and chest lifted

Health benefit: Strengthens obliques and improves trunk lateral flexion control
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with hands behind your head and feet hip-width apart.
2. Lift your right knee toward your right elbow while bringing your elbow down to meet the knee and contract the oblique.
3. Return to standing and repeat on the left side, alternating sides.
Safety cue: Keep ribs down and crunch obliques without dropping shoulder

Health benefit: Enhances footwork coordination and light cardiovascular endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width and hands up near your chin.
2. Bounce lightly on the balls of your feet with small hops.
3. Shift weight quickly from left to right while keeping a relaxed rhythm.
Safety cue: Stay light on your feet and land softly on the balls of your feet

Health benefit: Increases lower limb circulation and neuromuscular activation
Steps to perform:
1. Sit on the edge of a chair with knees bent and hands on the sides.
2. Lean back slightly and brace your core.
3. Extend the right leg and tap the heel quickly on the floor.
4. Alternate legs rapidly while keeping a steady rhythm.
Safety cue: Brace your core and control each tap keeping a neutral spine

Health benefit: Improves trunk rotational mobility and oblique muscle engagement
Steps to perform:
1. Stand feet shoulder-width apart and cross your arms at chest level.
2. Rotate your torso to the right, then to the left using your obliques.
3. Keep your hips facing forward and maintain a controlled tempo.
Safety cue: Rotate from your ribs with hips square and a tall chest

Health benefit: Develops upper body power and hand eye coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Adopt a boxing stance with hands up and feet staggered.
2. Rotate your hips and pivot the lead foot to throw a short, tight hook.
3. Snap the punch back to guard immediately after contact.
4. Repeat punches in controlled sets and keep your chin tucked.
Safety cue: Drive punches from the torso with elbows tight and chin tucked

Health benefit: Enhances lower body strength and aerobic capacity
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet together and lower into a half-squat.
2. Jump feet out wide then back together while staying in the half-squat.
3. Land softly, keep your chest up, and repeat at a steady pace.
Safety cue: Land softly in a half squat with knees tracking over toes

Health benefit: Improves shoulder external rotation and posterior shoulder stability
Steps to perform:
1. Lie face down with your arms out to the sides and elbows bent at 90°.
2. Keep elbows tucked and rotate your forearms up away from the floor.
3. Squeeze your shoulder blades together at the top.
4. Lower your hands slowly back to the starting position.
Safety cue: Keep elbows lifted and shoulder blades gently squeezed to control shoulder rotation

Health benefit: Strengthens hamstrings while promoting single leg balance
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and hold a stable surface for balance.
2. Bend one knee and curl your heel toward your glutes.
3. Lower your foot with control and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Keep hips square and torso upright while you curl the heel toward the glute

Health benefit: Enhances core anti rotation control and contralateral shoulder stability
Steps to perform:
1. Start on hands and knees with a neutral spine.
2. Reach one arm straight forward until it aligns with your torso.
3. Hold briefly, keep the hips still, and return the hand to the ground.
Safety cue: Brace your core and keep hips level as you reach the arm forward

Health benefit: Promotes anterior shoulder and chest flexibility to support upright posture
Steps to perform:
1. Stand beside a doorway and place your forearm on the frame at waist height.
2. Step forward with the foot nearest the frame until you feel a low chest and front shoulder stretch.
3. Keep your torso upright and hold, then step back to release.
Safety cue: Keep spine neutral, feet grounded, and breathe into the low arm stretch

Health benefit: Increases hip flexor flexibility and improves seated hip mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Sit on the edge of a chair with one foot flat on the floor.
2. Place the other foot behind you with the toes on the floor.
3. Tuck your pelvis slightly and shift your weight forward until you feel the hip flexor stretch.
4. Keep your torso upright and hold, then switch sides.
Safety cue: Sit tall, posteriorly tilt the pelvis, and breathe deeply into the front hip

Health benefit: Improves balance and proprioceptive awareness
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and place the heel of one foot directly in front of the toes of the other foot.
2. Close your eyes and take a slow, controlled step forward, placing heel to toe.
3. Continue stepping in a straight line with steady tempo and arms relaxed at your sides.
Safety cue: Keep chin neutral and core braced, place heel to toe with slow controlled steps

Health benefit: Enhances shoulder stability and core coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Start on hands under shoulders and knees under hips in a quadruped position.
2. Brace your core and lift one hand to tap the opposite shoulder while keeping hips square.
3. Return the hand and repeat on the other side with slow, controlled movements.
Safety cue: Maintain a flat back and hips square, tap shoulders slowly without rocking

Health benefit: Builds lower body strength and unilateral leg stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and take a controlled step forward into a lunge with both knees bent.
2. Lower until the front thigh is parallel to the floor and the back knee hovers near the ground.
3. Hold the lunge with an upright torso and engaged core for the desired time.
4. Push through the front heel to return to standing or switch legs to repeat.
Safety cue: Keep front knee aligned over ankle and torso upright, breathe steadily

Health benefit: Strengthens posterior shoulder and back muscles to support upright posture
Steps to perform:
1. Lie face down with fingertips touching your temples and elbows pointing out.
2. Squeeze glutes and lift your chest slightly while drawing your shoulder blades down and together.
3. Keep your neck neutral and hold the lifted position with steady breathing.
4. Lower back down with control to the starting position.
Safety cue: Lift chest using upper back, squeeze shoulder blades, keep neck long and neutral

Health benefit: Improves scapular mobility and upper back endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Lie face down with arms extended overhead in a Y and thumbs pointing up.
2. Engage the upper back and lift your arms off the floor while keeping the neck neutral.
3. Lower your arms slowly with control and repeat.
Safety cue: Raise arms in Y using scapular depression and external rotation, avoid neck strain

Health benefit: Develops lower body strength while promoting upright torso and core engagement
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width and interlace fingers behind your head, elbows wide.
2. Brace your core, push hips back, and bend knees to lower into a squat while keeping chest upright.
3. Descend until thighs are parallel or comfortable, keeping weight in your heels.
4. Drive through your heels to stand and squeeze your glutes, keeping hands behind your head.
Safety cue: Keep chest upright and ribs down as you squat

Health benefit: Enhances core stability and coordinated limb movement
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with hips and knees bent at 90 degrees and arms extended toward the ceiling.
2. Flatten your lower back and engage your core to stabilize the spine.
3. Lower one leg toward the floor while simultaneously lowering both arms in an arc behind your head.
4. Return arms and leg to the starting position and repeat on the opposite side.
Safety cue: Keep low back pressed to floor while moving arms and legs

Health benefit: Improves scapular control and shoulder girdle endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a high plank with hands under shoulders and body in a straight line.
2. Keep arms straight and pinch your shoulder blades together to retract the scapulae without bending the elbows.
3. Push the floor away to protract the scapulae and create a hollow between your hands.
4. Repeat the retract-and-protract motion while maintaining a stable core.
Safety cue: Protract and retract shoulder blades slowly while keeping a neutral spine

Health benefit: Enhances dynamic balance and spinal stability through controlled limb movement
Steps to perform:
1. Start on hands and knees with a neutral spine and hips stacked over knees.
2. Extend your right arm forward and your left leg back to form a straight line from hand to foot.
3. While keeping the limb extensions, move the right hand in a small square pattern (forward, right, back, left) with controlled motion, keeping the core stable.
4. Return to center, lower limbs, and repeat the pattern with the opposite arm and leg.
Safety cue: Maintain a flat back and engage core before extending opposite arm and leg

Health benefit: Strengthens posterior chain while engaging lats and posterior shoulder muscles
Steps to perform:
1. Lie face down with legs together and arms extended overhead.
2. Lift your chest and legs slightly off the ground while engaging glutes and core.
3. Bend your elbows and pull them down toward your hips, squeezing your lats and shoulder blades.
Safety cue: Keep neck neutral and squeeze lats as you lift chest and pull

Health benefit: Improves full body coordination and aerobic fitness
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet together and arms at your sides.
2. Jump feet wider than shoulder-width while swinging arms out to the sides and up to shoulder level.
3. Jump feet back together while bringing arms back to your sides.
4. Repeat at a steady rhythm.
Safety cue: Keep chest lifted and shoulders down as arms open wide

Health benefit: Boosts cardiovascular endurance and leg power
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and arms raised overhead.
2. Drive your right knee up toward your hands while keeping your chest upright.
3. Quickly switch and drive your left knee up while moving the opposite arm.
4. Maintain a brisk rhythm and land lightly on each foot.
Safety cue: Maintain tall posture and breathe while driving knees up with control

Health benefit: Enhances core stability and shoulder control
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a high plank with hands under shoulders and body in a straight line.
2. Brace your core and lift your right hand straight forward without twisting your hips.
3. Return the right hand to the floor and immediately reach the left hand forward.
4. Continue alternating reaches while keeping hips and shoulders level.
Safety cue: Keep hips level and brace core, reach slowly to avoid rotation

Health benefit: Improves upper body coordination and quickness
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width apart in a slight athletic stance and keep elbows high.
2. Bend your knees slightly and hold your hands up near your face.
3. Quickly alternate small punches forward from the shoulders while keeping elbows up.
4. Maintain a fast, rhythmic tempo and keep your core engaged.
Safety cue: Keep elbows lifted and shoulders relaxed while driving punches from the core

Health benefit: Develops explosive lower body power and landing control
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width apart and toes slightly turned out.
2. Lower into a chest-up squat until your thighs are near parallel to the floor.
3. Explode upward into a controlled jump and extend through the hips.
4. Land softly on the balls of your feet and immediately absorb the impact by returning to the squat.
Safety cue: Land softly through hips and knees, absorb impact with bent ankles

Health benefit: Enhances bilateral coordination and rhythmic motor patterns
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet wider than hip-width and knees soft.
2. Lift the right knee toward your chest and reach the left hand across to touch the outside of that knee.
3. Return to start and lift the left knee while reaching the right hand across.
4. Continue alternating in smooth, rhythmic repetitions.
Safety cue: Keep a tall spine and engage core with controlled opposite arm and leg reach

Health benefit: Strengthens core endurance while improving hip mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a high plank with hands under shoulders and body in a straight line.
2. Brace your core and keep a neutral spine throughout.
3. Drive the right knee toward your chest while maintaining shoulder and hip stability.
4. Quickly switch legs in a controlled, alternating motion without letting the hips drop.
Safety cue: Brace core and keep hips level so spine stays neutral throughout

Health benefit: Elevates aerobic capacity and upper body muscular endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width apart and knees slightly bent in a boxing stance.
2. Rotate your hips and drive a short upward punch from the rear hand toward an imaginary chin.
3. Return the hand to guard and repeat the movement with the other hand in a steady rhythm.
Safety cue: Keep chin tucked, rotate from hips, exhale on each uppercut

Health benefit: Improves shoulder mobility and thoracic extension awareness
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent, feet flat, and arms at your sides with palms facing up.
2. Press your lower back to the floor and slide your arms overhead while keeping contact with the ground.
3. Slowly return your arms to your sides and repeat with controlled movement.
Safety cue: Press low back gently to floor and slide arms with scapular control

Health benefit: Enhances single leg balance and posterior chain strength
Steps to perform:
1. Stand on one leg with a slight bend in the knee and arms extended out like airplane wings.
2. Hinge at the hips and lower your torso while extending the free leg straight behind you until your body forms a T.
3. Keep your hips square and core engaged to control the movement.
4. Drive through the supporting heel to return to standing and repeat on the other leg.
Safety cue: Hinge from hips with a flat back, keep hips square and knee soft

Health benefit: Enhances lateral core stability and shoulder mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your side and prop your forearm under your shoulder with legs stacked.
2. Lift your hips so your body forms a straight line from head to feet.
3. Sweep your top arm in a controlled arc from your side overhead and back down.
4. Lower your hips and return the arm to the start position, then repeat.
Safety cue: Keep hips stacked and core braced as you sweep the arm

Health benefit: Improves chest flexibility and promotes open posture
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing a corner and place your forearms on each wall at shoulder height.
2. Step one foot forward and lean your chest toward the corner.
3. Keep your shoulders down and press your forearms into the walls.
4. Adjust your step to increase or decrease the stretch.
Safety cue: Square shoulders and draw shoulder blades down while leaning into the corner

Health benefit: Reinforces hip hinge mechanics and flat back alignment
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width and place hands on your hips.
2. Hinge at your hips by pushing them straight back while keeping a flat spine.
3. Move until your torso is roughly parallel to the floor or you feel a hip hinge.
4. Reverse the movement by driving your hips forward to stand tall.
Safety cue: Hinge from hips keeping a neutral flat back and soft knees

Health benefit: Builds shoulder stability and full body core coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Start on hands and knees and lift your knees just off the ground to hover.
2. Keep your hips low and core braced throughout the movement.
3. Step backward by moving one hand and the opposite foot together, then repeat.
4. Continue alternating steps to move backward steadily.
Safety cue: Maintain a flat back and controlled steps using steady breathing

Health benefit: Strengthens hip abductors and enhances lateral hip stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall next to a wall or chair for support.
2. Shift your weight onto one leg and keep the standing knee soft.
3. Lift the other leg straight out to the side without rotating your hips.
4. Lower the leg in a controlled manner and repeat for reps.
Safety cue: Keep torso upright and controlled avoid leaning away from working leg

Health benefit: Improves hip flexor flexibility and promotes pelvic mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Kneel with one knee on the ground and the other foot flat in front.
2. Tuck your pelvis and squeeze the glute of the kneeling leg.
3. Shift your hips forward until you feel a stretch in the front of the hip.
4. Keep your torso upright and maintain steady breathing.
Safety cue: Tuck pelvis and gently drive hips forward until you feel front hip stretch

Health benefit: Enhances scapular control and upper body pushing mechanics
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a high plank with hands under shoulders and body in a straight line.
2. Bend your elbows and lower your chest toward the floor.
3. Press up to straight arms.
4. At the top, push through your hands to protract your shoulder blades and round the upper back.
Safety cue: Keep spine neutral and push shoulder blades forward at top of movement

Health benefit: Targets inner thighs while developing lower body strength and hip mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with a wide stance and toes turned outward, hands on hips.
2. Hinge at the hips and lower into a squat while keeping your chest up.
3. Keep your knees tracking over your toes as you descend to thigh-parallel or a comfortable depth.
4. Drive through your heels and squeeze your glutes to return to standing.
