Safety cue: Spread knees in line with toes and sit hips back with chest up

Health benefit: Combines core stabilization with glute strengthening and posterior chain activation
Steps to perform:
1. Assume a forearm plank with body in a straight line from head to heels.
2. Brace your core and squeeze the glute of one leg.
3. Lift that leg toward the ceiling without rotating your hips.
4. Lower with control and repeat on the opposite side.
Safety cue: Maintain neutral spine and engage core before lifting one leg to hip height

Health benefit: Builds triceps strength and improves elbow extension control
Steps to perform:
1. Sit on the edge of a bench or chair with hands beside your hips and fingers pointing forward.
2. Slide your hips off the edge and extend your legs in front of you.
3. Bend your elbows and lower your body until your elbows are about 90 degrees, keeping them pointing back.
4. Press through your palms to straighten your arms and return to the start.
Safety cue: Keep shoulders down away from ears and bend elbows to ninety degrees controlled

Health benefit: Improves unilateral leg strength and balance
Steps to perform:
1. Stand in a split stance with one foot forward and one foot back about hip-width apart.
2. Lower your hips until the front thigh is parallel to the floor and the back knee hovers a few inches above the ground.
3. Hold this position and keep your torso upright and weight evenly distributed.
Safety cue: Keep front knee over ankle torso upright hips level

Health benefit: Enhances core stability and coordinated breathing
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with your head on the floor, arms extended toward the ceiling, and hips and knees bent at 90 degrees.
2. Press your lower back into the floor and brace your core.
3. Slowly extend your right arm overhead and your left leg toward the floor while keeping the opposite limbs stationary.
4. Return to the starting position and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Press lower back into floor maintain neutral spine and breathe slowly

Health benefit: Builds upper body strength and shoulder mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing a wall and place your hands on the wall at shoulder height and shoulder-width apart.
2. Step your feet back slightly and hinge from the shoulders to create a partial angled plank toward the wall.
3. Slowly walk your hands a short distance up the wall while keeping a straight line from head to heels.
4. Walk your hands back down to the starting position and reset.
Safety cue: Keep shoulders down and packed core tight move slowly

Health benefit: Improves glute activation and hip stability during movement
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent, feet flat hip-width apart, and arms at your sides.
2. Drive through your heels and lift your hips until your body forms a straight line from shoulders to knees.
3. Keeping hips lifted and stable, lift one knee toward your chest while maintaining alignment.
4. Lower that foot back down and repeat the movement with the opposite leg in a controlled march.
Safety cue: Keep hips level and core braced as each knee marches

Health benefit: Boosts cardiovascular fitness and improves hip flexor coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and engage your core.
2. Lift one knee toward hip height while driving the opposite arm forward in a controlled motion.
3. Alternate knees at a steady tempo and maintain an upright posture.
Safety cue: Maintain tall posture drive knees up land softly and control breath

Health benefit: Enhances core rotation and standing balance
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and hands at your temples.
2. Lift your right knee toward your chest while twisting your torso to bring your left elbow toward the knee.
3. Lower your right leg with control and return to standing.
4. Repeat on the opposite side, alternating sides with a steady tempo.
Safety cue: Stand tall brace core lead elbow toward opposite knee

Health benefit: Develops lateral power agility and single leg stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand on your left foot with a slight knee bend and arms relaxed.
2. Hop sideways to the right, landing on your right foot while swinging your left arm across for momentum.
3. Absorb the landing with a bent knee and immediately hop back or alternate sides in a controlled rhythm.
Safety cue: Land softly with knees bent chest up absorb impact through hips

Health benefit: Improves upper body endurance and hand eye coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Stand in a staggered stance with hands up and chin tucked.
2. Rotate your torso and extend your lead hand in a straight punch, keeping the other hand by your face.
3. Retract the punch quickly and alternate arms at a steady pace.
Safety cue: Rotate from hips retract punches keep chin tucked and breathe

Health benefit: Increases full body conditioning with reduced joint impact
Steps to perform:
1. Stand feet hip-width and hinge at the hips to place hands on the floor.
2. Step your right foot back then your left foot back into a high plank.
3. Step both feet forward toward your hands and stand up.
4. Reach overhead or add a small jump at the top and repeat the sequence.
Safety cue: Step back one foot at a time maintain a neutral spine and tight core

Health benefit: Strengthens oblique muscles and improves trunk rotational control
Steps to perform:
1. Stand feet hip-width with hands clasped in front of your chest.
2. Rotate your torso to the right while keeping your hips facing forward.
3. Rotate to the left and continue alternating in a controlled manner.
Safety cue: Keep hips square forward rotate through torso with a tall spine

Health benefit: Increases hamstring activation and elevates heart rate for light cardio
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and knees slightly soft.
2. Begin jogging in place with a quick rhythm.
3. Flick each heel up to touch the glute on each step.
4. Pump your arms naturally to maintain momentum.
Safety cue: Maintain upright torso and land softly under your hips

Health benefit: Enhances core stability while adding dynamic cardiovascular challenge
Steps to perform:
1. Place forearms on the floor under your shoulders and extend legs behind you.
2. Brace your core and keep a straight line from head to heels.
3. Jump both feet out wide and then back together in a controlled motion.
4. Maintain steady hips and repeat the jack movement.
Safety cue: Brace core and keep hips level throughout movement

Health benefit: Improves deep neck muscle engagement and posture alignment
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat on the floor.
2. Gently draw your chin straight back toward your throat to create a double chin.
3. Hold the tuck briefly, then relax your head back to the starting position.
Safety cue: Gently nod chin toward chest and keep shoulders relaxed

Health benefit: Promotes shoulder mobility and scapular control
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with your back and heels against the wall and feet hip-width apart.
2. Place elbows and forearms against the wall with hands near shoulder height in a "W".
3. Slide your arms upward into a "Y" while keeping forearms and back against the wall.
4. Lower back to the "W" position with controlled movement.
Safety cue: Press low back gently to wall and retract shoulder blades

Health benefit: Develops lumbar stability and coordination between limbs
Steps to perform:
1. Start on hands under shoulders and knees under hips with a neutral neck.
2. Extend your right arm forward and left leg back until they align with your spine.
3. Hold briefly, then return to the starting position and switch sides.
Safety cue: Extend opposite arm and leg while keeping neck aligned with spine

Health benefit: Relieves upper neck and shoulder tension through targeted stretching
Steps to perform:
1. Sit or stand tall and place one hand behind your back.
2. Turn your head about 45 degrees toward the same side and drop your chin toward your chest.
3. Use the free hand to gently press the back of your head to increase the stretch and hold.
Safety cue: Depress the shoulder on the stretching side and gently guide head forward

Health benefit: Improves proprioception and single leg stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width and shift your weight onto one leg.
2. Lift the other foot slightly off the floor and soften the standing knee.
3. Keep eyes open and fix a point ahead to maintain balance, then lower the foot to return.
Safety cue: Keep hips level and core braced while softening the standing knee

Health benefit: Strengthens posterior shoulder and upper back muscles for improved posture
Steps to perform:
1. Lie face down with your forehead resting on the floor and arms extended overhead with thumbs up.
2. Squeeze your shoulder blades and lift the arms off the floor into an "I", then lower.
3. Move the arms out to the sides into a "T", lift by squeezing the shoulder blades, then lower.
4. Move the arms into a "Y" angle and lift by engaging the upper back, then lower.
Safety cue: Maintain a neutral neck and initiate movement from the shoulder blades

Health benefit: Enhances spinal mobility and gentle core engagement
Steps to perform:
1. Start on hands and knees with hands under shoulders and knees under hips.
2. Tuck your chin slightly and round your spine a small amount toward the ceiling.
3. Lift your chest a small amount and allow a gentle arch in your lower back.
4. Move slowly between the rounded and arched positions using small controlled motions.
Safety cue: Coordinate slow breaths with gentle pelvic tilts and avoid forcing range

Health benefit: Builds hip abductor strength and pelvic stability
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your side with legs stacked and head supported by your arm.
2. Keep the top leg straight and lift it upward from the hip without rotating the pelvis.
3. Lower the leg with control back to the starting position.
Safety cue: Keep hips stacked and toes pointing forward while lifting with control

Health benefit: Improves hip mobility and functional range of motion
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and hands on hips.
2. Lift one knee a few inches and begin a controlled circular motion from the hip.
3. Make smooth circles clockwise for several reps.
4. Reverse the circle direction and repeat with the opposite leg.
Safety cue: Keep a tall spine and move from the hip joint

Health benefit: Builds upper body pressing strength with reduced joint load
Steps to perform:
1. Place hands shoulder-width on a stable chair and step feet back into a straight plank line.
2. Keep a straight line from head to heels and brace your core.
3. Bend elbows to lower your chest toward the chair until elbows reach about 90 degrees.
4. Press through the palms to straighten the arms and return to the top.
Safety cue: Maintain a straight line from head to heels

Health benefit: Engages core while improving shoulder stability and midline control
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a forearm plank with elbows under shoulders and body in a straight line.
2. Press into your forearms and lift hips toward the ceiling into a pike/dolphin position.
3. Hold briefly at the top while keeping shoulders over elbows and core engaged.
4. Lower hips back to forearm plank with control and repeat.
Safety cue: Hinge from shoulders and exhale as hips lift

Health benefit: Strengthens upper forearms and chest while promoting wrist stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing a wall and place both hands on the wall at chest height with fingers pointing down toward your feet.
2. Step back into an angled plank so your body forms a straight line from head to heels.
3. Bend elbows to lower your chest toward the wall while keeping palms flat and elbows close to your sides.
4. Push through the palms to straighten the arms and return to the starting position.
Safety cue: Keep elbows close to sides and control descent

Health benefit: Increases lower body strength and hip mobility while emphasizing glute activation
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet wider than shoulder-width and toes turned out slightly.
2. Keep chest lifted and push hips back as you bend knees to lower into a squat.
3. Drop down until thighs are at least parallel to the floor.
4. Drive through the heels to stand up and squeeze glutes at the top.
Safety cue: Push knees out over toes and sit back into hips

Health benefit: Improves lower abdominal and hip flexor endurance and leg control
Steps to perform:
1. Sit at the edge of a sturdy chair with one foot resting on a low object and the other foot flat on the floor.
2. Keep your torso upright and engage your core.
3. Straighten the leg on the object and lift the foot so the knee rises above the object.
4. Lower the leg with control and repeat for the desired repetitions.
Safety cue: Press lower back into seat and lift with slow controlled breathing

Health benefit: Strengthens the posterior chain and enhances shoulder and core stability
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and feet hip-width on the floor.
2. Press through your heels and lift your hips until your torso and thighs form a straight tabletop line.
3. Squeeze your glutes, hold the position, then lower with control.
Safety cue: Squeeze glutes and hold hips level without overarching the lower back
is_not_suitable_for: Hypertension, Coronary Artery Disease, Sleep Apnea

Health benefit: Builds shoulder strength and balance while improving proprioception
Steps to perform:
1. Face a wall and place your hands shoulder-width on the floor about a foot from the wall.
2. Walk your feet up the wall until your body forms an incline with hips over shoulders.
3. Keep your arms straight, shoulders packed, and core engaged while holding the position.
4. Walk your feet down to return to the start when finished.
Safety cue: Keep shoulders stacked over wrists and engage core to prevent sagging

Health benefit: Combines leg strength and ankle mobility to improve functional lower limb power
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width and toes slightly turned out.
2. Lower into a squat by bending your knees and pushing your hips back while keeping your chest up.
3. Drive through your heels to stand and immediately lift onto your toes into a calf raise.
4. Lower your heels back to the floor and repeat.
Safety cue: Drive knees to track toes and transfer weight smoothly to heels

Health benefit: Enhances rotational core strength and coordination across torso and hips
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width and clasp your hands together in front of you.
2. Rotate your torso and raise the clasped hands diagonally above one shoulder.
3. Swing the clasped hands down and across your body toward the opposite hip with controlled motion.
4. Reverse the movement back to the start or switch sides and repeat.
Safety cue: Rotate through your torso with braced core and control the descent

Health benefit: Improves coordination and aerobic fitness
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet together and arms at your sides.
2. Jump feet wide and cross your arms in front of your chest mid-air.
3. Land softly with feet together and uncross your arms, then repeat.
Safety cue: Land softly with knees slightly bent and chest upright

Health benefit: Enhances shoulder endurance and hand eye coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with one foot slightly forward and knees soft.
2. Raise hands to chin level with elbows bent and wrists loose.
3. Punch rapidly with alternating hands in small, controlled motions.
4. Keep a steady rhythm and return hands to guard between punches.
Safety cue: Keep a soft bend in knees and maintain a tall neutral spine

Health benefit: Improves lateral agility and footwork
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with knees slightly bent and hips low.
2. Take quick, small steps to the side leading with the foot in that direction.
3. Push off the trailing foot to change direction and keep a steady rhythm.
Safety cue: Drive from hips stay low with chest up and knees tracking toes

Health benefit: Increases trunk rotational mobility and core engagement
Steps to perform:
1. Sit on the edge of a chair with feet flat and knees bent.
2. Lean back slightly with a straight spine and clasp hands in front of your chest.
3. Rotate your torso to one side until you feel the twist in your obliques.
4. Return to center and rotate to the other side in a controlled motion.
Safety cue: Sit tall brace core and rotate from the ribs not the lower back

Health benefit: Boosts shoulder mobility and upper body muscular endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with arms extended straight in front of your chest at shoulder height.
2. Quickly open arms out to the sides and then cross them in front, alternating which arm crosses on top.
3. Maintain a fast, controlled tempo and keep shoulders relaxed.
Safety cue: Keep shoulders down and back control arm speed with steady breathing

Health benefit: Develops shoulder stability and core control
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet together and arms relaxed at your sides.
2. Step your right foot out to the side while lifting both arms straight out to shoulder height to form a T.
3. Step the right foot back to center while lowering your arms to your sides.
4. Repeat the same stepping and arm movement to the left, alternating sides in a controlled rhythm.
Safety cue: Hinge at the hips and keep a soft knee while controlling arm movement

Health benefit: Improves thoracic mobility and spinal rotation range
Steps to perform:
1. Sit upright on a chair with feet flat and hands lightly behind your head.
2. Rotate your chest and shoulders to the right while keeping your hips facing forward.
3. Return to center and rotate your chest and shoulders to the left.
Safety cue: Sit tall and brace your core rotate from the thoracic spine keeping hips stable

Health benefit: Increases quadriceps flexibility and hip mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and shift your weight onto your left leg.
2. Bend your right knee and reach back to grab your right ankle or foot with your right hand.
3. Pull your ankle toward your glutes, keep knees close together, and switch sides.
Safety cue: Keep knees together and pull heel to glute without arching lower back

Health benefit: Enhances core stability and balance control
Steps to perform:
1. Start on hands and knees with shoulders over wrists and hips over knees.
2. Extend your right arm forward and your left leg back until both are parallel to the floor.
3. Pull your elbow and knee back under your torso toward each other.
4. Immediately extend the arm and leg again, then perform the same sequence on the opposite side.
Safety cue: Extend opposite arm and leg slowly keeping spine neutral and core braced

Health benefit: Improves thoracic rotation and shoulder mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Begin on hands and knees with a neutral spine and hands under shoulders.
2. Place your right hand behind your head with your elbow wide and rotate your chest upward toward the ceiling.
3. Rotate your chest down toward the supporting arm, moving through the thoracic spine.
4. Return to neutral and repeat the rotations on the left side.
Safety cue: Keep hips square and rotate through thoracic spine leading with the shoulder

Health benefit: Improves gait stability and ankle control
Steps to perform:
1. Stand upright with feet hip-width apart and eyes forward.
2. Step forward placing the heel of one foot directly in front of the toes of the other foot.
3. Shift your weight onto the front foot and bring the back foot forward, landing heel to toe.
4. Continue taking slow, deliberate steps in a straight line.
Safety cue: Keep spine tall and eyes forward and place heel to toe deliberately

Health benefit: Enhances hip mobility and lower back flexibility
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with legs extended and arms at your sides.
2. Bend one knee and draw it toward your chest using both hands behind the thigh.
3. Pull the knee toward your chest and hold the position.
4. Release the leg back to the starting position with control.
Safety cue: Keep low back gently pressed to mat and exhale as you draw knee in

Health benefit: Builds lateral core strength and shoulder endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your side with legs straight and feet stacked, propping your body on your forearm with elbow under your shoulder.
2. Press into the forearm and lift your hips until your body forms a straight line from head to heels.
3. Keep your top hand on your hip or extended overhead and hold the position.
4. Lower your hips back to the floor with control.
Safety cue: Stack shoulders over elbow and keep hips lifted in a straight line

Health benefit: Strengthens posterior thigh muscles and improves knee joint control
Steps to perform:
1. Stand upright near a wall or chair for support with feet hip-width apart.
2. Bend one knee and curl your heel toward your glutes while keeping your thighs aligned.
3. Squeeze the back of your thigh at the top of the movement and pause briefly.
4. Lower the foot back down with control and repeat on the other leg.
Safety cue: Hinge slightly at hip and curl heel toward glutes with slow control

Health benefit: Promotes chest and triceps strength while reinforcing proper pressing mechanics
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a high plank with hands under shoulders and body in a straight line.
2. Lower your chest to the floor in a controlled motion until your chest touches the ground.
3. Lift both hands off the floor briefly while keeping your chest on the ground.
4. Place your hands back, press up to a plank, and repeat.
Safety cue: Keep core braced and inhale as you lift hands then exhale to press

Health benefit: Increases single-leg strength and hip stability under load
Steps to perform:
1. Stand about two feet in front of a bench or sturdy surface with feet hip-width apart.
2. Place the top of one foot on the bench and lean your torso forward slightly from the hips.
3. Bend your front knee and lower your back knee toward the floor until the front thigh is near parallel.
4. Drive through the front heel to return to standing and switch legs.
Safety cue: Keep chest upright and hips square hinge from hips not lower back

Health benefit: Enhances core coordination and promotes neutral spine control against resistance
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back facing the wall with hips close and shins vertical, knees bent at 90° and heels on the wall.
2. Press your lower back into the floor and reach both arms up to press your palms into the wall.
3. Slowly lower one arm overhead and extend the opposite leg toward the floor while maintaining core contact.
4. Return the arm and leg to the start and repeat on the other side, alternating sides.
Safety cue: Keep lower back pressed to floor and move limbs slowly with controlled breathing

Health benefit: Improves unilateral lower-body strength and dynamic balance during movement transitions
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and hands on hips or at your sides.
2. Step one foot straight back and lower both knees until the front thigh is near parallel to the floor.
3. Push through the front heel to return to standing and immediately step back with the other foot, alternating sides.
Safety cue: Step back landing on heel keep torso upright and knee tracking over toes

Health benefit: Targets triceps endurance and elbow extension control using bodyweight leverage
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing a stable counter and place your hands shoulder-width on the edge at about chest height.
2. Walk your feet back to create an inclined plank position with your body in a straight line.
3. Bend your elbows and lower your forehead toward the counter while keeping elbows close to your sides.
4. Press through your hands to straighten your arms and return to the starting position.
Safety cue: Keep elbows tight to head and control descent avoid collapsing shoulders

Health benefit: Challenges oblique strength and improves controlled lateral trunk mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on one side and prop yourself on your forearm with elbow under shoulder and feet stacked.
2. Lift your hips to form a straight line from head to heels, keeping your top hand on your hip or extended.
3. Lower your hips toward the floor, then lift them back to the plank position and repeat for reps.
Safety cue: Keep hips level core braced and descend slowly without rotating torso

Health benefit: Builds upper back and posterior chain strength
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing a sturdy door jamb and grasp both sides at shoulder height with an overhand grip.
2. Walk your feet forward and lean back until your body forms a straight line from heels to head.
3. Pull your chest toward the jamb by squeezing your shoulder blades together.
4. Lower your body back to the starting line with control.
Safety cue: Maintain a long neutral line from head to heels and pull chest to the jamb

Health benefit: Enhances glute activation and hip extension mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with soles together and knees splayed, arms relaxed at your sides.
2. Press your feet together and drive your hips up until your body forms a straight line from shoulders to knees.
3. Lower your hips back down with control and repeat.
Safety cue: Drive through heels and squeeze glutes while keeping ribs gently packed

Health benefit: Develops rotational core stability and coordinated hip mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a high plank with hands under shoulders and body in a straight line.
2. Drive one knee up toward your chest, then quickly switch legs, alternating the drive.
3. Maintain a low, stable hip position and move with steady, controlled speed.
Safety cue: Maintain a long neutral spine and move opposite limbs with slow control

Health benefit: Improves hip flexor strength and dynamic balance
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and engage your core.
2. Drive one knee upward toward your chest while reaching your opposite arm forward.
3. Lower the leg and switch sides in a controlled, rhythmic manner.
Safety cue: Keep hips level and chest tall as you drive knees up with control

Health benefit: Increases core endurance and elevates heart rate for metabolic challenge
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a high plank with feet together and hands under shoulders.
2. Jump your feet out wide and then back together while keeping hips level.
3. Continue the jumping pattern while maintaining a braced core.
Safety cue: Brace your core and keep hips level while jumping feet in and out
is_not_suitable_for: Hypertension, Obesity / Overweight, Osteoporosis, Coronary Artery Disease

Health benefit: Enhances coordination agility and upper body endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Stand in a shoulder-width stance with hands up by your face.
2. Throw a jab or cross while stepping slightly forward and rotating your hips.
3. Drop your weight by bending your knees and pivot under an imaginary punch.
4. Drive back up and weave to the other side, then repeat the sequence.
Safety cue: Keep chin tucked and shoulders relaxed drive movement from the hips

Health benefit: Improves lateral power and dynamic balance with reduced joint impact
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width and knees soft.
2. Step laterally to the right and swing the left leg behind to lightly touch the floor.
3. Push through the right foot to return to center and then step laterally left.
4. Continue alternating without jumping and keep a steady tempo.
Safety cue: Land softly with knees slightly bent and control lateral movement

Health benefit: Strengthens quadriceps glutes and single leg functional stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing a stable step or bench with feet hip-width.
2. Place the right foot fully on the step and press through the heel to lift your body up.
3. Step the left foot onto the step, then step the right foot down followed by the left.
4. Alternate the leading leg each rep and maintain an upright torso.
Safety cue: Drive through the heel of the working foot keep torso tall

Health benefit: Develops full body coordination core stability and controlled mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a low quadruped with hands under shoulders and knees lifted slightly off the ground.
2. Reach the right hand forward and extend the left leg back while keeping hips low.
3. Pull the left hand and right knee forward to move the body slowly and smoothly.
4. Continue crawling with controlled, deliberate steps while maintaining a neutral spine.
Safety cue: Brace core and maintain a neutral spine move limbs slowly and deliberately

Health benefit: Boosts shoulder mobility upper body reach capacity and postural control
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width and arms relaxed at your sides.
2. Step the right foot forward and reach the left arm up and forward as if grabbing an overhead hold.
3. Return the arm and foot to start, then step the left foot forward and reach the right arm up, repeating the pattern.
Safety cue: Reach with shoulder blades engaged avoid shrugging and breathe steadily

Health benefit: Improves core endurance while minimizing spinal loading
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with one knee bent and the other leg straight.
2. Place your hands under your low back to preserve a neutral spine.
3. Lift your head and shoulders a few inches while keeping the spine still.
4. Hold briefly and lower with control.
Safety cue: Maintain neutral spine while bracing core and lifting only chest off mat

Health benefit: Enhances glute activation and pelvic control
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with both knees bent and feet flat hip-width apart.
2. Brace your core and squeeze one glute to lift your hips until the pelvis is neutral.
3. Extend the non-working leg straight while keeping the hips level.
4. Lower the hips slowly and repeat, then switch sides.
Safety cue: Drive through heels while keeping pelvis level and core braced

Health benefit: Increases thoracic mobility and shoulder range of motion
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your side with knees bent and both forearms stacked in front of you.
2. Rotate the top arm open across your chest and behind you while following the movement with your eyes.
3. Return the arm to the start position with control and repeat, then switch sides.
Safety cue: Keep hips stacked and rotate through thoracic spine not lumbar

Health benefit: Promotes thoracic extension and anterior shoulder mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Start on hands and knees with hips over knees and arms extended forward.
2. Walk your hands forward and lower your chest toward the floor while keeping hips high.
3. Rest your forehead or chin on the mat and breathe deeply during the hold.
Safety cue: Soften shoulders and pull chest toward floor while keeping hips over knees

Health benefit: Develops single-leg posterior chain strength and balance
Steps to perform:
1. Stand near a wall and lightly touch the wall with a fingertip for balance.
2. Shift weight onto one leg and hinge at the hips while extending the free leg straight back.
3. Keep a soft bend in the standing knee and a flat spine as you reach toward the ground.
4. Return to standing by driving through the heel of the support leg and squeezing the glute.
Safety cue: Hinge from hips with a flat spine and control the descent

Health benefit: Builds anti-rotation core stability and bracing control
Steps to perform:
1. Anchor a resistance band in a doorframe at chest height and stand perpendicular to the anchor with feet hip-width.
2. Hold the band with both hands at your chest and brace your core to resist rotation.
3. Press the band straight out in front of your chest until your arms are extended and hold the position.
4. Slowly return the hands to your chest while maintaining core tension.
Safety cue: Brace core and resist rotation, keep ribs tucked

Health benefit: Improves scapular mobility and overhead shoulder mechanics
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat and position your arms on the floor in a W shape.
2. Press the backs of your hands, elbows, and shoulders into the floor to maintain contact.
3. Slide your arms overhead into a Y while keeping contact with the floor and lifting only as much as comfortable.
4. Reverse the motion to return your arms to the W position.
Safety cue: Keep lower back flat, slide arms slowly while gently pinching shoulder blades

Health benefit: Enhances posterior chain flexibility and ankle and hip mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width and hinge at the hips to reach toward your toes with a flat back.
2. Bend your knees and drop your hips into a deep squat while holding your toes or shins.
3. Keep your chest lifted and press your elbows against your inner knees to open the hips.
4. Straighten your legs to return to standing while maintaining the stretch.
Safety cue: Hinge at hips, keep chest up, maintain neutral spine as you descend

Health benefit: Facilitates hip mobility and safe spinal flexion patterns
Steps to perform:
1. Start on hands and knees with wrists under shoulders and knees under hips and a neutral spine.
2. Rock your hips back toward your heels while keeping your hands planted and your spine neutral.
3. Rock your hips forward to return to the starting position and repeat.
Safety cue: Keep neutral spine, move from hips not shoulders, control the motion

Health benefit: Strengthens triceps and improves scapular control with low impact loading
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing a wall and place your hands close together at chest height with feet hip-width.
2. Brace your core and lean toward the wall on a slow four-count, bending your elbows close to your sides.
3. Press back to the starting position on a slow four-count while keeping your body straight.
4. Maintain a controlled tempo and repeat for the desired reps.
Safety cue: Keep elbows close, align wrists under shoulders, inhale down exhale up

Health benefit: Improves single-leg strength and balance
Steps to perform:
1. Sit on a chair with one foot flat and the other leg extended forward.
2. Lean slightly forward and press through the heel of the supporting foot.
3. Push up to stand on the supporting leg while keeping the extended leg off the floor.
4. Lower back to the chair with control and repeat before switching legs.
Safety cue: Keep chest tall and hips back as you sit and stand with controlled tempo

Health benefit: Builds core endurance and trunk stability
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back and lift your head, shoulders, and legs a few inches off the ground.
2. Engage your core and press your lower back into the floor while reaching arms by your hips or overhead.
3. Hold the hollow position with steady breathing and maintain a flattened lower back.
Safety cue: Pull lower ribs toward hips and breathe steadily to maintain a tight core

Health benefit: Enhances posterior chain activation and shoulder mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Lie face down with your hands by your hips and legs extended straight.
2. Squeeze your glutes and lift your chest and legs simultaneously to form a diagonal A-shape.
3. Keep your neck neutral and hold the raised position briefly.
4. Lower with control back to the ground and repeat.
Safety cue: Lift chest and legs using glutes and low back keep neck neutral

Health benefit: Develops unilateral leg strength and functional lower body control
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing a sturdy bench and place one foot fully on the bench.
2. Press through the bench foot to step up and bring your body upright.
3. Step the opposite foot back and lower into a reverse lunge until both knees are about 90 degrees.
4. Push through the front foot to return to standing on the bench and alternate legs.
Safety cue: Drive through the stepping heel control the transition keep knee aligned over toes

Health benefit: Targets oblique endurance and lateral core stability
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a forearm side plank with your elbow under your shoulder and feet stacked.
2. Lower your hips toward the floor in a controlled motion.
3. Lift your hips back up to the starting plank and repeat, then switch sides.
Safety cue: Stack shoulders over elbow lift hips and dip with slow controlled movement

Health benefit: Challenges core stability while improving shoulder and hip coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Get on hands and toes with shoulders over wrists and knees hovering 1–2 inches off the ground.
2. Brace your core and keep your back flat.
3. Hold the position and breathe steadily.
4. Keep your gaze down and maintain even tension through your limbs.
Safety cue: Brace your core and keep hips level with knees hovered under hips

Health benefit: Builds quadriceps endurance and calf strength in an isometric context
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with your back against a wall and slide down until your thighs are parallel to the floor.
2. Press through the balls of both feet and rise onto your toes.
3. Lower your heels back down while keeping your back flat against the wall.
Safety cue: Press low back into wall keep knees over ankles and raise heels with control

Health benefit: Increases aerobic activity with reduced joint impact
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet together and arms by your sides.
2. Step your right foot out to the side while lifting both arms to shoulder height.
3. Step your right foot back in and lower your arms to your sides.
4. Repeat on the left side and continue alternating at a controlled pace.
Safety cue: Keep arms below shoulder height land softly through midfoot with slight knee bend

Health benefit: Enhances hip drive and dynamic lower body coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and hands ready at chest level.
2. Drive your right knee upward toward your hands.
3. Lightly tap the top of the knee with both hands, lower, then switch sides.
Safety cue: Drive knee under control exhale on each drive and keep hips square

Health benefit: Improves upper body power and cardiovascular conditioning through rotational movement
Steps to perform:
1. Assume a boxing stance with hands up and knees slightly bent.
2. Rotate your hips and lead shoulder to throw a lead hand hook to the body.
3. Recover the lead hand, then rotate your hips the opposite way to throw a rear hand body hook.
4. Keep a tight guard and repeat the alternating body hooks with controlled hip rotations.
Safety cue: Rotate hips and shoulders together keep chin tucked and hands defending

Health benefit: Improves lateral speed and hip stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, knees bent and hands up by the chest.
2. Step quickly to the side with one foot, pushing off the opposite foot.
3. Bring the trailing foot to meet the lead foot, keeping your hips low and ready.
4. Repeat the shuffle back and forth, staying light on your feet.
Safety cue: Keep hips low and chest up land softly on midfoot

Health benefit: Elevates heart rate and strengthens core under reduced load
Steps to perform:
1. Place your hands shoulder-width on a stable chair and step your feet back into a high plank.
2. Keep hips level and core engaged.
3. Drive one knee toward your chest, then quickly switch legs, returning each foot to plank position.
4. Continue alternating knees at a controlled pace.
Safety cue: Keep hips level and core braced control each knee drive

Health benefit: Targets inner thighs and glutes while improving lower body endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet wider than hip-width and toes turned out, hands together at chest.
2. Lower into a deep squat until your thighs are parallel to the floor, keeping your chest up.
3. Pulse up and down in small movements within the squat, keeping weight in your heels.
Safety cue: Push knees out over toes keep chest upright and core engaged

Health benefit: Builds shoulder and core stability through controlled plank progression
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall, hinge at your hips, and reach both hands toward the floor.
2. Place your hands on the ground and walk them forward until you reach a high plank position.
3. Hold the plank briefly, keeping a straight line from head to heels.
Safety cue: Hinge from hips walk hands out maintaining straight spine and braced core

Health benefit: Develops coordination and rotational power in the torso
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width apart, knees soft, and hands at waist level.
2. Rotate your torso and drive one elbow across your body at waist height.
3. Retract the elbow and repeat on the other side with a controlled motion.
4. Keep a firm core and alternate strikes at a steady pace.
Safety cue: Rotate through hips strike with elbows while keeping shoulders relaxed and down

Health benefit: Improves shoulder blade mobility and upper back posture
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing a wall at arm's length and place palms on the wall at shoulder height.
2. Keep elbows straight and draw your shoulder blades down and together.
3. Hold the retracted position briefly while keeping your neck relaxed.
4. Release the scapulae back to the starting position and repeat.
Safety cue: Pull shoulder blades down and together keeping neck long

Health benefit: Enhances single-leg balance and posterior chain activation
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with hands on your hips and weight on one leg.
2. Hinge at the hips and slide your torso forward while lifting the free leg straight back.
3. Keep a neutral spine and a slight bend in the standing knee as you lower.
4. Drive the hips forward to return to standing and repeat on the other leg.
Safety cue: Hinge from hips keep back flat and hips level

Health benefit: Promotes spinal stability and coordinated contralateral limb control
Steps to perform:
1. Start on hands and knees with a neutral spine.
2. Keep your right arm resting by your right side and brace your core.
3. Extend your left leg straight back until it aligns with your torso, keeping hips level.
4. Return the leg to the floor, then switch sides and repeat.
Safety cue: Brace core and keep spine neutral as you lift opposite leg

Health benefit: Increases thoracic mobility and promotes gentle spinal articulation
Steps to perform:
1. Start on hands and knees with hands under shoulders and knees under hips.
2. Inhale and lift your chest forward and up to lightly extend the thoracic spine.
3. Exhale and round your upper back, tucking the chin to emphasize thoracic flexion.
4. Move smoothly between the two positions while keeping the movement focused in the upper back.
Safety cue: Initiate movement from mid back articulating each vertebrae

Health benefit: Teaches proper hip movement and hamstring loading for safe bending
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width apart and hands reaching toward the floor.
2. Hinge at the hips by pushing them back while maintaining a long, neutral spine.
3. Keep soft knees and lower your hands toward the ground until you feel a hamstring stretch.
4. Drive the hips forward and squeeze the glutes to return to standing.
Safety cue: Push hips back keep spine long and weight through heels

Health benefit: Builds core stability and improves abdominal muscle control
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a forearm plank with elbows under shoulders and body in a straight line.
2. Engage your core and glutes to keep hips stable.
3. Draw your right knee toward the floor and tap it lightly, then return to plank.
4. Repeat the movement with the left knee, alternating taps.
Safety cue: Maintain a neutral spine and brace your core before each knee tap

Health benefit: Improves chest and anterior shoulder flexibility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing a doorway and place one forearm low on the doorframe at about waist height.
2. Step the foot opposite the stretched arm forward until you feel a chest and front-shoulder stretch.
3. Keep your chest lifted and shoulders down while maintaining the stretch.
4. Release, switch arms, and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Keep hips square and gently retract shoulder blades as you lean forward

Health benefit: Strengthens gluteal muscles and enhances lateral hip stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width and step your right leg diagonally behind your left into a curtsy.
2. Bend both knees and lower until the front thigh is near parallel to the floor.
3. Pulse by making small up-and-down movements with both knees while keeping your torso upright.
4. Return to standing and switch sides to repeat the pulses on the other leg.
Safety cue: Drive hips back keep chest lifted and control small pulses from glutes

Health benefit: Improves balance while enhancing neck mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand in a tandem stance with one foot directly in front of the other heel to toe.
2. Slightly bend your knees and engage your core to stabilize your balance.
3. Slowly turn your head to the left, then to the right, keeping your eyes level.
4. Return your head to center and repeat the head turns while maintaining the stance.
Safety cue: Stand tall with weight evenly distributed and move head slowly with control

Health benefit: Emphasizes upper chest and shoulder strength development
Steps to perform:
1. Place your feet on a stable elevated surface and position hands shoulder-width on the floor.
2. Brace your core and keep your body in a straight line from heels to head.
3. Bend your elbows to lower your chest toward the floor while keeping hips level.
4. Push through your palms to straighten the arms and return to the start position.
Safety cue: Keep a straight line from heels to head and inhale on descent

Health benefit: Builds single leg strength and functional balance with assistance
Steps to perform:
1. Stand on one foot with the other leg extended forward and place a chair behind you within reach.
2. Sit back slowly onto the chair by pushing your hips back and keeping the supporting knee aligned over the foot.
3. Tap the chair lightly with your glutes and pause briefly while maintaining balance and a straight torso.
4. Drive through the heel of the supporting foot to stand back up and extend the free leg forward.
Safety cue: Sit back onto the chair gently keeping chest up and knee tracking over toes

Health benefit: Enhances core endurance and hip flexor control
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back and lift your shoulders and legs a few inches off the ground into a hollow position.
2. Keep your lower back pressed into the floor and hands by your sides or under your hips for support.
3. Alternate small, rapid up-and-down kicks with both legs while maintaining the hollow shape.
4. Keep movements controlled and avoid letting your lower back arch.
Safety cue: Brace your core and press lower back into the floor before starting kicks

Health benefit: Develops anterior shoulder strength and improves scapular control
Steps to perform:
1. Place your hands on the floor at hip level with fingers pointing toward your feet and arms straight.
2. Lean your shoulders forward over your hands while keeping your body in a straight plank line.
3. Hold the forward lean using shoulder and core tension and then return to a neutral plank.
Safety cue: Lean from the shoulders with wrists aligned and scapulae protracted

Health benefit: Builds lower body strength and improves gait related stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand upright with feet hip-width apart and wear a weighted vest if using extra load.
2. Step forward with one foot and lower your back knee toward the ground until both knees form 90-degree angles.
3. Push through the front heel to stand and bring the back foot forward into the next lunge step.
4. Continue alternating legs while maintaining an upright torso and steady stride.
Safety cue: Keep torso upright and front knee tracking over the ankle each step

Health benefit: Strengthens abdominal flexion and improves hip and core coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Lie flat with arms overhead and legs extended.
2. Simultaneously lift your torso and legs, reaching your hands to your knees and touching them at the top.
3. Lower back down with control to the starting position.
Safety cue: Exhale as you lift keeping lower back rounded and ribs pulled down

Health benefit: Builds lower body strength and functional mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Kneel on both knees with your torso upright.
2. Place one foot forward flat on the floor with the front knee bent about 90 degrees.
3. Drive through the front heel to stand up to full height.
4. Reverse the motion and return to the kneeling start with control.
Safety cue: Keep chest tall and hips forward as you stand

Health benefit: Strengthens triceps and enhances elbow extension control
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing a low wall and place hands shoulder-width on it at hip level.
2. Step your feet back so your body forms a straight line with elbows slightly bent.
3. Bend your elbows to lower your forehead toward the wall while keeping elbows close to your sides.
4. Press through your palms to straighten your elbows and return to the start.
Safety cue: Keep elbows close to ears and hinge from shoulders

Health benefit: Improves upper body pushing strength and core stability
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a push-up position with hands under shoulders and body straight.
2. Lower your chest to the floor by bending your elbows and then press up to full arm extension.
3. Rotate your torso and reach one arm toward the ceiling while stacking your feet to hold a side plank.
4. Return your hand to the floor, rotate back to center, and repeat toward the other side on the next rep.
Safety cue: Brace core and move slowly to avoid hip sag

Health benefit: Increases single leg power and dynamic balance
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a lunge with one foot forward and the other foot back, both knees bent.
2. Explosively jump and switch leg positions in midair.
3. Land softly with the opposite foot forward in a lunge and absorb the impact through hips and knees.
4. Maintain an upright torso and repeat the jump-switch rhythm.
Safety cue: Land softly with knees tracking toes and absorb with hips

Health benefit: Enhances lateral core engagement and coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat on the floor hip-width apart.
2. Engage your core and lower both knees to one side until your heels tap the floor.
3. Use your obliques to bring your knees back to center and then lower them to the other side to tap the floor.
Safety cue: Keep spine neutral and rotate from the waist

Health benefit: Develops rotational mobility and shoulder stability
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a high plank with hands under shoulders and feet hip-width apart.
2. Lift your right foot and kick it through to the outside of your right hand while rotating your hips.
3. Return the right foot to plank and repeat the same motion with the left leg.
4. Alternate sides in a controlled, steady rhythm.
Safety cue: Maintain a neutral spine and initiate rotation from your core

Health benefit: Boosts core endurance and rotational coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Begin in a high plank with hands under shoulders.
2. Drive your right knee toward your left elbow, rotating your hips and torso.
3. Return the right leg to plank and quickly drive the left knee toward the right elbow.
4. Alternate legs at a steady, controlled pace.
Safety cue: Keep shoulders stacked over wrists and brace your core

Health benefit: Builds explosive lower body power and vertical jump ability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width apart and hands on your hips.
2. Bend your knees and lower into a squat until your thighs are parallel to the floor.
3. Explode upward into a vertical jump and land softly back into the squat.
Safety cue: Land softly with knees tracking toes and chest lifted
is_not_suitable_for: Obesity / Overweight, Osteoporosis, Osteoarthritis, Hypothyroidism, Sarcopenia

Health benefit: Enhances hip power and anaerobic capacity
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet wider than hip-width and hands together at your chest.
2. Drop into a deep squat with your hips low and chest upright.
3. Explode forward or upward into a jump and land softly back into the deep squat.
Safety cue: Drive through hips and absorb landing by bending knees
is_not_suitable_for: Obesity / Overweight, Osteoporosis, Osteoarthritis, Hypothyroidism, Sarcopenia

Health benefit: Strengthens abdominal muscles and improves hip flexor control
Steps to perform:
1. Sit on the floor with hands slightly behind your hips and knees bent.
2. Lean back slightly, extend your legs straight out, and then pull your knees back toward your chest.
3. Repeat the extension and tuck motion in a controlled, rhythmic manner.
Safety cue: Keep lower back pressed to the floor and exhale on contraction

Health benefit: Develops upper back and pulling strength while improving posture
Steps to perform:
1. Lie under a sturdy table and grip the edge with hands wider than shoulder-width.
2. Extend your legs and keep your body straight from head to heels.
3. Pull your chest up toward the table edge by squeezing your shoulder blades.
4. Lower with control to full arm extension.
Safety cue: Keep body in a straight line from head to heels and engage core

Health benefit: Builds unilateral leg strength and hip stability enhancing balance
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and step one foot back into a reverse lunge.
2. Bend both knees until your front thigh is nearly parallel to the floor.
3. Pulse up and down a few inches while keeping your torso upright.
4. Push through the front heel to return to standing and switch sides.
Safety cue: Keep front knee aligned over toes and torso upright

Health benefit: Strengthens obliques and hip abductors while enhancing lateral core stability
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on one side and prop yourself on the forearm with elbow under the shoulder.
2. Stack your feet and lift your hips to form a straight line from head to heels.
3. Lift your top leg upward while keeping your hips steady.
4. Lower the leg with control and repeat, then switch sides.
Safety cue: Stack shoulders and hips and lift top leg without dropping hips

Health benefit: Improves hamstring mobility and activates core stabilizers
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and hinge at the hips to place hands on the floor with slightly bent knees.
2. Walk your hands forward until you reach a strong high plank with shoulders over wrists.
3. Hold the plank for the prescribed time while keeping a straight line from head to heels.
Safety cue: Brace core and maintain a neutral spine as you reach plank

Health benefit: Enhances scapular retraction and upper back muscular endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Lie face down with forehead on the mat and arms bent so hands point toward your ears forming a "W."
2. Keep your neck neutral and squeeze your shoulder blades to lift your hands and forearms a few inches.
3. Pause while maintaining the squeeze and hold the lifted position.
4. Lower with control to the starting position and repeat.
Safety cue: Squeeze shoulder blades together and keep neck long

Health benefit: Builds single-leg glute strength and improves hip extension control
Steps to perform:
1. Sit with your upper back against a bench and one foot flat on the floor.
2. Extend the other leg straight out and brace your core.
3. Drive your planted heel into the floor and lift your hips until your body forms a straight line.
4. Lower your hips slowly until they hover above the floor and repeat.
Safety cue: Squeeze glutes to drive hips level while keeping pelvis neutral and spine long

Health benefit: Combines unilateral leg strength with thoracic rotation and core coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with one foot forward and one foot back in a split stance.
2. Lower into a lunge until both knees are about 90 degrees.
3. Rotate your torso toward your front leg while keeping your hips square.
4. Press through the front heel to rise and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Keep front knee tracking over toes and rotate from thoracic spine

Health benefit: Strengthens calf muscles and enhances ankle stability for balance
Steps to perform:
1. Stand on one foot on the edge of a step or flat surface with the other foot slightly off the ground.
2. Lower your heel down below the step level if possible and hold tension.
3. Raise your heel as high as you can and squeeze your calf, then lower back down with control.
Safety cue: Rise slowly through ball of foot with controlled descent and neutral hip alignment

Health benefit: Targets obliques and improves dynamic core endurance and control
Steps to perform:
1. Set up in a forearm plank with elbows under shoulders and body in a straight line.
2. Rotate your hips to one side and lower them to lightly tap the floor.
3. Return to center and rotate to the other side, repeating the dips with controlled movement.
Safety cue: Brace core, hinge only at hips and keep shoulders stacked over wrists

Health benefit: Develops shoulder pressing strength and challenges upper body stability
Steps to perform:
1. Place your feet on a stable chair and hands on the floor shoulder-width apart.
2. Pike your hips up so your body forms an inverted V and your head points toward the floor.
3. Bend your elbows to lower your head toward the floor while keeping your core tight.
4. Press through your hands to straighten your arms and return to the pike position.
Safety cue: Lead with crown of head maintaining a long spine and controlled descent

Health benefit: Enhances single leg strength and balance
Steps to perform:
1. Stand beside a sturdy frame and grip it with the hand nearest the frame, feet hip-width apart.
2. Shift weight onto the working leg and extend the free leg forward with the toes lightly touching the floor.
3. Bend the working knee and sit back into the heel while using the frame to assist balance.
4. Drive through the heel to return to standing and repeat.
Safety cue: Keep chest upright and knee tracking over toes

Health benefit: Builds core and hip flexor strength and improves trunk control
Steps to perform:
1. Sit on the floor with hands beside hips and fingers pointing forward.
2. Press firmly through the hands and lift your hips off the floor while drawing knees toward the chest.
3. Keep the torso upright and hold the tucked position using shoulder engagement.
4. Lower your hips back down under control and repeat.
Safety cue: Keep shoulders packed and core fully braced

Health benefit: Strengthens biceps and forearm grip
Steps to perform:
1. Lie under a sturdy table and reach up to grasp the table edge with an underhand (supinated) grip shoulder-width apart.
2. Extend your legs and brace your core so your body forms a straight plank from head to heels.
3. Pull your chest toward the table by bending the elbows and squeezing the biceps.
4. Slowly straighten the arms to return to the start and repeat.
Safety cue: Keep elbows close to sides and retract shoulder blades

Health benefit: Develops hamstring and glute strength for posterior chain resilience
Steps to perform:
1. Kneel with your ankles secured under a stable surface or held by a partner and keep hips extended.
2. Tighten the glutes and hamstrings and maintain a straight line from knee to shoulder.
3. Lean forward from the knees, controlling the descent with your hamstrings as far as you can.
4. Use your hands to catch yourself lightly and push back up to the starting kneeling position.
Safety cue: Hinge from hips and keep a straight line from head to knees

Health benefit: Enhances upper body strength and muscular control through slow lowering
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a high plank with hands under shoulders and body in a straight line.
2. Lower your chest toward the floor slowly over 3–5 seconds while keeping elbows close to the body.
3. Lightly touch the floor, then push back up briskly or drop to your knees to reset and repeat.
Safety cue: Inhale and lower slowly keeping forearms vertical and core braced

Health benefit: Targets lower abdominal strength and improves core stability
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat on the floor.
2. Place your hands by your sides or under your hips for support.
3. Exhale and curl your pelvis up, lifting your hips toward your ribcage.
4. Inhale and slowly lower your hips back down with control.
Safety cue: Tuck pelvis and lift slowly using your abs keep neck relaxed

Health benefit: Strengthens rear deltoids and upper back to support better posture
Steps to perform:
1. Anchor a resistance band in the doorframe at about eye level and hold the ends with both hands.
2. Step back into a staggered stance with arms extended and palms facing each other.
3. Pull the band toward your face, keeping elbows high and squeezing your shoulder blades.
4. Slowly extend your arms back to the start with control.
Safety cue: Squeeze shoulder blades together and lead with elbows keep chest proud

Health benefit: Improves full body conditioning and metabolic endurance with low impact
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width apart and bend at the hips to place hands on the floor.
2. Step your feet back one at a time into a high plank position.
3. Step your feet forward one at a time to return them near your hands.
4. Stand up by driving through your heels to return to the starting position.
Safety cue: Maintain a neutral spine and brace core as you step each foot back

Health benefit: Enhances core stability and lateral coordination through dynamic plank movement
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a high plank with hands under shoulders and body in a straight line.
2. Keep your core tight and slightly hop both feet together to the right.
3. Hop your feet back through center and then together to the left.
4. Continue alternating controlled hops while maintaining a stable plank position.
Safety cue: Keep hips level and core braced while controlling each small hop
is_not_suitable_for: Hypertension, Coronary Artery Disease, Obesity / Overweight, Osteoporosis

Health benefit: Develops shoulder stability and core strength while improving lateral mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Start on hands and toes with knees bent and hovering a few inches off the floor.
2. Keep your hips low and core engaged with hands under your shoulders.
3. Step your right hand and right foot one step to the right.
4. Follow with your left hand and left foot and continue stepping sideways in a controlled pattern.
Safety cue: Maintain low hips and neutral spine move slowly with opposite hand foot coordination

Health benefit: Strengthens abdominal muscles and improves core endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Sit on the edge of a chair with feet off the floor and hands behind your head.
2. Lean back slightly and bring your right knee toward your chest while twisting your left elbow toward it.
3. Extend the right leg as you lift the left knee and twist your right elbow toward it.
4. Alternate sides rapidly while keeping your core engaged.
Safety cue: Keep a neutral spine and rotate through your torso with controlled speed

Health benefit: Improves hip mobility and lower body coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet wider than hip-width and toes slightly turned out.
2. Sit into a shallow squat with chest lifted.
3. Swing your right leg across your body and shift weight onto your right foot.
4. Reverse the motion to the left and continue alternating swings.
Safety cue: Hinge at the hips keep chest tall and knees tracking toes

Health benefit: Enhances agility and rapid footwork
Steps to perform:
1. Stand in an athletic stance with knees slightly bent and weight on your toes.
2. Jump both feet in toward each other, then immediately jump them back out wide.
3. Repeat the in-out motion rapidly while staying light on your feet.
Safety cue: Stay light on your toes keep hips low and maintain rhythmic breathing

Health benefit: Improves cardiovascular fitness and upper body coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Stand in a boxing stance with hands up and elbows tucked.
2. Rotate your hips and drive a compact left hook, snapping from the shoulder.
3. Return the left hand and immediately rotate to throw a right hook with the same snap.
4. Continue alternating hooks quickly while maintaining your guard.
Safety cue: Rotate from your hips keep your guard up and exhale on each punch

Health benefit: Boosts aerobic fitness and full body coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet together and arms extended straight in front at chest height.
2. Jump feet out wide while sweeping your arms out to the sides.
3. Jump feet back together and clap your hands in front, repeating the seal jack motion.
Safety cue: Land softly with knees slightly bent keep chest lifted and core engaged

Health benefit: Enhances lateral core strength and rotational stability
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your side and prop your forearm under your shoulder with legs stacked.
2. Lift hips to form a straight line from head to heels and extend the top arm toward the ceiling.
3. Rotate your torso and thread the top arm under your body, reaching through the gap.
4. Reverse the motion to return to the side plank and repeat for reps.
Safety cue: Keep hips stacked and core braced as you rotate under and reach

Health benefit: Strengthens glutes and improves lateral lower body stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width and place one hand on a stable support at arm height.
2. Step to the side with one foot and push hips back while bending the stepping knee and keeping the other leg straight.
3. Drive through the bent heel to return to center and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Hinge hips back keep chest tall ensure knee tracks over toes

Health benefit: Enhances thoracic mobility and posterior chain flexibility
Steps to perform:
1. Sit with knees bent, feet flat, and hands behind hips with fingers pointing away.
2. Press through your feet and hands to lift hips while rotating one shoulder toward the ceiling and opening the chest.
3. Reach with the top arm overhead and continue the rotation to extend through the thoracic spine.
4. Lower hips and torso back to the start and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Open chest by driving through shoulders and lift hips maintaining neutral neck

Health benefit: Improves static balance and proprioceptive control
Steps to perform:
1. Stand and place one foot directly in front of the other so the heel of the front foot touches the toes of the back foot.
2. Keep hips level, shoulders relaxed, and fix your gaze on a point ahead.
3. Hold the position and maintain steady breathing for the desired time, then switch foot position.
Safety cue: Stack hips and shoulders keep gaze forward and breathe steadily

Health benefit: Strengthens posterior chain and reinforces proper hip hinge mechanics
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width and interlace fingers behind your head, keeping elbows wide.
2. Hinge at the hips by pushing them back while maintaining a neutral spine and slight knee bend.
3. Continue the hinge until your torso is nearly parallel to the floor.
4. Drive hips forward to return to standing while squeezing glutes and keeping the chest up.
Safety cue: Hinge from hips with neutral spine and maintain chest up throughout

Health benefit: Builds quadriceps and calf strength while enhancing lower body muscular endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with your back against a wall and feet hip-width apart a few inches away.
2. Slide down until knees form about a 90-degree angle and press your lower back into the wall.
3. Lift both heels off the floor onto the balls of your feet and hold.
4. Lower your heels back to the floor with control.
Safety cue: Keep knees aligned over toes and maintain a neutral spine

Health benefit: Improves scapular stability and shoulder posture
Steps to perform:
1. Sit with knees bent, feet flat, and hands placed behind your hips with fingers pointing forward.
2. Lift your hips until your torso and thighs form a straight tabletop position and keep your arms straight.
3. Pull your shoulder blades together without bending your elbows.
4. Release the scapulae to neutral and repeat the squeeze.
Safety cue: Squeeze shoulder blades down and together without shrugging keep neck long

Health benefit: Strengthens posterior chain and core while promoting hip extension strength
Steps to perform:
1. Sit with legs extended and hands placed behind hips with fingers pointing toward your feet.
2. Press through your hands and heels to lift your hips until your body forms a straight line from head to heels.
3. Squeeze your glutes and hold the elevated position.
4. Lower your hips back down with control.
Safety cue: Lift hips into a straight line and squeeze glutes while keeping ribs drawn

Health benefit: Enhances spinal mobility and promotes gentle relaxation of the lower back
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with arms extended in a T and knees bent over your hips.
2. Drop both knees to one side while keeping both shoulder blades touching the floor.
3. Turn your head to the opposite side and hold the twist.
Safety cue: Keep both shoulders grounded and lead the twist from the hips

Health benefit: Develops core stability and dynamic shoulder endurance through alternating forearm to hand transitions
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a forearm plank with elbows under shoulders and body in a straight line.
2. Press one palm into the floor and then the other to rise into a high plank.
3. Lower one arm at a time back to the forearm plank while keeping hips steady.
4. Alternate leading arms and maintain a braced core.
Safety cue: Keep a neutral spine and steady breath while preventing hips sagging

Health benefit: Boosts cardiovascular fitness while improving hand eye coordination and movement economy
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width apart and knees slightly bent and raise fists to chin.
2. Throw alternating jabs and crosses with controlled rotation and return hands to guard.
3. Add hooks and uppercuts while staying on the balls of your feet and maintain a steady rhythm.
4. Keep hands up and move only within a small step range without leaving your spot.
Safety cue: Keep soft knees and rotate power from hips not shoulders

Health benefit: Improves unilateral balance while targeting hamstring and glute strength
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and shift weight onto one leg with a soft bend in the knee.
2. Hinge at the hips and extend the free leg straight back as you lower your torso toward the floor.
3. Squeeze the standing-side glute and hamstring to return to upright.
4. Repeat for reps then switch legs.
Safety cue: Hinge at hips with a neutral spine and reach hips back

Health benefit: Emphasizes upper chest and shoulder strength while challenging core stability
Steps to perform:
1. Place your feet on a sofa or chair and set hands shoulder-width on the floor.
2. Brace your core and lower your chest by bending both elbows until just above the floor.
3. Push through your palms to extend the elbows and return to the start position.
4. Keep a straight line from head to heels and control each rep.
Safety cue: Tighten core and maintain a straight line from head to heels

Health benefit: Builds triceps strength and elbow extension control using bodyweight resistance
Steps to perform:
1. Sit on the floor with knees bent and feet flat and place hands behind hips fingers pointing forward.
2. Press through your palms to lift your hips slightly off the floor and bend elbows to lower a few inches.
3. Straighten the elbows to lift the hips back to the starting elevated position.
Safety cue: Keep shoulders down and elbows close to body during descent

Health benefit: Increases glute and inner thigh activation while improving muscular endurance in legs
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with a wide stance and toes turned outward and clasp hands at chest level.
2. Lower into a shallow sumo squat until thighs feel tension while keeping chest upright.
3. Pulse up and down a few inches using the glutes and inner thighs then stand tall to finish.
Safety cue: Drive knees out over toes and pulse from controlled hips and glutes

Health benefit: Improves hamstring flexibility and core activation while promoting shoulder mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width apart.
2. Hinge at the hips and place hands on the floor, keeping legs as straight as comfortable.
3. Walk hands forward until you reach a strong plank, keeping your core engaged.
4. Walk hands back toward your feet and rise to standing to repeat.
Safety cue: Hinge from hips with a flat back and soft knees

Health benefit: Builds core stability and enhances shoulder endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Start on hands and knees, tuck toes, and lift knees a few inches off the floor.
2. Align shoulders over wrists, keep hips low, and brace your core.
3. Hold this tucked plank position while breathing steadily.
Safety cue: Keep hips level and core braced to avoid sagging

Health benefit: Develops abdominal and hip flexor strength and improves seated posture
Steps to perform:
1. Sit with legs straight and heels resting on the floor, hands by your hips or on blocks.
2. Press down through your palms and straighten your arms to lift your hips slightly.
3. Keep legs straight and maintain heel contact with the floor.
4. Hold the lifted position with a tight core and relaxed shoulders.
Safety cue: Press through heels lift chest keep shoulders down away from ears

Health benefit: Strengthens posterior shoulder muscles and improves scapular mobility and posture
Steps to perform:
1. Lie face down with forehead on the mat and arms extended overhead in a Y.
2. Squeeze your shoulder blades and lift your arms slightly off the floor into the Y position.
3. Move your arms out to the sides at shoulder level and lift into the T position.
4. Bend your elbows and pull them down toward your ribs into a W, lifting your shoulder blades.
Safety cue: Squeeze shoulder blades together and keep neck long

Health benefit: Enhances core endurance and controlled hip mobility while raising heart rate moderately
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a high plank with shoulders over wrists and a straight body line.
2. Slowly drive your right knee toward your chest, pause briefly, then return it to plank.
3. Repeat the movement with your left knee, alternating slowly while keeping your core engaged.
Safety cue: Drive knees slowly with steady breath and hips low

Health benefit: Targets obliques and lateral core stability for improved trunk control
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat about hip-width apart.
2. Crunch slightly and reach your right hand toward your right heel.
3. Return to center and reach your left hand toward your left heel.
4. Alternate sides in a controlled motion while keeping your lower back on the mat.
Safety cue: Press lower back into floor and brace core before each reach

Health benefit: Builds lower body muscular endurance and improves quadriceps strength and joint stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with your back against a wall and feet about hip-width apart and a short distance from the wall.
2. Slide down until your knees form a 90-degree angle and your thighs are parallel to the floor.
3. Press your back into the wall and distribute weight through your heels.
4. Keep your arms relaxed or crossed and breathe steadily.
Safety cue: Keep knees stacked over ankles and chest lifted

Health benefit: Strengthens lower back extensors and enhances posterior chain endurance and posture
Steps to perform:
1. Lie face down with arms extended overhead and legs straight.
2. Engage your glutes and lift your arms, chest, and legs a few inches off the ground.
3. Hold the elevated position while keeping your neck neutral.
4. Squeeze your shoulder blades and glutes, then lower with control.
Safety cue: Keep neck neutral and squeeze glutes to lift with control

Health benefit: Improves hamstring flexibility and thoracic rotation while challenging balance and coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet wider than hip-width and extend your arms out to the sides.
2. Rotate your torso and reach your right hand toward your left foot while hinging at the hips.
3. Return to center and repeat the motion reaching your left hand toward your right foot.
4. Keep your chest open and eyes on the moving hand for balance.
Safety cue: Hinge from hips with a flat back and reach with control

Health benefit: Promotes core stability and shoulder control while challenging anti rotation strength
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a high plank with hands under shoulders and feet hip-width apart.
2. Brace your core and lift your right hand to tap your left shoulder with control.
3. Return your right hand and lift your left hand to tap your right shoulder.
4. Maintain a straight line from head to heels and breathe evenly.
Safety cue: Anchor hips level and exhale as you control each shoulder tap

Health benefit: Strengthens posterior chain and improves core stability and posture
Steps to perform:
1. Sit with legs extended and hands placed slightly behind hips, fingers pointing forward.
2. Press through your hands and heels to lift hips until your body forms a straight line from head to heels.
3. Squeeze your glutes and hold the top position while keeping your neck neutral.
4. Lower your hips with control back to the starting position.
Safety cue: Lift hips into a straight line from shoulders to heels and engage core

Health benefit: Elevates heart rate and enhances lower body endurance and coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and arms relaxed at your sides.
2. Rapidly lift one knee toward your waist while swinging the opposite arm, then quickly switch legs.
3. Land lightly on each foot and maintain a fast, continuous alternating rhythm.
Safety cue: Stand tall, brace core, drive knees up and land softly with quick controlled steps
is_not_suitable_for: Hypertension, Coronary Artery Disease, Hyperthyroidism, COPD

Health benefit: Targets triceps and chest to increase upper body pushing strength
Steps to perform:
1. Get into a high plank with hands under your chest and thumbs and index fingers touching to form a diamond.
2. Keep your body in a straight line and brace your core.
3. Lower your chest toward the diamond with elbows close to your ribs.
4. Press through your palms to straighten your arms and return to the start.
Safety cue: Keep elbows close to ribs and lower chest slowly, maintain a neutral spine

Health benefit: Builds shoulder strength and improves overhead pressing mechanics
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a pike position with hips raised, legs straight, and hands shoulder-width on the floor.
2. Bend your elbows to lower the top of your head toward the ground.
3. Push through your palms to extend your elbows and return to the pike position.
Safety cue: Tuck chin, lead with forehead, bend elbows with control and keep core tight

Health benefit: Enhances core activation and improves hip mobility and coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and engage your core.
2. Lift one knee toward the same-side elbow while rotating your torso to meet the knee.
3. Return the foot to the floor and immediately repeat on the opposite side.
Safety cue: Rotate torso and touch knee to opposite elbow, keep back tall and core engaged

Health benefit: Increases chest activation and horizontal pushing strength
Steps to perform:
1. Position hands wider than shoulder width and extend legs into a high plank.
2. Keep body in a straight line and engage core and glutes.
3. Bend elbows outward and lower chest toward the floor until elbows reach about 90 degrees.
4. Push through palms to extend elbows and return to the starting plank.
Safety cue: Pack your shoulders before lowering

Health benefit: Improves hamstring and glute strength while enhancing hip stability
Steps to perform:
