1. Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat close to your heels.
2. Drive hips upward into a bridge by squeezing the glutes.
3. Slowly straighten legs by walking your feet forward until hamstrings are under tension.
4. Reverse the motion by walking feet back toward heels and lower hips to the mat.
Safety cue: Maintain a lifted pelvis during the walkout

Health benefit: Develops upper body pushing strength and rotational core stability
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a high plank with hands under shoulders and feet hip-width apart.
2. Lower your chest to the floor by bending the elbows for a push-up.
3. Push up and rotate your torso, lifting one arm toward the ceiling to form a T.
4. Return the hand to the floor, rotate back to plank, and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Keep hips square during the rotation

Health benefit: Maximizes glute engagement while improving hip extension strength and core control
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with one foot flat on the floor and the other leg extended long and hovering above the ground.
2. Press through the planted heel and squeeze the glute to lift the hips until your body forms a straight line from shoulders to the extended foot.
3. Hold the top position briefly while maintaining a long line through the extended leg.
4. Lower hips with control back to the mat and switch legs for the next repetition.
Safety cue: Keep pelvis neutral at the top

Health benefit: Enhances lateral core strength and shoulder stability while challenging balance
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your side and prop yourself up on your forearm with feet stacked and body in a straight line.
2. Lift your hips and raise your top arm and top leg upward to form a star shape.
3. Hold the position with hips elevated and body aligned for the desired time, then switch sides.
Safety cue: Stack shoulders over hips and hold steady

Health benefit: Enhances posterior chain strength and thoracic spine extension
Steps to perform:
1. Lie face down with legs straight and arms at your sides, palms down.
2. Squeeze your glutes and lift your chest and legs a few inches off the ground.
3. Rotate your shoulders to open the chest and squeeze your shoulder blades together.
4. Keep your neck neutral, hold briefly, then lower with control to the mat.
Safety cue: Squeeze shoulder blades down and together while keeping neck long

Health benefit: Builds core endurance and improves balance
Steps to perform:
1. Sit tall with knees bent and feet flat on the floor.
2. Lean back slightly and lift your feet so your shins are parallel to the floor.
3. Extend your arms forward and straighten your legs to form a V with your torso and thighs.
4. Keep your spine long and hold the position with steady breathing.
Safety cue: Sit tall pull ribs toward pelvis and breathe evenly

Health benefit: Enhances hand eye coordination and light aerobic conditioning
Steps to perform:
1. Stand in a staggered stance with one foot slightly forward and hands up by your face.
2. Extend the lead hand straight forward in a quick, full-arm jab while rotating the shoulder.
3. Retract the hand quickly to the guard position and repeat with rhythmic, controlled reps.
Safety cue: Keep chin tucked rotate hips into each jab and breathe out

Health benefit: Increases core stability while challenging shoulder and hip control
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a high plank with hands under shoulders and a straight body line.
2. Step the right foot slightly wide to the right, then step the left foot wide to follow.
3. Step the left foot back toward center, then step the right foot back to the starting position.
4. Maintain a stable core and avoid letting the hips sag or rotate.
Safety cue: Maintain a neutral spine and brace core as you control each step

Health benefit: Boosts dynamic coordination and lower limb mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet together and hands at chest level.
2. Step the right foot out to the side while clapping the hands together in front of the chest.
3. Step the right foot back to center, then repeat to the left with the same hand clap.
Safety cue: Land softly through knees keep chest lifted and control arm movements

Health benefit: Develops hip strength and improves lateral balance
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width and hands at your hips.
2. Shift weight onto your left foot and lift your right knee to hip height.
3. Extend the right leg straight to the side with controlled motion and pointed toe.
4. Retract the leg to the chamber position and lower back to start; repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Keep hips square

Health benefit: Trains quick foot turnover and neuromuscular responsiveness
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with knees slightly bent and weight on the balls of your feet.
2. Rapidly tap both feet alternately on the floor while staying in place.
3. Keep shoulders relaxed and maintain quick, light foot contacts.
Safety cue: Stay light on the balls of your feet

Health benefit: Targets lower abdominal endurance and hip flexor activation
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with hands under your glutes and legs extended slightly off the ground.
2. Lift the right leg up while lowering the left leg toward the floor in a controlled motion.
3. Cross the legs by switching positions so the left leg rises and the right lowers.
4. Continue alternating the scissor motion with an engaged core.
Safety cue: Press lower back into the floor

Health benefit: Strengthens scapular stabilizers and promotes shoulder blade control
Steps to perform:
1. Lie face down with arms extended overhead and palms facing down.
2. Sweep your arms outward and down toward your hips while keeping them close to the surface.
3. Return your arms overhead with controlled motion and keep the chest slightly lifted.
Safety cue: Squeeze shoulder blades

Health benefit: Enhances coordinated contralateral movement and general motor control
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width and arms relaxed at your sides.
2. Lift the right knee toward your chest while driving the left elbow forward in a cross-body motion.
3. Lower and immediately repeat on the opposite side with left knee and right elbow.
4. Maintain an upright posture and steady rhythm as you continue alternating.
Safety cue: Maintain tall posture

Health benefit: Enhances core stability and balance
Steps to perform:
1. Start on hands under shoulders and knees under hips.
2. Extend your right arm forward and left leg back until both are parallel to the floor.
3. Keep your hips level and core engaged while holding the position.
4. Hold steadily and then switch sides.
Safety cue: Keep hips level and core braced as you extend opposite arm and leg

Health benefit: Strengthens hip abductors and improves lateral hip stability
Steps to perform:
1. Start on hands and knees with a neutral spine.
2. Keeping the knee bent, lift your right leg out to the side to hip level.
3. Lower the knee with control back to the starting position.
Safety cue: Maintain a neutral spine and move through the hip not the lower back

Health benefit: Promotes spinal mobility and movement coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Start on hands under shoulders and knees under hips.
2. Inhale and drop your belly while lifting your chest and tailbone.
3. Exhale and round your spine, tucking your chin and tailbone.
4. Continue to alternate smoothly with your breath.
Safety cue: Coordinate spinal flexion and extension with slow deep breaths

Health benefit: Builds inner thigh strength and hip control
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your side with the bottom leg straight and the top leg bent with the foot in front.
2. Lift the bottom leg upward using the inner thigh until it reaches hip height.
3. Lower the bottom leg with control back to the starting position.
Safety cue: Keep hips stacked and lift with inner thigh control not momentum

Health benefit: Enhances core coordination and pelvic stability
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent at 90 degrees and arms extended toward the ceiling.
2. Brace your core and press your lower back gently into the floor.
3. Slowly extend your right leg toward the floor while lowering your left arm overhead.
4. Return to center and repeat on the opposite side.
Safety cue: Press low back into the floor and breathe as limbs move slowly

Health benefit: Improves posterior chain strength and hip hinge mechanics
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width and a soft bend in the knees.
2. Hinge at the hips by pushing the hips back while keeping a neutral spine.
3. Lower your torso until you feel a stretch in the hamstrings or your back remains flat.
4. Drive the hips forward to return to standing while keeping the core engaged.
Safety cue: Push hips back and hinge from the hips keeping a neutral spine

Health benefit: Enhances scapular mobility and upper back activation
Steps to perform:
1. Lie prone with forehead on the floor and arms at your sides, palms facing down.
2. Lift your chest slightly and squeeze the shoulder blades together.
3. Sweep your arms overhead in a wide arc keeping them close to the ear line and thumbs up.
4. Reverse the movement to return the arms to your sides with control.
Safety cue: Keep ribs anchored and move scapula smoothly to avoid neck elevation

Health benefit: Strengthens scapular retractors and promotes shoulder stability
Steps to perform:
1. Lie face down with elbows bent and hands near ear level so the arms form a W.
2. Squeeze the shoulder blades and lift your chest and forearms off the floor.
3. Extend the arms backward slightly while maintaining the lifted chest, then lower with control.
Safety cue: Squeeze shoulder blades down and together while lifting arms keeping neck long

Health benefit: Develops core endurance and full body tension control
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back and press your lower back into the floor while lifting shoulders and legs into a hollow shape.
2. Hold the hollow position by engaging the core and drawing the ribs toward the pelvis.
3. Rock back and forth on the tailbone in a controlled motion without losing the hollow shape.
Safety cue: Brace abs and tuck hips slightly to keep lower back pressed to floor

Health benefit: Improves thoracic mobility and rotational movement quality
Steps to perform:
1. Start on all fours with hands under shoulders and knees under hips.
2. Place one hand behind your head and rotate the upper torso to bring the elbow toward the ceiling.
3. Return the elbow toward the same-side knee and repeat with control before switching sides.
Safety cue: Keep hips stable and stacked over knees and rotate from thoracic spine

Health benefit: Increases unilateral pushing strength and shoulder stability
Steps to perform:
1. Place hands wider than shoulder-width with one arm more extended and toes on the floor in a high plank position.
2. Keep the body rigid and lower your chest toward the supporting hand while the extended arm slides out to the side.
3. Push through the supporting palm to return to the start position.
4. Repeat on the opposite side or alternate sides each rep.
Safety cue: Shift weight slowly while keeping shoulders packed and core braced

Health benefit: Improves glute strength and single-leg hip extension control
Steps to perform:
1. Sit with your upper back resting on a bench and both feet flat on the floor.
2. Extend one leg straight out and brace through the planted heel.
3. Drive the hips upward until your torso and front thigh form a straight line.
4. Lower the hips under control back to the bench.
Safety cue: Drive through heel and keep hips level with ribs stacked over pelvis

Health benefit: Enhances core to upper-body coordination and anti-extension stability
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a forearm plank with elbows under shoulders and a straight body line.
2. Press through one hand to lift onto the opposite palm, then place the other hand under the shoulder to reach a high plank.
3. Keep hips steady and resist rotating as you hold the high plank briefly.
4. Lower back down to the forearms one hand at a time.
Safety cue: Keep a neutral spine and brace core as you control each transition

Health benefit: Strengthens posterior chain and improves shoulder girdle mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Sit with knees bent, feet flat, and hands placed slightly behind your hips with fingers facing forward.
2. Press through hands and heels to lift your hips until your torso is parallel to the floor and your thighs are aligned.
3. Hold the top position briefly then lower your hips back to the floor.
Safety cue: Press through heels, lift hips, and keep shoulders open with neck neutral

Health benefit: Targets triceps strength and elbow extension control
Steps to perform:
1. Place your hands shoulder-width on a sturdy elevated surface and extend legs forward with heels on the ground and body in a straight line.
2. Bend the elbows to lower your forehead toward the edge of the surface while keeping the upper arms stationary.
3. Extend the elbows to push your body back to the starting straight-arm position.
4. Keep the core engaged and repeat the lowering and pressing motion.
Safety cue: Tuck elbows and lower under control keeping upper arms steady

Health benefit: Builds unilateral leg strength and balance under load
Steps to perform:
1. Stand a couple of feet in front of a bench and place the top of one foot on the bench behind you.
2. Step the front foot forward and keep the torso upright.
3. Bend the front knee and lower until the front thigh reaches a moderate depth.
4. Push through the front heel to return to standing.
Safety cue: Keep front knee tracking over toes

Health benefit: Increases lateral core endurance and oblique activation control
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your side and prop yourself on your forearm with feet stacked.
2. Drop your hips toward the floor by bending at the waist until just above the ground.
3. Lift your hips back to the side plank position and repeat.
Safety cue: Maintain a straight line from head to heels

Health benefit: Enhances spinal extension endurance and posterior chain coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Lie face down with arms extended overhead and legs straight.
2. Lift the opposite arm and leg a few inches off the floor while keeping your torso stable.
3. Alternate lifting opposite limbs in a quick, controlled fluttering motion.
4. Keep your head neutral and maintain small, rhythmic movements.
Safety cue: Keep neck neutral

Health benefit: Improves core rotational control and dynamic balance during movement
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and hands behind your head.
2. Drive one knee up and across the body toward the opposite elbow while rotating your torso.
3. Return to standing and repeat on the other side in an alternating pattern.
Safety cue: Drive knee to opposite elbow using torso rotation

Health benefit: Develops lateral power and reactive single-leg stability at speed
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width and knees slightly bent.
2. Push off one foot laterally and land lightly on the other foot with a small sideways hop.
3. Swing the opposite arm across your body to help balance.
4. Continue alternating sides quickly while keeping the motion low and controlled.
Safety cue: Land softly on bent knees

Health benefit: Improves upper body coordination and aerobic conditioning
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width apart and hands held up by the chin.
2. Rotate your torso and snap a right hook, then a left hook, keeping elbows bent.
3. Drop slightly and drive a right uppercut then a left uppercut using hip drive.
4. Move lightly on your feet and repeat combinations with controlled breathing.
Safety cue: Tuck your chin and rotate hips with each hook and uppercut

Health benefit: Builds shoulder and core stability while promoting mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and arms relaxed.
2. Hinge at the hips, place hands on the floor, and walk them forward until in a high plank.
3. Hold a straight body line from head to heels briefly while bracing the core.
4. Walk hands back toward your feet and hinge to stand upright.
Safety cue: Hinge at hips, step hands forward, maintain a neutral spine

Health benefit: Enhances hamstring activation and light cardiovascular warm up
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width and arms relaxed at your sides.
2. Jog in place while kicking your heels up toward your glutes.
3. Pump your arms and land lightly on the balls of your feet.
Safety cue: Land softly, keep chest upright and drive heels toward glutes

Health benefit: Strengthens lower abdominal endurance and hip flexor control
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with hands under your hips and legs extended.
2. Lift both legs a few inches off the ground and engage your lower abs.
3. Alternate small, quick up-and-down scissor-like kicks with straight legs.
4. Keep your lower back pressed to the floor and breathe steadily.
Safety cue: Press lower back into floor and engage core to control leg movement

Health benefit: Improves hand eye coordination and rhythmic timing
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing the speed bag with feet shoulder-width and elbows up at shoulder height.
2. Tap the bag rhythmically with alternating fists, keeping wrists loose.
3. Use small shoulder rotations to maintain a steady cadence and timing.
4. Keep your core engaged and maintain an even breathing pattern.
Safety cue: Keep shoulders relaxed, retract shoulder blades slightly and breathe steadily

Health benefit: Increases aerobic stamina with reduced joint impact
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet together and arms at your sides.
2. Step your right foot out to the side while raising your arms overhead.
3. Return your right foot to center and lower your arms.
4. Repeat by stepping your left foot out and alternate sides at a steady pace.
Safety cue: Keep knees soft and step quietly through the hips

Health benefit: Enhances lateral mobility and hip adductor flexibility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with a wider-than-hip-width stance and hold onto a stable support.
2. Shift your weight to one side and bend that knee, pushing your hips back while keeping the other leg straight.
3. Keep your chest upright and maintain light contact with the support.
4. Return to center and repeat on the opposite side with controlled movement.
Safety cue: Keep chest upright and sit back into hips while controlling lateral descent

Health benefit: Develops upper body strength through dynamic full body movement
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a downward dog position with hands shoulder-width and hips high.
2. Bend your elbows and scoop your chest forward in a smooth, swooping motion.
3. Arch your back and straighten your arms to lift into an upward-facing position.
4. Push your hips back up into downward dog and continue the flow.
Safety cue: Move slowly through full range and exhale on the pushing phase

Health benefit: Targets glute activation and improves hip extension control
Steps to perform:
1. Begin on hands and knees with wrists under shoulders and knees under hips.
2. Keep the knee bent and lift one heel toward the ceiling by driving your foot upward.
3. Lower the knee back to the mat with control and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Brace core, keep hips square and lift with glute control

Health benefit: Improves scapular mobility and promotes shoulder blade stability
Steps to perform:
1. Assume a high plank with arms straight and hands under your shoulders.
2. Without bending your elbows, sink your chest slightly by squeezing your shoulder blades together.
3. Push through your hands to spread your shoulder blades and lift your torso, then repeat.
Safety cue: Retract and protract shoulder blades slowly without bending the elbows

Health benefit: Improves hip rotation mobility and coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Sit on the floor with your right shin in front and your left shin behind, both knees bent at 90 degrees.
2. Place both hands on the floor beside your hips for support and sit tall.
3. Rotate your hips and shoulders to open the front-side, move the back knee forward and the front knee back to switch legs.
4. Reset your hands and repeat the switch smoothly.
Safety cue: Maintain neutral spine and level hips while switching

Health benefit: Enhances single-leg balance and proprioception
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and shift weight onto your right foot.
2. Lift your left leg out to the side and extend both arms overhead and slightly out to form a star shape.
3. Keep your standing knee soft and your torso steady while holding the position.
4. Return the lifted leg to the ground with control and switch sides.
Safety cue: Hinge slightly at hips and keep gaze fixed for balance

Health benefit: Strengthens lower abdominal control through controlled range of motion
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with legs extended and hands under your lower back or hips for light support.
2. Lift both legs a few inches off the ground, keeping knees soft.
3. Lower the legs slowly to just above the floor and repeat without touching the ground.
Safety cue: Engage core and press lower back into floor throughout movement

Health benefit: Improves chest activation and shoulder stability through isometric tension
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and bring your hands together at chest height, palms facing each other.
2. Press your palms firmly together or against a fixed object and squeeze your chest muscles to create tension.
3. Hold the squeeze while keeping shoulders relaxed, then release with control.
Safety cue: Squeeze shoulder blades together and keep ribs down

Health benefit: Promotes hip extension mobility and active hip flexor lengthening
Steps to perform:
1. Kneel with your right knee on the ground and your left foot planted in front, creating a 90-degree angle at both knees.
2. Keep your torso upright and gently tuck your pelvis under by contracting the right glute.
3. Shift your hips forward until you feel a stretch in the front of the right hip while maintaining the glute contraction.
4. Hold briefly, return to neutral, and switch sides.
Safety cue: Tuck pelvis and drive hips forward while breathing deeply

Health benefit: Builds triceps strength and upper body pressing power
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a high plank with hands directly under your chest and hands closer than shoulder-width.
2. Keep elbows tucked close to your ribcage as you bend them to lower your chest toward your hands.
3. Press through your palms to extend your elbows and return to the start position.
4. Maintain a straight line from head to heels throughout each repetition.
Safety cue: Keep elbows tucked to sides and lower slowly with control

Health benefit: Enhances glute and hamstring strength and posterior chain activation
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with your feet hip-width on a stable chair and knees bent.
2. Drive your heels into the chair and lift your hips until your body forms a straight line from shoulders to knees.
3. Squeeze your glutes at the top and hold briefly.
4. Lower your hips back to the floor with control.
Safety cue: Drive through heels and keep hips level with a neutral spine

Health benefit: Strengthens posterior chain and improves lower back mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Lie prone across the edge of the sofa with your hips at the edge and hands gripping the sofa for support.
2. Keep your legs straight and together and lift them by contracting your glutes until your legs align with your torso.
3. Lower your legs back down with controlled motion to the starting position.
Safety cue: Hinge from hips and lift with glutes, keeping core braced

Health benefit: Challenges core stability and anti-rotational control through dynamic plank movement
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a forearm plank with elbows under shoulders and body in a straight line.
2. Brace your core and push your hips back and slightly toward one elbow in a sawing motion.
3. Sweep your hips across to the opposite elbow in a controlled movement.
4. Continue alternating hips while keeping your shoulders stable and hips level.
Safety cue: Keep shoulders stacked over wrists and exhale as you saw backward
is_not_suitable_for: Hypertension, Coronary Artery Disease, Chronic Low Back Pain, Osteoporosis

Health benefit: Develops oblique strength and hip abductor endurance for lateral stability
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your side propped on one forearm with elbow under shoulder and legs stacked.
2. Lift your hips to form a straight side plank from head to feet.
3. Keep the top leg straight and lift it upward while maintaining the plank.
4. Lower the top leg with control and repeat the lift.
Safety cue: Keep a straight line from head to heels and lift leg slowly

Health benefit: Improves shoulder mobility and upper body strength
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a pike or downward-dog-like position with hands shoulder-width and hips raised.
2. Sweep your chest forward and down in a controlled arc while keeping hips higher than a full dive bomber.
3. Lift your chest slightly at the end of the arc without locking the elbows.
4. Reverse the arc to return to the starting pike position.
Safety cue: Keep spine long and transition slowly through the movement

Health benefit: Builds core endurance and static shoulder stability
Steps to perform:
1. Begin in a downward dog with hands shoulder-width and feet hip-width.
2. Press hands into the floor and drive hips up until your body forms a V shape.
3. Hold the position and keep a steady torso without letting the shoulders sink.
Safety cue: Keep spine neutral hinge at hips breathe evenly

Health benefit: Elevates heart rate while reducing joint impact
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart.
2. Hinge and place hands on the floor, then step one foot back and then the other into a high plank.
3. Step each foot forward to meet your hands.
4. Stand up and reach overhead to finish the rep.
Safety cue: Step back softly and brace your core before standing

Health benefit: Strengthens posterior chain and improves shoulder mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Sit with feet flat and hands behind hips, fingers pointing away from the body.
2. Lift hips until torso and thighs form a straight line.
3. Step one hand and the opposite foot forward, then follow with the other hand and foot to move.
Safety cue: Keep chest lifted shoulders down take small controlled steps

Health benefit: Enhances lateral agility and hip coordination at low intensity
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with knees soft and feet shoulder-width apart.
2. Take a controlled side step with one foot, then bring the other foot to meet it.
3. Continue small side-to-side steps at a walking pace and change direction when ready.
Safety cue: Maintain slight knee bend and stay on the balls of your feet

Health benefit: Increases upper body power and timing
Steps to perform:
1. Stand in a shoulder-width stance with one foot slightly back and hands up by your chin.
2. Rotate your hips and drop your punching arm slightly while keeping the other hand guarding.
3. Drive your fist upward in a tight arc toward the target using hip and torso rotation.
4. Retract the hand quickly to guard and reset your feet for the next uppercut.
Safety cue: Lead with hips and shoulders drive through legs not arm

Health benefit: Builds leg strength and functional balance
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing the low surface with feet hip-width apart and arms at your sides.
2. Step up onto the surface with one foot and press through the heel to lift your body.
3. Bring the trailing foot up to the surface and stand tall.
4. Step back down leading with the same foot and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Step onto surface through heel lower with control keep chest upright

Health benefit: Develops full body stability and core coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Start on hands and knees, lift your knees a few inches off the ground and keep hips low.
2. Position hands under shoulders and eyes looking slightly forward.
3. Move one hand and the opposite foot forward together in small controlled steps.
4. Continue crawling forward with steady, coordinated hand and foot movements.
Safety cue: Keep hips low and core braced breathe steadily while moving

Health benefit: Improves hip flexor endurance and rhythmic coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and engage your core.
2. Lift one knee forward toward hip height with a controlled two-count ascent.
3. Lower the leg with a three-count descent and alternate sides at the set tempo.
Safety cue: Stand tall brace core lift knee with control avoid leaning back

Health benefit: Targets hip abductors to enhance pelvic stability and gait mechanics
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your side with hips and knees stacked and knees bent about 90 degrees.
2. Keep feet together and lift the top knee upward by opening the hip without rotating the pelvis.
3. Lower the knee back to the start and repeat for the set, then switch sides.
Safety cue: Keep hips stacked and pelvis stable open through glute control

Health benefit: Improves upper back strength and scapular stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing an open doorway and grip both sides of the door frame at waist height.
2. Step back and lean until your arms are extended and your body forms a straight line.
3. Pull your chest toward the frame by bending your elbows and squeezing your shoulder blades.
4. Slowly extend your arms and control your body back to the starting position.
Safety cue: Pull to squeeze shoulder blades together, keep chest lifted and spine neutral

Health benefit: Promotes thoracic mobility and shoulder range of motion
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with your back against a wall and feet a few inches from the base.
2. Press your lower back, shoulders, and head into the wall.
3. Raise your arms to shoulder height with elbows bent and keep them against the wall.
4. Slide your arms up overhead and back down while maintaining contact with the wall.
Safety cue: Press lower back lightly to wall, slide arms overhead maintaining contact

Health benefit: Challenges balance and proprioception through single leg stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and shift your weight onto one foot.
2. Lift the other foot and place it against the standing leg’s inner calf or ankle.
3. Close your eyes and maintain a steady upright posture.
4. Hold the position and make small balance adjustments through the standing ankle.
Safety cue: Stack hips over supporting foot, engage core, keep soft knee

Health benefit: Activates gluteal muscles and lower back endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Lie face down with your arms by your sides and legs extended.
2. Lift your legs slightly off the ground and point your toes or flex your feet so your heels are raised.
3. Beat your heels together in small, controlled motions and then relax.
Safety cue: Keep pelvis stable and core braced, move heels with control

Health benefit: Improves lateral hip mobility and functional leg strength
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart.
2. Step to the side with one foot and push your hips back.
3. Bend the stepping knee partway while keeping the other leg straight.
4. Drive through the bent foot to return to the starting position.
Safety cue: Lead with hips back, keep knee tracking over toes, chest upright

Health benefit: Strengthens posterior chain and hip extensor activation
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall facing a wall or chair and place hands lightly on it for balance.
2. Keep the standing leg straight and squeeze your glutes to lift the other leg straight back without bending the knee.
3. Lower the lifted leg under control to the start position and repeat.
Safety cue: Keep hips square and hinge from the hip joint

Health benefit: Improves shoulder stability and motor control
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width and arms relaxed at your sides.
2. Raise your arms straight overhead into an "I" with palms facing inward.
3. Move your arms forward and up in a V shape to form a "Y" with thumbs up.
4. Open your arms out to the sides to form a "T" and return to the start.
Safety cue: Stand tall and retract shoulder blades before lifting arms

Health benefit: Builds posterior chain pulling strength using bodyweight horizontal rows
Steps to perform:
1. Lie under a sturdy table and grasp the table edge with hands shoulder-width apart.
2. Extend your legs and keep your body in a straight line from head to heels.
3. Pull your chest toward the table edge by squeezing your shoulder blades together.
4. Lower your body under control until your arms are extended and repeat.
Safety cue: Maintain a straight plank from head to heels while pulling shoulder blades together

Health benefit: Targets lateral core muscles and improves trunk lateral flexion control
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width and hands behind your head.
2. Lift your right knee sideways while bringing your right elbow downward toward it.
3. Return to standing and repeat on the other side, alternating sides each rep.
Safety cue: Keep ribs down and lead the movement with your oblique muscle

Health benefit: Combines pressing strength with anti-rotation core stability and coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a high plank with hands under shoulders and body in a straight line.
2. Bend your elbows to lower your chest toward the floor.
3. Push up to full extension, shift weight slightly, and tap your left shoulder with your right hand.
4. Replace your hand, perform the next push-up, and tap the opposite shoulder on the next rep.
Safety cue: Stabilize hips to prevent rotation and breathe steadily between taps

Health benefit: Enhances core stability and anti-rotation strength
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a high plank with hands under shoulders and body in a straight line, and place the object beside your left hand.
2. Reach across with your right hand and drag the object under your chest to the right side while keeping hips level.
3. Return your right hand to plank and repeat the drag with your left hand, alternating sides for desired reps.
Safety cue: Keep hips level and core braced as you drag the object

Health benefit: Builds shoulder endurance and core coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a high plank with hands under shoulders and body in a straight line.
2. Lift your right hand and place it slightly forward, then lift your left hand and place it to match.
3. Move your right hand back, then left hand back to return to the starting position.
4. Continue alternating leading hands while keeping hips steady and core tight.
Safety cue: Maintain a straight line from head to heels and move slowly

Health benefit: Improves rotational mobility and lateral core control
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a high plank with hands under shoulders and feet wider than hip-width.
2. Rotate your torso to the right and swing your left leg under your body and through toward the right side.
3. Return the left leg and torso to the starting plank position and repeat to the other side.
Safety cue: Rotate through the thoracic spine and keep hips stacked

Health benefit: Develops posterior chain strength and hamstring control
Steps to perform:
1. Start kneeling with knees under hips and hands on the floor in front of you.
2. Slowly walk your hands forward while keeping hips stacked and hamstrings engaged until your body is nearly straight.
3. Brace your core and walk your hands back toward your knees to return to the start.
Safety cue: Hinge from the hips and control the descent with your hamstrings

Health benefit: Improves single-leg strength and dynamic balance for functional movement
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and hands at hips.
2. Step your right foot back and lower into a reverse lunge until both knees are about 90 degrees.
3. Drive through your left heel and stand up, bringing your right knee up toward your chest.
4. Reset and repeat on the other side, alternating sides for desired reps.
Safety cue: Keep chest upright and control the step before driving the knee

Health benefit: Increases lower-body power and metabolic conditioning
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width and hands at chest.
2. Bend hips and knees into a squat while keeping chest up.
3. Step your right foot quickly to the side and return to center.
4. Repeat the squat and step with the left foot, alternating at a fast tempo.
Safety cue: Hinge hips back and keep chest up during each controlled step

Health benefit: Enhances full-body coordination and core stability while challenging conditioning
Steps to perform:
1. Start on hands and toes with hips low and knees bent under hips.
2. Move your right hand and left foot forward together, then your left hand and right foot.
3. Continue crawling forward keeping hips steady.
4. Reverse the sequence to crawl backward using the same contralateral pattern.
Safety cue: Keep spine neutral and core braced while moving limbs deliberately

Health benefit: Improves aerobic fitness and upper-body coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Stand in a boxing stance with hands up and knees soft.
2. Throw alternating lead and rear hooks in short, controlled arcs.
3. Drive upward with alternating uppercuts and return hands to guard after each punch.
Safety cue: Rotate from hips tuck chin and exhale with each punch

Health benefit: Develops lateral power and balance with reduced joint stress
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and shift weight onto one leg.
2. Step laterally to the opposite side and tap the trailing foot lightly behind you.
3. Push off and step back to the starting side, swinging your arms for momentum.
Safety cue: Land softly with knees tracking toes and control lateral movement

Health benefit: Strengthens abdominal endurance and trunk rotation control
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with hands behind your head and knees bent.
2. Lift your shoulders and bring one knee toward your chest while extending the other leg.
3. Rotate your torso to bring the opposite elbow toward the bent knee.
4. Alternate sides in a pedaling motion with controlled breaths.
Safety cue: Keep lower back pressed to floor and move slowly without yanking neck

Health benefit: Enhances cardiovascular fitness and lower body coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and engage your core.
2. Hinge at the hips and place both hands on the ground in front of you.
3. Step one foot back and then the other into a high plank, keeping a straight line.
4. Step both feet forward to your hands and stand up to return to start.
Safety cue: Keep chest tall and core braced, land softly on midfoot

Health benefit: Improves full body coordination and transitional movement control
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and engage your core.
2. Step one foot forward into a deep lunge and place both hands on the ground inside the front foot.
3. Rotate your chest open and reach the top arm up while keeping hips low.
4. Return hands to the ground, step the front foot back to meet the other, and stand to repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Hinge from hips, keep a flat back, step back slowly

Health benefit: Improves thoracic rotation and hip mobility for functional movement
Steps to perform:
1. Start on hands and knees with shoulders over wrists and hips over knees.
2. Step your right foot forward outside your right hand into a deep lunge.
3. Rotate your torso and reach your left arm up and open the chest.
4. Return the left hand to the ground, straighten the front leg to hinge over the hamstring, and step back to repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Maintain a neutral spine, move through controlled breaths and reach long

Health benefit: Enhances core stability and contralateral coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Start on hands and knees with a neutral spine and engaged core.
2. Extend your right arm forward and your left leg back until they are parallel to the floor.
3. Return both hand and knee to the ground and repeat on the opposite side.
Safety cue: Keep hips square, extend opposite arm and leg with control

Health benefit: Enhances shoulder mobility and warms upper body muscles
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and extend both arms out to shoulder height.
2. Make large, controlled circles forward with your arms using the shoulders.
3. Reverse the direction and make large, controlled circles backward for equal repetitions.
Safety cue: Keep shoulders down and back, move with smooth controlled range

Health benefit: Develops upper body strength and promotes spinal mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a downward dog with hands shoulder-width and hips high.
2. Swoop your chest down and forward while lowering your hips toward the floor.
3. Arch your spine and lift your chest into upward dog while keeping legs engaged.
4. Push back through your hands and hips to return to downward dog.
Safety cue: Maintain a long spine and hinge from hips during the swoop

Health benefit: Strengthens triceps and enhances chest and shoulder stability
Steps to perform:
1. Kneel on a mat with knees hip-width and toes untucked.
2. Place hands under your chest with thumbs and index fingers touching to form a diamond.
3. Bend elbows to lower your chest toward the diamond, then press up to straighten your arms.
Safety cue: Keep elbows close to ribs and lower with controlled steady tempo

Health benefit: Improves single leg strength and balance control
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing a chair or box with one leg extended slightly forward.
2. Hinge at your hips and push your hips back while keeping the extended leg off the seat.
3. Sit lightly onto the chair on the standing leg's heel and pause briefly.
4. Drive through the heel to stand tall and repeat, then switch legs.
Safety cue: Sit back into the chair with chest up and knee aligned over toes

Health benefit: Enhances core stability and shoulder control
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a high plank with hands under shoulders and a straight line from head to heels.
2. Reach one arm straight forward while keeping hips square and core tight.
3. Return the hand under the shoulder and repeat with the opposite arm.
Safety cue: Brace your core and keep hips square while reaching forward slowly

Health benefit: Activates the posterior chain and improves glute and hamstring engagement
Steps to perform:
1. Sit with legs extended and hands behind hips with fingers pointing toward your feet.
2. Press through hands and heels to lift hips into a straight reverse plank.
3. Lift one leg toward the ceiling while keeping hips level and core engaged.
4. Lower the leg with control and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Press shoulders down lift hips high and breathe evenly during leg lifts

Health benefit: Improves core strength and hip flexor endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Sit on the floor with hands beside your hips and fingers pointing forward.
2. Press into your hands and lift your feet off the ground while tucking your knees to your chest.
3. Keep your shoulders down, spine tall, and hold the tucked position.
4. Breathe steadily and maintain the lift for the desired time.
Safety cue: Depress and pack shoulders while bracing core to keep hips lifted

Health benefit: Enhances glute activation and hip extension power
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back and place the soles of your feet together with knees splayed outward.
2. Drive your hips upward by squeezing your glutes until your torso and thighs form a straight line.
3. Lower your hips with control toward the ground without losing the foot position.
4. Repeat the hip drives for the desired number of repetitions.
Safety cue: Squeeze glutes at the top and lower slowly with control

Health benefit: Builds upper body isometric strength and shoulder stability
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a high plank with hands under shoulders and body in a straight line.
2. Lower your chest toward the floor until your elbows reach roughly 90 degrees.
3. Hold the bottom position while keeping a tight core and straight hips.
4. Maintain steady breathing and controlled muscle engagement.
Safety cue: Maintain a straight line from head to heels, brace core and glutes

Health benefit: Improves lower body muscular endurance and unilateral hip stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with your back against a wall and slide down until hips and knees form about 90 degrees.
2. Plant one foot firmly and lift the opposite foot a few inches off the floor.
3. Return the lifted foot and immediately lift the other foot, alternating marches.
4. Keep your back flat against the wall and core engaged throughout.
Safety cue: Keep knees over ankles, chest lifted, march with controlled movement

Health benefit: Increases upper body endurance and coordination while elevating heart rate
Steps to perform:
1. Sit upright on a chair or bench with feet flat and core braced.
2. Rotate your torso and extend your rear hand across your body into a straight punch.
3. Retract the hand under control and rotate back to center.
4. Alternate sides with crisp rotations and keep your chin guarded.
Safety cue: Sit tall, rotate through torso, exhale sharply with each punch

Health benefit: Enhances core rotational strength and shoulder stability through integrated movement
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a high plank with hands under shoulders and body in one line.
2. Drive your right knee toward your right elbow, twisting your hips.
3. Return the leg to plank and immediately repeat on the left.
4. Keep your core tight and shoulders steady.
Safety cue: Maintain a neutral spine and brace core before each knee drive

Health benefit: Improves upper body power and cardiovascular conditioning through rapid pulling motions
Steps to perform:
1. Sit tall on the edge of a bench with feet flat and a rope or band overhead.
2. Grip the rope with both hands and pull your right hand down toward your hip as if climbing.
3. Rapidly alternate by pulling the left hand down while the right resets upward.
4. Maintain an upright torso and a fast, controlled rhythm.
Safety cue: Sit tall brace core pull deliberately on each repetition with controlled exhale

Health benefit: Strengthens posterior chain and improves hip extension endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Lie prone on your stomach with forehead on the ground and legs extended.
2. Lift both legs a few inches off the floor with toes pointed.
3. Alternate small, rapid up-and-down kicks with each leg.
Safety cue: Keep pelvis grounded and press lower ribs toward hips to protect lower back

Health benefit: Targets oblique strength and lateral core stability for better trunk control
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your side and prop yourself into a side plank on your forearm with feet stacked.
2. Lift your top knee and bring your top elbow toward each other by crunching your oblique.
3. Return to side plank and repeat controlled reps.
4. Keep hips lifted and body in a straight line while moving.
Safety cue: Stack shoulders and hips and lift ribs while moving with controlled breath

Health benefit: Enhances shoulder mobility and muscular endurance with dynamic rotational movement
Steps to perform:
1. Kneel upright with knees hip-width and spine tall.
2. Extend both arms out to the sides at shoulder height with palms down.
3. Make small, rapid circles with your arms using only shoulder movement.
Safety cue: Keep torso tall and scapula stable and control circles with smooth shoulder movement

Health benefit: Enhances lower abdominal control and core stability
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with arms by your sides and both legs extended toward the ceiling.
2. Press your low back into the floor and engage your core.
3. Lower one leg slowly toward the floor until your heel is a few inches above the ground.
4. Return that leg to the ceiling and lower the opposite leg, alternating with control.
Safety cue: Keep low back pressed into mat and move slowly with control

Health benefit: Strengthens glutes and promotes hip extension control
Steps to perform:
1. Sit with hands behind you, feet flat, and lift your hips until your torso and thighs form a tabletop.
2. Brace your core and keep your hips lifted.
3. Extend one leg forward or upward in a controlled kick while keeping hips stable.
4. Return the foot and repeat the kick on the other side, alternating.
Safety cue: Keep hips level and core tight to avoid sagging

Health benefit: Improves calf flexibility and ankle dorsiflexion range
Steps to perform:
1. Sit with one leg extended and the other foot flat on the floor.
2. Loop a towel around the ball of the extended foot and hold the ends with both hands.
3. Pull the towel toward you to flex the ankle and feel a stretch in the calf while keeping the knee straight.
4. Release the tension, switch legs, and repeat.
Safety cue: Sit tall and hinge slightly forward from hips while pulling towel toward you

Health benefit: Activates intrinsic foot muscles to support arch control
Steps to perform:
1. Sit with both feet flat on the floor and weight evenly distributed.
2. Keep your toes relaxed and press the ball of the foot into the floor.
3. Pull the base of the toes toward the heel to shorten the foot and raise the medial arch without curling the toes.
4. Hold the domed position briefly, then relax and repeat.
Safety cue: Lift the arch while keeping toes relaxed and weight balanced evenly

Health benefit: Increases hip external rotation flexibility and glute mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Sit tall with both feet flat on the floor.
2. Cross one ankle over the opposite knee so the ankle rests just above the knee.
3. Lean forward from the hips while keeping your spine long until you feel a stretch in the outer hip.
4. Return to upright and switch sides.
Safety cue: Keep spine long and hinge from hips to lean into the stretch

Health benefit: Enhances core stability and spinal alignment while improving balance
Steps to perform:
1. Get on hands and knees with hands under shoulders and knees under hips.
2. Brace your core and keep a neutral spine.
3. Extend your right arm forward and your right leg back in line with your torso.
4. Hold briefly, then return to the starting position and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Keep spine neutral and core engaged to prevent low back arching

Health benefit: Improves hip mobility and coordination of pelvic movement
Steps to perform:
1. Position yourself on hands and knees with a tall spine.
2. Lift your right knee slightly so the knee stays bent at about 90 degrees.
3. Move your right knee in slow, controlled circles at the hip joint.
4. Reverse the circle direction for the same number of reps, then switch sides.
Safety cue: Maintain tall neutral spine and move hips slowly through controlled range

Health benefit: Develops core coordination and controlled limb movement
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat, arms at your sides.
2. Press your lower back into the floor and lift your right arm toward the ceiling while extending your right leg straight.
3. Lower your right arm and right leg together toward the floor without losing core contact.
4. Return to the start and repeat, then switch to the other side.
Safety cue: Press lower back gently into floor and breathe while moving limbs slowly

Health benefit: Builds pressing endurance and enhances shoulder stability
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat, holding dumbbells or a bar over your chest.
2. Bend your elbows so the weight rests just above your chest, palms facing forward.
3. Press upward until your arms are nearly straight and hold the position without locking your elbows.
4. Maintain the hold for the desired time, then slowly lower the weight to the starting position.
Safety cue: Squeeze shoulder blades into ground and avoid flaring elbows

Health benefit: Teaches hip hinge mechanics and strengthens posterior chain activation
Steps to perform:
1. Kneel on both knees with a straight spine and hands on your hips or reaching forward.
2. Hinge at the hips by pushing them back while keeping your chest open and spine neutral.
3. Drive your hips forward to return to an upright kneeling position and repeat.
Safety cue: Hinge from hips keeping spine long and chest lifted

Health benefit: Improves shoulder external rotation mobility and rotator cuff strength
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your side with knees slightly bent and the working arm bent at 90° resting against your side.
2. Hold a light weight or no weight and keep the upper arm steady with the elbow fixed at your side.
3. Rotate your forearm upward toward the ceiling by externally rotating the shoulder.
4. Lower the forearm slowly to the starting position with control.
Safety cue: Keep elbow tucked to your side and rotate slowly with controlled movement

Health benefit: Improves lateral hip stability and strengthens glutes and legs for better balance
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width and hands on hips or at chest.
2. Step one leg diagonally behind and across the front leg while bending both knees into a lunge.
3. Push through the front heel to return to standing and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Maintain upright torso and step diagonally keeping knee aligned over toes

Health benefit: Strengthens glutes and core while improving hip extension control and pelvic stability
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent, feet flat hip-width, and hips lifted into a bridge.
2. Squeeze your glutes and brace your core to keep hips steady.
3. Lift one knee toward your chest while keeping hips elevated and level.
4. Lower that foot back down and repeat the march with the opposite leg.
Safety cue: Squeeze glutes and keep pelvis stable while marching slowly with control

Health benefit: Builds triceps strength while challenging core stability and upper body control
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a forearm plank with elbows under shoulders and core engaged.
2. Press one hand onto the floor, then the other to rise onto your hands in a high plank.
3. Lower one forearm back down, then the other, returning to the forearm plank while keeping elbows close to your body.
4. Alternate the leading hand and keep the movement controlled to emphasize the triceps.
Safety cue: Keep elbows tucked close to ribs and lower with a straight spine

Health benefit: Develops single leg strength balance and mobility to support functional lower body movements
Steps to perform:
1. Stand on one leg with the other leg extended in front and arms extended for balance.
2. Sit back slowly onto a chair or box, keeping the working knee aligned over the toes and the extended leg straight.
3. Pause briefly, then press through the heel of the working leg to stand back up while keeping the torso upright.
Safety cue: Sit back onto the chair with weight through heel and chest lifted

Health benefit: Builds anterior core endurance and body tension to enhance midline stability
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back and draw your ribs toward your hips, lifting your shoulders and legs a few inches off the ground.
2. Extend your arms overhead in line with your ears and keep your legs straight with toes pointed.
3. Rock back toward your shoulders using a smooth arc while keeping your lower back pressed to the floor.
4. Rock forward toward your feet while maintaining the hollow position and steady breathing.
Safety cue: Keep lower back glued to the floor and breathe evenly

Health benefit: Strengthens posterior chain and improves scapular stability and postural alignment
Steps to perform:
1. Lie face down with your forehead on the floor and your arms by your sides, palms down and thumbs pointing back.
2. Squeeze your shoulder blades together, lift your chest off the ground, and rotate your arms so your thumbs point upward.
3. Hold the lifted position with a long neck and relaxed legs, then lower slowly back down.
Safety cue: Pinch shoulder blades together and lift chest while keeping neck neutral

Health benefit: Enhances core and shoulder stability and challenges whole body control
Steps to perform:
1. Start on your forearms and toes with elbows under shoulders and knees tucked under hips a few inches off the ground.
2. Lift your hips to a neutral position so your back is flat and maintain a slight bend in the knees.
3. Keep your core braced and gaze slightly ahead while holding even breathing.
4. Hold the position without letting hips sag or shoulders collapse.
Safety cue: Drive hips low and maintain a neutral spine while breathing steadily

Health benefit: Builds scapular retraction strength and upper back endurance to support better posture
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing an open doorway and grasp both sides of the frame at chest height with feet braced forward.
2. Lean back with a straight spine and bend your elbows, pulling your shoulder blades together without stepping forward.
3. Hold the contracted position for the desired duration while maintaining a tight core, then slowly release.
Safety cue: Pull shoulder blades back and down keeping wrists aligned with forearms

Health benefit: Improves cardiovascular fitness coordination and rotational core power through dynamic striking movements
Steps to perform:
1. Stand in a balanced boxing stance with knees slightly bent and hands up protecting your face.
2. Rotate your hips and pivot your lead foot as you drive a hook toward the opponent’s body, keeping your elbow bent.
3. Return your hand quickly to guard and then repeat on the other side with smooth hip rotation.
4. Maintain controlled breathing and move your feet lightly between punches.
Safety cue: Rotate from your hips and exhale sharply while keeping hands high

Health benefit: Increases lower body power and explosive leg strength
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width and toes slightly turned out.
2. Lower into a squat, keeping chest up and weight in your heels.
3. Explode upward into a small jump, extending hips and knees.
4. Land softly back into a squat and repeat.
Safety cue: Keep chest up and land softly with hips back and knees tracking toes

Health benefit: Boosts cardiovascular activity while improving hip flexor endurance and coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and cross your arms over your chest.
2. Run in place driving one knee up toward your chest.
3. Alternate knees quickly while maintaining an upright posture.
Safety cue: Keep tall torso and drive knees up using your core
is_not_suitable_for: Hypothyroidism, Hyperthyroidism, COPD, Coronary Artery Disease

Health benefit: Improves lateral power and single leg balance
Steps to perform:
1. Stand on one leg with hands clasped behind your lower back.
2. Leap laterally to the opposite leg and land softly on the ball of that foot.
3. Bend the landing knee and touch the trailing foot briefly behind you.
4. Push off immediately and repeat the lateral jump to the other side.
Safety cue: Land softly with hips level and chest up to protect knees
is_not_suitable_for: Obesity / Overweight, Osteoarthritis, Osteoporosis, Hypothyroidism, Sarcopenia

Health benefit: Develops eccentric control and lower body mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width apart and brace your core.
2. Quickly drop your hips back and down into a deep squat.
3. Drive through your heels to stand up and reset for the next rep.
Safety cue: Control the descent by hinging hips back and keeping a neutral spine

Health benefit: Builds core endurance while challenging shoulder stability and hip abductors
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a forearm plank with elbows under shoulders and body in a straight line.
2. Jump both feet out wider than hip-width while keeping hips level.
3. Jump both feet back together to the starting position.
4. Maintain a tight core and steady breathing throughout.
Safety cue: Keep hips stable and spine neutral while breathing evenly

Health benefit: Improves scapular mobility and promotes upright thoracic posture
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing a wall with feet hip-width apart.
2. Place forearms on the wall with elbows at shoulder height and palms flat.
3. Slowly slide forearms upward overhead while keeping forearms and palms in contact with the wall.
4. Slide forearms back down to the start with control.
Safety cue: Keep forearms flat on wall and tuck chin to maintain neutral spine

Health benefit: Improves single leg balance and multidirectional proprioceptive control
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and lift one knee to hip height.
2. Extend arms out to form a star and shift weight onto the standing leg.
3. Hinge at the hips and reach the opposite hand toward the standing foot while extending the lifted leg back.
4. Return to upright and repeat, then switch sides.
Safety cue: Reach arms and leg slowly while keeping hips level and core braced

Health benefit: Promotes spinal stability and coordinated core and hip activation
Steps to perform:
1. Start on hands and knees and lower onto forearms with elbows under shoulders.
2. Brace the core and extend one arm forward while extending the opposite leg back in line with the torso.
3. Hold with a flat spine for a moment.
4. Return limbs to start and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Keep hips level and exhale as you extend opposite arm and leg

Health benefit: Increases thoracic extension mobility and supports improved upright posture
Steps to perform:
1. Sit on a chair with feet flat and upper back against the top of the chair back.
2. Interlace fingers behind the head and gently lean back over the chair to open the chest.
3. Return to a neutral upright position with control and repeat.
Safety cue: Lift through upper back over chair while keeping ribs down and neck long

Health benefit: Develops lateral hip and thigh strength while enhancing single leg balance
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart.
2. Step wide to one side and bend the leading knee while pushing hips back into a lateral lunge.
3. Drive through the heel of the lunging foot to stand and lift the trailing foot off the ground into a balance.
4. Hold briefly, then lower the trailing foot and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Push hips back in lunge and control drive through standing foot to balance

Health benefit: Enhances lateral core strength and shoulder stability
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your side with forearm under shoulder and legs stacked.
2. Press forearm and outer edge of bottom foot into the floor to lift hips.
3. Stack hips and shoulders into a straight line and position top arm on hip or overhead.
4. Hold the position while keeping your core engaged and breathing steadily.
Safety cue: Stack hips over shoulders and hold a straight line from head to heels

Health benefit: Improves hip extension mobility and standing posture
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and step one foot back into a lunge with the front knee over the ankle.
2. Tuck your pelvis and shift your hips forward until you feel a stretch in the front of the back hip.
3. Keep your torso upright and squeeze the glute of the back leg.
4. Hold the stretch, then switch sides after the desired time.
Safety cue: Tuck pelvis and keep spine tall as you lunge into the stretch

Health benefit: Builds calf muscular endurance and ankle stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width apart and hands on a support for balance.
2. Rise onto the balls of both feet until your heels fully lift.
3. Maintain straight knees and core while holding the top position.
Safety cue: Control the ascent and keep knees soft while holding the top

Health benefit: Develops horizontal pushing strength and shoulder control
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a high plank with hands turned slightly outward and placed near your hips.
2. Shift your weight forward so your shoulders move ahead of your hands and engage your core.
3. Bend elbows close to your sides and lower your chest forward and down.
4. Push back up while keeping the forward lean and controlled tension.
Safety cue: Lean chest forward keep elbows close and core braced with a neutral spine

Health benefit: Enhances glute activation and single leg hip stability
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with one knee bent and foot flat, and extend the other leg straight.
2. Press the heel of the bent leg into the floor and squeeze the glute to lift your hips into a straight line.
3. Keep the extended leg aligned with your hips and maintain a neutral spine.
4. Lower your hips with control and repeat, then switch legs.
Safety cue: Drive through heel squeeze glute and maintain stacked hips with neutral spine

Health benefit: Improves rotational core strength and thoracic mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your side and prop your forearm under your shoulder, stacking your feet.
2. Lift your hips to form a straight line from head to heels.
3. Rotate your torso and thread your top arm under your body, then open back to the side plank.
4. Repeat the rotation while keeping hips lifted.
Safety cue: Keep hips stacked and spine neutral as you rotate slowly
is_not_suitable_for: Hypertension, Coronary Artery Disease, Chronic Low Back Pain, Osteoporosis

Health benefit: Improves overall core stability and shoulder girdle control
Steps to perform:
1. Start on hands and knees with wrists under shoulders and knees under hips.
2. Lift your knees a few inches off the floor so your shins hover while keeping your back flat.
3. Hold the hover while pressing your palms into the floor and maintaining a neutral neck.
4. Maintain the position for the set duration.
Safety cue: Brace core keep hips level and neck neutral while breathing steadily

Health benefit: Develops shoulder pressing strength and upper body balance
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a pike position with hips lifted and feet on the floor, hands shoulder-width apart.
2. Bend your elbows to lower your head toward the floor while keeping hips high.
3. Press through your palms to extend your elbows and return to the pike top.
4. Repeat the lower-and-press motion for the desired reps.
Safety cue: Hinge at hips keep shoulders protracted and neck aligned

Health benefit: Strengthens hip abductors and enhances pelvic stability
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your side with knees bent, heels together, and head supported.
2. Open your top knee while keeping your feet touching to perform the clam motion.
3. Lift your hips slightly off the floor to add the hip lift while keeping knees aligned.
4. Lower hips and close the knee, then repeat the sequence.
Safety cue: Keep pelvis stable and core engaged as you lift through the glutes

Health benefit: Enhances dynamic core control and shoulder girdle endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a forearm plank with elbows under shoulders and feet on sliders or towels.
2. Push through your forearms to slide your heels backward, extending your body slightly.
3. Pull your heels forward by engaging your core to return toward the starting position.
4. Continue sliding your body backward and forward while maintaining a straight line.
Safety cue: Maintain a neutral spine and move the body using shoulder control

Health benefit: Improves posterior chain strength and hip extension mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Sit with knees bent, feet flat hip-width apart, and hands placed slightly behind hips with fingers pointing toward your feet.
2. Press through palms and heels and lift hips and torso until thighs and torso form a straight line.
3. Squeeze glutes, keep neck neutral, and hold the elevated position.
4. Lower hips back down with control to the starting position.
Safety cue: Lift hips until shoulders, hips, and knees align, squeeze glutes and keep neck neutral

Health benefit: Strengthens abdominal muscles and enhances seated lower body stability
Steps to perform:
1. Sit on the edge of a chair or mat with hands beside hips and feet together on the floor.
2. Lean back slightly to engage the core and lift both feet a few inches off the floor.
3. Draw knees toward your chest by contracting the abdominal muscles.
4. Extend legs back to the starting position with control.
Safety cue: Sit tall, brace core, pull knees toward chest with slow controlled movement

Health benefit: Improves upper body coordination and light cardiovascular conditioning
Steps to perform:
1. Sit upright with feet planted and hands up in a light guard near your chin.
2. Rotate the torso and extend one arm forward for a punch, then quickly retract it.
3. Alternate punches rapidly while keeping the core engaged and maintaining the guard.
Safety cue: Keep spine tall, shoulders relaxed, exhale on each punch and control return

Health benefit: Increases shoulder and core endurance while promoting scapular mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Lie face down with arms extended overhead and legs together.
2. Lift chest and legs a few inches off the floor to engage the posterior chain.
3. Rapidly open arms out to the sides and spread legs outward like a jack.
4. Quickly bring arms and legs back together and repeat.
Safety cue: Maintain neutral spine, move limbs from hips, avoid excessive lumbar arching

Health benefit: Enhances abdominal endurance and oblique muscle activation at higher tempo
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with hands behind your head and shoulders slightly lifted off the floor.
2. Kick one leg straight out while driving the opposite knee toward the chest and twist the torso to bring the opposite elbow toward the bent knee.
3. Alternate sides rapidly in a controlled cycling motion at a fast tempo.
Safety cue: Press lower back into mat, brace core, keep neck relaxed during fast leg cycling

Health benefit: Boosts hip flexor mobility and raises heart rate with minimal impact
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and hands at your sides or on your hips.
2. Lift your right knee toward hip height while swinging your left arm forward.
3. Lower the right knee and lift the left knee while switching arm positions.
4. Continue alternating in a controlled marching rhythm.
Safety cue: Lift knees to hip level, maintain upright torso and braced core

Health benefit: Improves upper body endurance and coordination without lower body movement
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width apart and hands by your chin.
2. Extend your right arm forward in a quick punch while keeping feet planted.
3. Retract the right hand and repeat on the left side in a steady rhythm.
Safety cue: Rotate from the core, keep shoulders down and back

Health benefit: Challenges core stability while promoting shoulder endurance and hip drive
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a high plank with hands under shoulders and a slider or towel under both feet.
2. Draw your right knee toward your chest while keeping your hips level.
3. Slide the right foot back and immediately draw the left knee toward your chest.
4. Alternate knees in a controlled, continuous motion.
Safety cue: Maintain a strong plank, pull knees in without letting hips sag

Health benefit: Promotes full body mobility and controlled posterior chain engagement
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width apart and knees slightly bent.
2. Hinge slightly at the hips and reach your arms forward to prepare.
3. Press through your feet and straighten your body while lifting your arms overhead.
4. Lower your arms and return to the starting hinge to repeat.
Safety cue: Reach arms overhead while keeping ribs down and core engaged

Health benefit: Enhances core stability and coordinated contralateral limb control
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with arms extended toward the ceiling and knees bent at 90 degrees.
2. Slowly lower your right arm overhead and extend your left leg toward the floor while keeping your lower back neutral.
3. Bring the right arm and left leg back to the start position.
4. Repeat the movement on the opposite arm and leg while maintaining core control.
Safety cue: Press low back to floor, move limbs slowly while exhaling on effort

Health benefit: Improves hip mobility and glute activation
Steps to perform:
1. Get on all fours with hands under shoulders and knees under hips.
2. Bend one knee to 90 degrees and lift it out to the side to hip height.
3. Rotate the lifted knee in a controlled circular motion clockwise.
4. Reverse the circle direction or switch legs and repeat.
Safety cue: Keep hips level and core braced as you circle the lifted knee

Health benefit: Increases chest and anterior shoulder flexibility and supports upright posture
Steps to perform:
1. Stand in a doorway with feet shoulder-width apart.
2. Place forearms on each side of the door frame at shoulder height.
3. Step one foot forward and lean your chest through the frame until you feel a stretch.
Safety cue: Square shoulders and gently retract shoulder blades while breathing deeply into the chest

Health benefit: Enhances single-leg balance and posterior chain strength
Steps to perform:
1. Stand beside a chair or wall and place one hand lightly on it for support.
2. Shift weight onto the standing leg and soften the knee slightly.
3. Hinge at the hips and extend the opposite leg straight behind while lowering your torso.
4. Drive the hips forward to return to standing and keep the spine neutral.
Safety cue: Hinge from the hips with a neutral spine and keep the supporting knee soft

Health benefit: Challenges core stability and anti-rotation control while engaging shoulders
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a high plank with hands under shoulders and body in a straight line.
2. Brace your core and lift one hand to tap the opposite shoulder while keeping hips steady.
3. Return the hand to the floor and lift the other hand to tap the opposite shoulder.
4. Continue alternating taps while minimizing torso rotation.
Safety cue: Keep hips steady and minimize rotation as you tap each shoulder with control

Health benefit: Improves scapular mobility and promotes controlled shoulder movement
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with your back and heels against a wall and elbows bent at your sides like a "W."
2. Press your lower back and arms into the wall to maintain contact.
3. Slide your arms upward into a "Y" while keeping elbows and hands on the wall.
4. Lower back to the "W" position with control and repeat.
Safety cue: Maintain contact between low back and wall and glide shoulders without shrugging

Health benefit: Strengthens inner thigh muscles and aids hip adduction control
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your side with the bottom leg straight and the top leg bent in front for support.
2. Rest your head on your lower arm and place your top hand on the floor for stability.
3. Lift the bottom leg upward with a straight knee and pointed toe.
4. Lower the bottom leg with control and repeat.
Safety cue: Keep hips stacked and lift top leg slowly with control

Health benefit: Enhances thoracic extension and upper back mobility while activating scapular stabilizers
Steps to perform:
1. Lie face down with legs extended and arms resting by your sides.
2. Lift your chest slightly while keeping your neck neutral.
3. Sweep your arms out to the sides and overhead until they are beside your ears.
4. Reverse the motion to return to the start with control.
Safety cue: Keep neck neutral and squeeze shoulder blades together

Health benefit: Improves core coordination and lumbar stability through contralateral limb movement
Steps to perform:
1. Start on hands and knees with a flat back and eyes toward the floor.
2. Extend your right arm forward and your left leg back to form a straight line.
3. Pull your right elbow and left knee toward each other under your torso, then extend back and switch sides.
Safety cue: Brace core and move opposite arm and leg with controlled tempo

Health benefit: Elevates heart rate while engaging obliques and improving dynamic core stability
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a high plank with hands under shoulders and body in a straight line.
2. Drive your right knee toward your left elbow, then return it to the plank position.
3. Drive your left knee toward your right elbow and continue alternating rapidly.
Safety cue: Keep hips low and spine neutral as you drive knee to opposite elbow

Health benefit: Builds triceps endurance and encourages thoracic extension with forearm press mechanics
Steps to perform:
1. Lie face down and prop yourself on your forearms with elbows under shoulders.
2. Press through one palm then the other to straighten your arms and lift your chest into a high plank.
3. Pause briefly at the top with shoulders over wrists.
4. Lower back down onto your forearms one arm at a time and repeat.
Safety cue: Keep elbows under shoulders and maintain a neutral spine during each push up

Health benefit: Improves single-leg strength and balance
Steps to perform:
1. Stand on one leg a short distance in front of a stable chair with the other leg extended forward.
2. Hold a stable support with one hand and extend your arms for balance.
3. Bend the standing knee and lower your hips back and down toward the chair, keeping the extended leg straight.
4. Lightly touch the chair with your hips and push through the heel to stand back up with control.
Safety cue: Sit back toward the chair controlling the descent

Health benefit: Enhances core endurance and hip flexor strength
Steps to perform:
1. Sit tall on the floor with knees bent and feet flat.
2. Lean back slightly and lift your feet off the ground while extending your legs to form a V with your torso.
3. Reach your arms forward parallel to the floor, brace your core, and hold the position.
Safety cue: Keep a tall spine by drawing the navel toward the spine

Health benefit: Develops shoulder stability and upper body control
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a high plank with your feet touching the base of a wall and hands under your shoulders.
2. Slowly walk your feet up the wall while keeping a tight core until your body forms a slight incline.
3. Hold the partial inverted position briefly while maintaining straight arms and engaged shoulders.
4. Walk your feet back down the wall to return to the starting plank position.
Safety cue: Pack the shoulders and brace the core throughout the movement

Health benefit: Improves eccentric hamstring strength and posterior chain capacity
Steps to perform:
1. Kneel on a padded surface with your ankles secured under a sturdy anchor or held by a partner.
2. Keep your hips forward and torso straight as you slowly lean forward from the knees.
3. Control the descent as far as you can, using your hamstrings to resist the fall.
4. Use your hands to catch yourself if needed and push off lightly to return to the starting kneel.
Safety cue: Hinge at the hips and lower slowly with control

Health benefit: Enhances lateral core stability and oblique engagement
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your side and prop your body up on one elbow with feet stacked and hips lifted into a side plank.
2. Rotate your top arm underneath your torso and follow it with your chest, allowing your hips to open slightly.
3. Reverse the motion by reaching the top arm back up and returning to the side plank while keeping a straight line.
Safety cue: Stack shoulders and hips keeping a straight line to avoid lumbar collapse

Health benefit: Strengthens scapular control and promotes shoulder upward rotation
Steps to perform:
1. Get into a pike position with hands shoulder-width and hips raised high.
2. Keep arms straight and lift shoulders toward your ears in a controlled motion.
3. Lower shoulders by drawing the scapulae down while keeping elbows locked.
4. Repeat the shrugging motion with steady, controlled repetitions.
Safety cue: Brace core and shrug using only the scapula, keep elbows straight

Health benefit: Builds ankle plantarflexor strength and single-leg balance
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing a wall with one hand lightly touching it and the other foot lifted off the floor.
