2. Keep the standing leg straight and core steady.
3. Rise onto the ball of the foot by pushing through the ankle.
4. Lower the heel slowly back to the floor and repeat.
Safety cue: Push through midfoot to big toe, control lowering, keep knee soft

Health benefit: Develops rotational core strength and trunk stability
Steps to perform:
1. Sit with knees bent, lean back about 45 degrees, and lift both feet off the floor while holding your hands together or a weight.
2. Rotate your torso to bring your hands beside one hip.
3. Return to center and rotate to the opposite side.
4. Continue alternating twists with controlled movements.
Safety cue: Keep spine long and ribs down, rotate from torso, exhale on each twist

Health benefit: Improves coordination agility and upper body endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Stand in a boxing stance with hands up and knees slightly bent.
2. Drive an uppercut by rotating your hips and extending the punching arm upward.
3. Return the hand quickly to the guard position.
4. Alternate uppercuts from each side in a steady rhythm.
Safety cue: Drive power from hips, tuck chin, keep non punching hand guarding your face

Health benefit: Builds explosive upper body power and dynamic pushing strength
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a high plank with hands under shoulders and body in a straight line.
2. Lower your chest toward the floor with elbows tracking back.
3. Push explosively through your palms to lift your hands off the ground.
4. Land softly on your hands and descend into the next repetition.
Safety cue: Land softly, absorb impact with elbows slightly bent, keep core braced

Health benefit: Improves core strength and shoulder mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a high plank with hands under shoulders and body in a straight line.
2. Press hips up and back while keeping hands grounded to move into Down Dog.
3. Hold Down Dog briefly and breathe evenly.
4. Return hips forward to high plank and repeat the flow.
Safety cue: Keep hips controlled and core braced through each transition

Health benefit: Enhances abdominal strength and hip flexor control
Steps to perform:
1. Sit on the mat with knees bent and feet flat, hands behind hips for support.
2. Lean back slightly and lift feet a few inches off the floor to engage your core.
3. Pull knees toward your chest while exhaling and keep your back straight.
4. Extend legs forward without touching the floor and repeat the pulling motion.
Safety cue: Exhale as you pull knees in and maintain upright chest

Health benefit: Boosts lower body power and cardiovascular activation
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and hands up near your chest.
2. Drive one knee up toward your hands while snapping the hips forward like a strike.
3. Lower the leg and repeat on the other side in a controlled, alternating rhythm.
Safety cue: Snap knee up with controlled hip drive and stable standing leg

Health benefit: Improves static balance and proprioceptive awareness
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with one foot directly in front of the other so the heel of the front foot touches the toes of the back foot.
2. Focus on a fixed point and engage your core to maintain an upright posture.
3. Hold the position for the desired time, then switch feet and repeat.
Safety cue: Stack feet heel to toe and keep hips level over ankles

Health benefit: Enhances thoracic mobility and posterior shoulder stability
Steps to perform:
1. Lie face down with forehead on the mat and interlace hands behind your lower back like handcuffs.
2. Gently squeeze your shoulder blades together and lift your chest a few inches off the mat.
3. Keep your neck neutral and hold the lifted position while breathing evenly.
4. Lower your chest back to the mat and repeat the movement.
Safety cue: Keep neck neutral and squeeze shoulder blades together before moving arms

Health benefit: Strengthens glutes and enhances single leg balance
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and shift weight onto your left foot.
2. Hinge forward at the hips and lift your right leg back until your torso and raised leg form a straight line.
3. Reach your arms forward or keep them by your sides and square your hips to the floor.
4. Fix your gaze and hold the balance.
Safety cue: Hinge from the hips and keep your hips level over the standing leg

Health benefit: Targets hip adductor strength and core stability
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your right side next to an elevated support and place your top knee on the support.
2. Prop your right forearm on the ground under your shoulder and bend your bottom knee to the floor.
3. Press into your forearm and the elevated knee to lift your hips until your torso forms a straight line from head to knee.
4. Squeeze your obliques and hold the position.
Safety cue: Drive your hips level and brace your core to prevent sagging

Health benefit: Improves spinal rotation and shoulder mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Sit with feet flat and hands planted behind your hips, fingers pointing away.
2. Press into your hands and feet and lift your hips into the crab (tabletop) position.
3. Rotate your torso and reach your right arm overhead and back to touch the floor behind your left shoulder.
4. Return to center and repeat the reach with the left arm.
Safety cue: Lift hips, rotate through thoracic spine and open chest toward the ceiling

Health benefit: Promotes spinal extension and chest opening
Steps to perform:
1. Lie face down with hands under your shoulders and legs extended.
2. Engage your back and glutes and lift your chest using your back muscles while using your hands lightly.
3. Keep your shoulders down, hold briefly, and lower with control.
Safety cue: Press the tops of your feet and lift through the chest without collapsing lower back

Health benefit: Develops calf strength and eccentric control at the ankle
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with the balls of both feet on the edge of a step and hold a railing for balance.
2. Rise up onto your toes by lifting both heels off the edge.
3. Shift weight to one foot and slowly lower that heel below the step over several seconds.
4. Return both feet to the start and repeat for the other side.
Safety cue: Lower heels slowly with knees soft and hips stable, control the descent

Health benefit: Improves core strength and shoulder stability
Steps to perform:
1. Sit with knees bent, feet flat, and hands planted behind hips with fingers facing forward.
2. Press through hands and feet to lift hips into a reverse tabletop position.
3. Reach your right hand across your body to touch your left toe while keeping hips lifted.
4. Return to center, switch sides, and repeat alternating toe touches.
Safety cue: Keep hips lifted and core engaged while reaching to avoid sagging

Health benefit: Increases chest and shoulder flexibility and improves upper body posture
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing a corner and place your forearms on each wall at shoulder height.
2. Step one foot forward and lean your chest toward the corner until you feel a stretch across the front of your chest.
3. Keep a neutral spine and hold the position while breathing steadily.
Safety cue: Breathe deeply while keeping shoulders down and chest open toward the corner

Health benefit: Builds shoulder and upper body pressing strength while enhancing balance and proprioception
Steps to perform:
1. Place hands shoulder-width on the floor a few inches from a wall.
2. Kick up and rest your heels on the wall with your body straight.
3. Lower your head toward the floor by bending your elbows and keeping your core tight.
4. Press through your shoulders and extend your elbows to return to the start.
Safety cue: Keep neck neutral and press shoulders away from ears

Health benefit: Improves hamstring strength and eccentric control for stronger posterior chain
Steps to perform:
1. Kneel on a pad with your ankles secured under a stable anchor or partner.
2. Keep a straight line from knees to head and hinge slowly forward from the knees.
3. Use your hamstrings to control the descent as far as you can.
4. Catch yourself with your hands if needed and push off to return to kneeling.
Safety cue: Keep hips extended and lower slowly to control hamstring load

Health benefit: Develops core and hip flexor strength while improving shoulder and scapular stability
Steps to perform:
1. Sit between parallel bars or on the floor with hands beside your hips and fingers pointing forward.
2. Press down through your hands to lift your hips and straighten your legs into an L position.
3. Hold the position with a tight core and steady breathing.
Safety cue: Press hands hard and protract shoulders while tucking pelvis to keep legs level

Health benefit: Enhances shoulder and chest strength while demanding core stability and wrist conditioning
Steps to perform:
1. Place hands slightly wider than shoulder-width and turn your fingers toward your feet.
2. Lean forward so your shoulders move past your hands while keeping your body straight.
3. Bend your elbows to lower your chest toward the floor while maintaining the forward lean.
4. Push through your hands to extend your elbows and return to the start.
Safety cue: Lean torso forward with shoulders over hands and brace core throughout movement

Health benefit: Promotes full body coordination and core stability while building shoulder endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Start on hands and feet with hips low and knees hovering a few inches off the ground.
2. Move opposite hand and foot forward simultaneously while keeping your hips stable.
3. Continue crawling forward with short steps and steady breathing.
Safety cue: Keep spine neutral and hips low while moving opposite hand and foot with control

Health benefit: Boosts cardiovascular endurance and coordination while enhancing hand speed and agility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand in a staggered stance with hands up at chin and knees soft.
2. Throw rapid punches (jab, cross, hook, uppercut) with full extension and quick returns.
3. Move with light footwork, pivot, and slip to simulate defense.
4. Maintain a high tempo and keep your core engaged.
Safety cue: Keep chest tall and shoulders relaxed while exhaling through each controlled punch

Health benefit: Combines core stabilization with dynamic hip abduction and light cardiovascular challenge
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a high plank with hands under shoulders and body in a straight line.
2. Jump both feet out wide and then back together like a horizontal jumping jack.
3. Keep hips steady and core tight throughout the movement.
Safety cue: Hips stay level and core braced as you jump feet in and out

Health benefit: Enhances core rotational stability and hip mobility while elevating heart rate
Steps to perform:
1. Begin in a high plank with hands under shoulders and body straight.
2. Drive your right knee toward your left elbow, return to plank, then drive your left knee toward your right elbow.
3. Keep hips low and core engaged while alternating quickly.
Safety cue: Pull belly button to spine and drive knee across opposite elbow with steady breath

Health benefit: Improves posterior chain flexibility and shoulder mobility while engaging core stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width and hinge at the hips to place hands on the floor.
2. Walk your hands forward into a high plank while keeping legs as straight as possible.
3. Walk your hands back toward your feet, hinge up, and roll to standing.
Safety cue: Hinge from hips keeping lower back flat as you walk hands outward

Health benefit: Develops upper body strength with improved thoracic mobility and dynamic shoulder control
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a downward dog with hands shoulder-width and hips high.
2. Bend your elbows and swoop your chest forward and down in a fluid arc.
3. Press your chest forward and up into an upward-facing dog, extending the spine.
4. Lift hips back to downward dog and repeat the flowing motion.
Safety cue: Move through a smooth spinal arc keeping shoulders over hands and exhaling on effort

Health benefit: Enhances thoracic mobility and posterior chain strength
Steps to perform:
1. Sit with feet flat and hands behind your hips, fingers pointing forward.
2. Press through hands and feet to lift hips into a reverse tabletop.
3. Reach one arm overhead and rotate your chest toward the ceiling, following with your gaze.
4. Lower hips and return hands to the floor; repeat on the opposite side.
Safety cue: Lift hips and rotate thoracic spine with controlled movement

Health benefit: Improves hip rotational mobility and transitional control
Steps to perform:
1. Sit in a shin box with one shin in front and the other behind, torso upright.
2. Place hands beside your hips and hinge forward slightly.
3. Shift weight onto your hands, lift hips, and rotate to swing the legs so the opposite shin comes forward.
4. Lower hips and settle into the new shin box position.
Safety cue: Control pelvic rotation and maintain a neutral spine during each switch

Health benefit: Promotes full body mobility with thoracic rotation and hip flexor opening
Steps to perform:
1. Step forward into a deep lunge with the front knee above the ankle.
2. Place the opposite hand inside the front foot and lower your hips toward the floor.
3. Rotate your torso and reach the front arm up toward the ceiling, opening the chest.
4. Return hands to the floor and step back; repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Keep hips square to the front leg and elongate the spine

Health benefit: Develops thoracic extension and posterior chain activation
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent, feet flat, and arms by your ears.
2. Press through feet and hands to lift hips and chest toward the ceiling.
3. Reach one arm overhead and rotate your chest open toward that side.
4. Lower hips and return the arm; repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Press through shoulders keeping ribs down and lengthening the thoracic spine

Health benefit: Increases hip external rotation and glute flexibility
Steps to perform:
1. Start in tabletop or downward dog and bring one knee forward, placing it behind the same-side wrist.
2. Extend the opposite leg straight back and square your hips toward the front.
3. Walk your hands forward and lengthen your spine over the front shin.
4. Fold deeper by lowering your torso toward the floor or a prop; repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Square your hips forward and breathe into the front hip to relax

Health benefit: Improves shoulder mobility and scapular control
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat, arms at your sides with palms up.
2. Press your lower back gently toward the floor and keep your head relaxed on the ground.
3. Slide your arms overhead in a wide arc, keeping wrists, elbows, and shoulders in contact with the floor.
4. Reverse the motion and return your arms to your sides with controlled movement.
Safety cue: Keep low back gently pressed into the floor as you slowly move arms

Health benefit: Enhances hamstring and adductor flexibility and pelvic mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Sit on the floor in a wide straddle with legs extended and toes pointing up.
2. Sit tall and lengthen your spine, keeping your chest open.
3. Hinge at the hips and reach your hands forward toward the center floor.
4. Hold the forward position while maintaining a long spine.
Safety cue: Anchor sitting bones and hinge from hips to lead with chest

Health benefit: Promotes spinal extension and anterior chest opening
Steps to perform:
1. Lie face down with legs extended and the tops of your feet on the mat, hands under your shoulders.
2. Press through your palms to lift your chest slowly, keeping elbows slightly bent and shoulders down.
3. Look slightly forward to extend the spine, then lower your torso back down with control.
Safety cue: Lift through the sternum while keeping pelvis grounded and shoulders away from ears

Health benefit: Improves wrist mobility and forearm flexibility
Steps to perform:
1. Extend one arm straight in front with the palm facing down and fingers pointing away.
2. Use the opposite hand to gently pull your fingers and hand back toward you until you feel a stretch on the top of the forearm.
3. Hold the stretch, then switch arms and repeat.
Safety cue: Keep elbow straight and move only through wrist with slow controlled motion

Health benefit: Develops hamstring strength while improving balance and single-leg stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and shift your weight onto one leg, softening the standing knee.
2. Hinge at the hips while reaching the opposite leg straight back and lowering your torso toward the floor.
3. Keep your back flat and core engaged as you lower until you feel a stretch in the standing hamstring.
4. Drive through the heel of the standing leg to return to standing, then repeat and switch sides.
Safety cue: Hinge at hips with a neutral spine and soft knee for balance

Health benefit: Builds lateral core strength and shoulder stability
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your side and prop up on your forearm with elbow under shoulder.
2. Stack your feet and lift your hips until your body forms a straight line.
3. Reach your top arm toward the ceiling and lift your top leg toward the same side to open into a star.
4. Hold briefly, then lower your leg and hips back down with control.
Safety cue: Brace core and keep hips stacked so body forms a straight line

Health benefit: Improves spinal coordination and contralateral limb control
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a high plank with hands under shoulders and body in a straight line.
2. Brace your core and lift your right arm forward while extending your left leg back to align with your torso.
3. Keep your hips square and maintain a flat back as you hold the extension.
4. Lower your arm and leg with control and repeat on the opposite side.
Safety cue: Keep spine neutral and move limbs slowly without twisting hips

Health benefit: Strengthens calf muscles and enhances single leg balance
Steps to perform:
1. Stand on one foot with the other foot lifted slightly off the floor.
2. Push through the ball of your standing foot to raise your heel as high as possible.
3. Lower your heel slowly back to the floor with control and repeat.
Safety cue: Control the rise and lower with a straight standing leg and steady ankle

Health benefit: Enhances balance and hip stability through unilateral control
Steps to perform:
1. Stand on one leg and hinge forward at the hips while extending the other leg straight back.
2. Reach your arms out to the sides or forward to create a T-shaped balance.
3. Keep your torso and extended leg in a straight line and your hips level.
4. Return to standing by lowering the back leg and lifting your torso.
Safety cue: Hinge from the standing hip with chest lifted and hips level

Health benefit: Develops intense core strength and eccentric control
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on a bench or mat and grip behind your head or the bench for support.
2. Press through your shoulders and hips to lift your body into a straight, vertical line from shoulders to feet.
3. Lower your body slowly and with control while keeping it rigid and straight.
4. Stop before your shoulders touch the bench and reset for the next rep.
Safety cue: Lower slowly with a braced core and neutral neck to protect spine

Health benefit: Targets inner thigh strength while challenging lateral core stability
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your side next to a bench or elevated surface with the top leg closest to the bench.
2. Place the top foot or inner thigh on the bench and stack your forearm under your shoulder for support.
3. Press your hips up into a straight line from head to bottom leg, lifting the lower leg off the floor.
4. Hold the position while keeping hips square and the supporting inner thigh engaged.
Safety cue: Keep hips stacked and avoid sagging through the waist

Health benefit: Increases triceps and chest strength with enhanced pressing mechanics
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a high plank with hands under the chest and thumbs and index fingers touching to form a diamond.
2. Keep your body in a straight line and engage your core and glutes.
3. Lower your chest toward the diamond by bending your elbows and keeping them close to your sides.
4. Push through your palms to extend your arms and return to the starting position.
Safety cue: Align hands under sternum and lower with a straight spine

Health benefit: Boosts aerobic fitness and full body coordination through rhythmic movement
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet together and arms extended out to the sides at shoulder height.
2. Jump feet wide while bringing your hands together in front of your chest and clap.
3. Jump feet back together while sweeping your arms out to the sides and clap behind you.
Safety cue: Land softly with knees slightly bent and chest lifted

Health benefit: Builds wider chest activation and shoulder endurance during pressing
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a high plank with hands wider than shoulder-width and feet hip-width apart.
2. Keep your body straight and lower your chest toward the floor by bending your elbows outward.
3. Push through your palms to straighten your arms and return to the starting plank.
Safety cue: Keep elbows tracking slightly back and maintain a neutral spine

Health benefit: Strengthens posterior chain and promotes shoulder and hip extension control
Steps to perform:
1. Sit with legs extended, place hands slightly behind hips with fingers pointing toward your feet.
2. Press through your hands and heels to lift your hips until your body forms a straight line from head to heels.
3. Squeeze your glutes and hold the straight position while keeping your neck neutral.
Safety cue: Press through heels to lift hips and keep shoulders down away from ears
is_not_suitable_for: Hypertension, Coronary Artery Disease, Sleep Apnea

Health benefit: Enhances core stability and posterior chain engagement
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with arms extended overhead and legs straight.
2. Press your lower back into the floor and lift your head, shoulders, and legs to form a hollow shape.
3. Rock gently back toward your shoulders and forward to your hips using small controlled movements.
4. Maintain a braced core and steady breathing throughout the rocks.
Safety cue: Keep lower back pressed to floor and maintain a hollow core

Health benefit: Strengthens hip abductors and improves lateral pelvic control
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your side with hips and knees bent at 45 degrees and feet together.
2. Keep your pelvis still and lift the top knee open while keeping the heels touching.
3. Hold the open position, squeeze the glute, and keep steady breathing.
Safety cue: Keep hips stacked and knees aligned squeeze glutes without rotating torso

Health benefit: Develops abdominal power and hip flexor coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with arms extended overhead and legs straight.
2. Engage your core and simultaneously lift your torso and legs to reach your hands toward your toes.
3. Touch or reach past your toes at the top, keeping a strong midline.
4. Lower back down with control and repeat.
Safety cue: Exhale as you rise hinge from hips and keep chest lifted

Health benefit: Builds shoulder stability and dynamic core strength through coordinated limb movement
Steps to perform:
1. Start on hands and knees, lift your knees an inch or two off the ground so hips and shoulders form a tabletop position.
2. Brace your core, keep a neutral spine, and distribute weight evenly through your hands.
3. Lift the right hand and left foot off the ground in a controlled straight line, then place them down.
4. Repeat by lifting the left hand and right foot, alternating with smooth, controlled motions.
Safety cue: Keep spine neutral brace core move limbs slowly without pelvic rotation

Health benefit: Improves rotational power and anaerobic conditioning
Steps to perform:
1. Stand in a boxing stance with knees soft, hands up protecting the chin, and weight slightly on the back foot.
2. Drive quick upward punches from the hips and legs, rotating the torso and snapping the fist toward chin level.
3. Alternate hands rapidly in short bursts while keeping the other hand guarding and maintaining a compact, rhythmic tempo.
Safety cue: Exhale with each punch rotate hips keep chin tucked

Health benefit: Enhances posterior shoulder endurance and scapular mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Lie face down with arms extended overhead and legs straight.
2. Lift your chest and thighs a few inches off the floor.
3. Sweep your right arm down along your side as the left arm reaches back overhead in a fast swimming motion.
4. Alternate arms rapidly while keeping your movements controlled.
Safety cue: Keep neck neutral and move arms with controlled speed

Health benefit: Challenges core stability while promoting shoulder and anti-rotation control
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a high plank with hands under shoulders and body in a straight line.
2. Brace your core and minimize hip movement.
3. Lift your right hand to tap your left shoulder and return it to the floor.
4. Alternate hands in a steady rhythm while keeping hips square to the floor.
Safety cue: Brace core and minimize hip rotation during each shoulder tap

Health benefit: Activates glutes and improves pelvic stability with coordinated hip extension
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and feet hip-width on the floor.
2. Press your hips up into a bridge until your body forms a straight line from shoulders to knees.
3. Lift your right knee toward your chest, lower it back, then lift your left knee with a controlled tempo.
4. Continue alternating marches while keeping hips elevated and steady.
Safety cue: Keep ribs down and drive hips up with slow controlled marches

Health benefit: Supports lateral mobility and low-impact cardiovascular movement
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet together and knees slightly bent.
2. Step to the right and bring the left foot to touch next to it while swinging your arms naturally.
3. Repeat to the left side in a smooth, low-impact rhythm.
Safety cue: Land softly through midfoot and keep chest lifted

Health benefit: Increases shoulder joint mobility and local muscular endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width and extend arms straight out to the sides at shoulder height.
2. Make small, fast circles with both arms moving forward at high speed.
3. Reverse the direction after a short interval and maintain quick, controlled motion.
Safety cue: Keep a tall posture and control shoulder rotation without shrugging

Health benefit: Enhances deep core stability and coordinated breathing
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent at 90 degrees and arms extended toward the ceiling.
2. Brace your core and press your lower back gently into the floor.
3. Slowly extend your right leg and lower your left arm toward the floor with controlled tempo until a few inches above the ground.
4. Return to center and repeat on the opposite side with the same slow, controlled motion.
Safety cue: Maintain low back contact with floor as you move limbs slowly

Health benefit: Improves shoulder mobility and hamstring flexibility while challenging core control
Steps to perform:
1. Stand feet hip-width apart and hinge at the hips to place your hands on the floor.
2. Walk your hands forward until your body forms a straight line from head to heels.
3. Walk your hands back toward your feet, hinge up, and return to standing.
Safety cue: Hinge from hips keeping spine long and core braced

Health benefit: Improves single-leg balance and posterior chain strength
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and shift your weight into the right foot while lifting the left foot behind you.
2. Hinge forward at the hips and extend your torso forward as you raise the left leg until they form a straight line.
3. Reach your arms forward or out to the sides to help balance and keep hips level.
4. Hold briefly, then return to standing and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Keep hips level and a soft knee in the standing leg

Health benefit: Builds wrist strength and static balance through shoulder and core engagement
Steps to perform:
1. Squat low and place your hands shoulder-width on the floor with fingers spread.
2. Bend your elbows slightly and position your knees on the backs of your upper arms near the triceps.
3. Lean your weight forward and lift your feet off the ground to balance on your hands.
4. Keep a steady gaze, hold briefly, and lower your feet back down with control.
Safety cue: Bring shoulder blades together and lean forward gradually keeping core braced

Health benefit: Promotes scapular mobility and improved thoracic posture awareness
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with your back, hips, and head against a wall and bend elbows so forearms touch the wall in a "W" shape.
2. Press your forearms into the wall and engage your shoulder blades by drawing them down and together.
3. Slide your arms upward into a "Y" position, then return to the "W" with controlled movement.
Safety cue: Keep low back flat press arms and hands to wall while sliding up

Health benefit: Enhances spinal mobility and segmental control through slow movement
Steps to perform:
1. Start on hands and knees with wrists under shoulders and knees under hips.
2. Tilt the pelvis forward and lift the chest, extending the spine one segment at a time.
3. Tuck the tailbone and round the spine sequentially from lower to upper back.
4. Move slowly and repeat the segmental flexion and extension with control.
Safety cue: Articulate each vertebra slowly while breathing and bracing your core

Health benefit: Improves hip adductor mobility and deep hip opening
Steps to perform:
1. Start on hands and knees with knees wider than hips and toes pointed.
2. Keep your chest lifted and slide your hips back toward your heels to stretch the inner thighs.
3. Return to hands and knees by sliding your hips forward under control.
Safety cue: Keep chest over knee and hinge from hips to protect lower back

Health benefit: Improves glute and external rotator flexibility and hip mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat on the floor.
2. Cross your right ankle over your left thigh just above the knee.
3. Thread your hands behind the left thigh and pull it toward your chest until you feel a stretch.
Safety cue: Gently draw knee toward chest keeping low back pressed to floor

Health benefit: Stretches chest muscles and promotes anterior shoulder mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand in a doorway and place your forearm and palm on the frame at shoulder height.
2. Step one foot forward and lean your torso through the doorway until you feel a stretch across the chest.
3. Keep your spine neutral and repeat on the opposite side.
Safety cue: Align forearm on frame at shoulder height avoid arching low back

Health benefit: Develops upper body pulling strength and scapular control
Steps to perform:
1. Grip a pull-up bar with hands slightly wider than shoulder-width and palms facing away.
2. Hang with shoulders engaged by pulling them down and back.
3. Pull your body up by driving your elbows down until your chin clears the bar.
4. Lower back to the dead hang with control.
Safety cue: Retract shoulder blades and engage lats before initiating the pull

Health benefit: Enhances single-leg strength and balance
Steps to perform:
1. Stand on one leg facing a low box or chair, and extend the other leg forward.
2. Reach your hips back and lower your hips toward the box while keeping your chest upright.
3. Sit lightly on the box with control and keep weight in the standing heel.
4. Drive through the standing heel to return to standing and repeat.
Safety cue: Keep chest up and sit back onto the box with controlled descent

Health benefit: Builds shoulder strength and balance through inverted loading
Steps to perform:
1. Place hands shoulder-width on the floor a short distance from a wall.
2. Kick up so your heels make contact with the wall.
3. Press through your shoulders and engage your core to lengthen the body.
4. Hold the position for the desired time and control the descent back down.
Safety cue: Press through shoulders and keep hips stacked over shoulders

Health benefit: Strengthens core and hip flexors while challenging grip endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Hang from a pull-up bar with hands shoulder-width and legs extended.
2. Brace your core and tuck your knees toward your chest by curling your pelvis up.
3. Pause briefly at the top with knees near your chest.
4. Lower your legs back to a full hang with control and repeat.
Safety cue: Exhale as you curl knees up and control the lowering

Health benefit: Targets upper chest and triceps to increase pressing strength
Steps to perform:
1. Place your feet on an elevated surface and hands shoulder-width on the floor so your body forms a straight line.
2. Brace your core and lower your chest toward the floor by bending your elbows.
3. Keep your body rigid and stop just before the chest touches the floor.
4. Push through your hands to return to the start and repeat.
Safety cue: Maintain a straight spine and brace core through each rep

Health benefit: Develops unilateral pushing power and shoulder stability
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a wide push-up stance with one hand out to the side and the other under your shoulder.
2. Shift your weight to the side of the planted arm and bend that elbow to lower your chest toward it while straightening the opposite arm.
3. Keep your torso level and control the descent.
4. Push back to the center and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Shift weight deliberately and keep shoulders level with slow tempo

Health benefit: Builds hamstring and glute strength and improves posterior chain control
Steps to perform:
1. Kneel with your ankles anchored and your torso upright over your knees.
2. Keep your body straight from knees to head and hinge at the knees to lower forward.
3. Engage your hamstrings and glutes to pull your torso back to the start.
4. Control the movement and avoid collapsing at the hips.
Safety cue: Brace core and keep body straight while lowering under hamstring control

Health benefit: Targets triceps strength and elbow extension control
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back under a stable bar or handle and grasp it shoulder-width.
2. Extend your arms so your body forms a straight line and hinge at the elbows to lower your forehead toward your hands.
3. Press through your triceps to extend the elbows and return to the start.
Safety cue: Keep upper arms still and lower under strict elbow control

Health benefit: Improves lateral agility and hip activation for dynamic movement
Steps to perform:
1. Stand in an athletic stance with knees bent and hips high.
2. Push off laterally with one foot and shuffle quickly to the side while keeping hips elevated.
3. Maintain a quick rhythm and reverse direction by leading with the other foot.
Safety cue: Maintain high hips with an upright torso and soft knees

Health benefit: Develops lateral power and coordination with low impact force
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with slight knee bend and weight on one leg.
2. Push off and jump a short distance laterally to land on the opposite leg while swinging your arms for momentum.
3. Immediately push back to the other side with quick, light contacts and soft knees.
Safety cue: Drive from hips, keep chest up and land softly under control

Health benefit: Engages obliques and enhances trunk rotational speed
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with hands behind your head and feet hip-width apart.
2. Lift your right knee and rotate your torso to bring the right elbow toward the right knee.
3. Alternate sides quickly, driving each knee up and crunching the obliques.
Safety cue: Exhale on each crunch and keep hips stacked to avoid rotation

Health benefit: Improves foot speed and neuromuscular coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width and knees soft.
2. Rapidly alternate tapping the balls of your feet on the floor with a light bounce.
3. Keep an upright posture and a quick, steady rhythm.
Safety cue: Keep chest lifted and knees soft land lightly on midfoot

Health benefit: Enhances core stability and shoulder mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a high plank with hands under shoulders and body in a straight line.
2. Shift hips back and up into Down Dog by lifting hips and pressing heels toward the floor.
3. Return to high plank with control, keeping shoulders stacked over wrists.
4. Repeat the movement with a steady, controlled tempo.
Safety cue: Control the transition keep core braced and shoulders away from ears

Health benefit: Promotes hamstring engagement and elevates heart rate
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width and arms relaxed.
2. Jog in place and drive heels up toward the glutes with each step.
3. Pump the arms and maintain a quick, consistent tempo.
Safety cue: Maintain upright chest and drive heels toward glutes with controlled tempo

Health benefit: Strengthens lower abdominal endurance and hip flexor control
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with hands tucked under your hips and legs extended.
2. Lift both legs a few inches off the floor to a small range of motion.
3. Alternate small, controlled kicks with toes pointed and minimal hip movement.
4. Keep the lower back pressed to the floor and maintain core tension.
Safety cue: Keep lower back pressed to mat and breathe steadily

Health benefit: Develops anti rotation core stability and shoulder endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Place hands on an elevated surface and assume a plank with body in a straight line.
2. Shift weight into one hand and lift the opposite hand to tap the opposite shoulder.
3. Return the hand to the surface and repeat on the other side.
4. Stabilize the hips and minimize torso rotation with each tap.
Safety cue: Minimize hip rotation by bracing core and tapping slowly

Health benefit: Enhances thoracic rotation and hip mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Lie face down with arms extended out at shoulder height and legs straight.
2. Bend one knee and lift the foot toward the opposite hand while rotating the hips and spine.
3. Reach the foot toward the opposite hand until a gentle stretch is felt across the lower back and glute.
4. Return the foot to the floor and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Keep hips grounded and rotate through thoracic spine not lower back

Health benefit: Builds lateral strength and single leg mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with a wide stance and toes pointing forward.
2. Shift weight to one leg and bend that knee while keeping the other leg straight with toes up.
3. Lower into a shallow squat until the bent thigh is near parallel to the floor.
4. Push through the heel of the bent leg to return to center and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Keep hips back and chest tall control movement keeping knee tracking over toes

Health benefit: Improves thoracic mobility and spinal rotation control
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your side with knees bent and arms together in front of your chest.
2. Rotate the top arm up and open it across your body toward the opposite side while turning the chest and head to follow.
3. Return the arm to the starting position and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Keep lower back connected to floor and initiate rotation from thoracic spine

Health benefit: Strengthens obliques and lateral core endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a side plank on your forearm with the body in a straight line and feet stacked.
2. Lower your hips toward the floor in a controlled motion until the hips are just above the ground.
3. Raise your hips back to the starting side plank position and repeat.
Safety cue: Keep hips stacked and core braced as you lower and raise slowly

Health benefit: Improves single leg balance and posterior chain strength
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall on one leg with a slight bend in the knee and the other leg relaxed behind you.
2. Hinge at the hips and lean your torso forward while extending the non-supporting leg straight back.
3. Keep your back flat and reach both hands toward the floor until you feel a stretch in the standing hamstring.
4. Drive the hips forward to return to standing and switch legs.
Safety cue: Hinge at hips with neutral spine and soft knee reach with controlled motion

Health benefit: Improves quadriceps flexibility and knee range of motion
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart.
2. Shift weight onto your left leg and bend your right knee.
3. Reach back and grasp your right ankle or foot.
4. Pull your heel toward your glute and keep knees close together.
Safety cue: Keep hips square and core engaged as you pull heel toward glutes

Health benefit: Enhances triceps and shoulder flexibility for better arm mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Sit or stand tall and raise your right arm overhead.
2. Bend your right elbow and drop your hand behind your head.
3. Reach your left hand to the right elbow and pull gently down.
4. Keep your torso upright and relax your shoulders.
Safety cue: Keep chest lifted and spine long while avoiding shoulder shrug

Health benefit: Increases hamstring and lower back flexibility while promoting relaxation
Steps to perform:
1. Sit on the floor with legs extended and spine tall.
2. Flex your feet and actively press your heels forward.
3. Hinge at the hips and lengthen your spine as you lean forward.
4. Reach toward your shins or feet and soften your shoulders.
Safety cue: Hinge from hips and keep a long spine as you fold

Health benefit: Builds shoulder and upper chest strength with emphasis on vertical pressing
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a pike position with hips raised and hands shoulder-width apart.
2. Bend your elbows to lower your forehead toward the floor.
3. Press through your hands to straighten your arms and return to start.
4. Keep your core engaged and neck neutral throughout the movement.
Safety cue: Brace core and maintain a straight line from hips to hands as you lower

Health benefit: Improves unilateral leg strength balance and hip mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand a couple of feet in front of a bench and place your back foot on the bench.
2. Step your front foot forward and align your front knee over your ankle.
3. Lower your back knee toward the floor by bending the front knee.
4. Drive through your front heel to return to the starting position.
Safety cue: Keep front knee tracking over toes and maintain upright chest with core engaged

Health benefit: Strengthens core and hip flexors while enhancing shoulder stability
Steps to perform:
1. Grab a pull-up bar with an overhand grip and hang with arms fully extended.
2. Pull your shoulders down and lift your knees toward your chest, keeping knees bent and shins parallel to the floor.
3. Hold the bent-knee L-sit position, keeping your core engaged and your back straight.
Safety cue: Depress shoulders and brace your core while keeping knees together

Health benefit: Develops back and biceps strength while improving pulling mechanics
Steps to perform:
1. Set a bar at waist height and lie underneath it with an underhand grip shoulder-width apart.
2. Plant your heels and extend your body so it forms a straight line from head to heels.
3. Pull your chest toward the bar by driving your elbows back and squeezing your shoulder blades.
4. Lower yourself with control until your arms are extended.
Safety cue: Maintain a straight body line and pull your chest to the bar

Health benefit: Enhances core stability and oblique engagement for better trunk control
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a forearm plank with elbows under shoulders and body in a straight line.
2. Press one hand into the floor and push up onto the same-side palm, then place the other hand beside it to come into a high plank.
3. Lower back down onto the forearm of the first arm, then lower the second forearm to return to the starting position.
4. Continue alternating sides while keeping hips stable and core tight.
Safety cue: Keep hips level and core braced during controlled hand switches

Health benefit: Targets lower back and glute strength to support posterior chain function
Steps to perform:
1. Lie face down with arms extended overhead and legs straight.
2. Simultaneously lift your chest, arms, and legs a few inches off the ground by contracting your lower back and glutes.
3. Hold briefly at the top, then lower with control to the starting position.
Safety cue: Keep neck neutral and lift through glutes and upper back without overextending

Health benefit: Increases triceps and chest strength with a focus on elbow extension
Steps to perform:
1. Get into a high plank with hands directly under your chest and palms close together.
2. Keep elbows tucked close to your sides and lower your chest toward your hands while maintaining a straight body line.
3. Push back up to the starting position by extending your elbows and squeezing your triceps.
Safety cue: Tuck elbows toward ribs and maintain a rigid plank from head to heels

Health benefit: Builds lower-body strength and improves unilateral leg power and balance
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing the box with feet hip-width apart.
2. Step your right foot fully onto the box and press through the heel.
3. Bring your left foot up to stand tall on the box.
4. Step back down with the left foot then the right and repeat leading with the same leg.
Safety cue: Keep hips level and press through the heel of the lead foot

Health benefit: Enhances lateral core strength and hip stability
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your right side and prop your body on your right forearm with legs stacked.
2. Lift your hips until your body forms a straight line from head to heels.
3. Raise your top leg upward while keeping your hips stable.
4. Lower the top leg with control and repeat, then switch sides.
Safety cue: Stack hips and shoulders and engage obliques while lifting with control

Health benefit: Boosts full-body conditioning and anaerobic power
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet shoulder-width apart.
2. Drop into a squat, place hands on the floor, and kick your feet back into a plank.
3. Perform a push-up, jump your feet back toward your hands, and explode upward into a jump.
4. Land softly and reset for the next repetition.
Safety cue: Land softly with knees slightly bent and maintain neutral spine
is_not_suitable_for: Obesity, Osteoporosis, Hypertension, Coronary Artery Disease, COPD

Health benefit: Improves hand-eye coordination and upper body endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with knees slightly bent, hands up, and elbows tucked.
2. Strike the bag rhythmically with alternating fists using quick wrist snaps.
3. Maintain a steady tempo and light foot movement while continuing the punches.
Safety cue: Keep wrists firm and shoulders relaxed and breathe out on each punch

Health benefit: Increases cardiovascular activation and whole-body mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet together and arms at your sides.
2. Jump your feet wide while raising your arms overhead.
3. Jump your feet back together while lowering your arms to your sides and repeat.
Safety cue: Land softly on balls of feet and keep knees tracking toes

Health benefit: Builds upper-body strength and enhances scapular control
Steps to perform:
1. Get into a high plank with hands wider than shoulder-width and feet together.
2. Lower your chest toward one hand in a controlled push-up motion.
3. Shift your weight and slide your upper body laterally across to the other hand.
4. Push back up to plank and reverse the slide to repeat on the opposite side.
Safety cue: Keep shoulders stacked over wrists and core braced as you shift side to side

Health benefit: Targets obliques and improves rotational core control
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width and hands lightly behind your head.
2. Lift your right knee and twist your torso to bring your left elbow toward the right knee.
3. Lower and repeat on the opposite side in a smooth, controlled motion.
Safety cue: Stand tall pull ribs down rotate from ribs not shoulders

Health benefit: Enhances lateral power and dynamic balance for agility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand on one foot with a slight knee bend and hips low.
2. Push off explosively and jump sideways, landing on the opposite foot.
3. Absorb the landing by bending the knee and keeping hips low.
4. Immediately explode back to the other side and continue controlled bounds.
Safety cue: Land softly on midfoot with knees tracking over toes and hips level

Health benefit: Improves hip flexor explosiveness and lower-body coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a light squat with feet hip-width and weight centered.
2. Jump and switch feet midair so one foot moves forward and the other moves back.
3. Land softly with knees slightly bent and continue alternating at a steady tempo.
Safety cue: Keep hips stable and core tight control leg swing through the entire range

Health benefit: Increases hip mobility and dynamic balance
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and hold a stable support with one hand for balance.
2. Swing the free leg forward and then across your body in a controlled arc.
3. Reverse the motion to swing the leg out to the side and repeat, then switch legs.
Safety cue: Maintain neutral spine hinge slightly from hips and swing with control

Health benefit: Enhances hip internal and external rotation mobility and movement coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Sit with both hips and knees bent at 90 degrees, one leg in front and the other to the side, hands on the floor for support.
2. Rotate your hips and bring the back leg forward while moving the front leg back to switch positions.
3. Use your hands and core to control the movement and keep both knees at about 90 degrees.
4. Repeat the switch deliberately, alternating which leg is in front each repetition.
Safety cue: Maintain a tall spine and control hip rotation

Health benefit: Strengthens posterior chain and improves hip extension and shoulder stability
Steps to perform:
1. Sit with feet flat hip-width apart and hands behind hips with fingers pointing toward your feet.
2. Press through your feet and hands to lift your hips and torso into a straight line from shoulders to knees.
3. Squeeze your glutes and open your chest while holding the elevated position.
4. Lower your hips slowly back to the starting position with control.
Safety cue: Press through heels, lift hips, keep neck neutral

Health benefit: Improves proprioception and single leg balance under reduced visual input
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and lift one foot off the ground so the supporting knee is slightly bent.
2. Close your eyes and maintain a steady upright posture without tensing your shoulders.
3. Hold for the desired time then open your eyes and switch legs.
Safety cue: Soften standing knee, brace core, keep hips level

Health benefit: Builds lower body strength while enhancing rotational core control and dynamic balance
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and step forward with one leg into a deep lunge so both knees are roughly 90 degrees.
2. Rotate your torso toward the front leg and reach both arms in the direction of the twist.
3. Push through the front heel to rise and step the back leg forward into the next lunge.
4. Continue moving forward, alternating legs and repeating the twist on each step.
Safety cue: Keep chest tall, rotate from thoracic spine, front knee tracking toes

Health benefit: Promotes hamstring flexibility and posterior chain mobility during dynamic hinge movement
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width and hinge at the hips to reach toward the floor with straight or slightly bent knees.
2. Walk your hands forward a short distance while keeping the hips high and hamstrings engaged.
3. Step or shuffle your feet toward your hands and repeat the forward "walk" pattern.
Safety cue: Hinge from hips, keep spine neutral, maintain soft knees

Health benefit: Develops single leg balance and ankle stability while refining posture and focus
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart.
2. Shift weight onto one leg and lift the opposite foot to rest on your inner calf or inner thigh.
3. Bring hands to prayer at your chest or raise them overhead.
4. Fix your gaze forward and hold the position.
Safety cue: Press standing foot firmly into ground and lengthen your spine

Health benefit: Improves scapular upward rotation and shoulder mobility with thoracic extension emphasis
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing the wall with feet a few inches away and knees soft.
2. Place forearms and palms flat on the wall at shoulder height.
3. Slide your arms upward while keeping contact with the wall.
4. Slide your arms back down to the start with controlled motion.
Safety cue: Keep ribcage down and lower back neutral as you slide arms

Health benefit: Builds upper body pulling strength and enhances lat and biceps engagement
Steps to perform:
1. Grasp a bar with an underhand grip shoulder-width apart and hang with arms extended.
2. Engage your back and pull your elbows down and back.
3. Pull until your chin clears the bar and your chest approaches the bar.
4. Lower yourself slowly to the start position with control.
Safety cue: Lead with chest, retract shoulder blades and control the descent

Health benefit: Targets triceps strength while challenging shoulder and core stability
Steps to perform:
1. Sit on the edge of a bench and place your hands beside your hips with fingers pointing forward.
2. Extend your legs and rest your heels on a second elevated surface.
3. Slide your hips off the bench and bend your elbows to lower until elbows reach about 90 degrees.
4. Press through your palms to straighten your arms and lift your hips back to the start.
Safety cue: Keep shoulders down away from ears and stop when elbows reach 90 degrees

Health benefit: Strengthens rotational core muscles and improves trunk control and coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Sit on the floor and lean back slightly while lifting your feet off the ground.
2. Clasp your hands together or hold a weight at chest level.
3. Rotate your torso to one side and touch your hands or weight beside your hip.
4. Twist to the opposite side and repeat in a controlled rhythm.
Safety cue: Brace your core and keep spine tall while rotating from upper back

Health benefit: Builds glute strength and improves hip extension power
Steps to perform:
1. Get on all fours with hands under shoulders and knees under hips.
2. Place a dumbbell behind your knee or secure an ankle weight.
3. Drive your heel toward the ceiling by extending the hip with the knee bent.
4. Pulse with small controlled reps at the top, then lower slowly.
Safety cue: Keep spine neutral and brace core before lifting the weighted leg

Health benefit: Enhances lateral hip stability and gluteal activation
Steps to perform:
1. Start on all fours with core engaged and back flat.
2. Lift one knee out to the side to hip height with a controlled 2-second lift.
3. Hold for 1 second, then lower in a slow 3-second descent.
Safety cue: Maintain squared hips and move slowly with controlled hip rotation

Health benefit: Develops triceps strength and scapular control
Steps to perform:
1. Begin in a forearm plank with elbows under shoulders and body in a straight line.
2. Press through one palm then the other to lift into a high plank, extending the arms.
3. Lower back to the forearms one arm at a time with control.
Safety cue: Keep elbows under shoulders and lower with slow controlled core engagement

Health benefit: Challenges core stability while improving shoulder coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a high plank with hands under shoulders and hips steady.
2. Reach one arm straight forward while keeping hips square and core tight.
3. Return the arm, alternate sides, and maintain a stable plank throughout.
Safety cue: Anchor hips level and exhale as you extend arm to maintain stability

Health benefit: Strengthens upper back and promotes postural muscle endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Lie face down with legs straight and arms at your sides, palms down.
2. Lift your chest slightly and sweep your arms out to the sides and overhead while keeping them off the ground.
3. Reverse the motion to return arms to your sides with controlled movement.
Safety cue: Slide arms while keeping ribcage down and scapulae retract for control

Health benefit: Builds posterior chain strength and hamstring control
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat hip-width apart.
2. Press through heels and lift hips until your body forms a straight line from shoulders to knees.
3. Walk your feet forward a few inches one at a time, then walk them back to the starting position.
4. Lower hips with control and prepare for the next repetition.
Safety cue: Keep hips level and glutes engaged, move out and back with slow control

Health benefit: Improves oblique strength and rotational core stability
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on one forearm in a side plank with feet stacked and body in a straight line.
2. Rotate your torso and thread the top arm under your body toward the floor.
3. Reverse the motion by lifting the arm and opening the chest back to the side plank position.
Safety cue: Keep body in a straight line, rotate slowly with core braced
is_not_suitable_for: Hypertension, Coronary Artery Disease, Chronic Low Back Pain

Health benefit: Increases abdominal muscular endurance and coordinated trunk rotation
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with hands behind your head and knees lifted to tabletop.
2. Drive one elbow toward the opposite knee while extending the other leg, alternating sides rapidly.
3. Maintain a quick, controlled cycling motion and keep your neck relaxed.
Safety cue: Keep lower back pressed to mat, control each twist and breathe
is_not_suitable_for: Hypertension, Coronary Artery Disease, Osteoporosis, Chronic Low Back Pain

Health benefit: Targets lower abdominal engagement and hip flexor control
Steps to perform:
1. Sit on the edge of a bench with hands beside your hips and legs extended slightly.
2. Lean back slightly and pull your knees toward your chest by contracting your abs.
3. Extend your legs forward without touching the floor and repeat the tuck motion.
Safety cue: Sit tall, hinge from hips, pull navel to spine as knees draw in

Health benefit: Elevates heart rate and builds full body muscular endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall, then squat and place your hands on the floor in front of your feet.
2. Step back one foot at a time into a plank and perform a controlled push-up.
3. Step your feet back toward your hands to return to a low squat.
4. Stand up quickly without jumping and repeat.
Safety cue: Step back and forward with control, keep shoulders over wrists and breathe

Health benefit: Enhances cardiovascular fitness and upper body muscular endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Sit on the edge of a chair with feet flat and knees bent at 90 degrees.
2. Raise fists to chin level and keep elbows close to your ribs.
3. Rapidly punch one arm forward while retracting the other.
4. Keep a brisk pace and maintain an upright posture.
Safety cue: Sit tall and rotate from your torso when punching
is_not_suitable_for: Hypertension, Coronary Artery Disease, Hyperthyroidism, COPD

Health benefit: Strengthens core stability and lower abdominal endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with arms extended overhead or by your sides.
2. Lift head, shoulders, and legs a few inches off the floor to form a hollow shape.
3. Flutter kick legs up and down in small, rapid motions.
4. Keep the lower back pressed into the floor and breathe steadily.
Safety cue: Press lower back into the floor and breathe steadily during kicks

Health benefit: Builds core strength and hip flexor endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Sit and lean back slightly while lifting both legs to form a V with your torso.
2. Extend your arms forward parallel to your legs and lift your chest.
3. Perform controlled scissor motions by crossing one leg over the other.
4. Alternate crossings while maintaining the boat position and steady breathing.
Safety cue: Keep chest lifted and core engaged during scissor kicks
is_not_suitable_for: Hypertension, Chronic Low Back Pain, Osteoporosis

Health benefit: Improves hip flexor mobility and low impact cardiovascular activity
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and hands on hips or at your sides.
2. Raise one knee toward hip level while keeping your torso upright.
3. Lower the knee with control and repeat on the other side in a steady rhythm.
Safety cue: Stand tall and lift each knee with controlled motion

Health benefit: Develops dynamic core strength and improves spinal mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Begin in a forearm plank with a straight line from head to heels.
2. Press through one forearm and roll onto the outer edge of the same foot into a side plank.
3. Rotate through your core to roll back through the forearm plank and onto the opposite side.
4. Continue rolling smoothly between sides while keeping hips lifted.
Safety cue: Maintain a neutral spine and roll slowly controlling hip movement

Health benefit: Enhances single leg balance and proprioceptive awareness
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and shift weight onto one foot, then lift the other foot to rest against your inner calf or ankle.
2. Close your eyes and engage your core while extending your arms out to the sides for balance.
3. Hold the position for the desired time, then slowly open your eyes and switch sides.
Safety cue: Keep hips level and chest tall while breathing slowly

Health benefit: Promotes full body stability and shoulder girdle strength
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a high plank with hands under shoulders and feet wider than hip-width.
2. Spread your arms and legs wider to create an X shape while keeping a straight line from head to heels.
3. Squeeze your core and glutes to maintain stability and breathe evenly.
4. Return to a normal plank or rest and repeat.
Safety cue: Brace core and squeeze glutes to maintain a straight spine

Health benefit: Increases spinal mobility and promotes gentle upper body flexibility
Steps to perform:
1. Begin on your knees and sit back into child's pose with forehead on the mat and arms extended forward.
2. Inhale, slide forward onto your stomach, place hands under shoulders, and lift your chest into cobra with a gentle backbend.
3. Exhale, lower your chest and sit back into child's pose.
4. Repeat the flow for the desired number of repetitions.
Safety cue: Move slowly keeping ribs over pelvis and breathe evenly

Health benefit: Enhances hip extension mobility and reduces hip region stiffness
Steps to perform:
1. Kneel on one knee with the other foot planted in front and the front knee stacked over the ankle.
2. Tuck your pelvis and gently press your hips forward until you feel a stretch in the front of the kneeling hip.
3. Hold the stretch, then switch legs and repeat.
Safety cue: Tuck tailbone and shift hips forward until you feel a stretch

Health benefit: Improves shoulder range of motion and thoracic spine mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Hold a band or dowel with a wide grip and stand tall with arms straight in front at hip height.
2. Keep your arms straight and lift the band or dowel over your head and behind your back until it reaches your hips.
3. Reverse the motion slowly to bring the band or dowel back to the front.
4. Narrow your grip slightly if the movement feels comfortable and repeat.
Safety cue: Keep shoulders down and scapulae stable while moving slowly

Health benefit: Enhances lateral core strength and oblique stability
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your side with your forearm under your shoulder and legs stacked.
2. Lift your hips into a side plank, keeping a straight line from head to heels.
3. Crunch your top elbow and top knee toward each other by lowering the hip and lifting the knee.
4. Return to the straight side plank and repeat the motion.
Safety cue: Keep hips stacked and core braced as you control the crunch

Health benefit: Develops shoulder stability and coordinated full body mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back and hold a weight overhead with one arm fully extended.
2. Bend the same-side knee and roll onto your opposite elbow while keeping the weight vertical.
3. Press through the planted foot and elbow to lift your hips into a bridge with the arm still vertical.
4. Lower your hips, roll back onto your back, and return the weight to the starting position.
Safety cue: Press through the planted shoulder and heel while keeping ribs down

Health benefit: Builds rotational core control and grip endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Hang from a pull-up bar with a shoulder-width grip and legs together.
2. Brace your core and lift your legs up so they are perpendicular to your torso.
3. Rotate your legs in a controlled arc to one side, return to center, then rotate to the other side.
Safety cue: Keep lower back neutral and move hips slowly with controlled breathing

Health benefit: Enhances upper body pushing strength and thoracic mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Begin in a downward dog with hips high and hands slightly wider than shoulder-width.
2. Bend your elbows and swoop your chest down and forward between your hands.
3. Arch your back and lift your chest up into an upward dog position.
4. Reverse the motion to return to downward dog and repeat.
Safety cue: Lead with chest and glide hips smoothly while maintaining a long spine

Health benefit: Increases posterior chain endurance and lower back stability
Steps to perform:
1. Sit with legs extended and place your hands behind you under your shoulders with fingers forward.
2. Press through your hands and heels to lift your hips until your body forms a straight line from head to heels.
3. Hold the extended posterior plank while keeping your shoulders down and core engaged.
Safety cue: Engage glutes and core, maintain a straight line from head to heels

Health benefit: Develops unilateral leg strength and lateral balance control
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet wider than shoulder-width and toes slightly turned out.
2. Extend one arm out to the side and shift your weight onto the same-side leg.
3. Sit back and lower into a deep squat on the weighted leg while the opposite leg straightens.
4. Drive through the bent leg to return to standing and switch sides.
Safety cue: Sit hips back and maintain knee tracking over toes

Health benefit: Improves shoulder endurance and incremental overhead strength
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a high plank with your feet touching the base of a wall.
2. Walk your feet up the wall while simultaneously walking your hands toward the wall.
3. Continue until your body is vertical or chest is close to the wall.
4. Reverse the motion by walking your hands away and lowering your feet back to plank.
Safety cue: Brace core and move slowly, control shoulder position

Health benefit: Builds scapular control and rotational upper body strength
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a high plank with hands slightly wider than shoulder-width.
2. Lower your chest toward the floor until your elbows reach about 90 degrees.
3. Press up and at the top extend one arm straight out to the side, then return and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Retract shoulder blades and lower with controlled tempo

Health benefit: Strengthens glute activation and single leg hip stability
Steps to perform:
1. Sit with your upper back on a bench, one foot planted flat on the floor, and the other leg extended.
2. Drive through the heel of the planted foot and lift your hips until your torso and thigh form a straight line.
3. Squeeze your glute at the top while keeping the raised leg aligned with your torso.
4. Lower your hips under control and repeat, then switch legs.
Safety cue: Keep hips level and drive through the heel, squeeze glute at top

Health benefit: Improves dynamic core strength and hip flexor control
Steps to perform:
1. Hang from a pull-up bar with your arms fully extended and shoulders engaged.
2. Pull your knees up toward your chest, curling your hips and torso.
3. From the tucked position, straighten your legs forward until they are parallel to the ground.
4. Return to the hanging position and repeat the tuck-to-extension sequence.
Safety cue: Brace hollow core, minimize swing, exhale as you extend legs

Health benefit: Strengthens obliques and enhances lateral core stability
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your side and prop up on the forearm with feet stacked.
2. Lift hips into a side plank, reaching the top arm overhead.
3. Thread the top arm under your torso while dipping the hips slightly.
4. Reverse the motion by lifting the arm and hips back to side plank.
Safety cue: Keep hips stacked and core braced to avoid collapsing

Health benefit: Improves unilateral leg strength and hip stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and hands on hips.
2. Step one foot straight back and lower until both knees form about 90-degree angles.
3. Pause briefly while keeping torso upright and weight on the front heel.
4. Drive through the front foot to return to standing and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Step slowly keeping torso upright and knee tracking over toes

Health benefit: Enhances rotational core strength and spinal mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a high plank with hands under shoulders and body straight.
2. Bend the right knee and drive it diagonally toward the left elbow while sliding the foot under the body.
3. Return the foot to plank and repeat on the opposite side in a steady rhythm.
Safety cue: Maintain neutral spine and lead with hips not momentum

Health benefit: Develops hip mobility and rotational core coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Begin in a high plank with hands under shoulders and core engaged.
2. Drive the right knee forward toward the left elbow, lifting the foot off the ground.
3. Return the right leg to plank and immediately drive the left knee toward the right elbow.
4. Continue alternating knees in a controlled, rhythmic motion.
Safety cue: Control the movement keep shoulders stacked and avoid jerky motion

Health benefit: Boosts full body coordination and rotational core endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a high plank or downward dog with hands shoulder-width apart.
2. Swing one leg under your body and out to the opposite side while rotating your hips and chest.
3. Plant the foot outside your hand and extend the opposite arm overhead or out for balance.
4. Reverse the movement to return to plank and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Rotate from the torso keep opposite hand grounded and hips low
is_not_suitable_for: Depression / Anxiety, Cognitive Decline / Dementia, Chronic Low Back Pain

Health benefit: Increases cardiovascular fitness while training full body power
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width apart and arms at your sides.
2. Drop into a squat and place your hands flat on the floor in front of you.
3. Kick both feet back into a straight-arm plank while keeping your core engaged.
4. Jump or step your feet back to your hands and stand up to repeat.
Safety cue: Keep chest lifted and core braced when hinging to plank

Health benefit: Enhances shoulder stability and coordinated lateral core activation
Steps to perform:
1. Start on hands and knees and lift your knees a few inches off the ground.
2. Keep your hips low and core tight with fingers pointing forward.
3. Step your right hand and right foot sideways, maintaining a low posture.
4. Follow with your left hand and left foot and continue moving laterally.
Safety cue: Maintain a flat back and low hips, move slow controlled steps

Health benefit: Improves core stability and shoulder coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Begin in a bear hold with hands under shoulders and knees hovering above the ground.
2. Brace your core and lift your right hand to tap your left shoulder.
3. Return the hand, then lift your left hand to tap your right shoulder and repeat.
Safety cue: Anchor hips and minimize torso rotation when tapping opposite shoulder

Health benefit: Promotes upper body strength and scapular mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Lie face down with hands by your chest and feet together.
2. Push your chest up into a full push-up, then lower your chest back to the ground.
3. Lift both hands briefly off the floor, place them back, and press up again.
Safety cue: Fully exhale at the press and retract shoulder blades before releasing hands

Health benefit: Enhances shoulder endurance and alternating posterior chain activation
Steps to perform:
1. Lie face down with legs straight and palms flat by your shoulders.
2. Press your palms into the floor and lift your chest and torso into a seated-like, chest-up position.
3. Walk your hands forward a few steps while keeping your chest lifted and hips low.
4. Reverse the motion by walking your hands back to the starting position.
Safety cue: Keep chest open, shoulders down and move with controlled deliberate steps

Health benefit: Enhances single-leg balance and proprioception
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall on one foot with a soft knee.
2. Hinge at the hips and reach the opposite hand toward the cone while extending the free leg backward.
3. Touch the cone lightly with your fingertips while keeping a straight spine.
4. Return to standing by driving the grounded foot through the floor and repeat.
Safety cue: Keep hips level and hinge from the hips as you reach

Health benefit: Improves hip mobility and lower body strength
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet slightly wider than hip-width and toes turned out.
2. Sit back into a squat until the thighs are parallel or as far as comfortable.
3. Place your elbows inside the knees and press the knees outward with your forearms.
4. Drive through the heels to return to standing while keeping the chest lifted.
Safety cue: Push knees outward to track over toes and keep spine neutral

Health benefit: Increases thoracic mobility and shoulder range of motion
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and interlace your fingers behind your back.
2. Pull the hands down and away while lifting the chest and squeezing the shoulder blades.
3. Release the hands forward in a controlled arc and repeat the open-and-close motion.
Safety cue: Squeeze shoulder blades together and breathe evenly as you open

Health benefit: Enhances posterior chain strength and glute activation
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent, feet flat under the hips, and arms at your sides.
2. Press through the heels and lift the hips until the torso is parallel to the floor, forming a tabletop.
3. Squeeze the glutes at the top, then lower the hips back down with control.
Safety cue: Keep core engaged and lift hips until shoulders hips and knees align

Health benefit: Improves hip stability and lateral glute strength
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with weight on the supporting leg and hands on hips or holding a support.
2. Lift the opposite leg straight out to the side without leaning the torso.
3. Lower the leg slowly back to the starting position and repeat.
Safety cue: Keep torso upright and control movement without leaning away

Health benefit: Builds shoulder and core strength while improving scapular control
Steps to perform:
1. Place your hands on the floor under your hips with fingers pointing slightly outward and feet together in a plank position.
2. Lean your shoulders forward past your hands while keeping your arms straight and your core braced.
3. Hold the forward-lean position with a straight body line and controlled breathing.
4. Return to a neutral plank and repeat the lean for reps.
Safety cue: Keep shoulders protracted and hips low while leaning forward

Health benefit: Enhances calf eccentric strength and ankle control
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with the ball of one foot on the edge of a step and the other foot either touching the step or lifted.
2. Push up onto both toes to reach the top of the calf raise and then transfer weight to the working leg.
3. Lower the heel of the working leg slowly over 3–5 seconds until the ankle is fully stretched.
4. Return to the starting top position by pressing through the ball of the foot and repeat.
Safety cue: Lower slowly with control keeping knee aligned over toes

Health benefit: Develops core and lat strength and body alignment awareness
Steps to perform:
1. Grip a pull-up bar with both hands shoulder-width apart and hang with straight arms.
2. Retract the shoulder blades and pull your knees to your chest into a tight tuck.
3. Lean back and lift your hips so your torso becomes horizontal while maintaining the tucked knees.
4. Hold the tucked front lever position with engaged core and controlled breathing.
Safety cue: Pack shoulders and hold a hollow core during the tuck

Health benefit: Increases unilateral upper body strength and core stabilization
Steps to perform:
1. Place one hand under your chest and the other hand behind your back or at your side.
2. Position your feet wider than shoulder-width and brace your core to keep a straight line from head to heels.
3. Lower your chest toward the supporting hand with elbow tracking close to your body.
4. Push back up to full arm extension while maintaining a rigid torso and repeat.
Safety cue: Keep hips square and brace your core as you lower

Health benefit: Promotes hamstring mobility and posterior chain control
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and heels on sliders or towels on a smooth surface.
2. Drive your hips up into a glute bridge so your body forms a straight line from shoulders to knees.
3. Slowly slide your heels away until your legs near full extension while keeping hips elevated.
4. Pull the heels back toward your glutes, lower your hips to the ground, and repeat.
Safety cue: Hinge from hips with neutral spine and slide back slowly using hamstrings

Health benefit: Improves hip mobility and quadriceps strength
Steps to perform:
1. Kneel on both knees with torso upright.
2. Step one foot forward and plant the foot firmly.
3. Shift weight onto the front foot and sit back into a squat.
4. Drive through the front heel to stand and then return to kneeling.
Safety cue: Keep torso upright and hinge at hips to protect lower back

Health benefit: Develops explosive upper body power and coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a high plank with hands under shoulders and body in a straight line.
2. Lower your chest toward the floor while keeping core tight.
3. Explosively push through your palms to lift your hands off the ground and clap once.
4. Land softly with slightly bent elbows and reset into the plank.
Safety cue: Land softly with elbows slightly bent and core braced

Health benefit: Enhances core strength and balance while challenging shoulder stability in an inverted position
Steps to perform:
1. Kneel and interlace fingers, place forearms on the floor, and set the crown of your head lightly between your hands.
2. Lift hips, walk feet toward your head, and press through forearms to lift both legs into a vertical headstand.
3. Engage your core and slowly lower one leg toward the floor while keeping the other leg vertical.
4. Return the lowered leg to vertical with control and repeat the leg lifts.
Safety cue: Keep neck long shoulders engaged and lift legs slowly with control

Health benefit: Targets posterior chain muscles to improve hip extension strength
Steps to perform:
1. Lie face down with forehead resting on your hands and legs extended behind you.
2. Squeeze your glutes and lift both legs a few inches off the floor while keeping knees straight.
3. Hold briefly at the top and then lower your legs under control without letting them rest.
