Safety cue: Maintain neutral spine and squeeze glutes at the top

Health benefit: Builds upper body pulling strength and demands significant core and hip flexor control
Steps to perform:
1. Grip a pull-up bar with hands shoulder-width apart and hang with shoulders engaged.
2. Lift both legs straight out in front to form an L shape with your torso and legs.
3. Pull your chin above the bar by driving elbows down and retracting your shoulder blades.
4. Lower with control back to the hanging L position and repeat.
Safety cue: Brace core to keep legs horizontal and pull through scapular retraction

Health benefit: Develops shoulder and upper chest strength while improving vertical pressing mechanics
Steps to perform:
1. Place feet on a stable elevated surface and hands shoulder-width on the floor.
2. Raise hips into a pike so your body forms an inverted V with straight arms.
3. Bend elbows and lower the crown of your head toward the floor between your hands.
4. Push through your hands to extend the arms and return to the pike start.
Safety cue: Keep shoulders packed and hinge from hips to protect lower back

Health benefit: Improves fingertip and grip strength while enhancing wrist stability
Steps to perform:
1. Come into a high plank on your fingertips with fingers spread and hands under shoulders.
2. Keep a straight line from head to heels and brace your core.
3. Bend elbows and lower your chest toward the floor while staying on your fingertips.
4. Press through the fingertips to extend arms and return to the plank.
Safety cue: Keep wrists neutral and press fingertips evenly while controlling descent

Health benefit: Enhances upper body pulling endurance and scapular control in a seated pattern
Steps to perform:
1. Sit tall with legs extended or slightly bent and hold an imaginary rope overhead with both hands.
2. Pull your right hand down toward your chest while reaching the left hand up and keep a tall spine.
3. Alternate hands in a smooth climbing rhythm while engaging your back and shoulders.
4. Drive your feet forward as if stepping on the rope to add lower-body involvement.
Safety cue: Sit tall engage core pull shoulder blades down and together with each rep

Health benefit: Strengthens posterior chain and shoulder stability while improving hip mobility and coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Sit with knees bent, hands behind hips and fingers pointing toward feet, and lift hips into a reverse tabletop.
2. Keep hips elevated and core engaged throughout the movement.
3. Step backward by moving one hand and the opposite foot simultaneously, maintaining the tabletop height.
4. Continue alternating hand-foot pairs to walk backward for the desired distance or reps.
Safety cue: Keep hips lifted press through palms and heels step controlled and deliberate

Health benefit: Activates glutes and posterior chain muscles to build endurance and hip extension control
Steps to perform:
1. Lie face down and lift your chest and legs slightly off the ground with arms by your sides.
2. Beat your heels together alternately in a quick, controlled flutter behind you.
3. Maintain a small gap between body and floor and keep the motion steady for the set.
Safety cue: Keep lower back pressed into floor and breathe steadily during each beat

Health benefit: Enhances dynamic core strength and abdominal endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat on the floor.
2. Lift your head and shoulders and twist your right elbow toward your left knee while extending your right leg straight.
3. Return to center and immediately twist your left elbow toward your right knee while extending your left leg.
4. Continue alternating quickly in a controlled, sprinting rhythm.
Safety cue: Keep lower back pressed into mat to protect your spine

Health benefit: Improves shoulder stability and full body coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a forearm plank with hands under shoulders and body in a straight line.
2. Reach your right hand forward and step your left foot slightly forward under your body.
3. Reverse by reaching your left hand forward and stepping your right foot forward.
4. Crawl forward alternately while maintaining a stable core.
Safety cue: Keep hips level and spine neutral as you move

Health benefit: Increases upper body muscular endurance and power output
Steps to perform:
1. Sit tall on a chair or bench with feet flat and core engaged.
2. Rapidly punch your arms forward in alternating, straight movements at shoulder height.
3. Maintain an upright posture and keep the punches quick and light.
Safety cue: Sit tall with chest lifted and breathe steadily

Health benefit: Strengthens lower abdominal muscles and hip flexor control
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back and lift both legs straight up toward the ceiling.
2. Lower one leg toward the floor while keeping the other leg pointed up.
3. Quickly switch the legs in a scissoring motion.
4. Keep your lower back pressed into the floor and control each switch.
Safety cue: Keep lower back gently pressed into mat and control leg descent

Health benefit: Enhances cardiovascular stamina and lower body coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Sit on the edge of a chair with feet together and hands at your sides.
2. Explosively spread your feet wide while raising both arms overhead.
3. Bring your feet back together and lower your arms to the starting position.
4. Repeat the movement with powerful, consistent repetitions.
Safety cue: Keep weight centered through sit bones and land softly

Health benefit: Develops core stability while promoting shoulder strength and hip mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Start in high plank with hands under shoulders and body in a straight line.
2. Drive your right knee toward your right elbow, keeping hips low.
3. Return the leg to plank and immediately drive your left knee toward your left elbow.
4. Continue alternating quickly with controlled movement and an engaged core.
Safety cue: Keep hips low and spine neutral as you drive knee towards elbow

Health benefit: Enhances core endurance and rotational control
Steps to perform:
1. Start in forearm plank with elbows under shoulders and body in a straight line.
2. Push your hips back toward your heels, then shift them forward past your shoulders in a sawing motion.
3. Repeat the controlled sawing motion while keeping your core engaged and neck neutral.
Safety cue: Anchor shoulders over wrists and maintain a braced core as you saw

Health benefit: Builds wrist and arm strength while improving balance and body awareness
Steps to perform:
1. Squat with feet hip-width, place hands shoulder-width on the mat, and spread your fingers.
2. Bend your elbows slightly and press your knees into the backs of your upper arms.
3. Shift weight forward and lift one foot, then the other, bringing your heels toward your glutes.
4. Balance on your hands with gaze forward and core engaged.
Safety cue: Shift weight into palms and lift hips with core while gazing forward

Health benefit: Improves quadriceps flexibility and hip joint range of motion
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your side and bend the top knee, grabbing the top foot or ankle with the same-side hand.
2. Pull the foot gently toward your glute while keeping knees aligned and hips stacked.
3. Hold the stretch for the desired time, then switch sides.
Safety cue: Keep hips stacked and pelvis neutral while gently pulling heel toward glute

Health benefit: Enhances spinal extension strength and thoracic mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent, feet flat hip-width, and hands beside your ears with fingertips pointing toward your shoulders.
2. Press into your feet and hands, engage your legs and glutes, and inhale to lift your hips and chest.
3. Straighten your arms and legs as much as comfortable to create a full arch.
4. Hold with a long neck, then bend your elbows and lower down with control.
Safety cue: Press through feet engage glutes and lengthen spine to avoid lower back compression

Health benefit: Enhances neck and upper back flexibility and shoulder mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with arms alongside your body.
2. Press into your shoulders and lift your hips until your torso is vertical.
3. Support your lower back with your hands and straighten your legs upward.
4. Keep your neck long and hold the vertical position.
Safety cue: Keep neck long and shoulders supported by hands to avoid neck compression

Health benefit: Increases hamstring and inner thigh flexibility and hip range of motion
Steps to perform:
1. Sit with legs spread wide in a comfortable straddle.
2. Hinge at the hips and lean your chest toward the floor while keeping your spine long.
3. Reach forward and hold the stretch at your limit.
Safety cue: Hinge from hips and keep spine tall as you ease into the straddle

Health benefit: Builds integrated upper body pulling and pressing strength and coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Grip the bar firmly with hands slightly wider than shoulder-width and start from a dead hang.
2. Pull explosively, driving your chest toward the bar and generating upward momentum.
3. Transition by leaning over the bar and rolling your wrists to bring your chest above it.
4. Press down through the bar to extend your arms and lock out into the top position.
Safety cue: Explode through hips while maintaining a tight core and controlled transition

Health benefit: Enhances lower body power and explosive jump ability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width apart and place hands behind your head.
2. Drop into a controlled squat, keeping your chest up and knees tracking over toes.
3. Explode upward into a jump using arms held behind the head.
4. Land softly on the balls of your feet and immediately descend into the next squat.
Safety cue: Land softly with knees tracking toes and chest lifted

Health benefit: Develops core and hip flexor strength while improving seated stability
Steps to perform:
1. Sit on the floor or parallettes with legs spread into a wide straddle and hands beside your hips.
2. Press down through your hands and engage your shoulders to lift your hips off the ground.
3. Straighten your legs out to the sides and hold them parallel to the floor.
4. Maintain a hollow core and shoulder depression while holding the position.
Safety cue: Press through hands and rotate shoulders outward while keeping legs straight and engaged

Health benefit: Targets inner thigh and glute endurance and hip mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet wider than shoulder-width and toes turned outward.
2. Lower your hips into a deep squat until your thighs are near parallel to the floor.
3. Pulse up and down a few inches while maintaining squat depth.
4. Keep your chest lifted and knees tracking over your toes.
Safety cue: Keep knees tracking toes and chest lifted during each pulse

Health benefit: Improves explosive horizontal power and landing control
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width and hinge slightly at the hips.
2. Swing your arms and explode forward into a horizontal jump.
3. Land softly on both feet with knees bent and hips back.
4. Hold the landing for a moment and reset before the next jump.
Safety cue: Land softly with hips back and knees bent to absorb impact

Health benefit: Strengthens obliques and spinal rotational control while challenging core stability
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with arms stretched out to the sides and legs raised toward the ceiling.
2. Engage your core and lower both legs to one side in a controlled motion.
3. Bring your legs back to center with control.
4. Lower your legs to the opposite side while keeping your shoulders on the floor.
Safety cue: Press lower back into the floor and move legs with controlled tension

Health benefit: Builds unilateral glute and hamstring strength and enhances pelvic stability
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with one knee bent and the other leg extended straight.
2. Press through the heel of the bent leg and lift your hips until your body forms a straight line.
3. Lower your hips with control and repeat, then switch legs.
Safety cue: Keep hips level and drive through heel while squeezing glute

Health benefit: Improves lower body endurance and hip adductor strength for stable posture
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet wider than shoulder-width and toes pointing forward.
2. Bend your knees and sink your hips until your thighs are parallel to the floor.
3. Tuck your pelvis slightly and keep your spine upright.
4. Hold the position while breathing steadily for the desired time.
Safety cue: Sit low with chest upright and knees tracking over toes

Health benefit: Enhances core control and full body coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width and hinge down into a squat.
2. Place hands on the floor and roll backward onto your shoulders while lifting legs overhead into a candlestick.
3. Roll forward from your shoulders into a low squat with feet under your hips.
4. Drive through your heels and explode up to standing, then repeat.
Safety cue: Tuck chin and roll through shoulders with core engaged
is_not_suitable_for: Obesity / Overweight, Hypertension, Coronary Artery Disease, Metabolic Syndrome, Osteoporosis, Fatty Liver Disease (NAFLD)

Health benefit: Develops explosive lower body power and rapid movement transitions
Steps to perform:
1. Start kneeling with knees hip-width and torso upright.
2. Swing your feet forward and explosively push both feet to land on the balls of your feet into a low squat.
3. Absorb the landing by bending hips and knees and keep your chest up.
4. Stand tall, then return to kneeling to repeat.
Safety cue: Land softly into squat and absorb through hips with knees tracking over toes

Health benefit: Improves cardiovascular fitness and whole body explosive coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet together and sink into a light squat with arms at your sides.
2. Jump up and spread legs wide while thrusting arms overhead into a star shape.
3. Land softly back into the squat and immediately prepare for the next jump.
Safety cue: Land softly with knees bent and chest tall to control impact

Health benefit: Builds upper body pushing strength and shoulder stability through dynamic movement
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a forearm plank with elbows under shoulders and body in a straight line.
2. Press one palm into the floor then the other to lift into a high plank on your hands.
3. Lower your chest toward the floor by bending your elbows for a push-up.
4. Reverse the motion by pressing back up and returning to the forearm plank.
Safety cue: Keep elbows close to ribs and maintain a braced core

Health benefit: Strengthens lower abdominal muscles and improves hip flexor control
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with legs straight and arms by your sides or under your hips.
2. Engage your core and lift both legs together until they form a 90-degree angle with your torso.
3. Slowly lower your legs back down without touching the floor and repeat.
Safety cue: Press lower back into floor and exhale as you lower legs

Health benefit: Enhances lateral mobility and full body stability through coordinated crawling movement
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet wider than hip-width and toes slightly turned out.
2. Squat low and place both hands on the floor in front of you.
3. Step your right foot then your left foot sideways while keeping hips low.
4. Move your hands to follow each step and continue moving laterally.
Safety cue: Keep a neutral spine and hinge at hips while taking controlled lateral steps

Health benefit: Activates and strengthens the glutes to support hip extension and posture
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with soles together and knees splayed outward.
2. Press through your heels and lift your hips by squeezing your glutes.
3. Lower your hips back down and repeat for the desired reps.
Safety cue: Drive hips up through heels and squeeze glutes at the top

Health benefit: Develops explosive upper body power and rapid force production for pushing movements
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a high plank with hands under your shoulders and body straight.
2. Lower your chest to the floor with elbows at about 45 degrees.
3. Explode upward with force to lift your hands off the ground.
4. Clap quickly and catch yourself softly into the plank position.
Safety cue: Land softly with elbows slightly bent and brace your core

Health benefit: Increases lower body explosive power and anaerobic capacity through repeated maximal jumps
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width apart and knees slightly bent.
2. Swing your arms and jump up while driving both knees toward your chest.
3. Land softly on the balls of your feet and immediately prepare for the next jump.
Safety cue: Absorb landing through soft knees and keep chest upright

Health benefit: Improves rotational core strength and trunk stability during seated movements
Steps to perform:
1. Sit with knees bent, feet flat on the floor, and torso leaning back slightly.
2. Clasp your hands together in front of your chest.
3. Rotate your torso to touch your hands beside each hip, alternating sides.
Safety cue: Sit tall with a braced core and rotate through your upper back

Health benefit: Enhances abdominal strength and spinal flexion control
Steps to perform:
1. Sit with the soles of your feet together and knees dropped outward.
2. Lie back with arms reaching overhead and keep feet together.
3. Curl your torso up and reach your hands toward your feet.
4. Lower back down with control to the starting position.
Safety cue: Keep a neutral neck and lift with your core not pulling on the head

Health benefit: Builds shoulder stability and posterior chain strength while improving coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Sit with hands behind hips and feet flat, then lift hips off the ground into a reverse tabletop.
2. Step your right hand and left foot forward, then step your left hand and right foot forward.
3. Keep hips lifted and core engaged as you continue alternating steps.
Safety cue: Keep hips lifted and shoulders stacked over wrists as you step forward

Health benefit: Develops lateral hip strength and single leg stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart.
2. Step wide to the side and bend the stepping knee while pushing hips back.
3. Drive through the bent-leg heel to return to the starting stance.
Safety cue: Push hips back and keep knee tracking over second toe

Health benefit: Activates glutes and posterior chain while enhancing spinal stability
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent at 90 degrees and shins parallel to the floor (tabletop).
2. Press through your heels and lift your hips until your body forms a straight line from shoulders to knees.
3. Lower your hips with control until they hover above the floor.
4. Repeat the lift in a steady, controlled rhythm.
Safety cue: Maintain a neutral spine and control each lift without sagging or rotating

Health benefit: Improves scapular mobility and upper back endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Lie face down with arms extended overhead in a Y and thumbs up.
2. Lift your chest and arms in the Y position while squeezing your shoulder blades.
3. Lower back down, move your arms into a W position, and lift again.
4. Return down, move arms to a T position, and lift while keeping the neck neutral.
Safety cue: Squeeze shoulder blades down and back while lifting arms in each shape

Health benefit: Increases hamstring flexibility and posterior chain range of motion
Steps to perform:
1. Sit tall with legs extended straight and feet flexed.
2. Hinge at the hips and reach your hands toward your toes.
3. Keep a long spine and pull your chest toward your legs.
4. Hold the end range and breathe evenly.
Safety cue: Keep a long spine by hinging from the hips and lifting the chest

Health benefit: Enhances core stability and anti rotation control while challenging shoulder stability
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a high plank with hands under shoulders and feet wider than hip-width.
2. Brace your core and keep your hips level.
3. Reach one arm forward while maintaining a stable plank.
4. Return the hand and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Brace your core and keep hips square while reaching slowly

Health benefit: Builds unilateral upper back strength and improves pulling mechanics
Steps to perform:
1. Stand beside a sturdy doorframe and grasp the frame with one hand at chest height.
2. Step back and lean into the arm until your body forms an angle.
3. Pull your elbow back, squeezing the shoulder blade toward the spine.
4. Slowly extend the arm to the start position and repeat.
Safety cue: Pull with the shoulder blade, keep spine neutral and avoid rotating torso

Health benefit: Strengthens lateral core and hip abductors enhancing single leg balance
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on one side and prop your body up on your forearm with feet stacked.
2. Lift your hips into a side plank so your body forms a straight line.
3. Raise the top leg upward while maintaining hip height.
4. Lower the leg with control and repeat for desired reps.
Safety cue: Stack shoulders and hips, keep pelvis neutral and lift the leg controlled

Health benefit: Increases glute and hamstring strength with enhanced posterior chain engagement
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and feet placed farther from your hips to lengthen the lever.
2. Press through your heels and engage the glutes.
3. Drive your hips upward until your body forms a straight line from shoulders to knees.
4. Lower your hips slowly to the mat and reset.
Safety cue: Drive through heels, keep ribs down and pelvis neutral during the lift

Health benefit: Enhances single-leg stability and quadriceps endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Stand in a split stance with the front foot flat and the back foot on the toes.
2. Bend both knees and lower until the front thigh is near parallel to the floor.
3. Hold the position with an upright torso and engaged core.
4. Press through the front heel to rise and switch sides if performing the other leg.
Safety cue: Keep front knee stacked over ankle and maintain upright torso

Health benefit: Strengthens triceps and improves shoulder endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a forearm plank with elbows under the shoulders and body in a straight line.
2. Tuck elbows close to your ribs and keep the core and glutes engaged.
3. Bend the elbows to lower your chest while keeping the elbows tight to your sides.
4. Extend the elbows to press back up to the forearm plank position.
Safety cue: Tuck elbows to ribs and breathe steadily as you lower with control

Health benefit: Improves core coordination and lower back support
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back facing away from a wall with knees bent and feet flat on the wall.
2. Press your lower back into the floor and brace your core.
3. Extend one leg to press the sole into the wall while lowering the opposite arm toward the floor.
4. Return to the start and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Keep lower back pressed to floor while slowly moving opposite limbs

Health benefit: Builds upper body strength and shoulder balance
Steps to perform:
1. Start facing the wall with hands on the floor a few inches away and feet on the ground.
2. Walk your feet up the wall while walking your hands closer until your hips are near the wall.
3. Kick one leg up and bring the other to meet it, keeping arms straight and shoulders active.
4. Hold the handstand position briefly, then lower one foot to return to the floor.
Safety cue: Press through shoulders and keep core tight with neck neutral

Health benefit: Develops posterior shoulder mobility and upper back activation
Steps to perform:
1. Lie face down with arms at your sides and forehead resting on the floor.
2. Lift your chest slightly and sweep your arms out to the sides and overhead in a wide arc.
3. Reverse the motion to bring your arms back to your sides while maintaining a lifted chest.
Safety cue: Retract shoulder blades and glide arms while keeping ribs down on floor

Health benefit: Enhances core stability and lateral core engagement
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a high plank with hands under shoulders and body in a straight line.
2. Jump both feet slightly to the right, keeping hips level.
3. Jump both feet back to center, then jump both feet to the left.
4. Repeat side-to-side hops while keeping core tight and shoulders steady.
Safety cue: Keep hips level and core braced

Health benefit: Improves lateral power and single leg landing control
Steps to perform:
1. Stand on your left leg with a slight knee bend and your right leg relaxed.
2. Swing the right leg across and use your left leg to hop laterally to the right.
3. Land quietly on the left leg with hip and knee bent and eyes forward.
4. Hold the landing for two seconds, then reset and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Land softly with knee aligned over toes and hips square

Health benefit: Improves functional conditioning and raises heart rate with lower impact
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart.
2. Hinge at the hips, place hands on the floor, and step one foot back then the other into a plank.
3. Step both feet forward toward your hands to return to a squat position.
4. Stand up to return to start and repeat.
Safety cue: Keep spine neutral and core braced throughout movement

Health benefit: Elevates cardiovascular fitness and leg power
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with elbows bent and hands near chest.
2. Drive one knee up toward hip height while pumping the opposite arm forward.
3. Alternate knees rapidly, landing lightly and maintaining an upright torso.
Safety cue: Stay tall with chest up and land softly on balls of feet
is_not_suitable_for: Hypertension, Coronary Artery Disease, Hypothyroidism, Hyperthyroidism, COPD

Health benefit: Enhances upper body endurance and coordination with dynamic striking patterns
Steps to perform:
1. Stand in a staggered boxing stance with hands up and chin tucked.
2. Rotate your hips and torso to throw a rear hook and return your hand to guard.
3. Drop your lead elbow and drive an uppercut upward from the legs, then return guard.
4. Combine hooks and uppercuts in controlled sequences while moving and keeping hands up.
Safety cue: Rotate through hips and keep chin tucked

Health benefit: Improves sprint mechanics and coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and shift weight onto one leg.
2. Drive one knee up to hip level while hopping lightly on the opposite foot.
3. Pump the opposite arm forward as the knee rises and land on the ball of the foot.
4. Alternate legs in a rhythmic skip.
Safety cue: Stay tall and land softly on your midfoot using active arm drive

Health benefit: Improves foot speed and lateral agility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet together and knees slightly bent.
2. Quickly step one foot forward and the other foot back, then return to feet together.
3. Alternate the lead foot in a fast, controlled rhythm.
4. Stay on the balls of your feet and keep knees soft.
Safety cue: Keep knees soft and stay light on the balls of your feet

Health benefit: Builds core endurance and enhances shoulder stability
Steps to perform:
1. Begin in a high plank with a towel under your toes.
2. Slide one foot forward toward your chest, drawing the knee in while keeping hips level.
3. Slide that foot back to plank position and immediately slide the other foot forward.
4. Alternate legs rapidly while maintaining a tight core and straight back.
Safety cue: Hold a tight plank and drive knees under control without hips sagging

Health benefit: Develops core anti-extension strength and shoulder stability
Steps to perform:
1. Assume a forearm plank with a towel under your toes and elbows under shoulders.
2. Push through your forearms to slide your feet backward, lengthening the body.
3. Pull your feet forward with your core until your shoulders move slightly past your elbows.
4. Repeat the controlled slide while keeping hips level and spine neutral.
Safety cue: Keep shoulders stacked over wrists and move the body from core control

Health benefit: Improves hip mobility and movement readiness
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a high lunge with one foot forward and hands on the floor inside the front foot.
2. Lower your hips toward the front foot and rotate your torso to place the opposite elbow outside the front knee.
3. Hold briefly, then return your hands to the floor.
4. Switch legs and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Keep chest lifted and spine neutral hinge from the hips into stretch

Health benefit: Enhances thoracic rotation and upper back mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your side with knees bent and hips stacked.
2. Extend the top arm at shoulder height and rotate your chest open, following the hand with your eyes.
3. Keep hips still, hold the rotated position briefly, then return the arm and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Keep ribs down and rotate through thoracic spine not lumbar

Health benefit: Encourages gentle spinal extension and core engagement
Steps to perform:
1. Lie face down with forearms on the mat and elbows under shoulders.
2. Press forearms into the mat, engage the core, and lift the chest into an active backbend.
3. Draw shoulders down away from ears, hold briefly, then lower with control.
Safety cue: Press forearms evenly and lift sternum while keeping neck long

Health benefit: Stretches the lateral torso and shoulders while promoting relaxation and mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Kneel and sit back on your heels, then extend your arms forward and rest your forehead toward the mat.
2. Walk your right hand under your left arm and reach toward the left side, rotating your torso slightly.
3. Reach actively with the right arm to deepen the side stretch while keeping hips rooted on the heels.
4. Return the right hand, reset in center, and repeat the reach on the left side.
Safety cue: Anchor hips back reach through fingertips and breathe into the side body

Health benefit: Develops upper body strength, core control, and balance in an arm balance position
Steps to perform:
1. Sit in a crossed-leg or tuck position with your palms beside your hips and fingers pointing forward.
2. Press your palms firmly into the mat, engage the core, and lift your hips off the ground.
3. Draw the knees toward the chest and straighten the arms to balance on your hands.
4. Hold with shoulders down and chest lifted, then lower back down with control.
Safety cue: Engage core and press firmly through palms to lift hips evenly

Health benefit: Builds unilateral leg strength, balance, and controlled hip hinge mechanics
Steps to perform:
1. Stand on one leg facing a high box or bench, with the other leg extended slightly forward.
2. Hinge at the hips and bend the standing knee to sit back toward the box while keeping your chest upright.
3. Lightly touch the box with controlled contact without collapsing, then press through the heel to stand.
4. Keep the core engaged for balance and repeat for desired reps before switching legs.
Safety cue: Keep chest upright sit back to the box and control the descent

Health benefit: Enhances chest mobility and shoulder posture
Steps to perform:
1. Stand in a doorway.
2. Place your forearm and elbow on the doorframe at shoulder height with the palm facing forward.
3. Step the foot opposite the framed arm forward until you feel a stretch across the front of your chest and shoulder.
4. Keep a neutral spine and breathe steadily.
Safety cue: Keep ribs down and shoulder blades back

Health benefit: Develops single-leg balance and posterior chain strength
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a low squat with feet hip-width and chest lifted.
2. Shift your weight onto one foot and press through the heel.
3. Extend the other leg back and hinge your torso forward until your body forms a straight line from head to lifted heel.
4. Keep hips level, reach arms forward, hold briefly, and return to the squat.
Safety cue: Keep a neutral spine and hinge from hips for controlled balance

Health benefit: Improves spinal mobility and hamstring lengthening
Steps to perform:
1. Stand on a small elevated platform with feet hip-width and knees softly bent.
2. Tuck your chin and initiate a slow curl, rounding the neck, upper back, midback, and low back sequentially.
3. Pause at the bottom with a controlled curve and relaxed shoulders.
4. Uncurl the spine slowly, reversing the movement vertebra by vertebra until you stand tall.
Safety cue: Curl slowly articulating one vertebra at a time and breathe evenly

Health benefit: Enhances hip flexion range and squat confidence
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width apart and lower to your knees in a controlled motion.
2. Sit back onto your heels and lean back onto your hands and shoulders while engaging your core.
3. Roll forward and bring your feet under you so your heels contact the floor.
4. Drive your hips up into a deep squat with chest lifted and knees tracking over toes.
Safety cue: Keep chest up and weight through heels as you sit back

Health benefit: Builds lateral hip strength and single-leg mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet wider than shoulder-width and toes slightly turned out.
2. Shift your weight to one side and bend that knee while keeping the opposite leg straight and the foot flexed.
3. Lower your hips as deep as possible while keeping your chest lifted and the working knee tracking over the toes.
4. Drive through the heel of the bent leg to return to center and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Lead with hips keep the working knee tracking over toes and maintain upright torso

Health benefit: Improves muscular endurance and ankle mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width and toes slightly turned out, hands clasped in front of chest.
2. Bend knees and sink hips back and down, keeping chest up and heels on the ground.
3. Lower until thighs pass parallel while swinging arms down and back for momentum.
4. Drive through heels and straighten legs while swinging arms up to return to start.
Safety cue: Keep chest up and knees tracking over toes

Health benefit: Strengthens scapular stability and horizontal adduction control
Steps to perform:
1. Lie face up with arms extended perpendicular to your body and legs together and straight.
2. Brace your core, press shoulders into the floor, and lift your chest and legs slightly off the ground.
3. Rotate hips to one side and lower legs toward the floor to form a controlled T-position while keeping the opposite shoulder grounded.
4. Return legs and torso to center with control and repeat to the other side.
Safety cue: Control descent with shoulder blades packed and elbows slightly bent

Health benefit: Increases shoulder loading tolerance and core stabilization
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a push-up position with hands under shoulders and feet together.
2. Lean your shoulders and chest forward over your hands while keeping arms straight.
3. Hold the forward-weighted position with a straight body line and engaged core, then return to start.
Safety cue: Keep shoulders stacked over wrists and scapulae engaged

Health benefit: Develops unilateral leg strength and knee control
Steps to perform:
1. Stand on one leg and reach back to grab the opposite ankle with the same-side hand.
2. Bend the standing knee and lower your hips while keeping chest upright and the held foot close to your glutes.
3. Continue lowering until your knee touches the heel or you reach a controlled depth.
4. Drive through the standing foot to extend the knee and return to standing, then switch sides.
Safety cue: Hinge hips back chest tall keep knee tracking midline

Health benefit: Enhances thoracic rotation mobility and dynamic core coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Start prone with hands under shoulders and legs extended hip-width apart.
2. Press into your hands, lift one leg, and twist the hips to reach that foot toward the opposite hand overhead.
3. Touch the foot or reach as far as comfortable, then control the leg back down to the starting position.
4. Repeat dynamically for reps, alternating sides.
Safety cue: Control rotation with core engaged avoid collapsing the lower back

Health benefit: Enhances lower abdominal strength and hip flexor control
Steps to perform:
1. Grip a pull-up bar with an overhand grip and hang with legs straight.
2. Brace your core and exhale as you slowly lift both knees toward your chest, keeping your spine neutral.
3. Pause with knees near your chest while maintaining strict form.
4. Inhale and lower your legs slowly to the dead-hang position.
Safety cue: Retract shoulder blades and control hips up without swinging

Health benefit: Improves lateral hip strength and single-leg stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand upright with feet hip-width and place a slider or towel under one foot.
2. Slide the opposite foot laterally while bending the supporting knee and pushing hips back.
3. Drive through the supporting foot to slide the moving foot back to center and repeat.
Safety cue: Keep lead knee tracking over toes and chest proud

Health benefit: Enhances full body coordination and shoulder to hip mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a bear crawl with hands under shoulders and knees hovering an inch off the floor.
2. Crawl forward in small controlled steps while keeping hips low and core engaged.
3. Stop and step both feet to your hands into a squat with chest upright.
4. Return hands to the floor and lift hips back into the bear hover and repeat.
Safety cue: Brace core and keep a neutral spine through every transition

Health benefit: Develops upper body power and explosive pressing ability
Steps to perform:
1. Place hands shoulder-width on a sturdy elevated surface and extend legs into a straight plank.
2. Lower your chest to the surface with control.
3. Explosively push up so your hands leave the surface and land softly back on the surface.
Safety cue: Absorb landing by bending elbows and controlling the descent

Health benefit: Improves rotational core control and thoracic mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Begin on hands and toes in a bear position with knees hovering slightly.
2. Sit back onto your heels while keeping one hand on the floor and rotate your torso to reach the opposite arm across your body.
3. Return both hands to the floor and lift your hips back into the bear hover.
4. Repeat the sequence and rotate to the opposite side.
Safety cue: Keep spine long and rotate from the ribs not the lower back

Health benefit: Builds unilateral core stability and shoulder endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Assume a high plank with hands under shoulders and body in a straight line.
2. Shift weight onto one hand and lift the opposite arm straight forward, keeping hips level.
3. Hold the position for the desired time, then switch sides.
Safety cue: Keep hips level and core braced while breathing steadily

Health benefit: Enhances lateral power and dynamic balance control
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width and knees slightly bent.
2. Push off one foot and jump laterally to land softly on the opposite foot with the trailing foot close to the ground.
3. Swing the arms across the body for balance and immediately push back to the other side.
Safety cue: Land softly on midfoot with knees bent and control the lateral movement

Health benefit: Promotes hamstring flexibility and integrated core to shoulder strength
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall, hinge at the hips, and place hands on the floor near your feet.
2. Walk your hands forward until you reach a full plank position.
3. Lower your chest into a push-up, press back up, then walk your hands toward your feet and stand.
Safety cue: Keep a straight spine and brace the core during the descent

Health benefit: Improves hip mobility and dynamic posterior chain engagement
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a high plank with feet wider than hip-width.
2. Rotate your hips and swing one leg underneath your body to the opposite side, planting the foot outside the opposite hand.
3. Rotate your torso to face the planted foot while keeping hands on the ground for support.
4. Return the foot to plank position and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Rotate through thoracic spine and maintain a neutral lower back

Health benefit: Enhances thoracic extension and shoulder mobility with posterior chain activation
Steps to perform:
1. Sit with knees bent, feet flat, and hands behind your hips, then lift into a reverse tabletop (crab) position.
2. Reach one arm overhead and across toward the floor behind you while opening the chest.
3. Rotate onto the top shoulder and lift the hips higher to form a thoracic bridge.
4. Reverse the rotation to return to crab position and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Open the chest and squeeze glutes while keeping shoulders stacked

Health benefit: Builds lower body endurance and overhead mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Slide down a wall until your knees form a 90-degree angle.
2. Press your lower back into the wall and engage your core.
3. Reach both arms overhead with palms facing each other.
4. Hold the position while keeping steady breathing.
Safety cue: Press lower back into wall and keep core braced

Health benefit: Enhances hamstring flexibility and core endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Sit with legs extended and hands beside your hips.
2. Hinge at the hips and lean forward to lift your hips slightly.
3. Pulse your hips up and down in small, controlled movements.
Safety cue: Hinge from hips keeping spine long and chest lifted

Health benefit: Enhances shoulder stability and core anti rotation control
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a bear position with hands under shoulders and knees hovering off the floor.
2. Brace your core and keep your hips steady.
3. Lift your right hand to tap your left shoulder while balancing on three limbs.
4. Return the hand and repeat the tap on the opposite side in a controlled rhythm.
Safety cue: Anchor hips square to the floor and brace core before each tap

Health benefit: Boosts cardiovascular fitness and leg power
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and arms bent at the elbows.
2. Drive your right knee up toward your chest while pumping your left arm.
3. Quickly switch legs and arms in a continuous sprinting motion.
Safety cue: Land softly on midfoot drive knees high while keeping chest tall

Health benefit: Improves thoracic extension and overall core stability
Steps to perform:
1. Lie face down and prop up on your forearms with elbows under shoulders for sphinx.
2. Press through your hands to straighten your arms and lift into a high plank.
3. Hold a straight line from head to heels while maintaining core tension.
4. Lower back down onto your forearms to return to sphinx and repeat.
Safety cue: Move with a neutral spine and press shoulders away from ears

Health benefit: Develops upper body strength and rotational core stability
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a high plank with hands under shoulders and feet hip-width apart.
2. Lower your chest to the floor keeping your body in a straight line.
3. Push up and rotate your torso, lifting one arm toward the ceiling into a side plank T.
4. Return to plank and repeat on the opposite side.
Safety cue: Keep a neutral spine and brace your core during rotation

Health benefit: Enhances proprioception and single leg stability for balance
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and place a stick across your upper back, holding the ends with both hands.
2. Shift weight onto one foot and lift the other foot slightly off the ground.
3. Hinge forward at the hip while keeping your back flat and the stick aligned over the supporting foot.
4. Return to upright and switch legs after the desired reps.
Safety cue: Keep hips level chest tall and control small movements to maintain stick alignment

Health benefit: Increases unilateral pulling strength and shoulder mobility control
Steps to perform:
1. Grab a pull-up bar with a wide grip and hang with arms fully extended.
2. Pull your chest toward one hand while straightening the opposite arm out to the side.
3. Lower under control back to the dead hang while keeping tension in the working side.
4. Repeat the pull to the other side for balanced reps.
Safety cue: Drive shoulder blades down and back and control the lateral reach

Health benefit: Strengthens quadriceps and knee extension control through deep knee flexion
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width and hands behind your head or out for balance.
2. Rise onto your toes and push your knees forward while leaning your torso back.
3. Lower until your knees are forward and your body forms a straight line from knees to head.
4. Drive through the balls of your feet to return to standing.
Safety cue: Keep chest upright push knees forward in line with toes and control descent

Health benefit: Improves abdominal strength and dynamic hip flexor coordination for hanging movements
Steps to perform:
1. Hang from a pull-up bar with a shoulder-width grip and legs straight.
2. Brace your core and initiate a controlled swing with your hips.
3. Use your abdominal muscles to lift your legs until your toes touch the bar.
4. Lower your legs with control back to the dead hang.
Safety cue: Use a hollow core and strict shoulder engagement to control the kipping motion

Health benefit: Improves hip stability and glute strength for better single-leg balance
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and hands on hips.
2. Step your right leg back and behind your left leg into a diagonal lunge.
3. Bend both knees until your front thigh is near parallel and keep your torso upright.
4. Drive through the front heel to return to standing and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Keep chest tall and hips square as you step back into the curtsy

Health benefit: Builds upper back and lat strength while enhancing shoulder stability
Steps to perform:
1. Grip a pull-up bar with hands wider than shoulder-width and hang with arms fully extended.
2. Draw your shoulder blades down and back before initiating the pull.
3. Pull your chest toward the bar by driving your elbows down and back.
4. Lower with control to the full hang and repeat repetitions.
Safety cue: Pull shoulder blades down and back before initiating the pull

Health benefit: Strengthens core and obliques while improving shoulder stability and lateral coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a high plank with hands under shoulders and body in a straight line.
2. Step your right hand and right foot out to the right simultaneously.
3. Bring your left hand and left foot to meet them while keeping hips level.
4. Continue stepping laterally for the desired distance or reps.
Safety cue: Keep hips level and core braced as you step sideways

Health benefit: Develops single-leg strength balance and lateral power
Steps to perform:
1. Stand on one leg with the other leg slightly behind and hands in front for balance.
2. Hinge at the hips and bend the standing knee to lower your body into a single-leg squat.
3. Keep the non-working leg extended behind you and lower until your thigh is near parallel.
4. Push through the heel to return to standing and switch legs.
Safety cue: Sit back into the standing hip and keep knee tracking over toes

Health benefit: Strengthens posterior chain muscles and promotes improved spinal posture
Steps to perform:
1. Lie face down with legs straight and arms at your sides, forehead resting on the floor.
2. Tuck your chin slightly and gently lift your chest and hands off the floor while keeping the neck long.
3. Squeeze your shoulder blades together and lift your legs a few inches to engage the posterior chain.
4. Hold briefly, then lower slowly to the starting position.
Safety cue: Tuck chin and lift chest while squeezing shoulder blades and keeping neck long

Health benefit: Targets obliques and hip abductors while enhancing lateral core stability
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your side and prop yourself on your forearm with legs stacked.
2. Lift your hips to form a straight line from head to heels.
3. Raise the top leg toward the ceiling without rotating your hips.
4. Lower the leg with control and repeat.
Safety cue: Keep hips stacked and core braced as you lift and lower the top leg

Health benefit: Boosts lower-body power and explosive strength while increasing anaerobic conditioning
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width and chest up.
2. Drop into a squat with weight on your heels.
3. Explode upward and rotate 180 degrees in the air.
4. Land softly into a squat and immediately repeat.
Safety cue: Land softly with knees tracking toes and chest lifted

Health benefit: Improves lateral agility and quickness for better change of direction
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with knees slightly bent and weight on one foot.
2. Push off that foot into a lateral hop and swing the opposite arm forward.
3. Land softly on the other foot, absorb with your knees, and repeat back.
Safety cue: Drive hips forward, keep chest tall and land lightly on balls of feet

Health benefit: Enhances foot speed and hand foot coordination for improved rhythmic movement
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with knees soft and feet hip-width apart.
2. Rapidly shuffle by sliding one foot back and the other forward in quick alternating steps.
3. Stay light on the balls of your feet and maintain a low, balanced stance.
Safety cue: Stay low with soft knees and quick light steps on your toes

Health benefit: Improves cardiovascular fitness while promoting hip mobility and coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a slight lunge with one knee lifted and the opposite arm forward.
2. Push through the back foot to switch legs mid-air and bring the other knee forward.
3. Continue alternating knees and arms at a steady, rhythmic pace.
Safety cue: Keep torso upright, drive through hips and land softly under your hips

Health benefit: Improves lateral agility and cardiovascular endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width apart and knees slightly bent.
2. Drive your right knee up toward your chest and push off the left foot to step right.
3. Quickly alternate knees while moving laterally with small, rapid steps.
4. Pump your arms in opposition to your legs and keep your torso upright.
Safety cue: Keep upright torso and land softly on midfoot with controlled lateral knee motion

Health benefit: Enhances reactive coordination and upper body endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Stand in a light fighting stance with knees soft and hands up.
2. Throw short, controlled punches at shoulder height to set a rhythm.
3. Bend your knees and drop your hips to bob under an imaginary punch, then weave to the opposite side.
4. Keep moving on the balls of your feet and repeat the bob-and-weave between punches.
Safety cue: Keep chin tucked and spine neutral while bending knees to control bob and weave

Health benefit: Increases foot speed and agility for quick directional changes
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width, knees soft, and weight on the balls of your feet.
2. Quickly shuffle laterally by pushing off one foot and placing the other beside it with short, rapid steps.
3. Maintain a fast tempo and stay light on your feet while keeping balance.
Safety cue: Stay low with slight knee bend keep hips level and take quick light steps

Health benefit: Strengthens deep neck flexors and improves head posture
Steps to perform:
1. Sit or stand tall with shoulders relaxed and eyes forward.
2. Slowly draw your chin straight back to create a double chin without tilting the head.
3. Hold briefly, release to neutral, and repeat with controlled movements.
Safety cue: Glide head straight back keeping eyes level and shoulders relaxed

Health benefit: Develops single-leg balance while training dynamic head and eye coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and shift your weight onto your right foot.
2. Lift your left foot off the ground and bend the right knee slightly to balance.
3. Slowly turn your head left and then right while keeping your torso still.
4. Hold each head position briefly, then switch legs and repeat.
Safety cue: Keep hips square and core braced while slowly turning head to control balance

Health benefit: Improves hip mobility and joint range of motion
Steps to perform:
1. Stand feet hip-width apart with hands on hips.
2. Keep knees soft and rotate your hips in a large clockwise circle.
3. Complete desired reps keeping your torso stable.
4. Reverse the circle counterclockwise for equal reps.
Safety cue: Keep chest lifted and core braced as you move slowly through the hip circle

Health benefit: Builds scapular control and upper back strength
Steps to perform:
1. Grasp a pull-up bar with hands shoulder-width and hang with straight arms.
2. Retract and depress your shoulder blades to lift your body a few inches.
3. Hold the retracted position briefly while keeping arms straight.
4. Slowly relax the shoulders back to the starting hang.
Safety cue: Pull shoulder blades down and together before bending the elbows

Health benefit: Promotes hip flexor flexibility and dynamic leg range
Steps to perform:
1. Stand beside a support and place one hand on it for balance.
2. Swing the outside leg forward in a controlled motion while keeping the torso upright.
3. Allow the leg to swing back in a smooth arc without twisting the hips.
4. Repeat for reps then switch sides.
Safety cue: Keep torso tall and hips square control the swing with your core

Health benefit: Enhances shoulder mobility and thoracic rotation awareness
Steps to perform:
1. Sit or stand tall and extend both arms forward at shoulder height.
2. Cross the right arm over the left and bend the elbows, wrapping forearms and bringing palms together if possible.
3. Lift the elbows and draw the forearms away from the face to intensify the stretch, then switch sides.
Safety cue: Keep neck long and squeeze shoulder blades together while breathing slowly

Health benefit: Improves posterior chain strength while challenging balance and rotational stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall on one leg with a slight knee bend and hold a weight or keep hands together.
2. Hinge at the hips and lower your torso while lifting the free leg straight behind you until your body forms a straight line.
3. Rotate your torso toward the standing leg and reach the opposite hand across the body as you pause.
4. Reverse the hinge to stand upright and repeat, then switch legs.
Safety cue: Hinge from the hips with a neutral spine and rotate from the torso

Health benefit: Strengthens lower abdominal muscles and improves core control
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat on the floor.
2. Place hands beside hips or under glutes and brace your core.
3. Curl your pelvis upward and lift your hips toward your ribcage.
4. Lower your hips slowly back to the start with control.
Safety cue: Curl pelvis with control and keep lower back pressed to the floor

Health benefit: Enhances hip mobility and endurance of the core through dynamic movement
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a high plank with hands under shoulders and body in a straight line.
2. Step or hop both feet forward toward your hands and lower into a deep squat.
3. Sink hips down, keep chest up, and maintain arms overhead or forward.
4. Drive through your heels to stand and step back to plank to repeat.
Safety cue: Move slowly keeping a neutral spine and hips stacked over knees

Health benefit: Improves scapular control and strengthens upper back muscles
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat on the floor.
2. Position elbows at your sides with palms facing up near your chest.
3. Press elbows into the floor and squeeze shoulder blades to lift your upper back, then lower with control.
Safety cue: Squeeze shoulder blades together and control motion without arching the neck

Health benefit: Builds upper body strength while improving thoracic mobility and hip adduction control
Steps to perform:
1. Begin in a high plank with hands under shoulders and body straight.
2. Lower your chest toward the floor while bringing one knee toward the same-side elbow.
3. Push back up while returning the foot to plank position.
4. Repeat the movement on the opposite side, alternating each rep.
Safety cue: Keep hips level and core tight while moving knee toward elbow with control

Health benefit: Develops full body mobility and shoulder stability during deep squat movement
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width apart and arms extended overhead.
2. Push hips back and bend knees while keeping arms locked overhead and chest upright.
3. Descend until thighs are at least parallel to the floor, keeping heels down.
4. Drive through your heels to stand and maintain arms overhead.
Safety cue: Keep chest tall arms locked overhead and weight back on the heels

Health benefit: Enhances core and hip flexor endurance while challenging static shoulder support
Steps to perform:
1. Sit between parallel bars or on the floor with hands beside your hips and legs straight.
2. Press down through your hands and lift your legs and hips so your body forms an L shape.
3. Keep your core tight and alternate small, controlled flutter kicks with your legs.
4. Maintain the lifted position and steady breathing throughout the movement.
Safety cue: Keep shoulders packed and core braced to maintain a neutral spine

Health benefit: Strengthens glutes and improves single leg hip stability and pelvic control
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with one ankle crossed over the opposite knee and the other foot planted flat.
2. Drive through the planted heel and squeeze the glute to lift your hips until your body forms a straight line.
3. Lower your hips with control to the starting position.
Safety cue: Keep hips level and drive through the planted heel

Health benefit: Improves unilateral leg strength and enhances trunk rotation and balance
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and step one foot back into a reverse lunge, lowering until the front thigh is near parallel.
2. Rotate your torso toward the front leg while keeping your chest tall.
3. Push through the front heel to return to standing and perform the same sequence on the other side.
Safety cue: Control descent and keep front knee over ankle while rotating from upper spine

Health benefit: Challenges anti rotation core stability and enhances shoulder girdle control
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a high plank with hands under shoulders and body in a straight line.
2. Reach one hand under your body across to the opposite side while allowing a small torso rotation.
3. Return the hand to plank and repeat the same reach with the other hand.
Safety cue: Maintain a flat back and brace core keeping hips square as you reach

Health benefit: Builds shoulder strength, upper body confidence, and improves core stability in inversion
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a high plank with your feet a short distance from a wall.
2. Walk your feet up the wall a few steps while walking your hands slightly toward the wall until you reach a partial incline.
3. Hold the inclined position with shoulders engaged and hips steady.
4. Walk your hands back out and lower your feet down the wall to return to plank.
Safety cue: Progress only while shoulder blades controlled and core fully braced

Health benefit: Enhances posterior chain strength and hip stability while challenging core control
Steps to perform:
1. Sit with hands behind hips and feet flat hip-width apart.
2. Press into hands and feet and lift hips until torso and thighs form a tabletop.
3. Engage core and lift one foot off the floor, bringing the knee toward the chest.
4. Lower that foot, lift the other foot in the same way, and keep hips level.
Safety cue: Keep hips lifted and core braced while alternating leg march

Health benefit: Develops unilateral leg power and improves balance and explosive lower body strength
Steps to perform:
1. Stand in a split stance with one foot forward and one foot back.
2. Lower into a deep lunge until both knees are bent about 90 degrees.
3. Explode upward and switch legs mid-air so the opposite foot lands forward.
4. Land softly into the lunge and repeat with controlled form.
Safety cue: Land softly with chest up and knees tracking toes

Health benefit: Builds rotational core strength and dynamic coordination for body control
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a low crouch with one hand planted and the other arm ready to guide.
2. Swing both legs together and kick them up and across the body to initiate rotation.
3. Drive the hips and shoulders into the twist while keeping legs together for momentum.
4. Control the spin and return to a stable crouch before repeating.
Safety cue: Engage core and control rotational speed to protect your neck

Health benefit: Improves short distance agility and acceleration with high intensity cardiovascular challenge
Steps to perform:
1. Stand at the starting line in an athletic stance.
2. Sprint forward a short distance to the first line or cone and touch it.
3. Immediately turn and sprint back to the start and touch the line.
4. Continue sprinting to the next short-range line and repeat for the set.
Safety cue: Keep chest up hips low and accelerate under control
is_not_suitable_for: Hypertension, Metabolic Syndrome, Coronary Artery Disease, COPD, Hyperthyroidism, Fatty Liver Disease

Health benefit: Boosts full body power and anaerobic capacity through explosive plyometric movement
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width and lower into a squat.
2. Place hands on the floor and jump feet back into a plank position.
3. Jump feet forward to hands, then explode upward into a tuck jump bringing knees to chest.
4. Land softly, reset into a squat, and repeat.
Safety cue: Land softly with knees stacked over toes and core braced
is_not_suitable_for: Obesity / Overweight, Osteoarthritis, Osteoporosis, Hypertension, Coronary Artery Disease, Hypothyroidism, Hyperthyroidism, COPD, Metabolic Syndrome, Fatty Liver Disease

Health benefit: Enhances upper body endurance and coordination while promoting rhythmic movement patterns
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width and hands held up near your chin.
2. Rotate hips and shoulders as you drive one fist overhead in a controlled punch.
3. Retract the punching hand back to guard and reset your stance.
4. Alternate arms with steady tempo and breathe evenly.
Safety cue: Keep ribs down and core braced as you extend overhead punches

Health benefit: Strengthens core and oblique control while improving timing and balance
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width and hands at your sides or on hips.
2. Lift one knee and drive the opposite elbow toward it while twisting your torso quickly.
3. Return to standing and repeat on the other side with consistent tempo.
Safety cue: Hinge at hips and rotate through the torso with controlled tempo

Health benefit: Increases lower body power and hip mobility while elevating heart rate
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width and toes slightly turned out.
2. Bend knees into a shallow squat and explode upward into a small vertical hop.
3. Land softly on the balls of your feet and sink back into the squat.
4. Continue the pop-squat rhythm with controlled, soft landings.
Safety cue: Land softly and absorb force through hips and knees

Health benefit: Enhances scapular stability and posterior shoulder mobility with thoracic extension emphasis
Steps to perform:
1. Lie face down with forehead on the ground and hands placed behind your back in a handcuff position.
2. Squeeze your shoulder blades and lift your chest while moving your hands up toward a Y shape overhead.
3. Hold the lifted position briefly while keeping neck neutral.
4. Lower your chest and hands back to the starting handcuff position with control.
Safety cue: Keep neck neutral and scapulae engaged throughout the motion

Health benefit: Improves hip mobility and thoracic rotation to support deep squatting mechanics
Steps to perform:
1. Squat deep with feet slightly wider than hip-width and heels grounded.
2. Place one hand on the floor inside your foot and rotate your torso toward the opposite side.
3. Reach the free arm up overhead into a full T-spine rotation while keeping hips stable.
4. Return the arm to the floor and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Maintain tall chest and stable hips while rotating through thoracic spine

Health benefit: Improves thoracic spine and hip mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat.
2. Cross your right ankle over your left thigh near the knee and hug the left shin toward your chest.
3. Thread your right arm through the gap and grasp the left leg while keeping your left shoulder on the floor.
4. Extend your left arm overhead and rotate your chest toward the right.
Safety cue: Anchor ribs to protect the lower back

Health benefit: Enhances lateral hip strength and trunk mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width apart and take a wide step to the right.
2. Bend your right knee and sink into a lateral lunge while keeping the left leg straight.
3. Reach both arms overhead as you deepen the lunge.
4. Push through the right foot to return to center and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Push hips back to protect the knee

Health benefit: Builds shoulder pressing strength and spinal extension mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a pike position with hands shoulder-width and hips high.
2. Bend your elbows and lower the crown of your head toward the floor.
3. Shift forward and lower your hips while pressing your chest up into cobra.
4. Lift your hips back into the pike position to reset.
Safety cue: Control the descent with slow shoulder movement

Health benefit: Improves core stability and coordinated contralateral movement
Steps to perform:
1. Begin on hands under shoulders and knees under hips.
2. Extend your right arm forward and your left leg straight back until both are parallel to the floor.
3. Keep your core engaged and hips level as you hold the position.
4. Return right arm and left leg to the start and switch sides.
Safety cue: Maintain a neutral spine throughout

Health benefit: Enhances single leg balance and proprioceptive control
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and shift weight onto your left foot.
2. Lift your right foot slightly off the ground and look upward.
3. Maintain a straight spine and hold the balance, then switch sides.
Safety cue: Keep hips level while standing on one leg

Health benefit: Increases anterior shoulder mobility and chest flexibility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand beside a wall and place your forearm and palm on the wall at shoulder height.
2. Step forward with the foot nearest the wall and press your chest forward while maintaining arm contact.
3. Rotate your torso away from the wall to increase the chest opening.
4. Step back to the start and repeat the movement rhythmically.
Safety cue: Keep ribs down and shoulders back as you open the chest

Health benefit: Develops posterior chain strength and unilateral balance control
Steps to perform:
1. Stand on one leg and hinge at the hips while extending the other leg straight back and arms out to the sides.
2. Keep a flat spine and align your body from head to heel.
3. Sweep both arms forward in a controlled arc until they meet in front of your chest.
4. Reverse the arm fly to return to arms out wide, then lower back to standing and switch legs.
Safety cue: Hinge from the hips with a neutral spine and soft standing knee

Health benefit: Strengthens quadriceps while improving hip extension mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Kneel with knees hip-width and the tops of your feet flat on the floor.
2. Engage your quadriceps and slowly lean back from the knees while keeping your torso straight.
3. Use your quadriceps to pull yourself forward to the starting position with controlled movement.
Safety cue: Brace your core and tuck the pelvis slightly to prevent lower back arch

Health benefit: Enhances abdominal engagement and spinal flexion control
Steps to perform:
1. Sit with legs extended, feet flexed, and hands reaching toward your toes.
2. Hinge at the hips and round your spine to compress your torso toward your thighs.
3. Press through your hands and lift your chest slightly while keeping legs straight.
4. Lower back into the pike position with control and repeat.
Safety cue: Exhale as you lift and maintain a long neutral spine from hips to head

Health benefit: Improves scapular control and shoulder girdle stability
Steps to perform:
1. Begin in a forearm plank with elbows under shoulders and a neutral spine.
2. Keep your arms steady and push your chest away from the floor by spreading the shoulder blades.
3. Pull your chest back toward your hands by squeezing the shoulder blades together.
4. Repeat the controlled protraction and retraction while maintaining a stable core.
Safety cue: Move only through your shoulder blades while keeping elbows stationary and chest tall

Health benefit: Increases lower body strength and improves movement control
Steps to perform:
1. Stand feet shoulder-width apart with toes slightly turned out and chest lifted.
2. Push hips back and descend to a full squat keeping weight through your heels.
3. Drive up halfway and pause at the half-stand.
4. Drop hips halfway down again, then drive all the way up and squeeze your glutes.
Safety cue: Keep chest up and knees tracking toes throughout the partial and full reps

Health benefit: Enhances rear shoulder and scapular stability to support posture
Steps to perform:
1. Anchor a resistance band or a towel high on a sturdy doorframe.
2. Grasp the ends with thumbs up and step back until tension pulls your hands toward your face.
3. Pull into your face, keep elbows high, and hold the contracted position.
Safety cue: Anchor shoulder blades back and squeeze between them while holding the pull

Health benefit: Strengthens glutes and promotes hip extension for improved hip function
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with soles together, knees dropped outward, and arms at your sides.
2. Press through your heels and lift your hips until your body forms a straight line from shoulders to knees.
3. Lower your hips with control and repeat.
Safety cue: Drive through heels and squeeze glutes while maintaining a neutral spine

Health benefit: Engages posterior chain and lower back extensors to enhance trunk endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Lie face down with arms extended forward and legs straight.
2. Lift your right arm and left leg simultaneously while squeezing your lower back and glutes.
3. Lower both limbs and repeat on the opposite side, alternating each rep.
Safety cue: Lift opposite arm and leg with controlled breath and neutral neck alignment

Health benefit: Targets obliques to improve trunk rotation strength and lateral stability
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your side with legs extended, bottom arm straight, and top hand lightly behind your head.
2. Lift your legs and torso together while bringing your top elbow toward your top knee.
3. Pause while squeezing the oblique, then lower with control.
4. Switch sides after completing the desired reps.
Safety cue: Engage obliques to lift with ribs down and controlled exhale

Health benefit: Improves shoulder external rotation and scapular control for better shoulder mechanics
Steps to perform:
1. Lie face down with arms extended out to sides and thumbs pointing up.
2. Lift your arms and chest a few inches while squeezing the shoulder blades together.
3. Hold briefly at the top while keeping thumbs up.
4. Lower slowly to the starting position.
Safety cue: Squeeze shoulder blades during each rep

Health benefit: Develops core control and spinal mobility through rolling coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and arms at your sides.
2. Tuck your chin and use your core to roll your hips up so your legs reach overhead.
3. Reverse the roll to lower your hips back down with control.
4. Unroll to return to the starting position.
Safety cue: Brace your core before rolling

Health benefit: Increases ankle stiffness and reactive power to boost lower limb agility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and knees slightly bent.
2. Bounce lightly off the balls of your feet using quick ankle action.
3. Maintain a small, fast hop rhythm and land softly.
Safety cue: Land softly on your forefeet

Health benefit: Builds dynamic core power and coordinated hip flexor engagement for explosive movements
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat on the floor.
2. Explosively sit up and touch your right elbow to your left knee.
3. Lower back down with control.
4. Repeat the sit-up and alternate sides each rep.
Safety cue: Lead the sit up with your core not your neck
is_not_suitable_for: Hypertension, Coronary Artery Disease, Osteoporosis, Chronic Low Back Pain

Health benefit: Enhances footwork precision and neuromuscular coordination to improve agility
Steps to perform:
1. Place five markers in a cross pattern with one marker at the center.
2. Start at the center and hop quickly to each outer marker following a set sequence.
3. Return to the center after each outer hop with a quick touch.
4. Continue the pattern with rapid, controlled footwork.
Safety cue: Maintain low hips while taking quick light steps

Health benefit: Strengthens core muscles and improves dynamic spinal mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and feet off the floor so shins are vertical.
2. Reach both hands behind your knees and lift your head and shoulders off the ground.
3. Crunch your chest toward your knees and clap your hands under the knees.
4. Lower your head and shoulders and repeat the crunch rhythmically.
Safety cue: Keep ribs down and curl with slow controlled breaths

Health benefit: Enhances lateral stability and single leg balance
Steps to perform:
1. Stand on one leg with a slight bend in the supporting knee.
2. Shift your weight to the midfoot and explode laterally off the ground.
3. Land softly on the same foot with a bent knee and controlled ankle.
4. Maintain balance and repeat hops for the desired reps before switching legs.
Safety cue: Land softly through midfoot with a slight knee bend to absorb impact
is_not_suitable_for: Obesity / Overweight, Osteoporosis, Osteoarthritis, Hypothyroidism, Sarcopenia

Health benefit: Develops core rotational endurance and pelvic control
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back and cross your arms over your chest.
2. Lift your head and shoulders off the floor while keeping the lower back down.
3. Drive one knee toward your chest as the opposite leg extends out.
4. Alternate legs in a steady, piston-like rhythm while maintaining the lifted chest.
Safety cue: Rotate legs slowly using core control, keep chest lifted and spine neutral

Health benefit: Builds lower body muscular endurance and hip stability
Steps to perform:
1. Step one foot forward into a comfortable lunge stance.
2. Lower slightly into the bottom range of the lunge without locking the knee.
3. Pulse up and down in short controlled movements while keeping the torso upright.
Safety cue: Pulse from the hips, maintain upright torso and knee tracking over toes

Health benefit: Strengthens posterior chain and reinforces hip hinge mechanics
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width apart and hands behind your head.
2. Hinge at the hips by pushing them back and keep a flat, neutral spine.
3. Lower your torso until it is nearly parallel to the floor while maintaining soft knees.
4. Drive the hips forward to return to standing and repeat.
Safety cue: Hinge at the hips, keep a flat back and slight knee bend

Health benefit: Improves shoulder mobility and thoracic extension control
Steps to perform:
1. Kneel tall with knees hip-width and toes untucked.
2. Brace your core and hinge from the hips while keeping a neutral spine.
3. Lean forward slowly until your torso is at about 45 degrees or until you feel muscle engagement.
4. Pause briefly then drive your hips back to the start position.
Safety cue: Maintain a neutral spine and move slowly from the hips

Health benefit: Enhances thoracic and hip flexibility while promoting relaxation
Steps to perform:
1. Kneel and sit back on your heels with knees together or slightly apart.
2. Bring your palms together in front of your chest like a prayer.
3. Reach forward with your palms and lower your chest toward your thighs.
4. Relax into the stretch and hold the position.
Safety cue: Lengthen through the spine and breathe into the ribcage

Health benefit: Increases anterior shoulder and chest flexibility for improved posture
Steps to perform:
1. Stand beside a wall and place your forearm against it at shoulder height with elbow bent 90 degrees.
2. Gently rotate your torso away from the wall until you feel a stretch across your chest.
3. Hold the position while keeping your shoulders down and spine neutral.
Safety cue: Keep the shoulder blade down and back while opening the chest

Health benefit: Improves single leg balance and hamstring control during functional reach
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and shift weight onto one foot while lifting the other slightly off the ground.
2. Hinge at the hips and reach the opposite hand toward the toes of the standing leg.
3. Keep the standing knee soft and maintain a flat back during the movement.
4. Return to standing and repeat on the other leg.
Safety cue: Hinge at the hips with a flat back and controlled reach

Health benefit: Enhances core stability and controlled shoulder engagement through dynamic plank movement
Steps to perform:
1. Plant your forearms on the ground with elbows under shoulders and extend legs back into a plank.
2. Brace your core and keep a straight line from head to heels.
3. Rock your body forward toward your hands using your shoulders, then rock back toward your toes.
4. Maintain control and repeat the rocking motion without sagging the hips.
Safety cue: Brace the core, keep a straight line from head to heels

Health benefit: Improves single-leg balance and proprioception
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and shift your weight onto your right leg.
2. Lift your left knee toward your chest and wrap both arms around the shin.
3. Hold the balance with an upright torso, then lower and switch legs.
Safety cue: Keep standing knee slightly bent and core tight to maintain balance

Health benefit: Enhances scapular stability and posterior shoulder endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Lie face down with arms overhead in a Y and thumbs pointing up.
2. Engage your glutes and scapulae and lift your chest and arms a few inches off the floor.
3. Pause while squeezing your shoulder blades, then lower with control.
Safety cue: Pull shoulder blades down and back as you lift arms into a Y

Health benefit: Increases upper body power and explosive pushing strength
Steps to perform:
1. Assume a push-up position with one hand slightly forward and the other slightly back.
2. Lower your chest under control until elbows reach about 90 degrees.
3. Explode upward to push your hands off the floor.
4. Land softly, reset your hands, or switch the stagger for the next rep.
Safety cue: Control the landing by absorbing impact with braced core and soft elbows

Health benefit: Improves dynamic hip mobility and unilateral leg strength
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart.
2. Step forward into a lunge, bending both knees to about 90 degrees.
3. Push back through the front heel to return to standing.
4. Immediately step backward with the same leg into a reverse lunge, then return and switch sides.
Safety cue: Keep front knee tracking over toes and torso upright during the pendulum
